title: Bangkok trip
review: Found the BTS great for our trip great aircon to cool you down and for the experience  There is always a bit of walking involved in Bangkok bit thats part of the experience

title: Clean, reliable and good value transport
review: The BTS takes you from the National Stadium to the river in next to no time It is an aerial system and so offers brilliant views of the skyscrapers and Bangkok skyline Fares are reasonable and security is good with staff checking bags The system would benefit from having more lines but does its job of getting people away from the gridlocked and slow moving Bangkok streets

title: Efficient transportation
review: We took the train a few times on our visit and found it very easy to get around Ticket purchase is easy and not confusing destination maps are clear Fare is cheap

title: 2nd Class a/c
review: Very useful overnight train Would advise to try and book it as soon as you can in Bangkok as if there are local holidays or festivals you could not get the day you want Relatively comfortable if a little cold None of the food or drink on board is free so would recommend stocking up at the 711 near the station before boarding Saves you a hotel if you go overnight

title: Good guide and fun experience well organised
review: Fun experience going with the train to the train marketplace and seeing the train leave again while standing in the market Floating boats is also a unique experience The guide is knowledgeable and considerate Informed us about the itinerary and toilet breaks which helped a lot what to expect

title: The Best Way
review: The Best way how to get from one place to another placeüëç Very cheap and fast Operating very often during whole day

title: So easy
review: If you are travelling on your own this is the way to get aroundfast efficient service that takes you to many of the tourist areasyou can buy a day pass for 200 baht and hop on or off as you pleasewe stayed at the Mercure Siam and the skytrain was literally at the front doorif you are in a group it may be better to get a metered taxi

title: Nothing out of ordinary
review: Nothing out of ordinary Just a sky train to beat the traffic of Bangkok Must say the route is wisely chosen and good for tourist to many destination conveniently

title: nice airport rail link
review: good rail link to suvarnabhumi airport clean and nice train but from starting station to suvarnabhumi station need more than 25 minutes

title: Easy travel between City and Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Such an improvement over taxis or hotel pickups between the city centre and the main airport Only 45 Baht each way at time of writing

title: easy and cheap and fast
review: I was surprised how easy it was to take that train Large spaces to put suit cases public toilets in the train  very good way to get down townBangkok

title: only way to go
review: fast and effective and cheap and good to see city but only problem to many people but then again it  is fantastic to travel on

title: Perfect way of travelling around Bangkok.
review: Skytrain connects all major parts of modern Bangkok It is easy cheap and fully airconditioned way to move around Bangkok It also allows you to avoid traffic which is rather a big problem in Bangkok Also using BTS you can reach a train station where you can board Airport Link train

title: Very good
review: Good price convinced faster than a taxi  Totally recommended   You have to buy tickets for train in kiosk System is a very easy Each station has a number you just push number of station and on display showed the price On some station you can pay with coins only

title: Not bad
review: Not to easy to navigate but got their in end Very busy not many seats but nice experience all the same Advice is keep belonging safe

title: Do it!
review: We did the overnight Bangkok to Chiang Mai in early July  We pre booked our 2nd class sleepers for 2 tickets wandered on to the train found our seats only to be entertained by the wonderful & friendly staff onboard whom immediately stowed our cases then offered us Orange Juice (large cups but rather sweet & sickly)  Really good banter with the staff whom continually come around with OJ Chang water menus snacks & teacoffee in the morning They even brought over a chiller bin for our bottles of Chang how kind  There is a gentleman who comes to make up the beds between 20002200 he is so skilled and it is amazing watching him The bed linen is spotlessly laundered & the beds small but reasonably comfortable  The toilets are old & smelly but functional The views you see of Thailand are real & should be experienced for children & adults alike I would certainly recommend taking this bargain trip as it is a great experience although I confess we flew back

title: Go by skytrain
review: clean fast and avoids the trafficchoose a hotel near a station

title: Fast, cheap, clean
review: Fast cheap clean  It's kind of quaint you get a plastic token which you put in when you get to the airport of your stop downtown

title: Get out of those taxis
review: Cheap fast and convenient the Skytrain is the only way to get around the city  It stops in the middle of the best shopping in Bangkok

title: Fantastic
review: What a train service on time  clean and air conditioning The price is cheap from one end of Bangkok to the other about 60baht It's even easy for us foreigners to us haha Top marks to Thailand

title: Comfort public transportation..
review: We took this transportation going to Chatuchak Market Its cost 40 baht from Ratchathewi Bts to Mo Chit Bts Convinience train easy to access

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Don't be afraid to squeeze on in It was very clean safe and fast Best way to get around Bangkok If you don't know what to do just go up to a ticket window where someone will tell you which route you need to take and give you change to buy a ticket at the automated kiosk

title: Cheap and great way to see the city.
review: The MRT is the subway of BangkokIt is cheap and efficientI always try to get a hotel near a station if possible to save walking and using a Taxi or Tuk TukGreat place to hide if there is a war or natural disaster as it is underground

title: So easy to navigate, comfortable and so affordable.
review: Faster than so called BTS (skytrain) and cheaper as well There is only one line (PhayathaiAirport) with about 8 stations in total I prefer it to the regular Skytrain and prefer it to the Subway system also I wish the Express Line will reopen soon so airport becomes even more accessible and faster (from the city)

title: quick and easy
review: A really easy mode of transportation from airport to the city then an easy swap over to the BTS for us to reach our hotel near national stadium Can be quite busy in rush hour Best used for travelling with small amounts of luggage

title: Great Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: Great way to travel in Bangkok Keeps you away from the jam Even if you are travelling out of popular areas take the train to the nearest BTS and continue travelling by taxi (with meter) That way you save travelling time and money

title: BTS √† perfect way to travel in BKK
review: We always live near the BTS when we are in Bangkok because its √† cheap and perfect way to take you around in BKK

title: Crowded and more crowded
review: It is convenient if you are staying in city especially when there is traffic jam in the city but hard to purchase a ticket as there were too many people queuing during peak hour If you are in a hurry it is recommended to use taxi instead of skytrain There isn't too much difference in the price

title: Public Transport
review: As good as any European country if not better on time short waits easy to use access to the stations and reliable I used the BTS train daily to and from work I cannot complain about the service

title: Great way to get around the city
review: BTS is a cheap and easy way to get around Bangkok Would recommend staying at a hotel near the BTS as it makes it easier to get around Came in from the airport on the airport raillink and then caught the BTS to my hotel Super easy

title: Excellent
review: Very good option to get into Bangkok if rush hour Quick Clean Air con Cheap Excellent Still manageable with light luggage but not so much if heavy luggage as getting off at destination a little difficult

title: Convenient!
review: Super convenient to travel around Bangkok If you are 4 people Grab might be cheaper   Best part of BTS is all major stops near mall or monument

title: Easy
review: Getting around on bts ot mrt is very simple but if your more than I person cab (meter) is usually better option traffic excepted

title: Quick and convenient
review: Does the job it's quicker and cheaper than a taxi If you are staying in the airport hotel and have a few hours time on your hands i would recommend jumping on the rail link into Bangkok

title: Super easy to use.
review: Very convenient for getting into the city Take half an hour max Very cheap and no chance of getting stuck in traffic in a taxi But can be very busy at rush hour and in the evenings

title: Good for mall hopping...
review: The skytrain is the main public transport link in Bangkok It is very good for mall hopping because there are malls next to every station but problem is many places like restaurants are not accessible with the skytrain so normally taxi is more convenient and faster

title: Nice Transportation
review: Very fast and cheap trainAirconditioned and you won't sweatPeople won't squeeze you because it's spacious

title: Getting around BBk
review: First time to use the sky train Easy to buy tickets  you can get change at the counters Choose your stop press station number pay the amount and receive your ticket We travelled all morning on the BTS and didn't wait more than a few minutes for a train to arrive It's also good to be able to see a bit of Bangkok while on public transport

title: 'A convenient airport link, but not quick'
review: The Airport Link train from Suvarnabhumi Airport is a great way of getting into Bangkok  Once you come out of baggage claim you just have to make your way to the bottom level of the airport to buy your ticket and board the train I took it about a month ago and my oneway ticket cost about $140 You can transfer onto the BTS Skytrain at Phaya Thai station or Makkasan station The trains run quite frequently  I think every fifteen minutes  but for me the big disappointment is that there is no longer an express nonstop service The train now makes about seven stops before it reaches Phaya Thai but it still gets there in about thirty minutes On the plus side it is clean comfortable and airconditioned A steal at 45 Baht

title: Easy and cheap way to get around
review: Nice cheap way to get around Lots of english speaking staff and easy to follow instructions Very cheap way to get around Had never taken a train before and was fairly easy once you worked out where you need to be Train was nice and clean and well kept as well

title: Good price and easy to use
review: I live in London where I have a lot of experience with the tube there The ARL is just as easy to use with clear sign posts everywhere but at a fraction of the cost and with the trains being in far better condition

title: Trip advisor
review: Sarah is a really nice lady Fantastic tour Thanks for everything had a lot of fun She was very knowledgeable and friendly and spoke good English Thanks again

title: Easy to use !!!
review: Ticket machine provide English menu so you can buy tickets easily But avoid commuting hours not to wait so ~ long time to buy ticket and to ride

title: Cool, quick and smiling transport
review: The skytrain in Bangkok is the fastest way to travel across the city Added to this the courteousness of the staff at the station when you ask for information is amazing It does not go everywhere but covers key areas and then you can take a connecting tuktuk

title: Death Railway
review: Travel the history of Kanchanaburi  history to remember  Appreciate the origin and courage  the patience of a brave soldier  to maintain democracy   This Death Railway has a lot of tourists And there are beautiful places to take pictures But during the day it will be very hot

title: Lovely
review: Good transportation cheap It is veey easy to travel sith the train It is a little bit cold because there is aircon on the train But is is nice a lovely view

title: Easy, Convenient & Safe
review: I'm a single woman and a tourist who can't speak a word of Thai I found it easy to navigate as the stops are coded by North South East and West with numbers So if you figure the stop is E6 then you head east for six stops It's quite clean and safe and gets you where you need to go in Bangkok Oh and it's very cheap

title: Beat the traffic rush.
review: Friday afternoons are traffic nightmare in Bangkok In my previous visit in Feb 17 I have nearly missed my flight back to my home Take skytrain for small distances if you find roads are packed Only key problem it is not that user friendly and have poorly accessible for person with special needs

title: Emissions in the floating market
review: The tour was well organized Tum Tum was a great tour guide The railway market was impressive My experience at the floating market on the other hand was very negative I was sitting in a rowing boat with a family and two children Right next to us were several boats with outboard motors noisy and smelly Four boats next to each other several behind us and in front of us There was a traffic jam on the "market street" Although they weren't moving forward the motorboats were constantly accelerating to stay in their lane and fogging up everything around them I felt particularly sorry for the family with the small children One of the boys held his nose Anything but healthy  for people and nature

title: BTS is too easy
review: Love the speed of the BTS gies where you need to go is very reasonable 26 THB and no traffic jams

title: Well maintained
review: Air conditioning in the train was really cool passengers would not easily feel warm even it is very pack inside Take note that only coins is acceptable for the ticket buying machine you may change your notes to coins from the train information counter

title: efficient and safe
review: Good speed and clean can be crowded during rush hours Gets you to any part of the city in a faster way no traffic

title: Easy
review: No problems and staff even if English is not here spoken language help with a smile Just get on train  With the end destination on the front and watch the tv screen till your stop EASY

title: Great for avoiding the Bangkok traffic
review: Clean quick and reliable with a  great network of stations  Puts the London transport system to shame

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain is very good and the best way to travel aroung Bangkok You sit above the traffic below which is normally at a standstill You can pay by journey but if you intend to spend sometime there then I would advise to buy a pass which allows you to go straight through the barrier No waiting at ticket machines or trying to get change You can put as much money on the ticket as you wish and this can be done at the ticket deskthis being the only que The screen on the barrier will inform you when your debit is low on the card The staff are very helpfull and the skytrain links in well with the Express train from the airport to central Bangkok

title: Good and quick way to get to and from Bangkok to the airport
review: 1st of all this is not an attraction It is part of the transportation infrastructure If you're looking for a inexpensive and quick way to get to and from the airport AND do not have a lot of luggage definitely give this a try The airport station is located at the lower level of the international terminal Although there wasis an express train it is not always running and quite a bit more expensive Take the City Train and get off at Makasan Station or continue on to  It's about a 15 minute to 20 minute ride with all stops From Makasan Station follow signs to the covered walkway leading to the MRT (subway Petchaburi Station) It's a bit of a walk but easy and safe The MRT connects to the Skytrain (BTS) one stop away at Sukhumvit Station Please note you will need to buy a new fare when transfering from the Airport Link to either the BTS or MRT but fares are very reasonable

title: Clean and fast
review: Ride sky train is faster than taxi in central bangkok You have to avoid rush hours because too many people in it and the train sometimes come every 15 minutes Kids and pram friendly  but in some station u have to walk up down by stair

title: Great transport
review: bts skytrain is a great way to reach Bangkok from the airport Bts skytrain is one of the best ways to get around Bangkok and it is very easy buy the tickets and follow the destinations It is clean fast and very efficient  The price is very inexpensive 45 baht to reach Bangkok from the airport and it has  well air conditioned  I suggest to everyone to reach Bangkok through bts skytrain

title: An average experience
review: Took the railway from wang pho to kanchanaburi Our guide advised us to pay extra and get reserved seats which seemed expensive and not sure it was necessary but I think it may also have been a bit more comfortable Journey took 1 hour and was very hot even with every window open Cold drinks and snacks are available as you are whisked through the countryside arriving at the infamous bridge over the river kwae

title: East travel
review: The sky train is a safe fast and efficient way to travel  with easy to follow details for foreigners  it is also exceptionally clean

title: Skytrain
review: Very usefull to go in this havy trafic city especially if your hotel location is near the lines You need some time to use to the directions etc

title: Poor show
review: Today I used Airport Rail Link and the train broke down This incident showed a lack of any plan or preparation by the operator for dealing with a crisis Staff lacked any information to help passengers and no one knew what was happening or what to do There was then no one on hand amongst staff who could speak English so as to deal with the many tourists It was a shambles

title: The sky-train is a must do when visiting Bangkok
review: Always on time plenty of room clean and fantastic views all round  what a fantastic way to travel around this incredible city

title: Great to avoid the traffic!
review: 140bhat for the full day  We jumped on and off so we could see different parts of Bangkok  Much better than a taxi as most of the time u r sat in traffic

title: Easy and most reliable
review: We used the BTS every where we went after having our first ride in with a 'registered taxi' driver from BKK who was very sketchy and totally ripped us off  It is quick so easy to use and English signage every where  We even used it to return from DMK were you take the A1 bus from DMK to Mo Chit station  The bus was a little challenging but totally doable we each had a roller suitcase and bag with us

title: Very Convenient & Economical!
review: Get a Rabbit pass  28 Baht ($1) per ride  Very easy to get around and a nice AC break when walking all over town

title: Nice way to go around Bangkok!
review: The train is easy to get into Though it was slower than we expected it to be having gone to try similar rapid transit in Hong Kong's MTR Nonetheless it's still a better alternative to buses or tuktuks in trafficclogged Bangkok However lines are not that extensive so you still need to ride either a taxi or tuktuk to get to your final destination

title: Cheap and fast
review: Great way to travel downtown from the airport Cheap and not crowdy Think it cost about 50bath or something like that Taxi around 300400 Some pay more

title: USE IT AND NOT A TAXI - too much traffic and loads of traffic jams!
review: It was clean fast beautifully air conditioned and very reasonably priced  The first two days of my stay in Bangkok I used a taxi which was reasonably priced compared to a UK taxi BUT you spend half you travel time in traffic jams  Don't do it  use the Skytrain

title: Great reliable transportation
review: We used the Sky train as our main mode of transportation during our time here to avoid scamming taxis Always reliable and air conditioned Highly recommend it Vietnam sure needs one of these systems  We purchased a Rabbit card each (80 baht non refundable deposit) Made life a bit easier instead of buying a ticket each trip You can also use the card at the Siam Paragon food court for food or at 711 to pay for merchandise

title: Fun train ride, but can be hot and crowded
review: I took the train from Thonburi station in Bangkok to Nam Tok and back to Kanchanaburi  For the view of the river sit on the left going to Nam Tok and on the right going to Kanchanaburi   The train is worth traveling on for fun Of course it is 3rd class so it is hot and can get crowded on a weekend or holiday There's some snacks and water you can get on the train if needed The journey from Bangkok to Nam Tok is about 5 hours total and around 3 hours into Kanchanaburi It was neat to experience the dangerous bridge but only once is enough I think I had fun  Foreigner tickets even if you work here and pay taxes are 100 baht 4x the amount a local pays For what it's worth

title: Public transportation
review: Skytrain is an easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok Clean air conditioned and above the busy streets

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: You cannot go wrong with the sky train  For next to nothing you get to experience BKK and get from point A to point B easily and with a great view    It's safe and a fun way to see the city and people watch

title: Best thing about it is that its air conditioned...
review: I think this is the real reason Bangkok residents love the BTS It's cold  I would highly suggest anyone reserving a hotel to make sure it's close to a BTS station  It's the only efficient way to get around

title: Impossible to buy tickets online. Horrible website
review: It's impossible to buy tickets online What a mess  A tourist who is new in town must physically take the time and spend money to go and buy the tickets at the station before the travel day  What an effort and palaver The locals also said they couldn't buy tickets online Everyone I spoke to was upset and frustrated over this issue Can't comment on the other services because didn't get a chance to travel in a train which is something I always look forward to

title: MRT fast, efficient and on time
review: The MRT was fast efficient and on time Very comfortable and cool with the heat outside A little difficult if you have not done your homework related to where it stops but staff is very helpful

title: Easy to use.
review: The easiest way to get around Bangkok is the sky train Easy to use and at a cost which must be the cheapest in the world We travelled extensively on the sky train and it was clean and safe throughout

title: Suvarnabhumi to Ambassador Hotel
review: The experience was really good The services are frequent and you can escape from the traffic jams in the city The view from the trains are breath taking and you the night travel is safe and beautiful

title: TIME SAVED
review: The time taken by skytrain to a distance as compared to Taxi is 30% of toatal and it saves a lot of time

title: Easy Travel
review: athough new to the city but this made my travel so easy took less time than road to travel in the city it is suggested that you go for skytrain in the evening rush hours so that you save time

title: Cheap and easy way to travel
review: An excellent way to travel around Bangkok Much easier than the London unground The fares are easy to understand and the ticket machines are written in both Thai and English There are booths nearby that will swap your notes into change to get your tickets There are day passes available if you plan to use the trains a lot during the day  The trains are spotlessly clean and have air conditioning which is a welcome respite from the heat outside  The next station is announced in both Thai and English and shown on the screens throughout the train  Much easier than traveling by taxi and the stops are by a lot of the tourist spots

title: Don't panic!
review: This is actually a very easy way to get around Bangkok and links up with the MRT and the airport link The easiest way to navigate the sky train is to buy a travel card at one of the desks you will find at the entrance You can then dispense with having to figure out how much each journey will cost and buying the appropriate ticket just top it up every now and then and swipe it each time you after and leave It's a bit like an Oyster or Octopus card  But be aware it only works on the sky train you will need a separate card for the MRT

title: great to travel about on
review: so quick and easy to travel about on very busy but all the signs are written in englsh everyone knows it as "BTS" so if you need to get there thats what you ask for

title: Very good
review: I would say almost as good as the BTS I guess the MRT is exclusively underground while the BTS is overground and so has views all around

title: cheap but
review: its a hassle after when you get down to street leveljust get a cab its worth it Those energetic enough will not have a problem but after flying long distance to get to LOS I'd rather sit in an air conditioned taxi anyway

title: Fast, easy and cheap
review: Giving how bad the traffic in BKK all day everyday I definitely recommended taking the Airport Rail Link to the airport or from the airport to your place of stay in Bangkok  It is really easy  It is easy to navigate Really cheap and save you the headache of getting stuck in traffic

title: Scammed out of our money.
review: This has been the worst experience of our traveling lives and ruined our honeymoon  I hated this experience shame on them  They told us to meet at a specific address by a Rolex store that does not exist  Several locals tried to help to no avail  Thank you Thailand people  Do not book this  It scares me about booking anything else sight unseen  Do not do it  Scammed in Thailand  We thought trip advisor was better than this  Beware very sad

title: Clean and Quick
review: Very clean and easy to travel on  The AC is also super cold  Something that is a must have in Thailand

title: Efficient
review: It's fast Its on time The ticket is reasonable Not very crowded We commuted in the evening Its a good design

title: Excellent
review: Excellent cool we'll runworth every penny and so cheapyou couldn't see half of Bangkok if this was here Excellent service with friendly people to help

title: Fast and easy to use
review: Far better than a tech and easier than walking As a newby the maned desk is great Seems you can only buy one way tickets (but might be wrong)

title: Public transport at its best
review: I love Skytrain Best way to get around Bangkok no doubt They're reliable and always on time completely unrelated to the heavy traffic inching along in the streets Yes it's crowded during rush hours but what isn't Day passes are available and a great option

title: Modern, clean and efficient
review: BTS is the best way to travel in Bangkok The service is fast clean and efficient and the frequency of trains means that waiting time is small Accommodation reasonably adjacent to the BTS is a great way to get around the city and it is much quicker than travel by taxi The cost is very reasonable especially for tourists (compared to their own countries) Moreover it is safe

title: Using the BTS is definitely the way to get around Bangkok
review: When I'm in Bangkok I find that using the BTS is by far the fastest and cheapest way to go from one point to another (assuming that the final destination is fairly close to a station   This A+ assessment is due to its speedbecause its rails are up above the incredibly congested traffic ("We're so over traffic") you can get from one end of the line to another in twentyfive minutes   And that includes the numerous stops along the way    If the BTS can get you anywhere near your destination take it to that nearest station   After that a taxi or tuktuk is not costly the rest of the way  The stations are modern and convenient and the tickets for fares goes up only a few baht for each succeeding stop

title: Quick and easy
review: The ARL is quick and easy to use Gets from Petchaburi to Airport in 40 mins It beats sitting in the Bangkok traffic

title: Quick easy and cheap
review: Get your bearings in airport then go buy your ticket board the train and less than 20 minutes later you are linking up with MRT or BTS in centre ig Bangkok great

title: Great way to get about the city
review: This is a good way to get around the city quickest means of transportation  I would also say this is great value  I hardly used taxis and would opt for the sky train

title: Use the Physical Map to Know the Skytrain
review: Google Maps displays the stations in Thai which makes it difficult to track the station to alight if the announcements in the train is not spoken in English (which happens sometimes)   Beyond this small inconvenience everything about the Skytrain is positive It's clean comfortable and strangely a cool getaway from the brutal Bangkok afternoon weather

title: A Travel System that seems to work
review: We have used the BTS system to travel around the City It hits specific areas and is useful to go somewhere quickly in this hectic City It works well and is easily understood Fare boards show the cost of travel to various stations and then tickets are easily purchased If you don't have the correct change there is a fare office that will give change Trains are air conditioned which is great We are here in 30 degrees and high humidity

title: Unforgetable
review: This is such a awesome trip and i love it so much  the lady tour guide was so nice and caring (bought us some fruits for us to try along the way back to hotel in the returning journey)   surprisingly she didn't ask for tips which i thought i would have to get some change ready haha she did a good job  well done

title: Only way to travel
review: I have always taken the train to get to my hotel in Sukhumvit Way quicker than by car Ridiculously cheap and easy to navigate

title: The Quick and Easiest way to reach the middle of the city
review: The Airport Rail Link is a great way to reach to the city center provided that you don't have too many luggages It is fast and clean and most of the time it is punctual

title: The most convenience transportation
review: whenever I am in Bangkok I like to stay near the hotel with nearby BTS skytain station as skytrain is the most convenient type of transport to avoid the traffic jam

title: Fun experience, but not necessary.
review: We took the skytrain just to say we did Not a lot of value as we found a taxi to be about the same price for where we were going Very clean & safe You have to look at a map for the exact price for the number of stops you want You then put your money into a machine & get a ticket There are attendants but it appears they are only there to give you change for the machines not tickets for the train

title: fast cheap and easy
review: very quick to the the train from sukhumvit to siam square for an afternoon of shopping only 35 baht which its a great price

title: Spine of Bangkok
review: For 140 baht for a day pass it is a steal to navigate the key tourism spots of Bangkok Especially on super hot weather in early May

title: THE BEST
review: Trains are like 35mins  stops at all major shopping centres Its packed at times but this is definitely they way to travel in BKK Perfect and cheap Use the Rabbit cards

title: Convenient but busy
review: Used this to travel from airport to our hotel Very regular service Seems to be well used as it's always packed Very cheap method of travel

title: Efficient skytrain in Bangkok
review: It is easy to use but the lines cover only limited districts Look out for the automatic gates to the platforms they may bruise your hips if you are not quick enough

title: Easy to use
review: Bangkok's BTS Skytrain is clean convenient & super easy to use To obtain tickets get coins from ticket counter they can also confirm pricing for example from Chong Nonsi to Saphan Taksin only 25 Baht Then get tickets from automated ticket machines Directions & signage in English so easy to follow

title: What a line
review: It's one of the most ridiculous train linking airport and big city as Bangkok It would leave every half an hour for high speed train and at the end of the line u have to walk so far to connect to another local train For another train that leave airport more frequent it would stop by every local stations I suggest to take taxi rather than this air port link line

title: Easy to use, cheap and clean.
review: Easy to use cheap and clean All messages aboard are in Thai and English Quick and safe Trains come regularly (weekdays while I was there)

title: Good urban travel
review: I'm glad i was brave enough to try traveling from the airport to the city Saved a lot of money from taking a taxi

title: Convenient and cheap
review: Very convenient and cheap way to go airport which is only 45baht can drop by Siam Paragon using BTs for some souvenirs as just 2 next the station

title: Humbling
review: One of the most humbling places I've ever been  We visited on a day trip saw the bridge over the river Kwai and rode the train which is highly recommended

title: Very convenient mode of transport
review: One of the best ways to get around Bangkok Fast cheap and air con Especially if you need to be at the Hua Lamphong station Only down part is that there aren‚Äôt any travel cards you can use on all Bangkok public transport systems

title: Brilliant transport system
review: Inexpensive clean frequent and covers a large part of the city Why be stuck going nowhere in a taxi cab when one can travel fast and high above the streets

title: Convenient and fast
review: Got caught up in rain so the traffic wasn't moving  sky train was a good way of actually making progress Only downside is the limited coverage

title: Very Good Trip!!!
review: Very Good Tour Sara is awesome and so funny You must do this Tour ) Floating Market is fantastic and the Trainmarket is a mustsee Thank you so much Sara

title: Surprisingly easy to figure out... once we got cash from ATM.
review: We used the BTS Skytrain to return to our hotel from Muang Borang  Unfortunately the train is still underconstruction close to where we were so we needed to taxi to the closest station however it cut the taxi cost in half to get back to the hotel and gave a different view of the city as we went  If I had more time or went to Bangkok again I would definitely figure out the routs and use the BTS to get to all kinds of sights instead of taking a taxi  Ask at your hotel and they may be able to direct you on what routs and stations you want to use to get to different locations

title: best way to beat the traffic
review: For a single traveller especially this is the best and cheapest way out of Bangkok Airport and into the city Cost me only 35 baht to get to Makasan from the airport From there took a cab and was at my destination in about 30 minutes

title: Convenient and easy
review: A great way to travel around the cityeven for first time visitors like us Really straight forward to use And cheap

title: get a rabbit card
review: you can even get on the bts after 12 if you have a rabbit card  so that you dont have to use the machines to buy a ticket

title: Cheap and quick
review: We have just arrived in Bangkok after a very easy train ride from the airport on the city train Why the city train and not the express By necessity we used the city train when the airport express was out of service on our last visit and it is far cheaper and only stops at a few stations A good tip is to get a train map from the airport train station and plan your route from there Ticket machines are easy to use and have english options And the biggest plus was watching the congested traffic barely moving on the road

title: Not good if you arrive near 11pm
review: The Airport Rail Link is the inexpensive way to go between The Bangkok Skytrain or Subway and the Suvarnabhaum International Airport It is not good way to get to Bangkok if you plane arrives after 11pm as the Airport Rail and Skytrain and Subway close at midnight But luckily there is little traffic at that time of night and a taxi quickly gets into town cheaply

title: Two authentic experiences in a few hours
review: Sara is a great guide and a super thai teacher ) Nothing to say about the organization I appreciated arriving in the afternoon so I had time to do other things in Bangkok The Maeklong market was very nice but we had not much time And the Damnoensaduak market was very crowded when we arrived but more quiet when we left maybe because all the tours arrive at the same time

title: Easy and convenient
review: The Airport Rail Link is such an easy mode of transportation from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok  It is located floor B1 of the airport and there is someone at the ticket machine to guide you if needed Fast and efficient

title: Easy, Fast
review: It is a little bit crowded during the peak hours (6pmish) but it is one of the best and easiest ways to travel around Silom Siam area

title: Same as the BTS
review: I used this to transfer to BTS and MRT It was exciting and easy to navigate You can buy the coin tickets easily by telling he cashier your destination And the fare is really reasonable too

title: Ridiculous solutions not travelers friendly. Careful it‚Äôs cash only! Rush hours overcrowded, no space for extra luggage
review: Apart of the fact that it is a train that brings you quite fast and traffic free to the airport the entire idea of it has nothing to do with being smartly fit to be an airport transportation First of all the ridiculous thing is you pay 15 thb when you go to the airport but 35 when you go from the airport to the city It‚Äôs a cash only place how ridiculous it is I don‚Äôt have to explain At the airport you need to have Thai baht on hand in order to buy the ticket It is also one of the busiest train to be used instead of a subway system so in rush hours you will have problems to get on a train and even onto the station as they stop people from entering the station at certain hours So no it‚Äôs not an airport link as they call it It‚Äôs just a train that also goes to the airport

title: Convenient & exploring Bangkok city
review: 1st time been to Bangkok with my family & parents We bought the day pass THB140 (adult & kid are same price for BTS) to travel around Bangkok city We stayed at Silom area Chong Nonsi station to our hotel just few mins walk so convenient You can visit most of the major shopping malls like Siam center Terminal 21 MBK & more with BTS The stations & area nearby Siam are all connected with private pedestrian walkway so no worry about the traffic You can take BTS to riverside also Recommended for visitor even a 1st visit like me

title: Fantastically easy to get around
review: Unbelievably cheap and efficient Really helpful staff at each ticket office  clear maps air con and no traffic queues A no brainier to use this and not taxis

title: Fast & convenient
review: Great to travel around Bangkok with the Bts as it's air conditoned and service is frequent Try to avoid peak hours as there are many people and long queue Bought tickets from the ticketing counter except at Mo Chit Bts where they didn't have tickets but coins to buy tickets from vending machine

title: A Must See When in Bangkok
review: This tour was phenomenal Both markets were something so cool and interesting to visit and our guide Kiwi was amazing She made sure we did the highlights and tried all the food she even gave us tips on whenwhere to buy things So glad we got left Bangkok for a day to see this

title: Cheap, easy, clean and on time
review: By far the easiest way to get around Bangkok It's cheap easy to use and work out how to get from A to B air conditioned and always runs on time   By all means take a tuktuk a couple of times for the experience but use the BTS it's so easy

title: Best way to airport
review: We have used this train a few times now  It is such an easy no stress way to get to the airport  Trains run frequently and keeps you out of the traffic

title: Lots of stairs
review: Good network but the stairs are not elderly friendly Escalators only for some lines Mostly need to climb stairs

title: Cheap and good
review: It is really good and cheap Transfer to many places in Bangkok  From skytrane you have really nice view specially at night

title: One of the best ways to get around
review: The BTS Skytrain is one of the best ways to get around central Bangkok  Its cheap and efficient The trains run on time and are airconditioned and comfortable The map and ticketing machine systems are easy to follow You can also buy a ticket from  a person at the ticketing window Its always a good idea to get a hotel close to a BTS station as it makes life a lot easier to get around  In the Bangkok traffic taxis can get expensive and  it takes a long time to reach your destination   Top Tip If you do need to take taxis down load the grab app which is just like Uber Its a flat fare and you know exactly how much you'll pay before you book I use it all the time

title: fast way to travel
review: very fast way to avoid the traffic jams in the city a much faster mode of transport the map of the skytrain helps you find ur way

title: Thai Railways Old and Decrepid
review: Travelling by train in Thailand is quite an adventure the locos and rolling stock are ancient and the tracks not well maintained The best way to travel long distance is by first class sleeper but try not to go to the toilet it is a squat toilet that opens on to the speeding tracks below  Time keeping is not best with trains often arriving at their destination hours late  If you can fly or drive then do so in preference to travelling long distance by train

title: direct way to airport
review: This is the bast way to go to the airport quickly and cheap because there is the walkways link to the airport so it's convenient for you to carry your bag and walk into the airport instead of paying higher cost on taxi

title: Always Crowed
review: It's always that crowded on every train ride Station staff needs to brush up their english in order to dispense accurate information to foreigners

title: Fast way to get from airport to Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be bad This a fast way to get from airport to Bangkok city Is about 30 mins to a station that links to MRT

title: Very Convenient!
review: It is very convenient to have this Airport Rail Link It cost me only about 50B to get from the Suvarnabhumi airport to my hotel in Asok Station They should have this at the DMK airport too

title: Refuge From Traffic
review: It can be crowded at times but if your hotel and destination is along the BTS line you should not use anything else

title: trip with little one
review: Bets is a great & affordable way to get around Bangkok  Stops are announced in English & the maps are fairly clear Make sure you have Thai baht coins as the cash change machine doesn't always work Don't expect that people will follow signs & give up seats for small children pregnant women or elderly as that was not the case on our ride

title: Improving Day By Day
review: There is something different about the BTS system recently as I noticed  Oh yes they are expanding and the interval between trains are shorter   Well done Bangkok for improving the BTS line

title: Easy access to and from airport
review: Want to get to city fast and cheap  and it's very convenient  Get to the city from the airport within 45 mins no jams no toll fee and usually no crowded trains Great for solo tourist and it costs only up to 45 bahts to get to Ratchaprarop which is near Pratunam

title: My favorite transport in Bangkok
review: The MRT is not only faster cheap and less crowded but also recently serves tourist sites such as Chinatown Wat Pho the Grand Palais and a few minutes away the Museum Siam The suburb to Thonburi a station close to the Wat Arun Bang kae markets and Khlongs Some stations are nicely decorated and equipped with lift and all have escalators although benches on the platforms will be welcomeA 50% card discount for the senior aged 60 years Most of the station have a confortable mall and direction clearly marked signboards A TV screen show the waiting time for the next train and the staff are very kind   Smart card if you spend few days in Bangkok or token single journey vending machines or buy at ticket office Long queues at rush hour you can walk to the other side of the station it maybe better Fare indicated on a board in the stations

title: Good
review: Airport rail link is a great way to get into bangkok and a reasonable price Only downfall is there are not enough carriages so it gets packed and with nowhere to put you cases it can be hell cost 35 bht pp

title: Fast and Cheap!
review: Best way to get around BKK  Fast cheap and convenient to get to both shopping and tourist areas  Super busy at rush hour but manageable

title: best way
review: best way to move around in bangkok We took only taxis the first day here but we lost too much time being stuck in traffic in an icecold ac taxi Bts is much better to move around in bangkok

title: Convenience and cheap
review: The best public transport in Bangkok You will never care about traffic jam in Thailand just wait about 5~10 min and you can go everywhere

title: Efficient, frequent trains
review: The Purple line is the most useful for visitors as it connects with State Railways of Thailand's commuter and long distance trains to destinations such as Chiang Mai and Surat Thani  Underground trains are reliable smooth and frequent although during the off peak the latter drops off a bit  Ticketing has a day pass available but it does not seem to offer unlimited trips  Ticketing would improve if a multi modal ticket covering BTS and MRT was introduced  Staff are efficient and speak English a necessity given so many foreigners who use the MRT  Stations have lifts although there are a few steps from street level to negotiate so it is not completely disabled friendly  There are retail outlets at some stations  Trains as expected are crowded during the peaks

title: Super efficient!
review: We made sure we stayed near the ARL so we could get there easily Although with huge suitcases rolling on busy market streets wasn't exactly easy it was fairly convenient to get to the Ratchaprarop Station to board the City Line which stops at every station compared to the Express Line but we still made it to the airport in good time To top it off we got a free ride as it was New Year's Eve  thank you Thailand We enjoyed every bit of our trip and every trip that we have had to Thailand )

title: exellent ad fast
review: fast and clean every 15 minutes take off and they have a service 24 hours from a well known location

title: Would recommend!
review: I had to leave a review because I loved our tour guide Unfortunately i forgot her name but I think it was Yui  (big cheeks in thai) She was incredibly knowledgable and funny and took amazing care of us aslong as our driver Going on this tour allowed us to view and experience such unique places without ever having to worry and I had a great time Thanks so much again to our tour guide and driver

title: best way to move around town
review: very punctual clean and available different lines take you to multiple places It was easy to handle and use all around

title: best way to reach the city
review: depend on what time you arrive at the airport bangkok is a very busy city  the airport rail takes between 30 to 40 minutes to reach the center and then you can catch the btw to go to your final destination price is 45 bath

title: Quick and reliable
review: There is nothing much exciting about riding the tube The network still isn't anywhere dense enough to cover the city but if there is a line this is usually the fastest way of travel

title: Best way to travel!
review: We have been to Bangkok a number of times and have always relied on the Tuk Tuks but this time we used the Skytrain and we LOVED IT Best way to travel around Bangkok as it much cheaper cleaner and removes all the tiresome haggling

title: Transport
review: Clean and efficient way to get around the main districts of Bangkok  Top tip  book a hotel wishing walking distance

title: Great transport system
review: Bangkok's MRT is a great way to get around the system It's punctual regular clean and inexpensive The MRT has a broad  network that gets you to most of the city's main attractions

title: Cheap rate but too crowded
review: It is very cheap n easy to get to other travel sites by BTS but it is too crowded and it is so hot in the skytrain

title: Convenient Bangkok transportation
review: I remember Bangkok before BTS (the "skytrain") and the MRT ("underground") These are great improvements to Bangkok transportation infrastructure Both are easy to use You can buy stored value cards and this makes them even more convenient BTS gets more tourists I think because it travels to more touristed locations Enjoy your visit to Bangkok and venture out on the BTS

title: Clean Efficent and Cheap
review: Nothing more to add The title says it all Way better and cheaper than trying to get a taxi and far faster from the centre of town

title: Easy access to the city
review: The train is clean and cheap It gets more crowded as it approaches the city center It costs about USD2 from airport to Phaya Thai (the end terminal) which connects to other rail services within the city

title: Suvarnabhumi Airport To hua lamphong railway station
review: We arrived at Suvarnabhumi Airport approximately 1230 pm We didn‚Äôt have to collect our luggage as we did carry on only We grabbed some money from the exchange & for our SIM cards for our cell phones & we were off to the skytrain It was quite easy to navigate to the skytrain & we purchased our tickets from airport to Makkason station then walked a short distance to Petchaburi station to grab the MRT to Hua Lamphong railway station  I think the entire trip for 2 of us cost only 60 baht AND it took us less than an hour to do it   Don‚Äôt be afraid to try it It‚Äôs super easy & if you do make a mistake there are lots of people able to help

title: BTS SKYTRAIN
review: Great mode of transport for getting about Bangkok This avoids all the traffic and mayhem below It covers most of Bangkok and is very popular with locals and tourists alike The trains are very busy so don‚Äôt expect a seat every time The ticket machines are in the stations and are easy to use just have plenty of change It is quite cheap to use Siam Square station is a busy interchange and the National Stadium is where the MBK shopping centre is directly out of the station Also the Art and Culture Centre is there

title: Great transportation system
review: Easy to use and navigate and an allday pass is only 140 bhat well worth it And probably safer than the tuktuks

title: BKK-SkyTrain
review: With the crazy traffic the BK subway systems(s) are the best and they move lots of people efficiently A great system for getting to tourist spots shopping restaurants and nightlife

title: So easy to use and essential if staying along or near Sukhimvit Road
review: Buy a Rabbit card to use the BTS Travel efficiently in air conditioned comfort to many shopping centres food courts & hotels in this area of Bangkok or to the river to access other tourist attractions The Rabbit card can also be used at food courts to pay for meals

title: Cheap and good
review: Best way to move around in the town quick and cheap and they cover almost the whole city  And I'll totally recommend this if you are here for couple of days better just buy the card rather than paying to the tuk tuk drivers

title: Often more convenient and quicker than a taxi
review: I switched to taking the airport rail link from taking a taxi It is often gets you to your destination more quickly than a taxi with good connections to Bangkok's other elevated and subway rail systems

title: Amazing experience
review: Sarah is an Amazing guide Everything Was perfect from the markets to the food and the van travel I kindly suggest this trip

title: Fast and efficient way to get around Bangkok
review: As with all trains this can be crowded but it is efficient and gets you around Bangkok and right into the city from many water ferry stations on the river

title: Very Nice And Clean Transportation......
review: We took the Rail Link 2times and the experience was very pleasant  Very clean and safe  Not your typical New York Subway

title: Amazing experience of Maeklong Railway Market & Daemneon Flaoting Market!
review: Had a great time on the Maeklong Railway & Daemnoen Floating Market Tour  Our tour guide was Lucky & she was great in taking us & guiding us through this tour  We‚Äôve seen these two markets on social media and have always wanted to come so we‚Äôre so happy that we did and got to do it through BigCountry Experience  We got picked up from River Ciry Bangkok which was quick & easy to get to from our hotel The drive over to Maeklong Railway was approximately 45min to an hour but we stopped at a nice rest area to use the restrooms & get a refreshment for those who chose to  After we drive to the train station to board the train go to Maeklong Railway   It was so cool to experience the Railway market from both vantage points of being on the train and on the track  After the railway market we took a short drive to the floating market & took a ride on the river boat  Both railway & floating markets were amazing  Highly recommend this tour‚Ä¶

title: Easy way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is a simple and fast way to get around Bangkok If you are going to be using it often there are deals you can get with a Rabbit Card which is like a Prepaid card for the BTS It is a bit cheaper and also saves time so you don‚Äôt have to constantly buy single trip tickets

title: Lovely experience would recommend Sara
review: Sara was lovely great tour guide and full of knowledge Would really recommend to get the best experience and make full use of the time in Bangkok

title: 10/10 would recommend
review: Very fun and detailed tour got to see stuff I'd never get to see back in Australia and the tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable

title: Not Fun
review: I taken the train expecting a city overview But I actually got a normal train You can see some interesting points but the most part of travel is just building view and average landscapes

title: Getting Very Crowded
review: The BTS is still the easiest method and cheapest way to get around Bangkok if it goes near where you want to go It is only two lines I have been riding it since it first opened I noticed that now it is very very crowded at all times not just rush hour The lines waiting to enter the train are huge and often you do not get on the first train to come The cars are just jammed packed They need to add more trains

title: Cheap and fast
review: The trains are nice an cold ( they only have 2 lines and not to the older part of bangkok Its a cheap way to get around

title: Alex Dunnin
review: Fantastic urban rail system So easy to use no hassles at all cheap Made travelling around Bangkok City a breeze Only wish Sydney Australia had such a great system A truly visionary piece of transport infrastructure

title: Easy and cheap
review: Arriving in Bangkok we were unsure about whether to catch the train or get a taxi We decided to be adventurous and catch the train I'm glad we did because it was peak hour and all the way to our hotel we could see the road traffic either crawling along or at a standstill The only downside was that when we connected to the BTS it was still peak hour and there was little room for our suitcases However we made it on and off the train without too much difficulty  just a lot of "sorry" "excuse me" "sorry" I would definitely recommend taking the Airport Rail Link  be mindful of peak hour though  especially if you have lots of luggage or kids with you

title: Easy to use
review: We travelled from airport to hotel for only 40 Bath per person Easy to use as long as you do your homework before hand and know which stop you need to get off

title: fast and eccelent
review: amazing train very fast absolutly necessery to visit Bangkok you can forget the incredible traffic of this fantastic city Siam station is a great place to start your city visit

title: It's the cleaniest sky train ever.
review: If you want to take sky train recommend not to do during rush hours otherwise you will be like canned fish It's very clean because it's not allowed to drink and eat inside the train or the station

title: Pricey and inconvenient.
review: Modern and well run but not cost effective for a family  Even small children need to pay a (reduced) fare  Compare to Tokyo where kids five and under ride for free  Taxis are a much cheaper option and can even be faster than the BTS depending on the time of day  Lots of stairs to climb as well and routes are fairly limited at present

title: Best way across bangkok
review: Skip the cabs and shady tuk tuka get in the clean air conditioned tramway for 30 baht or so Traffic can be a nightmare do this instead

title: The fastest way from the airport to the City centre.
review: A cheap and easy way to reach Central Bangkok from the International Airport Oddly it doesn't terminate at or near Bangkok's Central Station so most people need to transfer to either the Sky Train or the underground train to reach most of the hotels in the city

title: Fast and effecient transporation
review: BTS is so efficient and cheapest means of transportation getting around Bangkok It also located near the MRT

title: You will like it
review: So much fun so much memorable thingsthx miss sara you are so kind and english is goodwill go with u again in the next travelling

title: Safe, Fast, Cheap and Comfortable
review: When a transport is modern in very good conditions and also safe  fast  very cheap(unless you only do one or two stops because the price it's the always the same) and comfortable you must give 5stars

title: Convenient transport to the Airport
review: This is a cheap and convenient transportation to Suwannaphum Airport since the travel by public taxi is more expensive as well as heavy traffic jam and some drivers are not willing to go for a short destination

title: I wish we had a subway system as clean and reliable source n NY
review: By comparison nyc subways are garbage This system may not run 247 but it is highly efficient and extremely clean It makes NY seem like a third world city by comparison

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: Most hotels on the river side have shuttle boats to the nearest BTSstation During rush hour the trains can be crowded but they will take you quickly where you want

title: A cheap handy way of avoiding Bangkok traffic
review: It's an underground metro system  You can go quickly around the city avoiding traffic  There are ticket machines on the wall or you can use the ticket office  if you are staying long term in Bangkok consider an MRT M card which you can top up at the ticket office

title: Convenient w/Great ViEWS
review: i first came to Bangkok in 1985  Imagine no Skytrain  No Subway  It was all BUSES  All PRIVATE bus companies that didn't coordinate their routes with each other & that drove meandering routes not necessarily straight lines down major avenues  It was a mess and hot and punctuated wpuffs of black exhaust  Now you got the Skytrain  Take it to the very last stop and see Bangkok's skyline  I've seen Bangkok grow up  Now my "kids" are bigger and taller than me

title: Easy and safe way to get around
review: Easy air conditioned way to get around Language poses no problem Not sure of handicapped accessibility

title: Connecting
review: Easy to use train service connecting Bangkok With underground station interchanges Ticket system good and although sometimes crowded it is a easy way to get round Bangkok

title: Easy and quick
review: Cheaper way to leave the airport Easy and Quick  Departure from the underground of the airport (2)

title: Watch them in the jam
review: Superb mean of transport  New line opening soon It's clean It's neat It's Asia Why does it close so early

title: great transport system
review: although it can get cramped during rush hour there is no better way of getting around in Bangkok city the views are awesome too

title: Need improvement
review: Most of the BTS station require passenger to climb up the stairs for their services This is not friendly to travellers who need to carry pram or elderly passenger having walking difficulty I acknowledge that there are a few BTS station with access to buildings thus allowing passenger to use the building elevator to get to and out of BTS station But it is too few  Suggest to install escalator or elevator at majority of BTS station

title: fast and convenient but crowded during rush hours
review: I highly recommend taking the airport rail link if you are staying somewhere that is near a train station Using the airport rail helps you avoid the Bangkok traffic The airport rail trip plus the transfer trip can be a lot shorter than sitting through traffic However the airport rail gets very busy as well so I don't recommend taking it when you have big luggage(s)

title: Efficient!
review: Used te skytrain in the rush hour because of the traffic jams once you know how it works it's easy as pie best way to travel in Bangkok

title: Great Transport
review: When I go to Bangkok this month that was my first time So I was quite surprise to see that actually the traffics and the public transport in Bangkok are better than Jakarta About the BTS it was great the car is clean and the aircon are working perfectly the arrival and departure timing are great too But please be advice when you're about to board it on the first time follow where are the local passengers grouping Because that's where the train going to stop either way you'll waiting too far and need to run to catch it There's no sign at the platform where the train going to stop

title: Fastest and cheapest way from airport to the city.
review: Airport Rail Link is the fastest and cheapest way from Suvarnabuhmi airport to the city (it costs only 45 Thai Baht and around 30 minutes) Then you could take BTS skytrain to most of the popular tourist areas However if you have too much luggage to carry it's better to call a taxi from the airport to go directly to your hotel as it might be too difficult for carry luggages to walk down stairs

title: Easy !
review: best way to get to downtown Bangkok and back to the airport Very easy all signs are in English and Thai  great price very economical way to get to the airport

title: Just to be aware
review: The idea of seeing the markets is amazing however the time at the train market was was to fast There was virtually no time to really get to experience the shopping in the market The floating market was a great experience

title: Intuitive to use
review: The system is intuitive if you are familiar with subways if not the staff at the counters are helpful and you'll be on your way to your destination in no time

title: Railway trip
review: To enoy the whole journey start from Thonburi Station and end at Nam Tok Station Ticket is 100 bath per trip and journey take around 5h If short of time don't miss the train over River Kwai Bridge Krasae Cave Dangerous Curve & Wang Po

title: Great time saver but not easy for disabled/elderly people
review: If anyone has been to Bangkok and been stuck in their traffic jam even once they know how essential it is to learn how to use their sky train system  Pros The trains are clean The airconditioning feels wonderful in the tropical heat Trains come every few minutes and run till midnight  Route covers key tourist spots Some stations (like Saphan Taksin) connects to river shuttle which will take you to places like Chinatown or Grand Palace while AsokeSiam connect to MRT(subway) Some cons Most stations involve lots of stairs  so it can be tough for elderly people or those with mobility issues You can buy tickets on machines but the machines only accept coins You have to line up to get coins or to buy tickets In busy stationspeak hour the lines can be long Depending on your  travel it's better to buy a day pass Station names are written only in one or two places  so if you are distracted when you reach a station and try to look out the window chances are you won't spot the station name easily So keep a watch on the route map above the door  which also will alert you (quite late) from which side the door will open

title: Wonderful and easy
review: Used BTS for my travel during my visit to bangkok Travel from Ramkhamhaeng to river chopraya was a breeze Travelled to Makkasan changed to Pichburi to go to silom changed to Sala dang and to chopraya Reverse journey the same Easy inexpensive and time saving Ticket dispensing machines are easy to use Stations have eateries and restaurants You can relax in between Air conditioned trains are fast and comfortable Proper display system makes surebyou get off at the right station Enjoyed

title: Well - its a train
review: We used this when commuting around Bangkok and it worked very well The system seems used alot by locals as well as tourists but only a few times did we jump on very filled trains  Easy to use and costs is very low (for foreigners)

title: Sky train
review: Easy way to travel around Bangkok seemed quite good value All part of the Bangkok experience I would use the sky train again

title: Very convenient way to reach airport from the city
review: I took the train on the way back to the airport and it was really easy The luggage got checked in at the station itself and then I was free for the entire duration of the journey right till boarding

title: Best way to get around busy Bangkok
review: Easy travel Easy to work out the fares and buy a ticket in the machine Regular trains and very well airconditioned carriages Beats sitting in the road traffic

title: Adequate at Non-Rush Hour
review: The skytrain is now 1314 years old and most of my experiences have been good on it Exceptions now are rush hours near the busiest stations where the hordes jockey for places in line and cram into the coaches   It has recently suffered from breakdowns due to lack of maintenance  So traveler beware

title: Fast (and cool) transport around Bangkok
review: The BTS is very effective at shifting people around Bangkok The trains are often crowded but run on time and air conditioned The tickets can be sourced from a machine but you will need coins for the most part  change can usually be obtaine from the station staff in the ticketing box though Not at all expensive with a normal trip costing about THB2540 We used it daily for 5 days and were impressed

title: Skytrain
review: The bts is very reliable clean has air con and is easy to navigate Its also very cheap The carriages are big with lots of space The only setback is it dosen't cover the whole of Bangkok only the tourist areas There is an underground also but again does not cover the whole of Bangkok

title: fast and cheap
review: If  you do not use the express train this is a very cheap way to come into town from the airport It is also fast even if you do not use the express train

title: Spent 4 days in Bangkok riding almost only the BTS - cheap, fast and A/C
review: very comfortable way to get from place to place in Bangkok especially during rush hour Fast clean and well AC staying in a hotel along the BTS line saved me a lot of time and money

title: Travel Underground
review: I've been taking the MRT for about a month now Have to say Im impressed It's never too overcrowded and it's FAST Seriously make sure you hold on to one of the straps when you get in because this sucker takes off I also like that the internet works perfectly underground This and Skytrain are great ways to get around the city without being in so much traffic

title: Airport-connected
review: As the name suggests this train system is connected to the Airport The station going to the city center is Phaya Thai This is where all the other train systems connect to

title: Very pleasant and easy
review: Very easy to use metro in Bangkok like in Tokyo You can go and return from the airport with luggages very easily

title: Public transport
review: Easy and convenient for travelling in Bangkok The aircon are cool but usually the trains are crowded The fares are so much cheaper than taking taxis or tuh tuh And you dun face the traffic jam

title: Excellent Transportation
review: It connect to 6 shopping malls along the way From Siam Paragon to Thong Lo  also bring me to most of the places I wanted to go Excellent Things that I do not like is some of the station do not have escalator need to climb the staircase also during peak hours 4pm to 8pm it is too crowded

title: Very pretty ride to Nom Tok
review: I really enjoyed the ride to the National Park It was enjoyable and much better than the bus Make sure you arrive 30 min early for tickets

title: A fast, efficient way of getting around
review: Our guide took us on the Skytrain which was a fast efficient and cheap way of negotiating Bangkok The trains are very clean and offer great view

title: Reasonable price and fast
review: Its best to use skytrains whenever possible as the taxi fares can be too much for tourists  Taxi drivers charge 300400% more from tourists

title: hotel are closed to sukhumvit MRT (opposite terminal 21)
review: around 10mins walk to BTS asok right at terminal 21 and sukhumvit MRT  hotel located between BTS Phromphong (right at Emporium mall) and BTS Asok (Terminal 21)

title: Best way to avoid traffic in Bangkok
review: If you can use this service do it especially in the mornings and evenings and 100 percent on a friday evening when Bangkok is stuck especially if it rains You can buy a rechargeable card just pay with coins or buy a day ticket Major sights are connected Siam Square silom and Patpong Sukhumvit Road and the weekend market

title: Great way to scoot around Bangkok!
review: Very cheap air conditioned (what a boon) Served most of the places I wanted to go or linked up with another service that did (Metro)

title: Very convince
review: I use to take everyday on i go to work but now change so not use anymore but very much enjoy and good for bangkok people

title: Simple to use

title: Best way to travel from Airport to the Bangkok CBD

title: BTS Sky Rail a good way to travel Bangkok!!
review: Bangkok has a Sky Rail service which hubs through the centre of the city at Siam station and reaches out in three main directions To the SW to Bang Wa station near Bang Khae SE to Bearing station and North to Mo Chit  The BTS system interlinks with the underground rail known as the MTS which services other parts of the city   The carriages are modern quite and very well airconditioned for passenger comfort At peak times the carriages will become packed with standing room only or no room just a crush On less busy times comfotable yellow seating is provided with TV screens on each side of each carriage to keep you entertained  The system announces each stop well in advance in both Thai and English  All in all a very useful facility to get around the main locations in Bangkok

title: Fast, Cheap and Comfortable way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain offers a fast way to get around the Bangkok bypassing the notorious traffic jams that the city is famous for  The skytrain runs on two lines  the Sukhumvit line runs from Mo Chit (famous for its bus terminal and Chatuchak park) in the North to Bearing while the Silom line runs from National Stadium (famous for the stadium MBK and other shopping centers) to Bang Wa and covers downtown Bangkok The two lines are connected at the Siam station and also interconnected to the Airport Rail Link MRT and the boat taxi piers The entire network is airconditioned which is great comfort in the humid heat of Thai summers It is also surprisingly affordable with tickets starting at about 50 US cents  Prepaid (rabbit) cards with a fixed number of trips are also available for tourists  The network covers the Central business district as well as the major shopping and nightlife areas Unfortunately for the tourists it does not cover some of the major Bangkok attractions like the Grand Palace Wat Arun and other major temples So tourists are at the mercy of Bangkok traffic here Trains are not too crowded except at peak hours and are fairly frequent during the daytime  The skytrain is a fast cheap and comfortable way to get around Bangkok and is well worth travelling on

title: Don't get on during rush hours
review: I mean the BTS is now the main mode of transportation for people commuting in out and around Bangkok due to its convenience and fasttravel The air con is nice and the seats are okay not exactly equipped for long travel But BUT IT CAN BE SO CROWDED Of course this is during the rush hours During said time there can be delays DELAYS AND LOTS OF THEM Yes and they aren't exactly cheap Cheaper than taxis or motorcycles but they are pretty expensive still They aren't automatically operated so obviously there are drivers AND SOME OF THESE DRIVERS SUCK I mean it Suddenly stepping on the brakes out of the blue and knocking every passenger off their feet or parking not exactly in align with the door openings I mean come on And it can't really be helped because it is one of the most convenient modes of transportation available considering all of the frustrating traffic jams in the city So unless absolutely necessary I suggest that you avoid using the BTS during rush hours

title: Bangkok has Three Excellent Urban Train Services
review: I'm a huge fan of the Airport Rail Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok proper   (cheap very reliable and avoids horrendous traffic) and there's another airport link being constructed at the moment (Sep 2016) to service BKK's other major airport at Don Mueang The Airport Train provides great access to and from the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport  a great world class service that gets you as close to the airport as a taxi does and there's an interchange station with the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations  The Airport Rail Link is in very good company with both the BTS Skytrain and MRT Underground Train  all three provide public transport to a world class standard   	 If you're staying within close proximity to one the BTS Skytrain or MRT Underground Train stations they should be your primary transport whilst in Bangkok  if you're not staying within close proximity I suggest you should consider relocating   If the Skytrain doesn't get you to one of the mustsee attractions around Bangkok the MRT likely will  and viceversa  Skytrain offers the views of BKK whilst perched above the ground in airconditioned comfort but MRT stations provides a reprieve from the heat whilst waiting for air conditioned trains to come along

review: The BTS system is a reliable fast and comfortable way to get across Bangkok especially if you're staying a bit far from the centre The ticket machines have different language options so are easy to figure out and each station has a number code so you don't even need to be able to readpronounce the station names You need to ask at the desk for change to put in the machines There are TV screens throughout the carriages displaying the station in a green banner at the bottom (I missed this the first time I travelled on BTS and missed my stop because I wasn't paying attention) Oh and it's really cool that it floats in the sky so worth taking in the view from the platform and watching the traffic flow beneath the tracks

title: Essential connection to the past
review: What ThailandBurma train or Death Railway which runs from Namtok to Thonburi delivers is not a spectacular journey with scenic beauty around or pleasant weather or posh cabins For that please visit a different train at a different location On ThailandBurma Death Railway we are connecting to the brutal past of WWII What the soldiers from many countries who were PoW had to undergo to build this railroad And to get a taste of it you travel in railcar without airconditioning or plush seats but open windows and a small ceiling fan The scenery around is just rural and agricultural Thailand but before you stop at Thamkra Sae you tend to see the bridge on the river Kwai with arc like curvature on railroad It was one of the greatest railroad construction challenges back then when there were no ample resources but only the matter of life and death to lead the engineers design this structure The journey takes 90 mins from Kwai Rver station to Thamkra Sae When you get down at Thamkra Sae you could walk to see the curved bridge as well as find the temple of Lord Buddha in the cave It is critical to understand that the initiative to keep this railroad running for tourist in almost same condition is a challenging job and a lot depends on how tourists respond to this From my visit it appears that indeed it is a major attraction and Thailand should run this forever to allow the visitors get a glimpse of the horrors of the war
