title: Used to be great - horribly busy now
review: I live in Bangkok  Eight years ago the BTS was convenient and seemed to have ample space for passenger volume I loved it especially after living in a city without good public transport Compared to many other cities in SEA Bangkok was moving forward along the lines of Singapore's transport development   I use the BTS on an almost daily basis for work From 2017 onward it has become a painful and stressful exercise   It is always supercrowded during rush hours and often horribly crowded in offpeak hours More stops have been added but the number of cars have remained stagnant   Given the horrible amount of air pollution these days in Bangkok (on some days it is now at the point where it is detrimental to even healthy individuals) you would assume more was being done to encourage BTS improvement  It is not    Delays are frequent and last year delays involved people being trapped in the cars for up to 45 minutes with no carrier movement and inadequate ventilation   It has become horribly unpleasant and now for the first time here I am going to buy a car just to avoid it I cannot change my hours of work so this is the last variable I have at hand given that riding a motorcycle taxi exposes you to pollution and accidents (as well as the hot environment) and taking a taxi has become difficult as well due to traffic and high customer volume   There has also been limited effort on integration with the MRT boat and other transport mechanisms as well ie Rabbit card vs Mangmoon Card debacle  Prices have gone up service has gone down  Don't get me started on the limited accommodations that have been to physically challenged passengers but I will say the following    The BTS staff try their best to help those in need but elevators etc as well as the treatment from other passengers remain in a shocking state (non working or absent elevators for example at some stations or ablebodied passengers taking the elevator while a person in wheelchair gets shunted aside) These are events I observe every day or every week   This system has so much potential and so much need It is unfortunate that project deployment and oversee has really dropped the ball   It is still a useful system to get around Bangkok given the alternatives It has just been disappointing to watch a good idea decline due to poor planning and integration

title: The Only Way to Get Around BKK
review: Visiting Bangkok Try to find a hotel close to a BTS Skytrain station so you can truly see all the city and avoid the absolutely horrible BKK traffic   The BTS system is cheap and convenient and truly the only way to get around BKK without being stuck for an hour in traffic Easy to use  just locate your destination terminal on the ticket machine maps ( the number next to it is the amount for the ticket) pop in your coins and take your ticket Remember to keep the ticket you have to use it to get out Convenient coin changing stations next to the ticket stations  A couple of traveler hints  If you are going to be in BKK for more than a couple of days and plan on using the BTS extensively go to window 3 at the station and purchase a Rabbit BTS card It costs 50 baht and load it with 400  500 baht You can then avoid the at times long change and ticket lines and go straight to the train  Also before you go on the BTS google map your destination and make sure you are getting off at the closest BTS  I highly suggest you take a picture of the destination map close up enough to read the streets  it can save a lot of headache trying to find the little restaurant or attraction you are going to If your destination is too far to walk from the closest BTS take a taxi or tuk tuk Sometimes the taxis will not want the fare if it is too close to the BTS (be polite  you have to ask the taxi driver if they will take the fare) But the tuktuk will almost always give a lift Also this is where that screen shot comes handy if you don't speak Thai  Finally some BTS etiquette Be polite wait in line don't cut in place Let the passengers off the train first then get on Men leave the seats to the ladies unless the train is empty or only partially full Always give your seat up to the elderly And don't sweat the crowded train push by the other passengers The trains can get packed during morning and evening hours and most dont want to wait for the next train Also no eating or drinking is allowed on the trains  Hint  try to get on the train closest to the exit stairs That way when you get off you will be right at the exit Also if you are unsure which exit to take use that handy screen shot to ask the exit security guard (before you exit) this will save you loads of time and mistakes of getting off on the wrong side of the road

title: Unforgettable memories of Bangkok
review: On this tour we got to visit Maeklong Railway Market and Saduak Floating Market  It was a bit disappointing that they were unable to pick us up as was the plan but our hotel was a bit far off from the meeting point so I understand    When we arrived at the meeting point we checked in and waited for departure  Once on the road our guide was wellversed in Thai history and local culture which gave us a greater understanding of Thailand in general and the provinces we were visiting specifically  This person also kept us very well informed of what we would be doing how much time we had at a place and other logistical details   We were driven very professionally by our driver first to  Kalong Station where there are some salt fields and from where we would take the train to the famous Maeklong Train Market  Kalong in itself was very enjoyable as we were able to take a 15 minute break and take some pictures of  the very cute station area  After our break we got on the train for our trip to Maeklong  It was fun to ride a real Thai train  very crowded on the day we were there but it varies from one day to another  but a good experience all the same about a 20 minute ride from Kalong  Once we arrived at bustling Maeklong station it was fun to see how quickly vendors pack up their stalls when a train comes in and set them back up when the train passes  It is done in a matter of seconds as shopkeepers don't want to miss a second of business   While there you have time to walk along the tracks in an insanely crowded meter next to the tracks and consider whether you want to buy some crazy cheap food or souvenirs  My wife and I bought five magnets of the train coming into the station for only 100 baht (about $270)  Then we drove a short distance to the Floating Market  Taking a Thai long boat through the canal was something I'll never forget  This is a working area where people buy and sell and live and we were able to experience all that all the while getting food drink and souvenirs at huge discounts  The area is scenic and beautiful palm trees dot the area and people go about their daily lives in their houses and you're seeing things you've never seen before (and may not see again)  Finally we were able to sit down and eat at the food court for about an hour after the boat ride paying only about $1 each for our meals  We got to get to know some other people on the tour and take in the scene at the Floating Market  From there we headed back to Bangkok again driven wonderfully by our driver  If I had anything bad to say it's that the tour guide knew too **much**  I mostly wanted to take in the sights and sounds of Bangkok and the surrounding area as we drove up there but we were given a collegelevel history lesson about Thailand and its kings  I felt I had to focus and pay attention but I didn't really need a detailed account of the history of Bangkok and the area we visited even though  as I said I kinda wanted to take in the sights and sounds  That said I did learn a lot which I have been looking into since    If my biggest criticism is that the guides are **too** knowledgeable that's an acceptable issue  I truly don't want you to think that detracted from the experience my wife and I had   Out of 100 I would give this tour 98  The sights the experiences the kindness and professionalism of the employees to all their guest they gave us memories to last forever  It's worth every penny you spend on it and then some and if we return to Bangkok we will **certainly** call on them again

title: Overnight Train - Chiang Mai to Bangkok
review: We had a great experience on the overnight train which was recommended by a friend who used to live in Thailand We got First Class Sleeper for 2 (purchase one upper and one lower berth ticket) and bought before our trip through 12 Go Asia   The cabin we got was clean and comfortable It was a little loud until about 9pm but then it seemed everyone quieted down Our car had two bathrooms with toilets one with a urinal and a shower room The TVs in each cabin let you know if they are occupied or not so you don't have to get up just to stand in line The regular bathrooms were fine  pretty clean and had both toilet paper and paper towels Similar to an airport bathroom but a bit roomier The men's urinal got pretty disgusting (according to my fianc√©) towards the middle of the trip  the floor was a mess We didn't use the shower   We got complimentary bottled water (1 each) before we took off and two sets of noise canceling headphones to use during the trip (to be returned) The train also had free wifi  the conductor ()  man in charge of our car came around with the password shortly after we left the station   We bought dinner in the Chiang Mai train station before leaving and ate it on the train (cheap really good Pad Thai) as we saw many people reviewing the food on the train poorly Also the entire menu on the train was in Thai   Around bedtime we pushed the call button and our conductor came to make the beds up for us They were comfy enough  much better than sleeping on a train A little less comfortable than most Thai hotel beds (which are hard) but really not that bad We both slept pretty well   A note on the Chiang Mai train station bathrooms  wait to go on the train if you can The station charges 3 baht and provides no toilet paper or paper towel (luckily I had some Kleenex in my purse) and was much dirtier than our car's facilities   Would definitely recommend the overnight train to go to Bangkok from Chiang Mai (or vice versa) About $75 USD for two and it serves double duty as transportation and lodging

review: I highly recommend using the Airport Rail Link It's located in the lower level of the terminal you could purchase the card or tokens from the machine As long as you know where your hotel is located (you can find out at the Information stand at the airport) it is a very good way to get to the city Just remember it originates at the airport so the cars are empty but they get very crowded try to stay close to the doors for an easy exit

title: Useful transort
review: air conditioned carriages very clean but not yet all across the city

title: Convenient to go most of the places via Bts and Mrt
review: I spent four days in Bkk and used the Bts skytrain everyday and found it was very convenient to go to those places of interest or shopping areas And the Bts was also interconnected with the Mrt and other subway lines making the journey smoother compared to taking taxi whereby you would be caught in the jam or long wait at traffic lights But the Bts is getting quite crowded with all the tourists and local people taking the rides maybe the authorities can consider making upgrades to the system

title: Easy and fast
review: You can travel easily n preety fast on the BTS sky train  to all almost all over Bangkok  The fares are slightly expensive but much cheaper than a taxi  You can get the train right from under the airport   this line also connects to the other lines which get you into Bangkok  The trains and stations are clean n airconditioned  It sure beats the traffic jams of Bangkok

title: well organised and easy to access from anywhere.
review: I found the Airport Rail Link to be the best and fastest way to get you into the main city center and cheaper compared to the Taxis where you have to pay toll

title: Not perfect but still a good way to get around
review: There are too few trains running on the underground and during peak times you need to be prepared for rather long queues which will see you 23 trains arrive and go without you having a chance to get on  The MRT is still a good and fast way to get around BKK

title: Really easy
review: Ok you buy a token at the airport 45 Baht Only the stopping all stations line runs despite all the brochures but thats fine Takes you into the city area where you can connect to other transport services Would never use a taxi again Help desks located at station in Airport terminal

title: Improving all the time as more stations come online
review: This is a great way to get around BKK and is improving all the time with more stations being added to the network it is becoming a lot easier to get around town and opening up more areas of the city  Good too that some stations you can change over to the subway so all in all its becoming a very comprehensive integrated transport system and is a good way to see the city

title: Great way to move through Bangkok
review: The whole system is easy to understand and use Very clean very frequent trains Very effective air conditioning However the trains do get extremely crowded in rush hour

title: FULL of History, Stunning Views & Beautiful Surroundings!
review: During our visit to Kanchanaburi we decided to take a ride on the 'Death Railway' It sounds scary however there is nothing scary about it (apart from perhaps the rigid train lines) ‚Äì but it really is a peaceful scenic trip which you can ride (if you choose to) all the way from Bangkok to close to Burma We didn't ride it the whole way (as it would have taken us all day ‚Äì the trains are very slow) however we rode it for about 2 hours from Kanchanaburi station so we could get the famous view of the train passing the side of the mountain   It has been labelled the 'Death Railway' as many of the prisoners of war died trying to build it due to its dangerous working conditions (there is a museum close to Kanchanaburi station you can visit for more information on this if you wish)   The train itself was REALLY busy and full of tourists If you want the good views it‚Äôs a good idea to sit on the right hand side (you will know this as everybody will be sitting on this side) There are also only a certain amount of carriages assigned for 'tourists' as a lot of the local Thai people still use this train as transportation (for a smaller price) Try to avoid getting a guide or a booked trip through a concierge as they will charge you extortionate prices and there's really nothing they can tell you that you aren't able to see for yourself   Overall it was well worth a visit if you're staying in Kanchanaburi   Instagram @journeywithuss

title: Clean and convenient
review: We take the airport link whenever we visit Bangkok because it is quick easy clean and very convenient And it's definitely cheaper than a taxi  Also there is no problem loading your luggage into the train with you

title: Short visut
review: I use the BTS skytrain whenever I can it is so easy to get around Neither is it expensive You can travel to or from the airport on Skytrain as well

title: Effective and reliable means of transport in Bangkok
review: What a relief that we discovered the BTS train Traffic in BKK was horrible (we spent 1hr in a taxi for a7km ride) and having the option to use the BTS was the perfect way to visit the city Of course it doesnt reach all the tourist attractions but it will definitely make you save a lot of time And the working Aircon was a precious gift

title: Efficient form of Travel
review: This is a great way to get around especially in rush hour traffic There were three of us travelling and we worked it out the price of sky train and underground compared to taxi about the same So solo traveller would be cheaper witth sky train

title: Very Convenient
review: This train service is faster than taxis if you are close to one of the stops Phaya Thai station is where it connects to the BTS line

title: Easy travel from and to airport
review: Great service fromto the airport  easy 30 minute ride at 45 baht each way (approx AUD $180)  Air conditioned comfort and frequent service  More seats would have been nice

title: Very reliable, clean and affordable
review: The skytrain is more reliable than most public transport systems I have seen so far To connect with the airport it is very quick easy and affordable Yes it is busy at peak times but the staff and queuing system make for very orderly travelling

title: Great way to get to airport
review: Forget taxis or grab take the rail  Cheap easy and fast  Rush hour can be crazy if you take the sky train and commuters will hate you for bringing lots of luggage but other times go for it

title: Convenience mode of transport
review: BTS Skytrain is the good transportation to move around in places where you like to go It helps and it's easy to move around You can easily purchase your ticket on the vending machine or buy it at the counter No small change don't worry you can change it at the counter All signage are written in Thai and English You can buy a one day unlimited ride ticket at the counter  ie if you know you will be traveling the whole day It's 140 thai batts

title: cheap and fast
review: The link is fast low price clean but it's quite crowded  Air condition works very well and the train run smoothly  Just half an hour from Payathai station to get to suwannapoom airport  This is the best way to avoid Bangkok heavy traffic  One thing if I want to complaint is there is no lift at payathai bts station to connect to airport rail link

title: Excellent way to get around!
review: At first it was a bit daunting but once you get used to it it's pretty easy We used it all the time It's quick efficient and convenient It can however get very crowded so be prepared to stand frequently  Its a cheap way to get around the place

title: SKYTRAIN
review: The sky train is a easy and cheap way to get around and to the airport would recommend using it don‚Äôt need a time table just turn up and a train will be there soon

title: Really convenient city access
review: Quick and easy to use this helps you get around Bangkok bit on the expensive side however well worth it to escape the traffic

title: Great way of transport in
review: Great way of transport in an overcrowded city like Bangkok But for people who aren't used to it mind the cold air conditioning  I catched a hefty cold

title: Efficient
review: Probably the most efficient way to move around Bangkok (so try and get a hotel within walking distance üòâ)   Quite expensive for Bangkok standards (depending on travel distance around 3040 BHT) The ac typically runs on full blast so can be quite cold

title: MRT,  BTS, Airport RailLink - all big importace
review: The best way of traveling around bangkok is using those 3 public transportation ways and at the closest point to the destination change to taxi  Tuktuk or motorcycle (if you have the guts)

title: Clean and Aircon
review: If the BTS doesn't get you where you want to go try the MRT  underground You can't share tickets between BTS & MRT though Excellent service and option of getting around Bangkok

title: It‚Äôs about timing
review: This train is extremely efficient and a great affordable and speedy way to get around  The last time we visited Bangkok it was during school term and we managed to get the train just as schools dismissed That was horrific lol We were like sardines jammed into a tiny compartment but it‚Äôs an experience to say the least  That is the only set back and offcourse it‚Äôs not every trip Best to travel at times before or after the work and school rush hours

title: Well connected
review: This is a popular mode of transportation for the tourists since it is so well connected The prices are on the higher side nevertheless very convenient to travel

title: Best way to get around
review: Make learning the train a day 1 objective if you are visiting Bangkok Taxis rarely want to run the meter for you (instead they quote prices depending on how much of a tourist you look like) and tuk tuks are a fun experience but are equally unsavory The train is a cheap and seamless way to get around

title: the ultimate way of transport in Bangkok
review: the BTS system is an affordable way to move around in Bangkok A great time schedule affordable prices and very convenient compared to the trafficjams that you avoid now It will and can be busy around Siam etc nevertheless still a great way to move around

title: Easy to navigate
review: Easy and cheap travel in Bangkok helpful staff at the ticket counters and a great way to view the city

title: Safe Efficient way to travel across the city
review: Need to get around the city  BTS then walk  If need to get somewhere away from BTS then most BTS have motorbikes  taxis immediately available at ground level  I having used BTS frequently I have never had any concerns for my safety  Stations are clean with security guards on site that take pride in their station  During peak periods expect to line up for a train and that you might have to catch the next train  This is no problem as they run every 5 mins  A great system  With BTS you can access shopping centres attractions etc  some BTS has skywalks allowing you to access locations without having to walk on the street

title: Easy Transportation Though Crowded at Rush Hour
review: We took this from the airport to get closer to our hotel near Khao San Road (we took a taxi from the Phaya Thai stop) It was rush hour so it filled up quickly Luckily we were at the front of the line from boarding so we got seats

title: Most Convenient Way to travel
review: Sky train is the best way to commute in Bangkok Though slightly steep when travelling more than 3 people compared to taxi but yet fastest way to commute It is worth paying little more and save time

title: A Breeze
review: You go to the basement floor from the arrivals hall and there is a train ready in no time at all A swift trip to Phyra Thai station then a change to the sky train on a separate line upstairsYou are in the centre of town in no time at all40 min at most  for a couple of dollars Aust

title: Decent option to get to airport if you have access to the skytrain rail links
review: Got us to the airport with not too much fuss We 'unfortunately' travelled on the standard line (as I believe there is an 'express' option) so there were a good number of stops along the way for normal residing locals This made travelling with 2 big travel bags a little uncomfortable for the first legs of the rail trip as the train got emptier and emptier along the way

title: Busy, cheap and convenient
review: So easy to get around once you get the hang of it Weird part was going to the ticket office and asking for your ticket and they give you change to use the machine so you spend time queuing to get change and then have to go into the machine queue to get the ticket Advice go with lots of change Not every station has escalators so if you don't like stairs then this isn't for you It's so cheap and quick that it's the best way to get around Bangkok especially because traffic is horrendous here

title: The best place to get around
review: MRT is definetely the best way to get around It is quite cheap fast and comfortable Easy to understand also in English where and how to go

title: Fast, efficient, clean and cheap
review: What's not to like  A taxi trip to my hotel took over an hour and cost 400 baht with the airport surcharge and tolls  The airport sky train was about 60 baht and took around 45 minutes    There were demonstrations and riots during my Bangkok stay Demonstrators closed roads and interchanges which make traffic even worse that it typically is in Bangkok The sky train helped you by pass all of that congestion  Is it easy  Well sorta  I'm not intuitive about mass transit Several people had to help me on my journey but they did  Just look confused and someone is bound to help you  If not pull out a map and lint to where you want to go and even if they don't speak English they will help you or find someone who can  That's been my experience throughout Thailand

title: hassle free travel in bangkok
review: this is the best way to travel in Bangkok during peak traffic hours good connectivity with shopping mall hotels near bts sky train stations

title: Best way to travel around in Bangkok
review: Love taking the BTS cos it's so convenient to go anywhere on that I also bought their 'Rabbit' card which is a stored value card You don't need to buy a ticket everytime you need to take the BTS 100 baht stored value in the card lasts you a long while

title: Effective & fast
review: The skytrain is a very effective way to get from A to B if A and B is along the skytrains route that is )  Be aware that Bankok taxis is very cheap so if you are 23 or 4 people a taxi might be a very good idea but not necessarily during rush hours when the streets are full of cars

title: Sky train
review: This is one of the best travel system i have used its simple just buy you ticket for the day an go through the barriers and board the train They are frequent clean and we always felt safe but they can get busy but so does every good transport system I work on the trains at home and have taken some of the good practice that I have seen on the sky train back to UK  This is a must use to get around Bangkok

title: Nice way to get around but very busy
review: This is a way to get around Bangkok during the workday especially around rush hours when there are traffic jams in Bangkok  Better to take this than a taxi during rush hours But it is really crowded on the Skytrain at this time also  It is quite air conditioned and you get the bonus of having a neat moving aerial view of Bangkok so it's worth trying just for the moving view of the city  I like to ride in it during rain storms

title: Efficient
review: Best way to travel into Bangkok from the Airport It is cheap reliable and you avoid the notorious Bangkok  traffic jams

title: For travellers who have only one laggage
review: It is very convenience way for the travellers It is very easy to use But you have more than one laggage you should not use it

title: The only way to travel through Bangkok
review: Top tip Chinese people why not watch how people in Bangkok alight the train b4 others start boarding  You will see this system allows for a smoother system of getting onoff the train rather than everybody alightinggetting on at the same time  There's a thin line between hullabaloo and chaos

title: Good direction from the staff
review: I used the Airport Rail Link for the first time from Rajprarob station to Phayathai station I have to walk up the stairs from the road to the station It cost 15 Baht for one station The staff is very helpful and give me the direction to the station by elevator

title: Train travel
review: A great way to move around Bangkok It is cheap and easy to use For those arriving at the airport with minimal luggagejump on and enjoy the ride into The City of Angels

title: What do I do with 19 stops?
review: On my last day in Bangkok I decided to try its other modes of  transportation such as the MRT BTS and Bus #53 i did not have happy moments with either my tuktuk drivers and taxi drivers ( overcharges)  From my hotel near Khao San Road I took Bus 53 to Hua Lampong Station where the MRT line starts I bought a day pass for 120 bahts unlimited rides  My goal was to see how the various stations look like They don't appear to have any shops or restaurants at these stationsI stayed in the train from Hua Lamphomg to Bang Sue where all passengers had to get off Took the train on the other side of the tracks and got off at the Chatuchak Park Station  This station has a beautiful park near by the Chatuchak Park Clean public restrooms are free at the park I bought my day pass for BTS train at the Chatuchak Train Station  Please see my related review of BTS Note that there might be some attractions near the MRT stations I just did not stop by due to time constraints

title: Highly recommend this tour. Our guide was lovely, very informative.  Very long day but so worth it!
review: Highly recommend this tour Great driver Our guide was lovely and very informative Very long day but totally worth it

title: Humbling
review: Definitely one of the more interesting parts of our trip to Bangkok This is a full day excursion from Bangkok so be prepared for a long day My husband and I have a keen interest in war history so this was definitely worth seeing Our guide was excellent

title: Comfortable
review: Bangkoks Skytrain is a very comfortable and easy way of getting around the city The links to subway could be better

title: Great way to travel and very helpful
review: Great way to travel to and fro in Bangkok then using the boats staff very helpful and maps to help you find your way Airconditioned which is a godsend

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS (skytrain) is a fantastic way to get around Bangkok   This was our second visit to Bangkok and using the BTS with the MRT (underground) makes every but of Bangkok you'd want to see easily accessible  The bonuses are the airconditioning and funny adverts playing on the tvs throughout the carriages   We have only ever bought individual tickets (cheap as) but for a longer stay would consider buying a rechargeable card

title: sky train
review: well it's convenience but crowded Anyway there should have been  more ticket vending machines since too many people waited to buy the ticket

title: One single line from Suvanabhumi Airport to city
review: The train is clean comparing with the other in the city It come straight from the airport to the city On each station it may be too risky to wait near the track as there is no protection glass wall or rail it is easy to fall off and also easy to jump in The end station is Phayathai where you can connect to the BTS (sky train) You may also get off at Makhasan station to connect to MRT (underground)

title: Good transport easy to use
review: Cheapest way to get around Bangkok as Taxi's and tuk tuk's try to rip you off all the time Was quick and easy to get on and off There is a automatic machine or you can go to the window to get a ticket just make sure you know where you want to go also if getting on and off many times get a day pass for 140thb

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: Very efficient air conditioned and travellers orderly and very patient Think if we had stayed longer we would have  got the hang of it very quickly

title: very effective and cheap
review: I always take taxies from and to the bangkok airport I used the rail link once and discovered a very fast cheap and easy way to connect to the air port I didnt carry a large bag but escalators will make the trip easy for havy travellers as well some hours the rail link may be fpacked but it is only because of the goodlocation on the stations

title: Very convenient!
review: Extremely fast and convenient way to get to the airport Very much recommended in this busy bisy city )

title: A great way to get out the Airport as long as the destination is on the Map
review: This is a great service as long as you don't have to get a taxi or other transport that is not local to the Destination Rail stop Have used many times from and to the airport Very clean and good service

title: A fraction of the cost of a taxi, and quicker
review: The airport rail link takes around 35 minutes to reach the Praya Thai BTS station (less if you get off at one of the closer stations) and cost 45 baht A taxi on the other hand will cost 400 to 500 baht to Sukhumvit and depending on the traffic will often take close to an hour

title: Fast and cheap
review: This is by far the best mode of transport from suvarnbhumi airport to city centerThe taxi charges for the same travel amounts to around 500 bahtThe express line was not operational on the day we traveled and we took the city lineIt cost us around 100 baht for two persons and around 20 minutes to reach  makkasan station from where we changed to BTS station for our travel to NANA BTS

title: Great Day Trip from Bangkok
review: Excellenty organised Smooth planning and taken care of by our guide Utai AC transport and some great pics

title: Really good if you have patience
review: If you have patience to learn how everything work is the easiest way to go around to avoid Bangkok horrible traffic and suffocating smell of fumes and exhausting fumes for traffic is nice pleasant and fast

title: Best way to get around
review: Convenient clean safe and low cost It's just getting too crowded  This is the best way to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic and at the same time getting exercise climbing up and down the stairs

title: Fastest cheapest best way to get to and from the airport
review: If you are not being picked up and you have only one bagsuitcase then this is the fastest way into the city From there you will have only a short taxi ride to your hotel Only use metered taxis and never use tuktuks as they are all part of a criminal scam to prey on tourists Tuktuks are also expensive with a minimum fare of about 200 baht to cross the road

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Excellent train service and we used it all the time  Very easy to work out  Please make sure that you have change when you want to buy the tickets at the machine as they dont take notes

title: Clean, quiet, comfortable, easy to use
review: The title pretty much sums it up  This is a modern elevated subway that serves as an excellent and fast public transportation system for the city

title: The best thing about Bangkok
review: I wasn't overly fond of Bangkok  But I understand it's a place you love or hate  The BTS was clean and easy to use  Very orderly

title: A Must for Exploring Bangkok
review: The BTS is FAST CLEAN and affordable for more expats With four children in tow we often dread the hike up the stairs and through ticketing But once we travel to our destination we never regret skipping the taxi Traffic in Bangkok has become terrible even standstill at some times of the day So you are really risking a much longer trip if you go any other way than BTS

title: Airport into city
review: Easy cheap and fast Will never take a taxi again  Token payment very easy Just keep token for exit too

title: The best way to get around, but a little hard to navigate.
review: The BTS Skytrain is the greatest way to get around Bangkok It's only a pity that it's so hard to figure out how to get to the sights from the Skytrain  But don't get too worried about getting lost when we asked a Skytrain official for directions she actually walked us to the right exitcalling us back when we went the wrong way

title: Easy Airport Transfer
review: Quick easy and cheap way to get to and from the airport with no hassles Trains are very clean and ride is very smooth plus the air conditioning is refreshing in the heat Best way to beat the traffic and get to or from the airport

title: Faster way  to the city
review: Clean  fast and cheap   Airport rain link is a lifeline for tourists who r ready to haul the luggage from their location to the airport  People with heavy luggage may find it difficult and can take a cab to the airport  Since we were carrying empty bags it was easy for us

title: Review of the trains rather than station...
review: We came here after an AirAsia flight from Malaysia and we got our train with a 2 hour delay We wanted to get to Ayuthaya and I guess made the wrong assumption of thinking the train would be faster Make yourself a favor and take a bus from Don Mueang to Ayuthaya if you are in the same predicament as us

title: Convenient
review: Bangkok traffic is horrible but luckily that we got BTS sky train very convenient friendlyhelpful staffs and very cheap  During our stay in Bangkok we always take BTS to Mochit and Victory Gate for shopping and looking for tasty street foods down there

title: The intervals could be better
review: Overcrowded like all public Transport facilities in Bangkok Shorter Intervalls would offer more comfort to the travellers But quick within 30 Minutes you get to the Airport You are very lucky if you get a free seat there But it is more reliable if you Need to arrive to the Airport just in time than by taxi that cannot escape the traffic jam

title: Get a scarf ready
review: It's amazing transportation to avoid trafic in Bangkok but get a scarf ready as inside the trains is really cold

title: one day unlimited rides pass. make the most of it, if you can:)
review: super if you study the map  connectivity day pass only or good for a few trips Royalnnair has it complimentary for a day Gr8 to check out the connected malls

title: Good
review: Good Thai "underground" efficent and clean you can reach different area of Bangkok  That's another option to visit and familiarize with this big city

title: Flawless
review: If it is on your route you should use it because BTS is by far the best mode of transport in Bangkok Inexpensive and fast regardless of famous Bangkok traffic Clean and punctual although one can easily catch a cold in the train

title: Good experience
review: We used sky train to reach Suvarnabhumi airport from Phaya thai Excellent connectivity and comfortable Definitely recommended

title: Very Convenient
review: This is the easiest and best way to do away with traffic jam during peak hours This link is connected to other line like the BTS station which can take you to many attractive destinations around Bangkok

title: Best way to get to Sukhumvit from the airport
review: This takes less time no traffic jams and costs 60 baht total Perfect for single travelers or couples but could be a bit of a hassle for a family with kids

title: Great Public Transport
review: The BTSMRT is likely the best possible public transport in Thailand It can get crowded during peak hours 3  6 pm weekdays for example Worth it to buy a prepaid card if you're visiting for more than a few days as ticketing booths can have long lines  For travelling outside of the city or to the outskirts remember that the skytrain is actually two different companies You may need to change cards or method of payment

title: Pretty handy, but sometimes too crowded
review: Sky train is a quick and cheap way to get from one hot spot to another however depending on the time of day it can be very crowded around certain stops

title: Great means of public transport
review: The Skytrain was awesome You could basically get everywhere in Bangkok with it and it made travelling very convenient and enjoyable

title: skytrain
review: cheap and efficient The only drawback is that there are three companies running different lines so remember you may have to buy several tickets for your trip

title: Quick
review: A quick way to get around the city but certainly not cheap If you are travelling in a group of 36 it probably is more comfortable to just get a meter taxi since you end up paying about the same to visit any of the malls The trains do get crowded but are the fastest way of getting anywhere

title: Great transportation system
review: Very clean and convenient Ticket booths mostly accept coins but there you can exchange bills for coins at information desk Staff are knowledgeable and speak English A faster and efficient way to travel around Bangkok without sitting in heavy traffic

title: Something new to try
review: I decided to take the train into BKKUnfortunately one has to lug heavy bags up the stairs as there are no lifts or escalators once you get to the BTS

title: Best Transportation for Airport Transfer
review: You can get the Airport Train from the Phaya Thai Station Its connect with BTS line so you just get down at Phaya Thai BTS and move to Phaya Thai Airport Rail Link Station Its just on 12Mints walk  As per me this is the best mode of transportation in Bangkok as the road to airport is full of traffic in peak hours

title: Simple and cheap to use
review: A very useful transport system that is so easy to use and get you to your destination without the need to sit in a traffic jam

title: Very good, fast and safe way of transportation
review: It's good if you can make a connection with one of the metro lines but if not you just drop off at last station and take a cab than from there to the Khao San Road ex It's about $100bts The train ticket is about $45 bts

title: easy and quick trip to town
review: in high traffic jam times of the day skip the queue on the road to town and continue your journey from the city center either by BTS taxi or else  with big luggage it is a bit of a haul

title: Tube made modern
review: Excellent service cheap and very modern Helps to have a aerial scenery of Bangkok Get out of the traffic and enjoy a ride on the "modern looking" Tube

title: Convenient and efficient
review: The BTS is the most efficient way to navigate the city Although crowded during peak hours it still manages to get from A to B more quickly than any other means of transport in this trafficchoked city

title: Top Train Ride and Brilliant Boat Ride
review: Fantastic day trip had a wonderful time this trip exceeded all of our expectations Our guide Alex was fabulous he was very knowledgeable and made the trip so much  fun Arriving on the train into the market was such an experience and then to experience being on the edge of the tracks as the train passed was something we won‚Äôt forget in a hurry The floating market again was surreal to see and experience a real culture tour to see the authentic Thailand  I would 100% recommend this trip to anyone visiting Bangkok we had such a great day and have so many brilliant memories from the trip Thanks Again Alex you really did make the day FABULOUS

title: 8 stations to downtown Phaya Thai@45bhbt
review: My first time experiencing airport rail link You need to purchase the ticket at the vending machine at B45 one way better purchase the ticket via Klook if you are traveling from HK it cost slightly cheaper to order in advance  Rabbit is not able to ride on the airport link  Then you can continue your journey with BTS train  Just give you an example on the time I spent from Nana station to Airport it takes approx 75mins All the way there is lift at Nana and Phaya Thai therefore it‚Äôs hassle free to travel yourself   Compare to taxi ride I prefer airport rail link if you are travel with light luggage

title: Getting around town
review: The best way is to buy a multi pass as this will take you to all the major shopping centre and to the river where you can catch a ferry to all the major sites

title: Cheap and quick public transport
review: Great chice if you are tired of tuktuk drivers and if you want to travel from further places in bangkok Price is ok we paid for journey from first stop till to destination of the line about 47 baths Only thing is crazy AC and there is super chill But definitely have to recommend Also staff there is helpful and english speaking so they are able to help you how to get to the place where you need to go

title: use it at least during rushhour
review: as traffic is horribel in bangkok us the skytrain as much as possible cheap and fast if not us Grab

title: Comfortable transport
review: Cheap ad comfortable transport around Bangkok Very intuitive orientation in plan all skytrain lines

title: No Regret!
review: This public transportation helped me very much Even though that was my first time to take the BTS Skytrain I really enjoyed that Bangkok is really bad during the rush hour and this facility is the best idea So if you're in Bangkok don't ever hesitate to take the BTS Skytrain

title: Efficiency
review: A great way to travel around the city Very inexpensive and easily accessible Easy to follow signage and ordered queuing

title: Best way to get around in Bangkok
review: This clean efficient way yo get around Bangkok avoids all the traffic jams and frequent problems with taxi drivers  but it is very popular and you need to avoid rush hours  during rush hours it can take several trains before you can get on  They are buying new trains but the same size so the problem will continue  even in rush hours it is still the best way to travel

title: What an efficient mode of travel!
review: This is a truly hidden gem in Thailand Unfortunately we only found it on the last day of our vacation or else we would've used it and saved a ton of cash The best part of it is that it so efficient and easy to use Incredible value

title: Easy to use, extremely cheap and convenient.
review: The air conditioned trains were a welcome respite from the Thai sun and we didn't find them particularly over crowded but having said that we weren't using them during rush hour The trains themselves were clean and the ticket offices gave out easy advice

title: The best way to go around Bangkok
review: Great transportation system Bangkok is such a huge City and this means a lot of traffic the BTS system is efficient sparkling clean and staff very friendly and helpful They even bring passengers two trains if they are handicapped I hope they expand fast to go to other places too

title: Useful if in a hurry
review: This is a useful way of getting to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport but only if you're in a hurry The reason is that the train inevitably gets packed and that makes for a very UNCOMFORTABLE journey Catching a taxi tofrom the airport is still relatively cheap (providing you insist on them using the meter) and obviously much more comfortable

title: Clean and fab metro
review: Wow found a new station near main temple area on the river Very easy to use and clean Wish our at home were as great

title: Public Transport
review: We used it for one day Good to traverse Bangkok for shopping and sight seeing Get the route guide and off you go

title: Amazing tour

title: Best way to go to the city
review: The easiest convenient traffic jam free and economy way to go direct to the city from the airport If you are not a fan of taking taxi this is your option

review: Why only have on suvarnabhumi airport Why don mueang airport dont have airport link  Now don mueang aiport is very crowded dan busy Need many transportation likes airport link

review: After having ARL I can now travel to Rajaprarop (Pratunam) from Suvarnabhumi It's cheap for only THB40 per way from the airport Plus it's also connected to BTS Phaya Thai and MRT Petchaburi Station   The downside is it can be overcrowded during rush hours and sometimes you have to wait more than 10 minutes unlike the bTS that it's frequent   Hopefully they would be able to extend the line up to Don Mueang in the future

title: Convenient and good experience
review: Once you arrive at airport dont need to go out in search of taxi this ARL is very convenient Ofcourse only if the hotel you are staying at is nearby the ARL stop ARL Saves time

title: Best way to travel
review: In Bangkok as an obvious looking tourist we felt the skytrain was the only mode of transport which 100% never let us down   It doesn‚Äôt travel across the whole city but around the areas of the main attractions it does It‚Äôs also air conditioned which is a huge plus London take note  While taxis will try to scam you 75% of the tome sky train was reliable 100% of the time

title: A Great way to get around.
review: Trains are really frequent and ideal for travelling round the main touristy areas of Bangkok Really easy to transfer to SRT and between lines

title: Convenient fast and easy
review: We took the skytrain to Mo Chit to go to Chatuchak Weekend Market Super convenient easy and cheap

title: Express train was out of service, otherwise okay
review: I wanted the express to Makasaan but a sign said it was out of service on Nov 9 2014 The local train is okay but gets too crowded when carrying a suitcase It was only 35 baht You can buy tickets in a machine or at a counter I connected to the MRT subway a short walk on a walkway This service beats the taxis and traffic It is very easy to use the machines and maps

title: Meeting
review: This is good for those who are not having heavy luggage as its restricted at rush hours its fast track 2 reach your hotel or destination not recommended with children as if it's your first experience as mostly signs are in their local language

title: 2nd class was quite all right
review: We just got off the sleeper train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai All in all our family had a decent time We played a board game before bed We highly recommend bringing cards etc as their WiFi is spotty Some tips to support the other postThe bottom bunks are better for sleeping since the lights never go off The food is terrible so pack snacks and buy drinks on the train It‚Äôs a fun way to get to Chiang Mai and you don‚Äôt need a hotel for the night

title: Simple travel
review: Reasonably priced very clean & easy to find your way

title: Easy to use
review: We used the Skytrain to get to all our destinations  It was inexpensive and simple to navigate  The trains were clean and everyone helpful

title: fantastci way to move quickly through a combusted metropole

title: Bangkok traffic

title: Convenient and cheap way to get to and fro from the airport
review: This is a great way to get from and to the airport however this is only to the Suvarnbhumi Airport and does not go to Don Muang airport so it's only for the full service airlines unfortunately Even if you are not along the airport rail link route you can stop at the nearest station and get a cab from there Note sometimes meter taxis don't use the meter here in Bangkok so beware and know the fare negotiate before boarding the taxis

title: Easy to use
review: I've been living in Bangkok for 6 months and when I travel throughout the city the BTS is the best way to go The train is easy to use and gives access to most places in Bangkok It is also not as expensive as other modes of transport

title: Reliable
review: Reliable way of going around in BKK with air conditioning Forget the traffic jams take the BTS Visit the official website to see where they are connected to the subway Some BTS stations have parking grounds as well however you have to come early to find a parking space During peak hours BTS is extremely busy It's packed Be ready so be pushed in and out I don't consider this an attraction though I have not seen a toilet anywhere

title: This should be called a full day tour
review: 6 hour tour 4 hours of which is driving Railway market stop is literally take photos and go Floating market is just nicknak stuff and heavily over priced So over priced that even bartering leaves you paying so much more than standard markets Victor our guide was a lovely older gentleman but other guides in other groups where providing much more information Overall experience = Meh

title: best way for travelling in Bangkok
review: This is very best way for travelling in Bangkok I can go many places for shopping lunch and dinner

title: Easy
review: Using this was so easy Far quicker than a taxi and so cheap At the end of the airport rail link we hopped on the skytrain to get to our hotel

title: Great fast route
review: Super fast cleanefficient cost effective way to move around Coming from London and being used to the mayhem that is rush hour on the underground I was stunned when people formed an orderly queue to board the shuttle Very classy Bangkok very classy

title: Quick and cheap
review: Second review on second return use When arriving go all the way down the escalators to the bottom floor for ARL (all signposted) Use the ticket machines  I think the maximum note they take is 100 Baht  and buy ticket to destination I was travelling to Si Lom so went to Makkasan then used the overpass walkway to Phetchaburi for the MRT link to Silom ARL fare was 35 Baht and similar on MRT I travelled with medium sized case and a carry on case and didn't find the occasional stairs much of a hindrance Travel time for the ARL was around 25 minutes  total time to Si Lom around 45 minutes Excellent service for the solo traveller

title: Cheap n convenient
review: If u don't have much luggage I'd suggest u to take the airport link at least upon arrival into the city Cheap n convenient

title: Amazing
review: Amazing tour and well organised Had a really cool guide that spoke good English and had some funny jokes for us The tour is worth every penny and we can highly recommend it

title: loved the skytrain
review: I travelled on the skytrain to the mbk mall in the rush hourQuickon timeclean it was a pleasure to travel onand very cheap  Try it

title: Bustling market
review: This is a large bustling chaotic market with everything you would expect Street food stalls imitation watches and Levi jeans make up and fresh vegetables Mainly local Thai people shopping and tourists having a look on

review: This is our main transportation while we‚Äôre in Bangkok Much faster than taxi the only thing is a lot of places you have to connect with other buseswalk around

review: Easy access to key shopping centers (Siam) and can connect to underground station at Silom and Asoke)

title: Regular User
review: Living Saungluang District of Bangkok I regularly use the Airport Link when going to downtown Although there are less frequent trains than other lines it serves my needs quite well

title: Most convenient and fast transport in Bangkok but take care of your health.
review: Since Bangkok is a very crowded city with heavy street traffic BTS skytrain is the most convenient and time saving transport option You can get in to any station go to any part of the city with this comfortable and air conditioned trains All are written both in Thai and English so you have no chance to get confused Just one advice if you have problems in your knee joints or symptoms of chest pain or discomfort during physical exertion (medically called "stable angina" a heart problem) better to avoid BTS because in most stations you need to walk through high stairs

review: Easy to use but the ticket machines only take coins which can be obtained from the ticket office just check the fare  it varies by station

title: Underwhelming

title: ‚ô°

title: Best and cheapest way to travel
review: Submerge yourself into the local way avoid taxis and tuk tuks at a much higher price and jump on the train It does get busy at rush hour but atleast your not stuck in bangkok traffic  Use Google maps to find the best train route

title: Great way to travel
review: If you are staying in Bangkok it is advisable to stay in an hotel with easy access to the sky train We have experienced Bangkok's traffic and it is the only city we have visited where a taxi has refused a fare because of the traffic jams If you use the sky train all these problems are eliminated It is good value safe and reliable  and cool if the heat is getting to you

title: the easiest and cheapest way to get to the center of Bangkok
review: train is really fast (just 2530 minutes from the airport) also it is quiet cheap (4045 BAT per person) Also all trains are equipped with airconditioning so you are not suffering from heat Comfortable and easy way to get to the city center

title: stairs too steep
review: too many stairs and inconvenient for old and handicap people exit not clear pricing of the area not easy to understand

title: Amazingly efficient
review: Very clean and on time Ticket purchasing easy to understand and complete Air con on train units very strong and a welcome break from the heat  Surprised to often be only Westerners using transport even in the busier areas around Silom

title: A Fascinating Journey
review: We travelled back to Kanchanaburi by train after going to Hellfire pass and experienced passing over the wooden platform built by the POWs It's hard to believe that it still exists especially after learning about booby traps and sabotage deliberately planted during the building process This experience was a must for us as an important lesson in history and hoping to prevent such atrocities in future

title: Super simple and cheap
review: From airport to near endof line (Ratchaprarop) was no more than 90 baht for 2 people (total about $3 USD) Very fast and easy way to get from the airport to the city You buy a token you scan the token going in (RFID) and then you feed the token in the slot coming out of the station   Will be nice when Bangkok finally creates a unified system for the train fare Rail link uses a token BTSMRT uses a card kind of annoying

title: Excellent for getting around
review: The skytrain is a fantastic transportation system for Bangkok Didn't take up to every destination but very efficient and inexpensive for many destinationsor at least getting us closer to destinations  Puts the public transportation in my home town (Seattle) to shame

title: So easy to use.
review: Great way to get around Bangkok  Links up to most things you want to see during a short stay in this city  Links up with other public transport systems including airport train and the Eastern and Northern bus stations and Central Pier

title: BTS is the way
review: Follow it to the end of the line on Saturday to visit the largest outdoor market in Bangkok anything and everything is there and I truly mean everything

title: So clean!
review: Their train system is so easy to navigate I'm from New York and am used to taking the subway so I was glad that I experienced taking the trains in Bangkok There's always someone to assist touriststravelers if any problem occurs

title: cheap, quick and efficient
review: trains clean staff friendly and willing to help and assist punctual and air conditioned  we used it a number of times to visit shopping malls and eat out in the evening very safe environment

title: Thanks BTS for making my travel in BKK easy!
review: Thank you BTS to make my travel in BKK easy and economical I really like to travel in Bangkok It is fast clean fully airconditioned  and cheap to travel within the city i'd recommend BTS to people traveling within the city

title: Great, clean, modern service.
review: Great way to travel across the city away from the airport Cheap but quality transport Particularly nice to see are the smart train guards who salute the train and passengers as it departs the platform  I would use this to beat the taxi queues at the airport even if it is to then hail a cab at the next stop It also beats the chaotic traffic jams that Bangkok is known for

title: Easy way to travel
review: Taking the train into Bangkok is probably not for everyone if you have a lot of luggage as the train gets very busy We had three suitcases for the two of us and the closer you get to the city centre the busier it gets

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok!
review: Clean and convenient and fast One of the better way to get around Bangkok without being caught in traffic   Most stations also have guards at the platform who will assist you if u have strollers or wheelchairs   Buying tickets are also convenient as the ticketing machines are easy to comprehend and is available in English   Only small grumble is that some stations do not have escalators or elevators going down and is a little inconvenient if ubhave kids on strollers

title: Practical
review: Easy to use Air conditioning and really can save you a lot of time and money to reach a few places in Bangkok

title: Transfer for Bankok to Airport
review: Fast cheap and direct much better for getting to the airport than a taxi especially with the traffic in Bangkok Cost for us was about $500 AU for both of us  Compare that to  $30 AU to $50 AU in a Taxi

title: Asian Surprise
review: I went there with my family during the winter break last year and i also passed through this year during a work trip The skytrain is very well connected especially with the skywalks which are connected directly into the malls and some hotels the trains are very regular and frequent unlike in Kuala Lumpur and what really amazes me in this city is the etiquette people have Proper queuing to get into the train while waiting for the people to get out And once you're in the train they get up to give seats to children and old people and so on I found this very very surprisingly as this is not how it happens in China or Malaysia I pretty much took the Skytrain everywhere and didnt want to use taxis at the end of day because they'rewell they're a headache to deal with once you have used the trains Only negative thing is that with all the walking you have to do make sure to wear Linen or summer clothing because its humid as it is and then you're going to sweat a lot Otherwise I just love to use the Skytrain

title: What a wonderful tool for getting around Bangkok.
review: We lived in Bangkok for seven years the first two were doing construction of the BTS (Sky Train) For the next five years we have enjoyed the BTS to the fullest Clean speedy great air con and extensive lines I would recommend buying the card for 50 Bht and topping it up with 200 Bht if you plan on several trips if more just add to the card as needed This will ensure you avoid the longer lines of the single ticket riders A great way to move around BKK Also suggest you avoid the tukTuks except for one time so you can say you did it Taxis are usually cheaper and air conditioned

title: Comfortable and reasonably priced
review: The Bangkok Skytrain has multiple lines and one needs to be careful and have a map to board from the right station The tickets are reasonable specially if you're travelling long distances for shorter distances I find taxis comfortable and cheap unless it's peak hour traffic The staff is pretty helpful in guiding you about the appropriate line station and where you need to change lines

title: Fast, clean n cheap
review: You can travel around fast n cheap can connect with BTS at a couple of major BTS stations  Easy to navigate around all signs are in english and thai

title: Thailiand sky train
review: People were very nice who were waiting for the train and on the train Everything was inorder  People waited in line (no one was rushing to get on or off  I was there in November 2016

title: Got mass transit
review: Very easy to use gets you round the main areas of interest Fast and cheap can be crowded Worth buying a travel card so you don't have to always que up for single tickets Gives you a real sense of freedom to explore

title: Great way to get around in Bangkok!!
review: The BTS is affordable clean easy and Air Conditioned It‚Äôll get you close to many destinations and from there you can walk cab or try a tuk tuk I use it every time to get to BITEC and it‚Äôs great and gives time to cool off It does get very crowded at times but the BTS runs often so rest assured there‚Äôs always another train close by

title: Great Service
review: Easy going from and to Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport and reasonable price service till midnight

title: Great way to travel to and from airport
review: Very easy to use and cheap  You can get from the airport to the City Phaya Thai station in 2030 minutes for 45 baht approximately ¬£1  Beats all the traffic jams and toll way fees

title: BTS
review: Bts have excellent cold air conditioning in the trains which is much better than trains in Singapore which is always trying to lower cost by cutting down on air conditioning Even though the bts trains were always packed the ride was comfortable as it was very cooling in the trains with the blistering heat outside

title: Fast but Flawed
review: Bangkok's new Airport Link makes it possible to zip from the center of the city to Suvarnabhuymi Airport in about twenty minutes It's great if you have only carryon luggage But if you have a lot of checked luggage forget it Some stations in the city do not have escalators when you exit them Trains stop running at around 11 PM Too bad they do not run all night Airport Link is popular with commuters in both directions including a lot of airport staff so seats will be scarce during morning and evening commute periods

title: Super Convenient
review: A big help if u want to get out in a traffic of the city the best option to the city of bangkok Everytime we went to bangkok we use ARL

title: Great, cheap way to get to BKK
review: I use this about 3 times a month Gets me back to BKK quickly I use the Makkassen station to get to the MTS Be nice if they could merge the SkytrainBTSMTS onto one fare card

title: BUSY BUT EASY
review: We travelled on the Sky Train from Phayathay Stn to the Siam Paragon Centre This was our first trip & although being seniors we were concerned about managing the fare purchases etc the staff at the ticket counter were very helpful Also although the crowds using the Sky Train were huge the system for boarding & exiting the train was very good

title: EFFICIENT, FREQUENT TIMELY IMMACULATE ....
review: BTS train is a perfect example how to releave traffic congestion andprovide an efficient affordable and most pleasant public transportation and easy to use by foreigners

title: Very fast and comfortable
review: Airport link is very fast and relatively cheap way to get to the international airport of Bangkok  Higly recommended

title: Fast, efficient and only a $1!
review: A lot of western cities could learn from Bangkok's answer to getting to the airport on time I wish there was one of these in Sydney This train is linked to the MRT system so is easily reached from anywhere in Bangkok and runs above the congested road system below No need for taxis Just book a hotel within walking distance of an MRT station and let the trains do the rest

title: Efficient travel
review: An easy way to get round central Bangkok Clean stations Liftsexcalators for wasy access Tickets were cheaper than BTS A topup card made getting around simple

title: A essential means of transportation in Bangkok
review: The BTS is a superb way of traveling around the city There are some parts of the city not on the route such as Chinatown and Old Town Use a taxi or Grab The skytrain is often very packed so come prepared for crowds Polite crowds Recommend getting a Rabbit Card We bought ones with 25 rides each for a 6 day stay

title: Convenient, good price
review: Pros The most convenient way of getting to the town from the Suvarnabhumi airport if you are staying somewhere on Sukhumvit or Silom Road No need to go outside of airport building just few floors down Easy to buy tickets using machines There are always some officers offering help at info desk Train is very modern clean and air conditioned Lots of space for baggage   Cons you cannot buy one ticket from airport to Asok station for example You have to buy one ticket to Phaya Thai station and then you have to buy another ticket to Asok This can be improved    If you are staying on Khao San Road (near Grand Palace) then this option is not suitable for you

title: It‚Äôs transport, not a tourist attraction
review: The skytrain is a simple and relatively cheap way to get around Bangkok but it is a transport system and not a tourist attraction The skytrain is easy to navigate and air conditioned  both significant pluses It does get very busy at peak times and it is not unusual to have to wait for a second train to your destination the first one being full to capacity and unable therefore to take additional passengers However take a few minutes to plan your journey and you will be able to use the skytrain to travel to the main attractions in Bangkok Many journeys head to Saphan Taksin station where the skytrain meets the river ferry to enable access to the Royal Palace and other attractions

title: The Travel Carrier
review: Nice way to get around the city Fast and convenient Cheap and fast way to escape from the traffic in the busy streets of Bangkok

title: Great alternative to Bangkok taxis!
review: Fast and efficient and no need to deal with those dangerous taxis and their belligerent drivers The ticketing system is easy to use and help is at hand if you get stuck

title: airport rail link efficiency
review: I took this rail link a few time The big advantage is that you do not need to deal with the taxi at either the airport or the hotel You just take the rail link then take the BTS to the station close to your hotel Most good hotel have a "tuktuk" free of charge to take you to the hotel thus no walking The only problem is the stairs At some station there is no escalator thus you need to carry the luggage either up or down and it is annoying I wish they had escalator on all of those

title: Very comfortable and convinient!!
review: We travelled from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and back through train and we were so glad we chose this over buses The trains reach the platform much before the departure timeso it was easy for us to locate our berthcar number Seats are comfortable and there are dedicated people who will make your bed when you wish to sleepplenty of storage spaceEither where will be fixed rqcks next to the seats or there will be place below the seatsFood can be ordered or you can get your own It will get very cold so take warm clothessocks

title: connectivity is usp
review: I didnt like the fact that it does not connect every area of bangkok cause its a good facility especially during songkran festival when all thai are celebrating new year a week long featival where everyone is splashing water and chalk on all people (both ways no exceptions) and roads are facing a bit more trarric snarls Its a good way to commute I liked the facility of sky pedestrian way which takes directly to malls and shopping complexes with out stepping on the road It nice to try

title: Why even bother...
review: Nope Nope Nope  Take a taxi seriously its not worth the hassle to take the train Taxi costs less than 350 baht incl highway tax and is much faster  Not recommended

title: Best transportation
review: Best way to move around in Bangkok  Avoid the rush hour  Cheap and convenient but do not cover the whole town

title: Very fast and Clean!
review: Most reliable transportation in Bangkok if you'd like to avoid traffic jam Price starts from 30 THBway You can buy one day pass for 140 THB

title: So simple
review: Really easy to get around independently and avoid sitting in traffic First time in Bangkok and my daughter and I found it so helpful

title: Good Metro
review: Confy good AC Best when there is lots of trafic We usually used this instead of taxi or tuk tuk

title: Good experience
review: Yes as others pointed out the floating market is for tourists now but it's still cool to see how they used to do it The salespeople aren't pushy either The railway market has a lot of tourists but is also used for daily shopping by locals It's super chaotic but also super interesting Overall enjoyed this tour and the price was ok Nice that hotel pickup is included Thanks
