title: Space
review: Sometimes the BTS is crowded sometimes not If you are going to Ploen Chit from the BTS it is very crowded You'll have to squeeze

title: Easiest way around Bangkok and with some great views too
review: Easiest way around Bangkok although very crowded weekdays before 0830 and between 17001900 Cheaper than taxis or tuktuke too though for "eal Bangkok" cheapskates the cheapest option is nonairconditioned bus

title: Super convenient way of transport in a part of Bangkok
review: This is very convenient way of moving around in a part of Bangkok and also connects to train stations such as MRT or airport rail express

title: The best way to move
review: The best and the cheapest way to move in Bangkok Skytrain is also used to go to airport is very fast and the price is very low

title: Well worth it!
review: We loved this tour The highlight is definitely the Maeklong train market Coming in on the train and then watching it leave again and getting to explore a bit was a great experience The floating market was more of a tourist trap but still worth seeing and going around on the paddle boat  Our guide was amazing He was super friendly and helpful Very informative and overall made the trip an even better experience Definitely recommend going on  this tour while your in bangkok

title: Best thing to use especially in peak hours
review: Not too crowded  Easy to buy ticket and use  Better if you have coins with you otherwise you might need to exchange for some since their machines only eats coins or small notes

title: Extreme Convenient to avoid traffic
review: I experienced the terrible traffic jam in Bangkok thus I choosed to use Airport Rail Link to avoid traffic jam and save my time   The price is fair and it is very convenient  It worth a 5stars review

title: efficient
review: regular service clean & safe this means of transport to get around Bangkok has become the best way to compute between shopping centres restaurants theatres and most points of interest

title: The best service ever
review: I was surprised the first time I used the BTS skytrain service And I am still every morning when I take it for going to work The service is impeccable and it should be repeated around the world Well done

title: Fast and clean city travel
review: These trains run along the main routes across the city and dont get held up in traffic jams  Usually quite full as they are popular but they get you across town quickly especially down to the river

title: Good connectivity. Well located to many attractions. Cheap. But coin system ticket machines are CRAZY.
review: The only downside is the coin system ticket machines It's really silly If you don't have coins you go to the coin exchange counter to get coins then come back to the machine to buy the tickets  Also they should have more station  system maps and ticketing cost posters  signage around as now they only have it near the machines and many tourists find it a problem to crowd near the machines to check where they need to go and the costs while others are trying to line up and buy tickets  The system is cheap just around 20+ baht for 13 stops for more stops it's up to around 45 baht  BTS can also get you to many areas easily MBK shopping center stop at Rachadamri Siam paragon stop at Siam Central world and platinum fashion mall at Chidlom Emporium at Phrom Phong And Terminal 21 at Asok station Jim Thompson house at National stadium All within 510 min walk from the stations Very good connectivity  Now there's escalators and lifts in the station which is great for elderly and kids Great improvement from 23 years ago  A great way to travel around Bangkok and beat the crazy traffic Just keep all the coins you have to buy tickets

title: Everyday travel
review: If you are visiting and plan to travel and visit many places I highly suggest to buy the one day pass   If you are starting in Bangkok  then get the Rabbit Card It's so fast being able cut through the long lines of people needing to buy a ticket

title: Fast, clean and cheap
review: Buy a daily pass  save money and time  The Skytrain is fast cool and runs regularly The wait for a train is rarely more than 2 or 3 minutes Links to the River ferries Airport Express and MRT are easy

title: easy as
review: Im an expert travelling on the MRT safe clean well airconditioned it the best way to get around central bangkok

title: Great elevated tram system.
review: As long as the Skytrain is nearby you have a reliable quick and inexpensive way of getting around Make sure you have change for the automated ticket machines otherwise you may have to queue for assistance Great to have an aerial view of the city as you travel above ground

title: Quick and Efficient
review: Brilliant system slick smooth and inexpensive gets you too all the best sights with a minimum of fuss easy to navigate

title: air conditioned and fast
review: The skytrain is convenient and fast but very crowded at most times of the day

title: efficient system
review: One of the many available transportation options to explore Bangkok It connects you to all the main attractions I appreciated the efficiency of the BTS especially when we were running from place to place in a tight schedule I love the fact that it connected to all the areas in Bangkok that we wanted to explore from the Chao Phraya River Sites to the heart of the City A must experience The orderly gathering of the queues is admirable Everyone lines up quickly single file and they follow that order with efficiency It's considered impolite to jump the queue Get ready for stare downs if you don't follow this order Don't be the 'Ugly Tourist"

title: Busy train
review: Lots of staircases at stations but we manage to find a small lift in the stations we went to The lines are simple to understand and you can buy tickets at manned counters or using vending machines

title: Fast and cheap
review: If you go to the town from airport You can reach the town through the interchange of MRT or BTS around 40 mins  The fee must cheaper than taxi or rental car It is very economy

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be a nightmare Standstill especially in the afternoon and evening The Skytrain is quick comfortable and easy to navigate All signs and announcements are in English as well as Thai

title: Convenient
review: to explore and travel around without getting caught up in traffic if you are not in a hurry  Weekdays can be very crowded but there are trains once every 5 minutes or so

title: Best Way To Get from Airport to City Centre
review: Don't get a taxi from the airport Not as quick or not as cheap 45 baht (‚Ç¨125) to get to Phaya Thai and about ‚Ç¨2 then in a metered taxi from there to Grand Palace or Kho San Road Extremely clean method of transport too

title: Great way of getting around.
review: Fast inexpensive airconditioned and much easier than haggling with tuk tuk or taxi drivers You can get a day pass which might be worth it if you are making multiple trips

title: Not Running
review: When I was in Bangkok in June 2015 the dedicated Airport train was not running The local train was still running It akes about 15 minutes longer but is also less money and thus a bit more crowded but goes the same route as the Express did

title: easy to use
review: its really simple to use you can get a boat to southern taskin from which the kiosk will give you change and a easy map will tell yu how much you fare is based on you destination one of the main stops is national stadium where yo ucan get to most of the shopping

title: Quick and easy service
review: Excellent service to and from the airport to the city Takes about 25 minutes on the slower train Airport Express is faster but less frequent and doesn‚Äôt run at weekends

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Airport Rail Link is very convenient economical safe option for traveling to and from Swarnabhumi airport

title: Convenient
review: My boyfriend and I are backpacking Thailand and I must say the BTS is extremely convenient For 140 baht you can purchase a day pass which allows unlimited access for the day This was the pass we used There are many touristy spots located from station to station and it's fun to get off and on the train and go look around The train itself can get very crowded depending on the time you take the BTS The train is very clean and the layout of stations is very easy to navigate through We also took the airport rail link which the BTS links up with Very very convenient

title: Great way to explore the city and get from A to B
review: The Bangkok Skytrain or BTS is an impressive and efficient way to visit many parts of the city It is very well maintained and efficient It also offers nice views on the city on certain parts of the track If you are visiting as a tourist try and avoid the very busy rush hours

title: Best airport to downtown transport.
review: Most convenient and cheap transport from airport to downtown Took a taxi from airport to my hotel arriving in Bangkok and it cost way too much I used airport link from downtown to airport and it was less time and third of what I paid for taxi

title: 5 stars : 100 % recommend
review: Nati our guide and Mr Ping Pong our driver were both excellent  Nati was knowledgeable and very helpful and explained everything very clearly  Mr Ping Pong was an excellent driver and the air con was so appreciated in the transport  We were picked up from our hotel at 820 am and joined some other passengers on the bus  When everyone was boarded Nati explained what the day would entail  The tour takes up to 8 hours depending on Bangkok traffic  Nati took our orders for lunch on the bus before we reached the floating market and organised everything for us so we didn‚Äôt have to Q  Lunch was 150 tbt for 2 people and was delicious  We arrived at the station to board the 1040 train to the market  The train travels past the salt flats It is really quite an experience arriving into the market  Sit on the left Nati said  Exit to left  The train leaves the station to go back through the market so you see the traders retracting their stalls and awnings  Nati recommended the juice shop at the meet point and it was excellent ( see menu in pics ) great value  The floating market exceeded my expectation as you spend a long time going through the canals and you see a lot of interesting sights  Nati had written return instructions for the people who had been picked up from hotels which was helpful  I recommend this trip and it is a very unique experience and I felt the trip was very good value for money  Again thank you Nati and Mr Ping Pong for a great experience

title: Fab
review: Really easy way to get around BKK would recommend a day pass for 120 baht also a great break from the smog

title: Easy and fast to us
review: Good value for money and keeps you out of traffic easy access from airport Gives good views of Bangkok

title: Transport for London....Eat your heart out!
review: This is clean reliable inexpensive and safe Much more pleasant than sitting in traffic jams Of course it gets very busy at rush hours but people are very politethey wait for passengers to get off before crowding on Many stations have multiple exits which can be a bit confusing so it is best to do some homework first

title: Fast and Convenient
review: It's a very convenient to and from the airport which is very economical as well From start to the last station will only cost you 49 Baht per trip which you can avoid the costly taxi fare and traffic jam

title: Fast & Efficient
review: The Airport Railway Link was fast and efficient for people to get to the BKK Airport It just cause a little to get to the airport compared to getting a cab The speed is really amazing fast Really enjoyed it There's also plug built in inside the train at some corners which allows people to have their gadgets charged when they are on the train Cheers

title: Cheap for individuals
review: It covers most of the locations in Bangkok Travellers travelling in group of more than 3 should avoid train and choose taxi as it is cheaper

title: Fast and easy
review: It is extremely easy to understand how it works What‚Äôs more it is fast and cheap We had no problems when we used it

title: Great service
review: Sky train is a must Great way to experience real life in Bangkok Frequent clean trains Employees are always willing to help

title: Clean and crowds.
review: Its cheap its clean and its crowed I don't mind the crowd because of the order that its seems to have It's shuffle shuffle in and out but its quick as well compaired to taxi traffic

title: The only way
review: This is the only sensible way to the airport if you stay along the BTS skytrain line You get on the airport rail link from one of the BTS stations  Phayathai At this moment the nonstop express train to the airport has been terminated and only the city link which makes several stops and carries largely city commuters is available It is crowded and uncomfortable as it has just long steel benches for seats But it is cheap  at just 45 baht (US$150 but expensive for daily office workers) The journey takes halfanhour point to point At the station (Phayathai) there are only escalators going up but not down So if you arrive from the airport you'd have to take the stairs down dragging your luggage There are no facilities for travelers as it seems to be built for commuters

title: Brilliant
review: What is there to say  This is a very efficient transport system at a very affordable price Fantastic way of getting around Bangkok covering most of the relevant areas And you can always use it to get nearer you end point and then take a Taxi from there

title: Cheap, efficient and fast
review: For 45thb you get into the city  disembarking at Phaya Thai and from there take a 5 minute walk to catch the BTS service  which will get you most of the places in the city for another 45thb or under Best thing  you avoid the traffic snarl Great service

title: The best transit in Bangkok
review: Bangkok is bad traffic so BTS and motor bike taxi is the best for you Avoid office time 8 AM to 9 AM

title: Clean and Fast
review: it was a little bit complicated for me to access my destination and when i was asking people every one was showing me a different direction

title: Great way to get around
review: You need coins to buy tickets though you can get change at the station  Maps are fairly easy follow  It is quick and can be very crowded so be prepared to get up close and personal with strangers

title: Fast, efficient way to get into Bangkok
review: The rail link cannot be beat for getting into Bangkok from the airport It is fast efficient and inexpensive It can be a bit crowded but that is because it is fast efficient and inexpensive

title: great fast service
review: The skytrain service is excellent but could do with more capacity trains are too full but the best way around Bangkok

title: Great but can be busy
review: This is a great way to travel across the city quickly and cheaply it can however be very busy The counter staff are more than helpful assisting travellers

title: Good way into Bangkok
review: A good alternative to reach Bangkok city center during rush hours We opt to go by train back to the airport one change in between which is quite a long walk but 35 min and we reached the airport ok

title: See the world Thailand
review: Purchase this trip off of Groupon the hotels were all five star the trip was very educational it was really enjoyable

title: Great trip
review: Thanks to Mr Ekaphol of Bigcountry Vacation for his private tour to the railway market and floating market  These places are very unique and certainly worth a visit  The guide was knowledgeable and friendly with good English  We had asked for a recommendation for a shopping mall and back at the hotel he wrote a note in English and Thai for us to give to a taxi driver so really helpful

title: Quick, easy and cheap way of getting to the city
review: We used the airport rail link to get into Bangkok city We were staying in China town so had to change to the underground for a few stops The train service is cheap and efficient easy to use and avoids the Bangkok congestion

title: Cheap and fast
review: Cheap fast and reliable way from BKK to city I see no alternatives to do this way Comfortable interchange with MRT Bangkok's buses are practically only for locals because of routes and stops signed only  in thai so railway transportations in Bangkok is the most appropriate transport for budget tourists

title: good transpotation
review: another good option for travelling to hotspot especially peak hour price are good cabin are clean

title: The easiest way to get around Bangkok.
review: Conveniently connects you to important shopping areas and lets you avoid the infamous Bangkok traffic Quick and efficient Tickets are reasonably priced Can get very busy during office hours

title: Cheap and clean
review: This is the cheap way to see Bangkok easily and quickly It was clean and people were friendly  as well You could get the train easily because there are many directions

title: Easy and Efficient.
review: We enjoyed taking the BTS Skytrain it was easy to navigate and quite efficientWe liked the glass gates that go up when there is no train in the stationvery safe so that people cannot fall or jump on the rails

title: Great
review: Very easy to use and perfect for getting around in Bangkok It is a good thing that some hotels are directly connected to the BTS making it even easier getting by

title: Easy System
review: Great public transport system Easy to purchase tickets Clean air con trains Passengers always giving me a seat when I hopped on with my toddler The best way to get around Bangkok

title: Good public transport with nice view of the city
review: The good   Many stations across the city  Easy to travel around  Clean  Several ticket options  Good view of the city  Easy railway map  The bad   Sometimes a little too cold inside  No sign at stations showing when the next train will arrive  Often too crowded (Should put in more trains)  Conclusion  I prefer to use BTS to get around in Bangkok They are now expanding and are building new stations

title: Great tour. Would recommend.
review: Great tour Well organised tour guide was knowledgeable friendly and funny Van was comfortable Definitely worth the money

title: Great way to get around
review: Air conditioned Cheap fast way to get around the city

title: Impressive efficient
review: It is a first world train in terms of quality it is fast clean and cheap highly recommended Buy the ticket in the train station and go

title: Best way to beat traffic
review: Bangkok has terrible traffic  The best way to beat traffic and reach destination is the sky train  Most of the malls and happening places are very well connected with sky train like chutatak weekend market MBK mall complete Shukumivit area

title: Easy to use...
review: This is easy to use they have kiosks or ticket machines and the info is in Thai and English so make sure you have some coins Not expensive Most of the stations have direct access into shopping malls Emporium MBK Siam Paragon etc You can get to most places on this and it's a lot quicker than taxis If you are arriving at the airport with carry on luggage you can get a train from the airport into town so you can use this to get where you need to go

title: Very easy to get around
review: The rail link doesn't cost too much for a day visit and is very easy to use You have you pass ticket for the day hop on hop off and you can read the rail map to decide on where to go

title: Easy for tourists
review: We used the sky train several times on our holiday the ticket fares were quite cheap (compared to London anyway) The trains were clean with very good connections The upcoming stations were lit up to show the next station and that helped Loved that it was very orderly getting on and off the trains with platforms marked with where passengers getting on or off should stand

title: Easy to do.
review: We travelled during rush hour and it was fine There is space to fit your luggage and sit comfortably We bought a yellow coin touched in for our first entry then put in the hole when we got to the airport Very simple to go up the escalators to the departure lounge or wait for the lift if you want

title: Perfect Way to Explore Bangkok
review: We utilised the BTS train throughout our stay in Bangkok as we were staying near 2 stations (Siam & National Stadium) Although at a 1st glance it can seen complicated the stations and automated voice throughout the BTS are in English as well as Thai making it easy to determine where you are at a times  The BTS is very convenient for getting to a number of sights including Chao Phraya River boat cruises Siam Sq KingPower Mahanakhon and Chinatown Unfortunately as Bangkok is so vast it doesn‚Äôt cover all of the City which is why I am giving 4 stars instead of 5  When I next visit Bangkok I will be making use of the BTS train system once again

title: Easy public transport.
review: We travelled by airport link to Phraya Thai station Then connect to BST for Nana station About 80 baht Easy to buy tickets and to make connections Many stairs to carry bags up and down though at stations   More should use this

title: Cool place on a hot day
review: Bangkok Skytrain is clean  modern  fast  cheap and the best way to get around in the city  AC works very well on a hot sweaty day

title: Great and efficient means of transportation around the City.
review: We used the sky train to go to shopping areas during the day and also to access the water taxi to get to the tourist attractions

title: Convenient & Easy to Use
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok  The BTS system is cheap clean and very easy to use We used the BTS system to get to the huge weekend market at the Mo Chit stop as well as took it down to the river to connect with the riverboats to see old Bangkok  So much cheaper than taxi's Grab Uber etc

title: Incredible way to get around
review: Low cost very fast efficient transport Fully airconditioned Travel anywhere for just a few Baht Everyone is so polite no pushing or shoving

title: Very easy to navigate
review: Coming from Singapore we're used to a great public transportation system This one was easy to navigate as well We went up to the ticket counter and showed the person the station we wanted to travel to on a map After we paid we were given a card to scan to enter the station The train was very clean came frequently and has easy to understand signage on which station we were traveling to on the line When we left the station we inserted our card to exit and it kept the card

title: Great day trip from Bangkok
review: Such a great experience We went on this tour with our three sons ages 8 10 and 12 They all loved it We were picked up at our hotel in the morning The ride to the train market was made interesting by our awesome tour guide Bean who gave us interesting information about Thailand‚Äôs history and facts about what we were seeing along the way The train market was very cool to visit We loved the boat ride through the floating market and the place we went for lunch was delicious Bean helped us bargain for some great finds at the market I wish we could have stayed longer

title: City's lifeline
review: Very convenient connecting all the major places If you dont have change  dont bother  there would be a change counter just near the ticket machine

title: Easy transportation to the city
review: I found the ARL really help me The best transportation if you arrive in Survanabhumi and want to continue to the city Suitable for backpaker and anyone who travel lite It's connected withe several BTS and MRT station so you can easily transfer to BTS or MRT and explore Bangkok city Operation hour 600  2400 Location basement floor

title: Easy to use
review: This made our travel so much easier Much quicker than any cab and easy to follow station guides Very cheap

title: A must
review: I get confused alot if I look at the boards for the info  I prefer taxi  But just ask someone if you don't understand how to use the skytrain  never found anyone who would not

title: Fast and safe way to travel
review: It a very fast way to travel and very easy to locate yourself in the maps Very useful for going to the airport too You avoid very boring traffic in BBK

title: Heavy security guarded
review: I think Bangkok is the safest monorail ride cos every time you enter the entrance you have to get screening first  Very clean the place  No eating and drinking in there Time arrive good  Weekend not many people  But week day so full like you have eaten 15cheese burger in 1 go  Price is reasonable  I took the 1 day pass cost me 140bhatt  Can bring me go shopping many places and famous chatuchak night market and to saphan taksin take the free boat ride to asiantique warehouse night market

title: fast and Cheap
review: Taking BTS will help you reach your destination super fast in cheap price but it has very limited station and BTS is usually crowded

title: Expensive, expensive but needed
review: Cost of sky train ride is expensive compared to the MRT However they are the connecting points to areas of interest There is no choice but to take them

title: not that convenience
review: the main station has no lift u need to carry your luggage and walk down few staircase the service is quite new but the train looks old 2 person's fair equals to (or similar ) to the taxi only good thing is there is no traffic jam

title: Not express but convenient
review: The Airport Rail Link doesn't seem to offer the express train any more but it was still pretty quick especially during the day when the roads are busy  It is also cheap compared to taxi's and transfers even if you still have to get on the MRT which we did  We were also a family of 4 and it was still cheaper  A good experience and easy to navigation from the airport

title: Surprisingly smooth and comfortable ride.  The trains are clean.
review: Our first time taking the Rail Link and we are pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and the efficiency of the train and the clear directions in the Rail mall

title: Travel light on airport link
review: I travelled via airport link several times while living in BKK When picking up visitors from the airport by myself it was the cheapest way to get there from Sukhumvit 59 ( Thong Lo) where I lived  In rush hour it was the fastest It is however always a 35 minute journey from Sukhumvit terminal The train has almost always been full when I travelled it even after 9 pm With the crowd you will probably be standing with your luggage the whole time The train makes quite a few stops Apparently there is an express one but I never was able to time my rides on express schedule  If you are travelling with someone else the cost will be about the same as a taxi except in rush hour when every road bus train and BTS train will be packed very tightly with passengers  NOTE there are very long walks to and from the train both directions Some elevators available but often long waits for them in busy airport Be forewarneddo not overload yourself with luggage

title: Convenient
review: Easy to use great way to get around Cheap too hopefully the expansion of the lines arrives sooner rather than later

title: Easy to use and dirt cheap.
review: Really good way of getting around and getting a sense of space within the city You need change to buy your ticket from a machine but there are plenty of people who'll give it

title: Great
review: The skytrain is great for transport and also for viewing the city because it is elevated so we got a good perspective on the city by riding around

title: not enough trains
review: Not suitable for family and suitcases noone helped

title: Save money and time
review: This is a lifemoney saver when you arrive at BKK airport for the first time I had no idea how to reach my hotel which was around 30km from the airport and this train helped me reach my hotel in very less amount of money Later I realised that it saved my time as well since roads have heavy traffic near Sukhumvit and other places which were part of the route

title: BTS Skytrain experience
review: I utilized the skytrain while visiting Bangkok  I must say that this mode of transportation was quite easy to get around Bangkok  The transportation system was clean and appeared to run on a regular schedule This appeared to be a major mode of transportation in Bangkok

title: By far the easist & coolest way to get round Bangkok!
review: We have travelled to Bangkok many times now the first time was in preSkytrain days  All I can say is the Skytrain has revolutionised travel around Bangkok from the minute you step out of the airport  The trains are prompt frequent and best of all lovely and cool  Travelling from one area of the city to another is relatively easy once you get your bearings  Remember always have some loose change to buy your ticket at the machine as sometimes the queue's for change at the counter are long

title: Best way to get around
review: Inexpensive clean and reliable Very best means of transpo Used it everyday to see the sites of BangkokReclining Buddha Chinatown and dining

title: Get ready some coins or you will wait at the long queue
review: One thing I don't like is that the automatic ticket selling machine can only accept coins If you only bring notes with you you will end up queuing for long time at the ticket selling counter This problem won't happen in the MRT line where the machine can accept both coins and notes

title: Air conditioned efficiency
review: Taxis can get stuck in Bangkok traffic at most times of the day After 9pm is ok but for all other journeys I would seek out a route using the Skytrain Get as near as you can to your destination and only then grab a cab Very cheap air conditioned convenient transportation

title: Easy to use
review: We took the subwayBTS around town Very easy to use and understand We also went from the airport to the Nana stop very clean cars

title: Very convinient
review: If you stay near station and don't carry a lot with you BTS is the best way to move in the city with crazy traffic Handy and easy to use

title: Easy and cheap
review: The underground is an easy and cheap way to get around in Bangkok Every station has clear and understandable maps of the train system

title: A welcome and necessary in improvement in Bangkok's public transport
review: The BTS has grown into a very useful method of efficient public transport It's above the traffic snarls that frequent Bangkok's streets I have found it to be good value relatively clean and quick It's been running to the airport now for a while and is a nice change from the taxi queue hassles

title: Makes travelling so simple
review: I lived in Bangkok as the Sky Train was built It was legendary for its traffic jams  Thanks to the Skytrain traffic is no longer something most visitors need to worry about Traversing many of the main tourist areas the Skytrain is clean air conditioned and cheap It's transformed visiting Bangkok  Look out for the multi trip tickets and the unlimited day tickets It's great value either way

title: Useful, cheap but can be extremely busy
review: We used the BTS Skytrain on several occasions It's a good service but currently routes are quite limited Depending on time of day the service can also be very busy in Bangkok itself On one occasion it was so packed we couldn't even get on a train so gave up & hailed a taxi instead The rail network plans for the future look very good & work has already started the sooner these routes are finished the better

title: Easy way to get into the heart of Bangkok
review: The rail link is super convenient after landing in BKK as a means of getting into Bangkok This route leads directly to the BTS and MTS lines It's also a nice way to see the city

title: Reliable, cheap only 150 baht a day
review: Easy to use aircon works brilliantly English signposting faultless

title: A very convenient way to move around the city
review: It is something like the metro only ground very comfortable was struck by the fact that the trains are airconditioned so very comfortable to drive long distancesOne trip costs from 15 to 50 baht depending on the distance and the desired station

title: Little sleep on the sleeper
review: My daughter soninlaw and I travelled from Bangkok to Chiang Mai on Friday 14 August 2015 My sononelaw went to the station and booked the tickets for two women in the lockable sleeper and one man in the second class sleeper but the tickets were for two men in the lockable sleeper and one woman in the 2nd class sleeper so he ended up having women all around him which is okay because he talked to them and they must have thought he was no threat because none of them apparently complained Also separating the two classes of sleepers was a carriage specifically for women which is handy to know  They have traveled on this train several times and had warned me that we would not be eating food provided by the service because it is not good and is overpriced  We did buy a cup of tea each for 30 baht and took our own snacks  The rail track is very rough so I think that may have contributed to my lack of sleep and also the beds are across the carriage rather than being along the carriage as they are in 2nd class which is how my soninlaw travelled The train was 35 minutes late into the station where we got on but was on time inIo Chiang Mai so maybe we travelled fairly quickly to make up that time which contributed to the roughness I had no expectation that anything would be particularly clean having been in Thailand for two weeks and been astounded at the amount of garbage that seems to be just thrown around on the streets and the waterways but the sheets appeared to be clean and the staff were pleasant enough It was interesting watching the room being changed into seating while we waited in the corridor in the morning I think overall it was a good experience but I will not take the 1st class sleeper again  If I was going overnight I would travel 2nd class and if by myself the women only carriage Because trip adviser has defined What Sort of Trip Was This and none of it fits my visit I'll tell you that I have never travelled outside Australia and had a policy of "if I can't drive to it I'm not going" but I am visiting my adult family who have lived here for six years and speak the language fairly well

title: User friendly ticketing machines
review: As a foreigners found it super easy to understand the route and to buy our own tickets without having to ask from local people to help Just need to change the money into coins They also having the auto door to prevent people slipped to the railway

title: the only way to travel
review: Great way to get about above the traffic A must for getting around

title: Memorable
review: The whole day was exceptional from the war cemetery museum  the bridge & hellfire pass something we not forget  our tour guide ‚ÄúX‚Äù (that is his name) & our driver we‚Äôre very knowledgeable  We got adequate time to look & explore each of the locations  which all passes & tickets were included Lunch was delicious so much food & water drinks were on hand for any time we needed They broke the travelling up with stops at convenience stores so you could purchase goods & stretch the legs etc We couldn‚Äôt have been more happier with our experience on this tour would highly recommend this tour a must do

title: Super Handy Travel
review: Just not extensive enough in my opinion It did not take me to the places I wanted to visit which was a shame but a good service otherwise

title: Clean and Easy
review: The MRT was very clean and easy to use It can get very busy and crowded during peak travel times for locals so keep that in mind I felt really safe and had no issues   Notes The MRT uses a "coindisk" system After paying for your trip you recieve a plastic disk Place the disk upon the activation pad which will upon the gate Keep the disk till you get to your destination When leaving your destination station slide disk into coin slot and the gate will open DO NOT THROW AWAY DISK

title: well planned skytrain
review: Good experience the train runs more or less on top of Sukhumvit road Therefore very convenient for moving along and going to the various malls Paying by cash is a bit of a nuisance as you need coins first to buy the ticket

title: Great if luggage is light
review: Great service if little or no luggage Fast and affordable and easier than taxis  If a lot of luggage the stations end route are very difficult to negotiate so better to take taxis

title: Overcrowded
review: Great to get around but so overcrowded it's almost dangerous  Sometimes you have no choice but to use it as traffic is so bad

title: This is hands down the fastest way into the city.
review: Very cheap fast way into the city You can take the city route which has about 5 stops or express all the way to the end There are kiosks and a service desk at every station Get with your hotel and ask if there is a station close so you can plan which stop to get off on Taxis and tuk tuks are at every station if your destination is to far We have used this service many times and it is the best fastest safest & cheapest way to and from the airport

title: Fast, clean & easy to navigate
review: We found the skytrain really easy to use Have some coins handy to purchase your ticket On the back of the ticket it the rain map so you can always keep track of the stops and where you are going The skytrain was clean fast and on time It gets very busy in peak hour and not all stations have lifts if you are commuting with luggage

title: best way to avoid traffic
review: Fast and convenient transport from town to airport  avoiding traffic problems  Takes 4560 minutes from town to airport  Allow 5 minutes to reach check in area from station

title: Scheduled
review: This train quite fast and punctual and waiting time not too long The ticket price also very cheap and I like it

title: Good, lacking in rolling stock
review: A great service in general and seems to be well manaeged However as with other transit sytems in Thailand little planning was applied in the setup and now there is a lack of sufficient rolling stock to carry the passengers effectively This results in extended waiting times during rush hours (which are expanding daytoday)

title: The Bangkok "underground" is about to blossom
review: The Bangkok underground the MRT is about to blossom with lines being finished new stations springing up and new rolling stock in the near future The existing trans provide the most rapid transport around the areas served already  a very civilised way to travel the trains and the stations are kept spotless and some of the stations are huge having been built to accommodate the future travellers in comfortIt takes about 2 years to build a train set and while some overcrowding is now being experienced the MRT commuter can soon expect some relief One of the quirky things about the MRT is that passengers of any nationality aged over 60 years can travel at half price all that is required is to show you passport when buying a stored value ticket Through 201920 a total of 4 lines will be completed making commuting easier Step on board and experience Bangkok's hidden gem

title: Very convenient!
review: Such a good choice if u want to avoid bad traffic in Bangkok Make sure u spare enough coins Hopefully they have more stations for tourist in future

title: Help desk staff were brilliant
review: Didn't know where we had to get off as staying in Sukhumvit but asked the ladies at the helpdesk and they were wonderful They marked on the map exactly where we needed to be  super The rail link was clean quick and not at all busy when we took it We arrived at 930am is and were in Sukhumvit  with a change of train by 1030 Would have struggled without the support from help desk

title: Bts to airport
review: Oh its a very nice public tranaport service we can avoide traffic jam and can reached airport in time without any tention

title: Fast and comfortable
review: It take you from airport to final destination only for 20 minutes So it won't be problem if you can't get a sit there I liked how everything is organized And it's not very crowdy

title: Clean and organized train system
review: Clean Stations Very Organized professional staff Train stop information was very easy to understand

title: Clean, efficient and great air con
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok safely in rush hour You could always take a moped taxi at 20Bhatt a km the skytrain is way cheaper 42bhat a single journey and a way more safer way to travel

title: Great System
review: Easy to navigate  Simply work out where you want to go in your map and then locate your nearest station to board  Line up and get your ticket (paper card) from the seller  they do understand basic English Put your card in the machine and go to the platform  the card will be retained when you exit Make sure you are on the right platform and heading in the direction you want

title: A must in bangkok
review: So easy to use  Print out the train link off the web before you leave for your holiday and this shows you which platform you need  Once at the station just look for which station you need to get off and this will give you the price you have to pay  Press the amount on the machine put in the money and presto   Trains run every couple of minutes with aircontoo easy

title: Comfortable and Quick
review: The BTS is a comfortable way to travel if your destination is close to a BTS station A short ride will cost about 15 baht and a 10 stops ride about 50 baht  My only complaint is many places are still not accessible using BTS

title: Good connectivity across main Bangkok
review: This train service is very good connectivity across main Bangkok   It's no brainier to use this service as you can beat the traffic   Only downside is it's crowded

title: Allow time rush hour is crowded.
review: The airport link is only just over a dollar to the end of the line which is located in a BTS station so one can get the BTS to the nearest point to you hotel If your hotel is a on theriver you can get the relevant hotel shuttle to the 5 star  onesIf you flight gets in at 1100pm or later get the public taxi because you won't get through customs in time the link close at midnight It started at 730am but is about to change to 530 am It was an easy journey but crowded in rush ours I personally only carry a rucksack and small rolling suitcase  I saw people which huge luggage I would not attempt the link with such Remember when you travel less is best so you are not held back by possessions

title: A great success!
review: We love using this mode of transport to get around BKK  Clean efficient regular and easy to use Buy yourself a "Rabbit Card" for even more ease of use with the tap on tap off system and you can top it up when it runs low  Sure beats sitting in Bangkok traffic any day

title: Quick,cheap and easy
review: BTS Skytrain is a great way to travel around Bangkok The link with the Airport Express is good and value for money

title: Fast but cold
review: It was really a good way how to move in the city except to go to the center where skytrain is not going Inside AC was extremely cold

title: Excellent way to get to/from BKK
review: Avoid the horrible Bangkok traffic  if you can take the Airport Rail link to BKK Plus it costs less than $150 US to get from Phaya Thai station to the airport in less than 45 minutes

title: Great Train System
review: The BTS Skytrain is a terrific train system that is cheap and simple to use It works its clean and it's airconditioned The users all seemed friendly Strong recommendation to get around in Bangkok

title: Over the roofs of Bangkok
review: The sky train in Bangkok is an efficient and cheap means of transport in this megacity It is clean and modern and brings you to most destinations in combination with the underground buses and motorcycle taxis Instead of a office car I used it also to get to business meetings and events

title: BTS.  BANGKOK
review: It's easy to use  signage is clear  reasonably priced    This will take you to all shopping malls   take it to the river  and from there the river ferrys will take you to all the attractions

title: fantastic.
review: Skytrain is great Clean and efficient And links with the MTR in many locations What more can I say Forget taxis

title: Fast, affordable!
review: I took the airport rail link to Phaya Thai station and interchange to Bang Wa station alight at BTS Nana It took me less than an hour to get to my hostel in Sukhumvit 8 and the whole trip is less than 100 baht  If you take the taxi to the city center I heard it will cost you 400 baht I suggest taking the airport link if you dont have a big luggage Safe trip

title: Easy
review: Very easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok Staff are helpful if you get stuck but it is a simple system and very easy to understand With a little pre planning you can really get to anywhere in Bangkok

title: Best way to get into the city
review: Cheap and easy Located on the bottom floor of the airport Less than 100 baht cheaper than any taxi

title: Easiest way to get around
review: BTS Skytrain (and the underground MRT) are super easy to use  They are impeccably clean as are the stations and they are among the easiest systems to navigate in the world

title: Nice
review: 1 star less as it doesnt have a display to show station names in english But otherwise all good Same like bts

title: 3nts in Bangkok
review: Here for three nights hadnt really looked at travel till we got here stayed in Sukumvit which has the metro and Skytrain stop Found the metro very easy to use as its only one line either way got a three day pass for 230B

title: Convenient, but crowded and a little too expensive
review: Over the years the SkyTrain has become too crowded and is now on the verge of becoming too expensive  There are some odd design and management choices that exacerbate the problem The main one is the lack of ticket machines that take anything other than coins necessitating waiting in line at a staffed window to get change It also feels like they could add more or longer trains to ease crowding  Still it beats sitting in traffic in a taxi

title: So Easy
review: This is the best way to get around Bangkok It is so easy to use and saves so much time and hassle in the traffic

title: The safest and best way to get around ther main parts of Bangkok
review: The BTS is always busy Go with the flow get up close with your fellow tourist  Beware that pickpocket are not unheard of so be aware of where your valuables are  In all the years I've travelled on the BTS I've never had a ounce of trouble  Recommend that you buy a Rabbit Card so you can just prepay and go travelling without worrying about coins for each leg of your adventure These can be brought and preloaded with a minimum of B100 at the station ticket counters

title: Convenient - beat the traffic jam
review: The best transportation mode in BKK if your destinations are accessible via BTS  Average 23 mins to next stop and most hotels provide shuttle tuk tuk tofrom BTS  Get a Rabbit card and for foreigner you will need to present passport to purchase the Rabbit card and for topup

title: very easy to travel
review: its very easy to travel to most of the places in bangkok Cheaper than the local taxi very neat and clean

title: A good experience, but felt a bit rushed.
review: The tour itself was very well organised and the timing of the train ride was impeccable Victor was informative and took good care of us We arrived at the train station a little early which allowed us to view the salt farm briefly It would‚Äôve been nicer if we could‚Äôve spent a bit more time at the Railway Market to have a wonder instead of getting off the train walking to the next point to see the oncoming train and leaving straight away Perhaps also we could‚Äôve got on the previous train station to avoid the crowds at Ban Kalong and also it would‚Äôve been good to spend a bit more time at the Floating market 330 pm was a good time to get back to Bangkok City but considering the above coming back at a later time would‚Äôve also made a good day trip

title: Unbelievable!!!
review: these days in Bangkok there is a tidal wave of cold  temperatures between 1315 degrees Celsius and frozen wind  almost all citizens and tourists are sick or cooled from the strangeness of the weather  and the BTS managment what to do  It keeps the cold air conditioning in trains just like always do  at this point I have the doubt if they are against public health or are really STUPID  legal complaint

title: Clean, reliable & cheap
review: We found this by far the easiest way to get around No bargaining with taxi drivers or unplanned visits to tailors just a top notch public transport system   The all day passes cost 120150 baht per person which is great value if you are visiting multiple locations   If you miss a train don't worry there will be another along in 36 minutes Trains have AC and announcements also made in English   This is how public transport should work   Peter

title: The best way of transportation in Bangkok
review: There are only two lines and some more are being constructed They are quick nice and effective We did not use rabbit card you just need change to buy tickets according the simple plan

title: Easy way to travel around Bangkok
review: Cheap to use easy to get around but avoid rush hour Platforms are organised to queue politely and allow passengers to get off first

title: Move around Bangkok Fast
review: One of the million ways to move around the city Used MRT thrice during our 10 day stay in Bangkok Very convenient service BTS tickets not valid on this system

title: Cheap & efficient
review: Best way to get to the airport Very cheap only 70 bahts for the 2 of us We got a taxi to Makkasan one of the connecting stations to the airport Easy enough & very quick too It also avoids the risk of getting ripped off by the Bangkok airport taxis

title: very useful and convenient
review: for 45bahts it takes 20min to get downtown clean and fast you can even stop before the end of the line to get closer to your destination

title: Good but expensive
review: Very nice and clean way of traveling Also the busses in Bangkok are easy to understand and very cheap

title: great to move around
review: You can get to all your touristicy places Efficient and not expensive  all ticket vending machines will have English option Some of them only take coins tho

title: Easy to use.
review: The above ground rail system is easy to use and inexpensive It's clean safe and You can get to many of the attractions in Bangkok

title: Efficient way to travel
review: Although the MRT is limited in the place it gores to if you need to use it then it is cheaper than the BST and also very efficient also links to the BSt and is the best way to get to CAhtuchak and China town

title: What time not to use sky train.
review: The sky train is a fantastic transport system that is making Bangkok less polluted A green environmentally friendly way to travel that gets you around Bangkok quickly It also connects to the underground airport and main train station I have a car and leave it in Nasa Vegas car park as a Sky Train station is just a 100 metres away Do not use the system between 6am and 9 am as the locals use the system to get to work If you have heard the expression pack them like a tin of sardines it is no exaggeration

title: Driver didn't pick me up - wasted my day
review: Waited in front of the hotel for an hour at 645am for pick up  at the spot I was told to wait  Driver never came  After calling the agent they said the driver couldn't find me  I was holding the receipt in my hand  I was the only person in front of the hotel at 645  I have my doubts  I was provided a refund  But I leave tonight so no opportunity to see the market  Very disappointed in this tour company

title: Didn't exceed our expectaions
review: So we were thrilled about the death railway and it was niceand the views are great but it is way too long and the view doesn't changeIt takes about 2 hours for each direction and it was just too much

title: Quick if you don't have much luggage
review: The airport link is now just a normal BTS line from the airport to Phaya Thai station  To get to the train at BKK you need to follow the signs and go to the basement  It is relatively easy to get down there and then it is 45 baht for the journey to Phaya Thai the terminus  There are 7 stations and it takes about 30 minutes The trains are newish and cool and comfortable  However they are just like any other BTS train so not much space for luggage  It can also get pretty crowded with commuters travelling between the stations  Once you reach Phaya Thai station you have to get out and walk a few hundred metres to get to the main BTS station on the Sukhumvit line  All in all a quick easy and convenient way to get to the city from BKK  Though bear in mind the numerous escalators and negotiating the entry and exit gates  If there are one or two of you with little luggage it is definitely one of the most convenient ways to get to the city  If you have big bags and lots of luggage it may not be the easiest

title: Great for getting around if a station is near your hotel!
review: This Skytrain was great at each station they will have desks to give you coins and you go to the machines and select what zone you want to go to and you pay and it prints the ticket  Very easy to know where you are and was probably the quickest way to get into the city center It was clean and had an English speaking voice to tell you each stop   I do recommend it if a station marked with BTS is near your hotel although you will still need a taxi from Phrya Thai stop to get to Khao San Road etc

title: Great way to travel around
review: Considering very few taxi drivers will use their meters this is the way to got if the train stops anywhere you want to go You can xfer from one line to another If you need to transfer from one line to another and you're not carrying a ton of change you'll need to get change at the ticket booth so you can use the self service machine it will tell you or the ticket person can tell you what button you'll need to press to get the correct ticket from start to  stop  Dave your ticket you need it again at the end to exit

title: Value for money
review: not the best of service but good value for money to get from place A to B wouldn't recommend if you are in a rush language is an issue if its your first time

title: Efficient transport, especially in rush hour.
review: Traffic is the major problem in Bangkok Especially in rush hour which lasts 23 of the day going by taxi is taking its' time Better take MRT and BTS instead While also overcrowded it allows you to go from station to station in short time Prices are  for tourists  small and you can by timebased passes

title: Fast & Easy - just the way I like it!
review: the Airport rail link is a wonderful way to save money as you enter or exit the Big Mango Even if you still get on a taxi at your destination stop you're still saving a good chunk of change  although the new ticketing system for taxis at the BKK airport does make getting ripped off a lot less likely

title: Super fast

title: Awesome BTS Skytrain

title: Very convenient and clean, and far less expensive than a taxi.
review: I have been numerous times to Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi airport as the way to get to Bangkok Bangkok's street traffic is notoriously slow and congested but the Airports Rail Link makes the trip to the city a stressfree inexpensive option The train starts from the lowers floor at the BKK airport so arriving passengers can simply roll their luggage there using the free airport trolleys Getting a ticket is simple The maps of the city are clear and allow one to determine where to get off and which other local subway or "skytrain" to take to get the particular place in Bangkok one wants to go

title: Good transportation around the city
review: Skytrain has two lines You can go to almost everywhere in the main city and it is VERY easy  It is clean and you have small shops where you can buy thingsfooddrinks  To go to the airports you have to take other transportations as well But it is very easy to connect the train with the Railway Airport Link or the buses

title: the best and fast transportation in Bangkok
review: easy to find the BTS station a clean train and with a good air condition a ticket machine is user friendly and easy to use

title: Fabulous day trip with an exceptional guide

title: Easy and fast
review: The best and easy way to get around the city use the btk  Anyone can use very simple  Clean and fast

title: Efficient way of getting around
review: While Bangkok is essentially a concrete city and the Skytrain adds to this due to its construction method this form of transport is desperately needed in the city to help get travellers off the roads It has limited destinations even for tourists but it has good access from most hotel areas to Siam Sukhumvit and the Chao Phraya river It is clean efficient and terribly overcrowded in the rush hours on weekdays as I am sure most city mass transit systems are

title: Fantastic way of getting round
review: So easy to get around good idea to get an all day ticket so you can get on and off as many times as you

title: Cheap and fast way to get int the city
review: 45 Bht (per person) and 45 minutes from Suvarnabhumi airport to Phaya Thai station Very convenient but might not be a good idea if you are carrying many or big bags

title: Worth it to use
review: You can take a taxi or if the BTS goes near where you are going it is so worth avoiding sitting in traffic  At rush hours it is busy but outside those hours it is incredibly convenient to use and not costly  The fares are preset so there are no surprises like with a taxi  I used it a lot

title: Great!
review: Great day The only thing stopping it from being a 5 star is it would have been great to have some time looking around the train market Other than that we had time to look around the floating market and we really did have a great day The best thing we did in bangkok

title: Great and convenient
review: clean affordable and very convenient The token system is very simple to understand as are the maps The carriages are spacious and air conditioned  so much nicer than the london tube

title: The most convinient way to reach the heart of Bangkok
review: I've been taking ARL every single visit to Bangkok The prominent station stops at the heart of Bangkok It is an alternative way to avoid the traffic to and fro the airport One recommendation is to take the ARL and then take a taxi or ehailing ie GRAB to your hotel if the station is not near your hotel This will reduce the cost and time You need not worry especially heading back to the airport as the traffic at Central Bangkok can be notorious during their peak hours

title: Punctual and clean way to go around BKK
review: Skytrain is a punctual and clean way to go around BKK With a lot of traffic jam in BKK this option is obviously preferred The price is quite cheap as well in same time

title: Train ride Great
review: Interesting encounter with the usually pleasant Thai people Booked night train at 1800 Chiang Mai to Bangkok Managed to get a much sought after sleeper birth for my wife and I Requested a forward facing seat but got a rear facing seat Windows in the sleepers are far smaller than the normal second class windows I got a sore neck from twisting around to prevent train sickness when travelling backwards Carriage attendant made the bed up about 8pm and the bed was comfy if you like hard beds Air conditioner worked well and had to turn the vents right  off to get the carriage up to 20 C  Outside was 38c Menu for evening meal and breakfast was brought to us by a very rude man in a brown coloured uniform We didn't order from him as we had brought 2 minute noodles and other snacks Later I enquired about getting some boiling water and firstly got directed to the Restaurant car 6 carriages away Headed off to the restaurant car and when I arrived I politely asked for some boiling water I was verbally attacked by 3 persons in the brown uniform The told me "Everything is not for free You buy the meal you may get some water No meal no water" I was shocked and returned to my carriage I asked the carriage attendant about my encounter and she apologised and said they were contractors and that I could lodge a complaint when I arrived at Bangkok I slept for a few hours then left the berth and went to the second class carriage I found a forward facing seat and looked out the very large window for the rest of the trip The train staff were reasonably friendly but not really interested to talking to anyone The train was clean and the toilets and shower were well appointed and clean If I had my time again I would definitely travel 2nd class as the beds fold down and you have a fair bit of personal space The passengers in all carriages were very quiet The night train was the most modern train but it got dark very quickly and didn't lighten up until the trip was nearly finished so you didn't get to see much of the country side Overall good trip spoiled by the encounter with the food contractors and the fact that boiling water is just not available on the train (I am used to travelling on china trains that have hot water in each carriage to make tea and the old 2 minute noodles)

title: Excellent and efficient
review: We used this means of transport several times  It was very quick and efficient and easy to use but could be extremely crowded

title: Fast but crowded even at 8.30pm
review: Good way to skip the traffic but not cheaper than a taxi if travelling with a small family I was surprised how busy it was even at the late hour

title: Amazing
review: This rail lick is fantastic On time and inexpensive It brings you right into the main sky trail hub  or I like to stay at the inexpensive and pretty nice Nasa Vegas hotel Great name Just a few stops from the airport

title: Very efficient!
review: This is one of the modes of transport we used while in Bangkok It was affordable very efficient and made getting around town quicker Though we sometimes had to take long walks to our destination after getting off the train The air conditioning in the trains was also very welcome

title: Convenient
review: Buy a tap and go card well worth it to use this AC modern mode of transport You can buy oneway tkts

title: Easy, good, airconditioned
review: An easy and cheap public transport Ideal to move around safely and quickly through Bangkok Also excellent for exploring the city

title: i always uses
review: when i reached @ bangkok i go to underground of suvarnambhumi international airport go to airport rail link to Ratchaprarop station here my hotel is near to this station with shopping district Pratunam My hotel name is Golden Inn and price for one room one night is 800 baht for twin room but single bed for 500 baht

title: Convenient
review: Try and stay near a BTS station when visiting Bangkok  makes travelling around so much easier when you don't have to keep bargaining for taxi and tuk tuk fairs

title: Very Easy And Tourist-Friendly
review: Navigating Bangkok from the airport is made much easier and stressfree because of the train connection

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain is a great way to navigate around Bangkok cheaply and I would recommend it to anyone instead of using taxis or tuk tuks  We used it to get to pat pong which was only three stops and so quick and easy to use  The staff are also very helpful if you ask them where you need to get off for your destination

title: Overnight train Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: We were two friends traveling from Bangkok to Chiang Mai on the overnight train in 1st class The accommodation was good and better than sleeping in an upright seat The main difference between 1st and 2nd class is that you have a shower and are able to turn the light off in the 1st class car The bed was very uncomfortable and the "blanket" provided was a large towel I would suggest bringing a blanket

title: Superb way to get around
review: BTS is efficient and clean and best of all a means to avoid the jam altogether An excellent way to get around Bangkok Better if the machine is able to accept noted instead of having to change at the station master Also long queue forms frequently during peak hours

title: Not sure if this is an "attraction" by itself, but is still awesome
review: I wish we had a sky train that was this functional in Portland Cheap as dirt fast reliable comfortable and convenient Everything mass transit should be

title: Quick inexpensive transportation
review: We took the BST to the weekend market  It was fast and convenient  It gave us a nice view of the city  Best of all it's air conditioned

title: City Trip
review: BTS works well buy a daycard and you can travel the whole day for 160 thb Very cheap and very clean

title: Fast and efficient service
review: The airport rail link provides a fast and efficient service into central Bangkok A great alternative to taxi service if you have minimal luggage

title: Week trip to Bangkok Tourists
review: Used train to BK City hotels both arriving and departing BK two train changes required Airport Rail Link and BTS Skytrain are two separate systems and different tickets System easy to navigate with staff on hand to help out Note Express service Airport to Makkasan & Phaya Thai no longer operates but trip is not much longer even stopping all stations

title: Cool and quick
review: This is the only way to get around Bangkok if you are looking for the places to visit  After a heat stroke you can get on sky train and rehab with the air con

title: Fast way to beat the jam
review: Taking the rail link to the airport cuts down on the worry of being stuck in traffic There's also no need to worry about being fleeced by the cabs It's the best way to travel

title: Fast and cheap
review: Goid way of getting to the airport FROM BANGKOK TOWN However unless you are travelling light or on a strict budget when going from SUVARNABHUMI TO TOWN use the Taxi rank From the airport is the rare occasions the drivers WILL use the meters when you say as it is controlled by the airports The fee into Sukhumvit or Pratunam areas is roughly 200thb including tolls and airport fee

title: The best way to go around
review: no traffic jam just try to avoid taking this train in peak hour and the price is not cheap But it connect to most of the tourist places

title: Transport
review: You could not live without bts in bkk and 2018 another 9 station added from bearing onward further to don meaung airport The aircond is cold enough and very clean

title: Fast, but not modern
review: The Sky Train is clean and will get you where you want to go but it's not very modern The payment system is 20 years old  You pay with coins ONLY at machines  They don't accept paper money  There are no change machines so you need to line up at the windows Don't feel you are putting anyone out needing change The lines are long

title: Quick, cheap transportation
review: The MRT is the subway system in Bangkok and is primarily used by the locals  As a subway it doesn't offer pretty views like the BTS Skytrain but it is slightly less expensive and will take you to areas not served by the BTS  Your "ticket" is a little plastic coin  hang onto it as you'll need it to get off at your destination  The stations seem to be unnecessarily large and occasionally difficult to navigate but most signage is in thai and English  Not quite as clean as the BTS but a fast easy way to get from place to place in Bangkok without having to hire a taxi  There are a couple of stations along the routes that allow easy transfer between the MRT and the BTS  the combination of the two particularly in conjunction with the river taxis allows you to get just about anywhere you'd need to go

title: quick clean and cheap
review: quick clean and cheap can get multi trip tickets if staying in BKK for a few days two lines  all very convenient and away from chaos of bangkok streets

title: Cheaper than a Taxi and no traffic jams
review: Airport rail link is easy to navigate you will not get snarled up in any traffic and it's cheap it also links up with the sky train so you can get pretty much any where My travel time from the airport to the lower Sukhumvit area was about the same time a Taxi would take when the roads are clear but only cost me 50 baht a Taxi would cost about 285 baht

title: Train travel
review: Clean Quiet Quick Air Conditioned User friendly People are polite and friendly A must for travelling around Bangkok with the humidity being so high

title: Fast. Cheap. Reliable.
review: Great way to travel round the city  Fast Cheap Reliable Air conditioned   Definitely worth using to avoid the congestion

title: Bangkok Sky Trains
review: Wonderful way to get around a city with terrible traffic  Beats cabs and those miserable tuk tuks with their thieving drivers

title: Airport Link
review: A great mode of transportation clean and afforadabke and convenient too No being caught in traffic jams and ripped off by taxi Drivers from the airport

title: If you haven't been on the BTS you haven't been to Bangkok
review: By far the most reliable and efficient way to get around the city  Chances are if you haven't seen or been on the BTS (sky train) you've been stuck in the old city and you are missing 90% of what Bangkok has to offer Nearly every stop on the BTS has something different to offer and even if you don't have any other plans Id recommend taking this train just to see if something takes your fancy along the way  Its also a great place to get some air con if you're out and about

title: Bangkok Shopping Line
review: BTS is the first mass transit train in Bangkok since 1999 passing main shopping areas like Siam Paragon MBK Center CentralwOrld Emquartier and mores  From luxurious brand hotel until economy brand lodge are located along BTS lines Saphan Taksin Station or Bangkok riverside station is obviously zoning world class five star hotel like Mandarin Oriental Shangri La The Peninsula with free shuttle boat Additional part is interchange to Chao Phraya river boat for river visit to Wat Arun temple and Grand Palace

title: Best way from airport to the city!
review: It's a lot cheaper than using taxi  and no traffic jamming but make sure you check their schedule first because it takes quite some time for each one  But the sound of the door is super loud and scary plus the seat is not so comfy yet it's okay compare to the price )

title: Good experience and cheaper than a hotel.
review: The night train is not bad for the price but isn't the comfiest to sleep on  It's a good choice to travel overnight and save travelling time whilst you are sleeping  Restaurant staff are friendly and a pleasure but the night staff don't appreciate you walking around after a certain time and can be a bit rude Didn't ruin the trip though

title: Convenient & Great coverage
review: Just about any place of interest you would fancy the BTS covers that location Very conveniently located & clean stations Directions & Announcements all are in English as well

title: Better than a taxi
review: If you're staying near a BTS station Use the rail link It's cheaper than a taxi and you don't need to sit in endless traffic for ages

title: Very easy to use
review: Our first time in Bangkok and found the sky train extremely easy to use   Just find the station near where you want to be Find its number on the easy map at the station select the number and put in the coins (there is a change machineoffice if needed)  Tickets are very cheap but remember it's one way only

title: Easy and fast way to get around town
review: The overhead rail system is fast easy and fairly inexpensivestops are announced and stops in all of the popular locales

title: superb

title: Some tips on what to do when you get to the Airport
review: OK so you are through customs immigration and security and you have luggage on a trolley (Free at Suvarnabhumi) airport  Do not wait for the lifts to the lowest floor as they are few and the queues to use them usually long at peak times  Use the travelators and get to the lowest level and follow the signs to the "City Line" "Airport Rail Link" Use the toilets at the airport before boarding as there are non on the train system  You get to a pay kiosk (English spoken) and buy a token (round plastic disc) which you insert in the barrier If however you have LOADS of luggage the train police will allow you through the barrier and you take yet another lift down onto the platform   You should arrive knowing what station you want to disembark from however the end of the line is Phayathai and there you insert your token or again go to the train police SMILE and get let through a barrier again  take the stair or a lift down to an underpass (still above ground level) and walk the 200 metres or so to "PHAYATHAI" station on the BTS   Here you reverse the procedure to enter the BTS network proper but the system for purchasing tickets is different so read the SKYTRAIN section of Trip Advisor  Trains are cheaper than taxis and trains are well airconditioned  Now if you are elderly or infirm this mode of transport is not for you and you younger people with so much baggage that you cannot organise it's transit on your own this is where we recommend you take a taxi  By the way we never see the point of taking the EXPRESS train to the airport as it costs significantly more but is not significantly faster It costs 150 Baht and if you are 'late' for check in then you might want to use it but the access from the airport (basement) is slightly different Note this  Do you research and read several reviews here as if you come unprepared it is horrible to be lost when first in a new destination   Really you should have purchased a train map or downloaded something online as you need to know your station although we expect most of you will be heading to the city centre (Phayathai)  You get a good view of the suburbs as the track is elevated the system very modern fast (say 25 minutes to the centre Look out for the giant TV screen on the side of a building as you near the City Centre and treat this experience as an excursion to be enjoyed  Best Regards  Chris & Anna PS In theory this transport system is wheelchair friendly but we have found on occasion that the lift is out of order and then you would be stuck If this is your category arrange private transport
