review: I've taken this train 2x now to the international airport It was super clean super easy to use and very easy to connect from the BTS station in our area  From Chit Lom station it took about an hour It was well worth it I'd rather be on sitting on this train than sitting in traffic We will be happy to use it again and recommend it highly to friends

title: Quick trip to city centre
review: This is the fastest cheapest and most convenient way to get downtown from Suvarnabumi airport if you don‚Äôt have too many suitcases The access is easy and the ticket can be bought at regular counters or vending machine making the process quick The last station is at a BTS station in the centre of town from where you can easily reach anywhere downtown

title: Fast and simple
review: Easy to reach every corner in BKK either you buy a single way ticket or a passcard you can top up with cash

title: Clean, efficient, frequent
review: Well worth finding accommodation near a BTS station as it avoids the frantic Bangkok traffic and takes you to a wide variety of destinations at moderate cost

title: Very Busy Efficient  used by commuters
review: The link is good value and quite quick and good  It is used by commuters a lot and it will be VERY busy  Try to get on early and get a seat  I do prefer it to a taxi though  it is cool and air conditioned out of the traffic

title: Quick, clean and cheap
review: Cheap and quick way to travel Just make sure you don't listen to touts outside telling you where you're going is shut It's not They just want you to go somewhere else in their taxituck tuk

title: Best way to travel from Airport into the city.
review: Comfortable fast clean cheap   Great value and you save a lot of time   Lovely view over Bangkok too both day and night time

title: Good mode of public transportation; inexpensive, safe and relatively easy
review: I use the sky train when in Bangkok  It is a reliable safe way to travel around the city especially when combined with the MRT ( subway)  and the River Ferries It an especially nice mode of transportation during high traffic times on the roadways If you plan on using public transportation while in Bangkok it would be prudent to book your accommodations accordingly ) As with any other big city it can get crowed on these modes of transportation with standing ( squishing) room only at times  stay alert and be mindful of your personal property ( purse wallet etc ) and enjoy the ride

title: Great way to get around
review: With Bangkok traffic this is the way to get around especially from the river area all the way up Sukhumvit Road Try and avoid the Peak times as last night I got on at Saladaeng to go to Nana and I had to change trains at Siam Despite it being a Holiday the 6pm peak was worse than usual so I just got on at Siam but had to almost fight my way through the crowd to get off at Nana in time Much faster than Taxi and for 31 baht a bargain for my journey but late night Taxi is the best bet

title: nice way to get around from Nana to malls and back
review: It was  cheap and fast and easy and a lot better than taking a taxi or tuk tuk It is the best way to get around Downtown Bangkok and avoid all the street traffic and bad air quality

title: Easy transportation
review: The BTS makes travel around Bangkok simple Works on the same end of line principle as systems all over the world A day travel ticket in inexpensive and easy to use Although not all areas are covered the main attractions are made a whole lot closer by cross reference of the BTS map and one of the tourist maps readily available A transfer from the airport on the "Airport rail link" and join the BTS at Phaya Thai is a seamless inexpensive and traffic free way to get into this busy city Although very crowded at peak times AM and PM the AC makes it a great way to travel

title: I wish we had this system back home
review: The train system is integrated into public transport making it much easier to travel back and fourth from the airport üëçüëå

title: Very convenient
review: A must in Bangkok if you want to miss the traffic everyone is using the skytrain and a bonus plus it has air con Very convenient but not fully completed yet but when it‚Äôs done it will be boss

title: Skytrain to cut downtime !
review: It's my favourite means of transportation in Bangkok Traffic in the city is totally awful and that's the best way to avoid it and arrive on time  if you wish to respect an appointment  Trains come in a few minutes and the Skytrain transportation network covers the major spot in the city It's cheap and easy to use for foreigners too Definitely much better than taxi My suggestion  adjust the air conditioning temperature please  it's freezing cold

title: BTS skytrain
review: Stations are located in quite convenient locations But some of the stations only have stairs to access the platform from street level If you want to use escalator or elevator you have to walk certain distance to access it There might be some inconvenient for old people For the rush hours train is very crowded People with young children might found some inconvenient Also that that the Cashcard used for BTS cannot be use for MRT MRT need different type of cashcard to ride

title: Clean & Efficient
review: Skytrain is a fantastic way to get around Bangkok It's fast and easy plus the staff at the station is able to help if you need it All stops are announced in Thai and English and maps are very easy to follow Both the trains and the stations are extremely clean and the trains are also nicely air conditioned

title: Very good transport system
review: A good transport in the heart of Bangkok city Fully automatic and well decorated air conditioned coach Easy and fast transport medium in Bangkok  We had traveled 5 times and enjoyed a good and pleasent journey Note  Heavy rush is there during busy hour

title: Delighted Experiences
review: Trip to Maeklong Railway market was pleasant as we took the train from a less crowded station  We got to see the Salt Farm up close and Tom our tour guide warmly offered his help to take a picture for our family  At the railway market  this is the place where coconut only cost 15 baht compared to Bangkok city of 80 to 100 baht  Floating market gave us a different experience somehow it‚Äôs commercialized  Food were charged at premium price and you can try getting a lower price  A bowl of noodles cost 50 to 80 baht   Things such as souvenirs were priced high too  Better deal at pratumum market

title: comfortable ride for my travel
review: i stayed in Bangkok for 3 days and this helped me a lot  took 15time pass 450 thb and it was more than enough for 3 days on weekend there are lots of people linedup to get the ticket so that was worth it    FYI security staff check your bag when you get in

title: The most convenient way to move
review: Buy a ticket or better get a card (70 bahts) to avoid the long queue and enjoy bkk  If you do not like air conditioning stay between 2 wagons

title: First Rate Metro
review: I use the blue line quite often and am quite impressed with the cleanliness punctuality courtesy and helpfulness of station staff facilities at each station and overall value Ticket machines are plentiful and very user friendly Trains are properly temperature controlled as are stations Signage is excellent and several stations have modern minimalls with coffee shops convenience stores banking facilities takeaway restaurants etc Even when crowded it is a pleasure to ride the MRT (I‚Äôm originally from New York and this transport system puts the NYC Subway system to shame)

title: Death Railway
review: Our ride on the ThaiBurma Railway was interesting and I will give it four stars for its history Be sure to include the museum to make it a more enriching experience I am glad I visited and my family enjoyed our short ride on the historic rail

title: A convenienvence for all
review: the airport express is very convenient  escaping traffic  from central Bangkok to Swarnabhumi airport at a very less price  it also saves a lot of time

title: It's a train!
review: I cannot believe this is the number one 'attraction' in Bangkok It's a public mass transportation system that does what it needs to efficiently  It's like saying that the Tube in London or Metro in NYC are an attraction Get over it See something else and use this if you need to

title: Rail and Boat Market
review: Not really sure what we were expecting but after doing the tour realized this is something you can do on your own and I would have just caught a cab out to the floating market  Didn‚Äôt care much for the railway  You can also just catch a cab out to the railway market too  Our tour guide Jockey was really nice but there wasn‚Äôt really much to explain

title: Functional
review: Best to always have change (coins) and be prepared to climb stairs Also it might be hot outside but AC temperatures internally in the train carriages can be subzero

title: Alternative way to travel around BKK
review: Fast and cheap way to travel around BKK with less hustle & bustle The line for buying token sometimes can be long The station can be crowded during morning & evening rush hoursMulti language guide signs are clear to tourists Stations are well kept and cleanFirst time I took it was some 20years ago and quite some improvements and more new lines and new stations since then

title: Better than a taxi
review: I stayed near the Nana BTS station so the airport link provided a cheap and relatively quick method of transporting to and from the airport

title: Save time and money from Airport to Downtown.
review: Airport Rail Link is a modern over ground railway to take you closer to your destination if it is a hotel in the downtown area It only costs a $12 and is very fast albeit it has a few stops (46) before arriving at a junction so you can change trains to get closer to your hotel Makasaan is the name of the station where I always changed train for the final mile to my hotel (Red Planet)

title: Best for travelling
review: Its just too good if you want to travel without traffic on road You can reach everywhere almost by BTS Thailand is famous for this rail to avoid traffic jam It is a good way to get around Bangkok Compare to taxi it is much safer  A lot of tourist attractions can reach easily using sky train They have the railway map too so grab that and you could move around easily Avoid rush hour like morning or evening But even if its rush you always get a space for urself so dont worry They are just the best means to travel here and there

title: Cheap and easy way to travel around Bangkok
review: Use to use the Tuk Tuks and taxis to get around Bangkok but started usint the BTS and its way cheaper 40 baht to the weekend market 30 baht to MBK and nSiam discovery You can hop on and get off next stop for only 16 bahtt

title: Definitely an experience
review: It's not as crazy as the New York Subway but not as chill as the Seattle Light Rail Very busy fun for people watching Easy ticket purchase boarding getting off but make sure to know the name of your stop in Thai  Oh and we got paparazzied everywhere Apparently we're famous in Thailand

title: Great tour company but disappointing floating market
review: The service provided by the tour company was great and the busvan drive was comfortable That deserves 5 stars The guide was very pleasant but probably could have spoken for less time on the bus on the way there He was great in ensuring our utmost safety The Train market was fun although when arriving into the train station one is effectively taking a video of hundreds of tourists taking videos of the train and you I was really disappointed with the floating market as it was 100% geared towarda tourists and was just a whole lot of canoesboats selling Singha beer and souveniers No authentic market experience at all There has to be better floating markets than this Once again it's not fair for me to penalise the tour company when they did an excellent job

title: Can't go wrong
review: Possibly the world's best and efficient transit from airport to city at around 45 baht and you are above all the traffic

title: Great Tour
review: Great tour Sarah was a wonderful tour guide )  we had the best time Be sure to bring cash for the markets as well as sunscreen and water

title: 100% better than london tube ;-)
review: Very modern lovely ac and goes pretty much everywhere for cheap Cant beat it

title: Easy, convient, cheap and air conditioned
review: So easy to navigate throughout Bangkok taking the Skytrain  Get a 30 day adult pass add on 15 to 25 rides it's really cheap about $80 a ride  then all you do is touch the card on the kiosk pad and zip through  Quick and efficient  I would have given it a 5 star but the system does not go to Chinatown area yet they are in the process of building it should be done in 2015 but the BTS goes everywhere else

title: Simple, easy and cheap if you're traveling light
review: This train which has express and local variants is an easy way to get into Bangkok from the airport and is a great idea especially during peak traffic times We took the local for 45THB each which is a great value compared with taxis It runs every 15 minutes or so But there's nowhere to store luggage and the stations in the city have lots of steps and no one (at least no one legitimate) to help with luggage We were fine as we had backpacks but this is not a good mode of transportation for those with 2 large bags per person  My understanding is that the express trains have luggage areas on board But at 150THB per person I'm not sure I would prefer the express over a taxi unless I were staying right next to Makkasan or Phaya Thai

title: cheap and safe travel
review: The skytrain is the best option to travel in Bangkok Because taxis won't take you with the "Taximeter" and Tuktuks often are a little expensive for tourists

title: Soaking into a painful history
review: We a family of three had a great day out to Kanchanaburi death railway hellfire ridge and Bridge over the river kwai on on 19th December It was never a dull day as our guide Mr Ken kept us entertaining with his in depth knowledge about the world war to and the local geography The train ride was fantastic A comfortable lunch at the bank of river Kwai was relaxing At the end of the day we returned rejuvenated

title: Clean and nice rail link
review: It is really a nice and clean rail link Many people use it to reach airport but unfortunately it is only to reach suvarnabhumi airport not don mueang airport

title: Bangkok Train is best travel option
review: Since most cab drivers dont speak English and the same goes for bus drivers the train is best option for tourists Easy to follow map makes it easy to purchase tickets Very clean and the AC is always working In addition to the map there is CC TV that airs commercials and the next stop is always scrolling across the bottom of the screen in both Thai and English Language is not a problem when riding the skytrain

title: convenient
review: Rode to Business Meetings  Much more  convenient than cab  Head to some of the more popular malls and areas in Bangkok

title: brings is fast to the center
review: easy to use not expensive Cuts the traffic jams Air conditioned Not connected with other transportation options like the metro lines

title: A perfect tour for British Commonwealth Tourists with an interest in the WWII history of the Death Railway
review: A fabulous day excursion which we would recommend to anyone particularly to anyone with interest in the Second World War in the Far East  Our Driver and Guide were excellent knowledgeable and helpful and importantly always ready with cold water or a cooling towel when returning to the minibus   To travel some of the track laid by the allied servicemen and civilians was very moving and gave spectacular views of the river and an insight into the hardships suffered during its build The stop at the CWGC cemetery in Kanchanburi made one realise that the many who died on the railway were real people with families and regional contacts from all the many services and regionally based regiments who fought in World War Two  The tour also gave us the opportunity to get out of the Bangkok bright lights and get a feel for the Thai countryside and its people We would recommend though one significant change to the itinerary While the trip to the JEATH Museum was interesting (a reconstruction of an accommodation hut with many photos) it really should be replaced by a visit to theThailandBurma Railway Centre more commonly known as the 'Death Railway Museum and Research Centre' adjacent to the Commonwealth War Graves Cemetery in Kanchanburi which was part of the tour  This is a very well presented and informative museum with many more times the information and artefacts than the JEATH  We were lucky in that we were the only two on the trip and thus were allowed to briefly visit this Museum (at our own small expense) and contact with the curator who could tell us more of the personal history of my wife's father who worked on the railway absolutely made our entire holiday to Bangkok

title: A speedy way to get from the airport to the city
review: As the traffic in BKK can often be very busy the Airport Rail Link is probably your best bet to get to and from the international airport  it takes around 45 mins from the city and costs only 45 Baht The trains are also very frequent  I just missed one and only had to wait around 10 to 15 mins for the next one to depart

title: One of the nicest ways to get around the city! Aircon is especially nice!
review: Though the destinations are limited (for now  they're expanding) this is the best way to get from one end of the city to the other especially during rush hour going during quieter hours is good too as you can get some nice views from up above on the skytrain line

title: A smooth ride
review: Air condition cars that can get crowded but still comfortably and fast and convenient a train arrives just about every 5 minutes to what ever part of Bangkok they service that you would like to go

title: Brilliant!
review: Would thoroughly recommend using the airport link Cheap fast and convenient  If your hotel is near where it stops then great but if not just take a metered taxi it's not that far from the main shopping centre

title: Convenient and Inexpensive
review: The BTS provides a wonderful way to negotiate your way around Bangkok in airconditioned comfort  The trains operate frequently and are clean  Fares are very inexpensive  Tickets are purchased from ticket machines which are great examples of clarity of use  In case you need change for the ticket machine you obtain it from one of the booths which are available on all stations  You can now go all the way to the International Airport by Skytrain Using the Skytrain avoids the hassle of gridlocked roads  The only negative I can think of is that there are some stations that require passengers to climb a number of stairs to reach the platforms  Not good for the elderly or disabled This excellent means of transport is highly recommended

title: Efficient, easy and clean transportation.
review: Buy a day pass it‚Äôs inexpensive and will take you to several places Malls and Chatuchak weekend market

title: Greatly organized trip
review: Thank you Tee for an unforgettable trip Your funny stories and tips were the BEST  Experienced amazing views and tasted the best food

title: Quick
review: Fastest way to get around in Bangkok Even though taxi is cheap the train is much better (and cooler)

title: Decent rail
review: What else can I say the rail is descent it's easy to get info from the ticket office or buy directly from the machine It's important to know your get off stop and tell ticket agent where it is as the prices differ depending on your stop

title: Best Transportation option in Bangkok
review: A great way to get around Bangkok in air conditioned comfort  Gets you close to lots of attractions

title: Very convenient
review: Getting around in Bangkok in a car is such a pain especially during peak hours MRT definitely saves a lot of time and is cheap The trains are very clean and it‚Äôs quite quick to get to places Would definitely recommend

title: Amazing and quick travel
review: A very nice quick and easy transport means Safe and pleasurable moments while moving Cosy as well as offering nice views a travel by the rail in Bangkok is a trendy way to get around

title: Very convenient
review: My hotel advised how to reach hotel from Airport and highly recommended travel by Airport link express Convenient and reasonable45 Bhat for one way full journey Only problem is while returning specially during afternoons and evening when local commuters use service in great nos Suggest during peak hours one coach is reserved for Airport travellers with luggagewill be of great help

title: Convenient mode of transport
review: It was a breeze taking the airport link to Ratchaprarop station in less than 30 mins It costs 40 baht per person I took the train at around 9am and the train was crowded The only inconvenient thing is that you need to move your luggage through the crowd during peak hrs Walking from Ratchaprarop station to Amari Watergate Hotel was less than 15mins But it can be challenging if there are a lot of people around the rows of shops that you need to drag your luggage through For bagpackers it will not be too difficult to walk through the crowd

title: Chiang Mai to Hualamphong (Bangkok)
review: Always wanted to do this overnight trip and after three abortive attempts managed it in October 2017 Firstly getting tickets is a cinch by booking ahead and collecting them from the hotel opposite the station When you board the train don't be taken in by the 'hustler' who 'gives' you a cold drink and presents you with a menu for dinner This is not an official and you will be (over)charged for the 'free' drink and meal the following morning also your (clingfilmed) meal will be served on a tray in your cabin and not in the dining car Resist all efforts to buy from the onboard hustler and make yourselves known directly with the dining car staff As it's an overnight journey there isn't a lot to see but is still a experience  which I would recommend but with a cautionary note

title: Very fast and cheap
review: It was a very comfortable ride to the airport  Take the nonexpress train because it is so much cheaper than the express train  It is very convenient because you avoid the monstrous traffic

title: The way to go!
review: An excellent way to get around the city as well as see the sights from above ground  Air conditioned and very quiet and organized  Crowded yes but it is Bangkok Shop in the metro stops for excellent designer sample clothing and goods

title: Logical and Easy
review: Well marked and easy to use Could use some help with purchasing tickets at certain stations Have lots of change in your pocket as most ticket machines do not accept bills or cards

title: fast and save money
review: If you are 1 or 2 traveller then its a good way to come to city center fast and save money and then take taxi

title: The best way around Bangkok
review: Definitely not a taxi but MRT and BTS are the best way to around the city the maps are very easy to understand nevertheless if you did not have time to check in advance how this works you just need to have the address and the cashiers will help you with the nearest station to your destination (in YouTube there are plenty of great videos about how these great transportation works) It is a very nice way to start visiting Bangkok because it is very easy to take it from the airport Fully recommended

title: I love MRT as always!
review: Everywhere I go I love to use public transportation But here in Bangkok they didnt have a tourist pass like Singapore and Hongkong do So sad as we dont have a special card during the time there

title: Definitely worth it
review: you can take a taxi into town or you can hop on the airport rail  absolutely one of the better ways to travel  The only challenge is changing trains midway through to catch the BTS  Worth the ride

title: Best transport system
review: BTS  is the best transport system in Bangkok and is truly very connected to almost all of the famous tourist attractions here

title: Fun market day
review: The person who ran the tour (Bean) was amazing Very helpful Very funny Took the time to learn everyone‚Äôs names Would highly recommend

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: Getting around in taxis is becoming a hassle the traffic is horrendous and many taxi drivers won't use their meters The Sky Train is fantastic  easy to maneuver not horribly expensive clean cold

title: Very fast and reliable
review: Fast and reliable train from airport to city Safe and cheap Best way to get to and from the airport 30 mins beats all the traffic a car transfer usually takes an hour

title: Too hot and not well thought through.
review: It is too hot to stand on a non air conditioned station with your luggage Then struggle with a taxi that tries to go without the meter  Not well thought by those who developed this

title: Comfortable ride into the city!
review: This is the best and cheapest way to get to the city from the BKK Airport Ride is quiet and comfortable though the line is always crowded and the frequency of trains are around once every 10 minutes

title: Gets you around above the chaos
review: The Skytrain gives you good views from an elevated position around Bangkok and is the quickest way to get from A to B so long as your destination is on one of the lines Watch out for rush hours as they get crowded but generally spacious and comfortable

title: A different way to spend the night.
review: Having  travelled to Chiang Mai by air we decided to return to Bangkok by the night train  What a contrast This was Thailand Second class with a sleeper for two Cost was 1642 bht for two lower bunks Far cheeper than a hotel We had booked two top bunks but changed them after reading the reviews No window with the top bunk and it's a little short of headroom  The Rolling stock like the line has seen better days but it all works ( I think) You can walk across or on the track to take photos no one worries It's very hard to describe the train other than long sedate and old We set off at 1730 expecting to arrive at 0830 (thats inThai time) but they rolled up in Bangkok at 0835 so fair play after 14 12 hrs Tea coffee food and beer is available on the train from locals who make a living catering for travellers  Beds are Made up from 2000 onwards and are surprisingly comfortable  You get clean sheets a blanket and a curtain Air con was just about the right temperature but we had been warned that it could be a little cold and to take a light coat Plenty of room for your bags right next to the seatsbeds  A great experience and a chance to mix not only with fellow travellers but the locals as well A must do if you have the time

title: Well Worth a visit.
review: Fantastic Guide and the trip certainly opens your eyes The train coming through the market was something not be missed The floating market was good although the water is very dirty

title: Convenient but preferred taxi or tut tut
review: The diversity of Bangkok from shopping to Tours to Nightlife which combined with the spicy Thai food made it a very enjoyable 7 day holiday in Bangkok and Pattaya

title: Best way to get around!
review: The sky train is great as it‚Äôs so efficient and clean The trains run every few minutes and all the main tourist hot spots are on the BTS lines (such as National Stadium station for MBK Nana & Asok for Sukhumvidt Saphan Taksin for the river taxi)

title: Quick access
review: A quick access to the airport from City At times there is a huge traffic blockage in the city and Airport link help to get passengers on time

title: Airport rail link
review: best way to move from the airport to bangkok and it costs even less than taxi or bus considering also that your avoid the huge traffic of bangkok

title: future
review: BTS is the fastest way of transport in such a big city like Bangkok is You must try this it feels like the future is here

title: Nice Cheap Transportation
review: Clean ride  Different classes of train cars  First class has freezing air conditioner  3rd class open the windows no air and it smells  That said you can ride this in all directions

title: Knocks spots of the London Underground!
review: Clean airconditioned cheap well organised and safe Just about everything the London tube system isn't  I use this service every time I visit Bangkok and am always impressed  The most welcome difference is that there is no pushing and shoving to get on All very orderly and calm but this is more to do with the people than the BTS

title: Easy and cheap way into Bangkok
review: Used the train to connect into the Metro from Lat Krabang where we were staying before we flew home We changed at Makkasan and walked to Pechaburi and onwards to Sanam Chai which is the closest station to The Royal Palace The journey took about 45 mins so much quicker than taking a taxi which we did on our last visit also a lot cheaper Round trip cost 273 Bhat trains were nice and coo unlikeothertrain systems like Dubai where you need a coat it‚Äôs so cold ü•∂

title: Good Mobility
review: Very nice way to get around Bangkok They are expanding it everytime I go to BangkokUltra modern as it is only a few years old It takes you to all the New shopping malls like Siam Paragon MBK and a lot of stations have shopping malls connected to them Inexpensive way to sightsee and mingle with the locals Buy a metro card so you don't have to buy a ticket every time you want to travel sometimes the lines are really long to buy a ticket

title: Connects to BTS
review: We used this mode of transport to get access to the BTS Sky train It was really easy quick and efficient The train took us straight to one of the BTS Sky train stations from which we could easily get to our hotel

title: Won't take you directly to your hotel, but will probably get you there faster.
review: Comment to the Thai government if you want to make Thailand a more friendly place stop the apparent requirement that every taxi and tuk tuk driver be a scam artist or just a plain thief   Do you get the idea that I don't like dealing with taxi drivers in Bangkok  It's true  If you find a good one (and they do exist or so I hear) get their card and call them directly for service  Until then do not even think about leaving the Suvarnabhumi Airport by taxi  Head down to the basement pop some coins into the machine and get your ticket to the city center and lose the headaches (at least for a little bit)  Since the train does get used by normal commuters as well it will tend to get more and more crowded as you approach the last stop but I had no problems getting off and changing to the BTS even though I was wheeling a couple of unwieldy bags  45 baht no haggling no having taxi drivers stop by a suit store so they can get 5 liters of free gas etc Loved it and the smooth ride

title: Fast clean and easy to navigate
review: So glad I took the BTS while visiting Bangkok Its cheap easy to use super fast and AIR CONDITIONED IF you can work out how to use the ticket machines they have info offices where the staff speak fluent English

title: Great
review: Great option for getting into the heart of the city I have been many times and always got a cab this time I tried the train how easy this is you buy a token at the counter the most expensive is 45 Bart and that's it and if you need to change trains they announce it in English on the train at each stop

title: Always on Time
review: BTS is an easy way to get around the Sukhumvit area It's always on time and helps avoid the city traffic The lines and stops are easy to find all the stops are written in English along with Thai

title: Great for singles and couples.
review: Cheap and fast a great addition to public transport ) Airport Rail Link are comprised of 2 lines nonstop Express services and City Train services Both lines operate from 0600 am ‚Äì midnight

title: The MRT is Bangkok's underground rail service
review: With only one line that was completed around 2004 the MRT is clean reasonably quiet and cheap It is of course used heavily during the rush hour I believe weekly or monthly tickets can be purchased which would help avoiding the queues The trains are about 5 minutes apart and everyone queues to get on There is no real pushing or shoving During off peak times it is a joy to use

title: BTS - fast, efficient and cheap
review: After multiple visits to Bangkok I finally decided it was time to try the BTS It's easy to use very efficient and so much  cheaper than taxi or tuk tuk I can't believe I haven't used it sooner Caught it to Chatuchak market today and was back at my hotel within 30 minutes of leaving the market Suggest you have small change on you most trips range from 20  45bht but failing that change is available at the station information window

title: Much better then taxi service
review: Travel from airport to Makkasan station is fairly hassle free and less costly compared to regular taxi service  This station has escalators and elevators to lower levels for local taxi service in air conditioned environment without having to hike over to the Petchaburi MRT station to make a connection  Returning this way is a bit of a problem because either the taxi is trying for a fare to the airport or because they don't knowbelieve about the access method  Pretty good chance to get a seat from the airport but a tossup about getting a seat to the airport  System did have a power malfunction leading to a stalled train to the airport for about an hour which became a matter of management controversy in midMarch with improvements to follow

title: Slow but convenient - if you need to go somewhere close to the tracks
review: No troubles with the Skytrain It takes you where you want to go and it is reliable It is slow and crowded though When you go you always feel that it could  or should  have travelled twice as fast Don't expect to get a seat unless it is in the middle of the day  Lots and lots of areas in Bangkok is not covered but if you're going somewhere close to the tracks it is a convinient and cheap option

title: Easy to travel and not be lost in the crowded city
review: The easiest way to move in this city without been lost Staff in the counters speak english and can provide help to choose the kind of ticket that best fits you (simple daily weekly)

title: Efficient, quite cheap ... and cool!
review: Very good way to get round Bangkok (certainly compared with any form of road transport) Easy to use Fast frequent service Can get a bit crowded at peak times but generally OK Good links with airport line and subway system and network expanding all the time

title: A great way to travel in Bangkok
review: This is a very efficient and cheap way of getting around the city The train is clean and there are always attendants at the station to direct you in the right direction

title: Efficient
review: This efficient service Its fast to Bangkok and cheap price Inside train is not too busy and can sit down

title: Train cheaper than the Taxi
review: When you arrivethe immigration is very busythe first thing on your mind is get out to wherever you are heading toogetting a taxi is costly to the citywhere as you just have to take a lift down to the train which is very cheap and quick

title: Great way to get around for tourist pursuits!
review: We discovered the BTS sky train when we were trying to go to the Chatuchak weekend market on the Saturday we arrived in Bangkok I happened to be staying right off sukumvit road at the Amari boulevard hotel and was able to walk just about 3 blocks to find the entrance to the train  The far is very cheap and the stations are clean I do not believe that all of the stations are accommodating to those with disabilities as there are a ton of stairs to deal with  The train line we rode went straight out to mo chit where the market is and on the way back we noticed that stops were made at major shopping malls eateries and movie theaters   Air conditioning and clear announcements really make this train a great way to get around  The only down side is that the system is not sprawling and operates in a very narrow section of the city I live in NYC so I am used to a comprehensive train system but this was good for what we needed  Additionally metered taxis are so cheap so if you need to go somewhere not located off the sky train just hail a cab and make sure they use the meter don't negotiate a flat rate I promise the meter will be cheaper For example a 28kilometer ride to the airport on the meter was only 230 baht  Have fun

title: Cool experience
review: Im not usually an fan of trains and undergrounds however this was an interesting experience  If you like skyline views and people watching then this is worth doing  The trains were frequent and the platforms were clean

title: Death Railway
review: As part of a large tour group we were allocated numbers which were our train seats prior to the arrival of the train  Considering the numbers of tourists on the train platform it was necessary to save us from a free for all  The train is comfortable and has fans in the ceiling however it is still very hot  Sellers come around selling drinks and souvenirs during the trip  A camera is a must on leaving the station the train goes over the "bridge" and gathers speed through the open countryside  We were on the train for approximately an hour and arrived at a station where there was an opportunity to walk along the railway and across bridges to takes photos the train continued after we got off  There are restaraunts at the stop including a market to buy clothing etc  The realisation of how the track was constructed does not hit until you visit the museum and the cemetary where the hardship and conditions are proven in photographs and exhibits  A very memorable trip

title: BTS - Great way to travel
review: BTS is the best way to get around the city  An all day pass will get you on all of the rail lines for the entire day  Lets you pass up the gridlock on the streets

title: easy

title: Easy way to get to the city from the airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is a wonderful way to transit from the new airport to the city There's a stop train and an express train I've been to BKK several times and never found the express train running Not sure what the schedule is But the stop train doesn't take too long Train connects to other systems like BTS conveniently

title: Handy if slightly meandering
review: Couldn't work out how to get thr bus to the airport so have BTSMRT a go Was very easy if not exactly direct Was not in a hurry and love trains so no big deal BTS asok then 1 stop on MRT (underground) and then easyish walk to airport link About 25 minutes and you are right there delivered almost to arrivals Would do this on my own With family will stick to taxi Cost only about 37 baht for rail link which is great

title: Too much travel time, floating market a disaster
review: It takes 15 hours to reach the first destination in good traffic  The return trip had traffic so start to finish it lasted 65 hours  This seems to be pretty typical  The drive was mostly on an older and uninteresting expressway   It‚Äôs a huge investment in travel time for what you get in actual tourism    The train ride and market visit was the better of the two experiences but the tour only gave us 10 minutes at the market before hustling us back to the bus  The organization at the market was poor so people got lost and the guide spent her time chasing after people  Totally unnecessary stress    The floating market is completely commercialized inauthentic and a waste of time  It‚Äôs filled with souvenir sellers and noisysmelly motorboats  Really an unpleasant experience  Our guide (Tum) spoke in heavily Thaiaccented English and was not particularly interesting  The minibus was okay  We made the best of it but I‚Äôm honestly shocked to see such a high rating for this tour

title: Life saver
review: If you come to Bangkok for business or pleasure this one of the best means of transport anywhere you want go the the trains arrived every 5 minutes it can be very crowded the pick hours still the prefer method of transport if you want avoid the the crowded Bangkokthe price very reasonable compared to the taxi most of Bangkok hotel very close to BTS to be honest it is a life saver

title: Efficient way to travel the city
review: After you have been in Bangkok a day you understand the only way to get any place is the Skytrain  Traffic is awful  NY City looks like a Sunday drive compared to Bangkok's traffic  The Skytrain is extremely easy to use  We had passes that you just placed on top of a scanner and off you went  The trains are well marked and onboard they have very good "maps" of where the train has been and where it is going  There is an electronic timeline above the doors showing you where the next stop will be  The PA system also announces the stops both in Thai and English  There are also video monitors that play advertisements and scroll the next stop again in Thai and English  It is the easiest mode of transportation in the citycab drivers don't speak English  After your first ride you will be an expert  We used the Skytrain to go most places and then walked  It is extremely safe  We used it late one night and we were fine  As I woman I never felt unsafe and I rode the train by myself many times   The only downfall is that it only goes to limited places and basically goes in one direction  Hopefully they will add lines so you can reach more places in the future  Keep in mind this is not an attraction it is only a way to get around a very busy city  It is their version of a local train system it is similar to the L in Chicago

title: Just do it
review: An easy and cheap way to get around The sky train is very simple to use  Information is  in English and staff very helpful Single use tickets  go to window tell them in English where you want to go  they tell you how much and give you appropriate coins to feed into ticketing machine easy as that There are staff on platforms to help  Lines and stations listed on back of ticket So much faster than taking a taxi Gets you everywhere and in the end that is was our preferred method

title: Awful experience!
review: Awful experience We arrived at the airport got the tickets and were ready to board the train and we waited and waited and waited some more No information whatsoever we assumed that maybe the train runs on 12 hr basis and we just missed one However at some point while the train platform got crowded there was an announcement in Thai that the train is not coming and we can go and get our money back (a friendly person translated the msg for us) This was Monday at 9 am Being that only two people was working on returns we did not wait in the long line to get our money back and just went to get taxi Bangkok's public transportation is the worst in all the countries that I have visited

title: Amazing. Please read
review: Oh my god so many moaners online about this train We braced ourselves for the worst night ever and couldn‚Äôt believe our eyes when we actually got on So take the number 9 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai It‚Äôs the newest carriage My review only applies to this number train We used 2nd class AC Firstly everyone online says this is Baltic cold and we took jeans and hoodies and thick socks In reality it was 33 degrees outside and 22 inside the cabin so I slept in my boxers Not cold at all only in the dining carriage By the way the food in the dining carriage is great again online people said it was diabolical Next  the internet will tell you it‚Äôs bumpy and noise it‚Äôs not The bathroom we read had cockroaches and was filthy in reality it was spotlessly clean The only complaint we have about this train is the lights are bright and they don‚Äôt turn them off So you need an eye mask   For context we are a 28 year old couple ‚Äúflashpacking‚Äù in mid range guesthouses at 600 baht a night We loved this train and found it really pleasant You‚Äôd have to be an absolute special snowflake to pick fault with this train It was borderline luxury

title: Annoying way to purchase tokens.

title: Try it!
review: Finally decided to try the rail link after years of taking a taxi from Suvarnabhumi Airport and I‚Äôm glad I did Certainly different and you wouldn‚Äôt want to be carrying too much luggage I had to make one change (at the last stop in the airport link) to get to Nana BTS close to my hotel It was cheap at around 80 baht compared to around 500 baht for a taxi It also ended up quicker though probably not by a whole lot   I suppose it‚Äôs up to the individual a taxi will certainly be more convenient picking you up and dropping you off at your hotel door But the rail link is certainly worth considering It‚Äôs cheap and quick but it is crowded and you‚Äôll have to carry your luggage from the closest BTS station to your hotel
