title: Makes life easy
review: Don't remember anything negative it was all good Easiest thing to do is buy a ticket from the staff at the booth rather than try to battle the machines Info on the trains is in Thai and English the service is great

title: Very efficient way to get around Bangkok
review: Nice system  takes you almost everywhere in Bangkok and does connect with the MRT at several places However can get crowded even during non peak hours with huge number of tourists in some sections and is a bit overpriced compared to better public transport systems in other big cities of the world

title: Floating market visit and Rom Hub market
review: Sara was a fabulous guide She was informative and extremely helpful especially when it comes to getting into local transportation of train and boats Great trip

title: Great, clean and safe public transport system
review: I used BTS getting around Bangkok and found it very convenient safe and clean Easy to understand and if one get stuck people are very helpful getting you into the right direction  With BTS you beat the Bkk traffic and get a great experience too

title: The quickest way to go!
review: The Airport to Bkk rail link is by far the safest  and quickest way into town  it is true you may not always get a seat but let's face it you've been sitting down for some 6 or 7 hours at least so 30 minutes on your plates isdisd not going to kill you )  the trains are clean and fast and here's the best bit CHEAP  Less than a pound  all the way  No rip off taxi drivers or the airport sercharge  to pay

title: Crowded but cheap and convenient.
review: Get day passes to save time Don't miss the Siam station and the shopping malls near it

title: Nice as always
review: My 15th trip to BKK and how come a trip complete with BTS  very punctual agile reliable services Though many stations you have to climb at least 3 sets of stairs to reach platform which is tiresome I have heard that they are installing escalators elevators but didn't find any new one in last few years  I could find extensions of Sukhumvit line It was up to Onnut in 2011 which is up to Kheha now (22 Km new track)  A must for all BKK travellers

title: Cheap to get into BKK
review: Great to get into Bangkoks and the BTS if going to Sukhumvit you need to get a taxi but a lot cheaper than from the airport

title: Faster and cheaper than a taxi
review: Take the train from the airport and get on the BTS from there If your hotel is in Sukhumvit it souns like a detourbut during rush hour it will be much faster

title: Fun day exploring, great guide!
review: Interesting day exploring two unique markets Sara our guide was fantastic  super knowledgeable and lots of fun Definitely recommend this tour

title: good value
review: pros  Avoids traffic jams and having to deal with sometimes not so honest taxi drivers con Did not extend out to the Old City where we stayed or to several other tourist sites

title: BTS Bangkok
review: It is fasteasy to move on from 1 to the other station and reach your destination or change lines If you stay in Bangkok better to buy the card and top up it It is called rabbit card Avoid rush hours It is impossible to get on The AC is on all the time and very cold Bring a scarf with you to put on once you get on

title: Advanced for a developing country
review: More than what I expected for a developing nation It was fast reliable and comfortable The trains are very well maintained too

title: Great service!
review: Easy to use English widely available Tickets are cheap A good way to get around the city  Busiest times seem to be around 630 pm other than that very pleasant to use

title: Easy and cheap
review: The BTS is I believe one of the best public transport systems in the world it's a credit to the Thai people Easy cheap safe even at night and very clean  Get on go anywhere  There are stations close to everything and you can go to the airport on it for next to nothing  You really cannot get lost but if you have any problem there is always help close at hand  It's a great day out exploring Bangkok by the BTS skytrain   Hinttourists say skytrain but the locals say BTS so if asking a local better to say BTS even if their English is limited to none BTS will get you pointed in the right direction

title: Unique experience
review: This experience was unlike anything we've ever done before  It was an hour and a half ride by mini bus to get to the railway  Then after 6 stops we got off at the railway market  Didn't have much time for shopping before getting back on bus for a short ride to floating market  This is just an unreal experience  Canals were very congested with boats of both buyers and vendors  but I am so glad we did it Highly recommend it

title: Sky Train only in the Sky
review: Here in Thailand Skytrain ticket cannot use together with subway  There also available for one day tour ticket for those who need skytrain for your ride with unlimited round before midnight   Normally Thai people buy rabbit card or adult card Its easy to buy at the counter   For single ride ticket just put your coin at the machine and ready to the ride  Aircon is cold dont forget to wake up on your stop

title: Easy way to and from airport
review: Taking the Airport Rail Link is really the easiest way to get from downtown Bangkok to the airport The cost is 45 baht which is so inexpensive If you are traveling light this is the best most cost effective way to do it BTS connects with the downtown Air Rail terminal very easy to figure out

title: Great transportation
review: The BTS is a great way to travel around as the traffic here is extremly bad The fare is pretty cheap and fast

title: Brilliant for us... do your research first
review: I thought the Airport link was easy and great value It was relliable and made our journey to and from the airport almost effortless It was busyer in the morning but by no means uncomfortable if you have luiggage you should be in the standing section anyway and you can always sit on your bags Get a trolley at the airport and take the lift to the station there is only a small amount of steps to the platform and most other stations have escalators out  You can't expect the line to go every where you want it to so do some reasearch before you book a place to stay For us it was easy we took the airport link then shared a taxi with another couple near to our hotel which was not expensive When we went back to bangkok we chose a hotel within walking distance to the airport link station but also close to other attractions we wanted  If you choose any old hotelhostel before you check where the airport link stations and what other transport is around no wonder people find it hard  Besides traffic this is a really easy city to get around with or without luggage  You really don't need to take much with you especially if your only going for a couple of weeks just pack light and take a large rucksack rather than a suitcase laundry services will wash your things in less than 24hrs  Although I reccomend buying a cheap suitcase out there if you want to go home with tons of shopping it's never as bad lugging things around when you leave and you'd be supprised what you can fit on a tuktuk

title: Nice & quick link to airport without traffic
review: We took airport rail lnk from masakon to AIrport The travel was excellent Ofcourse the train was crowded & we had to stand till airport  The security staff at airport were very supportive & cordial

title: Best way to go!
review: Already several years we use this great option to go to the airport or city Clean fast cheap and not difficult if you ever used a metro line in Europe Definitely prefer it over a taxi and the kids think it‚Äôs an amazing way to travel

title: Easy to use, only 45 baht a person
review: We tried the airport rail link without bags just to know for the future when we come back Easy to use not expensive Very busy both ways  If you have a big luggage maybe not so advisable

title: An easy and affordable way to travel
review: Upon arriving at Bangkok airport you could take a taxi or like we did follow the signs in the terminal for the Airport Rail Link The station is right inside the arrivals hall on a lower level and is very easy to access Once on it there is a straight air conditioned route into the heart of the city The 30 minute trip takes you to Phaya Thai station where you can quickly change to the BTS Skytrain system that links up much of the rest of the city   In short it is reliable cheap and a pleasant way of travelling between the airport and the city And you won't get stuck in traffic along the way

title: Quick and easy
review: Buy the card it's around 500 THB and it makes life easier Our hotel was in Sukhumvit so we would catch the train on the Nana Station and go to MBK at the National Stadium Station If you are planning to stay for a week or so then using the card is a good choice

title: Best way to get around
review: Best way to get around this very busy city  Traffic will take you 45 minutes to go 5k 1015 by skytrain  Get the card for 100 bht and just put money on the card It will be well worth it

title: cheap and fast
review: i used it from phaya thai station to suvarna bhumi airport  only cost 45 baht compared with taxi meter when i was arrived from airport to phaya thai road  450 baht  but use it if you bring small or medium luggage and not too many luggage  because it is public transportation though

title: Safest and quickest way to get around in Bangkok!
review: The BTS usually arrives every 5 min and is always airconditioned runs from 5 am to 12 pm At rush hour it is overcrowded but by taxi you may be in a traffic jam for an hour whereby by BTS you are always on time And it is cheap starting at around 20 THB (5 cents)

title: Fast service
review: Travelling on ARL enable us to get to our hotel within 20 minutes which to me is a bonus So you can certainly avoid traffic by taking this

title: Bangkok Airport Linl
review: Fast and reliable way toget to and from Bangkok city centre You don't have to deal with potential taxi problems just head to the Basementlevel of the of the terminal and take and easy ride right into Thailand's capital

title: So easy...
review: Used everyday to take me everywhere So cheap and air con can get busy at peak times but really good way to get around If unsure people at station are more than helpful to assist you with what platform to get

title: airport rail is great if convenient
review: You need to stay near the rail to use the rail as travelling with baggage is not easy Bangkok is a busy place Most reasonable accommodation places will come and collect you for about $2030 AUD depending on if you share the cost  so why bother about the hastle of lugging luggage on and off trains unless you have little luggage Their transport system is fabulous compared to Adelaide

title: Escape the madness
review: Unlike the "Deutsche Bundesbahn" the BTS is on time clean good value for money and easy to understand Travelling with the BTS I don't understand the flood of cars on Sukhumvit road spending hours for a few hundred meters For sure the best way to go from A to B

title: Easy and quick way to get around Bangkok
review: When staying in Bangkok I usually try to stay close to any BTS station because it is really a great way to get across the city quickly The fares are much more expensive then the buses (which sometimes take the same routes) but the train is never stuck in the traffic The trains are all air conditioned and the safety is of a high standard

title: Sleeper train with a/c a must
review: The sleeper car was a great experience to have  once We took the second class sleeper car both up and back First class not available and actually looked more like little prison cubicles Make sure to have ac sleeper carThe non ac sleeper car appeared to be a truly hellish experience Suggest you bring your own food and drink Have warm clothes as the ac has one setting frigid Bottom berth is more quiet and less light Use the squat toilet as after several hours the western toilet bathroom is very disgustingNumber 1 and 2 trains are much nicer We took number 52 back to Bangkok it was something out of a David Lynch movie

title: Nice.Easy access and a quick service
review: It is easily accessible and located I the basement of the airport City link goes to all the main market

title: Efficient
review: Great way to get around once you figure out the tickets Can get very crowded at certain times Very clean and efficient I liked using it

title: Great, cheap alternative way to travel through Thailand
review: The sleeper train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai was a great cheap (about ¬£20 each for second class) way to travel between cities without wasting a day   The train provided all sheets and onboard meals were available to order at extra cost both dinner and breakfast (about 160 baht each)   If you're a light sleeper he train can be quite rocky noisy but passengers were very considerate to others trying to sleep Obviously you will be sharing a bathroom with the rest of your carriage but make sure you stick a pair of shoes on before heading off to the toilet in the middle of night floor was often quite wet (I'm hoping mostly fro cleaning)  Early risers can enjoy the picturesque views on the way into Chiang Mai for a couple of hours before arrival including small villages and vast jungles   Overall very worth it  cheap great views and saved a day of travel and a night of accommodation

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok of notorious for its traffic jams The Skytrain  is the best way to get around this sprawling City of 12 million people When I come to Bangkok I always chose a Hotel close to a Skytrain Station Forget taxi's take the train it is quick efficient airconditioned and cheap

title: Rak Fi Fah - Skytrain - all you need
review: This mode of transportation is cheap easy to use clean and wonderfully cold when stepping in from the humid city It gets you to many if not most places you want to go including the following malls Siam Paragon MBK and those around Victory Monument The staff are really helpful if you do get lost or want some extra information Just avoid using it at peak hours  6am to 8am and 5pm unless the 'human sardine game in a train' is your kind of thing ) The skytrain will always be faster than the grid lock traffic below so avoid using cabs and instead buy a train card (to the value you desire) or a single train ticket

title: Cheap/Fast/Safe
review: This is a nice way to commute when in Bangkok It‚Äôs safe clean systematic & fast  I paid 60BHT to travel from Old Bangkok to Chatu Chak weekend market which is just down the railway station

title: Clean and In time
review: Clean and in time Nothing to complain about this  It arranges schedule so good I always use Airport Rail Link to go straight into Bangkok center

title: Great experience
review: A visit to the train market is a must for a market with a difference Well worth the early start although I wouldn't recommend eating the food there Did not use this company as went on a private tour but a bucket list tick Enjoy and be amazed

title: Way to weekend market
review: This is a quick way to the weekend market With the terrible traffic of Bangkok it is the best to get a taxi to the nearest station and then on to the train to get to the market You can also see some parts of Bangkok going there

title: Easy Breezy
review: Great way to get around  Easy to access card if machine are down they have ticket employees on site  Used this and the airrail a couple of times during my trip

title: Avoid traffic in Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok  Like all the other reviewers have mentioned Bangkok's traffic is a beast  It's also pretty simple to learn where to go and what stop to get off on  We took it to the weekend market JJ market (or Chatuchak Weekend Market) and that is the best way to get there and back  It took us less than 30 mins coming from the Sukhumvit Thonglor area of Bangkok  That's way less time than it would have taken us to take a taxi to that area  It does get pretty crowded on the train especially during rush hours

title: Love to move around Bangkok by BTS
review: It's really a good experiences viarious Bangkok city attraction through BTS It cheap and comfortable for tourist who has  know time pressure BTS is linked with various Bnagkok attraction and all the information is available in BTS rout map and tourist map in addition various Tripadvisor and other web page guidance Tourist also can linked the journey with Boat ride Tourist interested to discover Bangkok with own effort and in cheapest way are advised to try BTS But you should have a strong leg for getting up and down of BTS station and moving around on foot  Day and monthly pass is cheapest

title: simple and easy to ride
review: very convenient and good traffic u can take it to around BKK city dont worry about the route its easy and simple

title: should have one in all cities
review: great way to travel once you've studied how the system works and chose a friendly member of staff to get your ticket from

title: funny
review: very crowded at peak hours but interesting to use and see get familiarised with the tariffs you can only use coins  there is changers all over the stations

title: Very efficient and air-conditioned!!
review: I cannot imagine Bangkok without the Sky train Not going to every corner of the city but much faster of any taxitook tookbike

title: Great way to see Bkk
review: Easy to work out safe to travel and beats getting stuck in traffic and sweating it out on the long lost walk  Cheap enough also and constant stram of trains

title: A terrific way to avoid the traffic jams
review: The Skytrain is a very convenient way to travel with air condition and without traffic jams However for each year I see more and more people using this mean of transportation which is good but also means that the trains and stations can be quite crowded  I recommend you to buy a travel card for short time or with possibilities to refill depending on the length of your stay The reason is that when you have a loaded card you can pass the sometimes very long ques to change money and to the ticket machines you'll just go straight through the entrance barrier The system keep tracks on where you enter and where you exit and withdraws the correct amount from your card Easy  I'm struck by how clean everything is both at the Bangkok Skytrain and subway compared to the Stockholm equivalents  There's also a safe feeling with guards at every entrance and on every platform I've never seen a disturbing incident here so far

title: WHO NEEDS A TAXI?
review: If you're traveling light there's no reason to pay 30 bucks for taxi from the airport into town  After arrival at Suvarnabhumi airport head to the lower level (ask the friendly English speaking young lady at information desk for more specific directions if necessary)  Go to the ticket counter next to the train entrance and pay around 35 baht (about a dollars) for a small token to your intended stop (Makkasan Station third stop from the end of the line is centrally located and connects with MTR the Bangkok subway just one stop away from the main thoroughfare Sukhumvit station)    Really no need to wait for the "express train" that goes straight to Makkasan  The regular train which leaves every 15 minutes or so gets you there pronto  It affords a great welcoming view of the city from above as opposed the infernal trafficcongested stopandgo of a taxi  Unless you have tons of luggage Airport Rail Link is the only way to go

title: Businese
review: So many people traviling Very defucalt to in and out at every city station No one takingcare of people who safaring with problem

title: The only life line for Bangkok
review: Using the BTS is the only life line a traveler can get from the traffic mess that Bangkok is becoming You save and time and money Choose hotels in close vicinity of a BTS station   Google map provides detailed travel plan along with number of stations which train to choose cost etc

title: Low prices and it can take you anywhere in a flash.
review: I took the BTS Skytrain almost every day hopping on at the Thong Lo station The BTS has airconditioning which makes it very comfortable to travel Don't count on sitting a lot though seeing there arent a lot of seats  Tip You can get a day pass at most hotels you stay at That way you can go anywhere at all times If you buy a ticket every time you travel a bit you will soon run out of change and its more expensive  The changing of trains is pretty easy and staff at the platforms with help you no problem

title: great way to get around
review: Just a great way to get around and able to enter most shopping mallsplace right at the station without

title: Great fun unique day
review: Great tour to unique locations Worth getting the tour as a bit of a faff to arrange transfers to these places yourself Our tour guide Tammy made the trip she was very entertaining and gave a nice insight to Thai culture If you have a day to spare and fancy respite from busy Bangkok this is a good option plus with a train ride boat ride & visits to both markets you pack a lot in

title: Second class night train Kanchanaburi to Chang Mai and then Chaing Mai to Bangkok
review: Caught two trains a few days apart This is a good way to travel without using up too much of your  sightseeing time cheap and providing you plan a comfortable way to travel We stocked up on a few snacks and drinks but there was also a very good buffet car which you could eat in or have food delivered to your seat I would advise taking a light jumper or fleece Our first train wasn‚Äôt too cold but the air conditioning on the second train was a little chilly I packed what I needed ie toothbrush bottled water brush etc in a small bag Although your luggage stays with you there isn‚Äôt really enough room to rummage around for what you need and it‚Äôs best to put it out of the way under your seats as soon as possible as people will want to get past The seats are converted into a lower bunk with curtains and an upper bunk with curtains is pulled down There are bunks either side of the isle which are all assigned to you as seat numbers The lights stay on all night so would recommend an eye mask Your valuables should stay with you on the window side whilst you are sleeping Each bunk has a string pocket to store small items and an individual reading light The toilets are very standard train toilets Outside the toilets there are two extra basins I would advise using bottled water to brush your teeth  I slept on the top bunk on the first journey and the bottom bunk on the second journey Out of the two bunks I preferred the bottom as it was a little darker The journey is a little bumpy at times but the trains are clean and efficient

title: Good system for central travel
review: We bought day passes which were very useful and we certainly got our moneys worth Efficient trains and regular Once you get the hang of using these trains it makes sense to keep out of the traffic

title: Deeper Appreciation of Thailand Culture and Daily Lives of the People
review: We enjoyed the tour it was well organised and gave us a very different experience and a more deeper appreciation of the different aspects of the daily lives of Thai natives and culture

title: FAstest way to move in Bangkok
review: Fastest way to move around Bangkok city as it connects to all the major areas of bangkok Better to have the route map before boarding

title: great
review: It goes lots of places is fairly easy to use is clean and affordable  I used the skytrain for most of my transportation around Bangkok

title: Easy and fast
review: Don't be afraid to use this local transport system Clean fast and easy to maneouvre around Station announements in Thai and English Goid maps in trains Great way to get around without the crazy Thai traffic jams

title: Not much cheaper than a taxi
review: The train is very clean and easy to use Depending on which station you have to pay with change Before two of us it was around 100 baht Which is more expensive than what a taxi would have cost us

title: Nice transport!
review: Though it was the first time for me to have sky train as transport but I loved it If you get the process then travelling is so easy and smooth Most importantly it saves time and money And the service also good enough

title: Very good always on time and very cheap.
review: A very easy way to get round a very busy Bangkok Very cheap to use not to busy so easy to get on and off

title: Skytrain
review: Quick way to get round Bangkok  avoid end of day 5pm ish as trains get very packed

title: Great way to beat the traffic!
review: Very quick way to get from A to B and beats the chaotic road traffic of Bangkok but the BTS Skytrain is very busy at stations platforms and onboard the train

title: Quick and easy
review: The Airport Rail link whisked me quickly from the airport to central Bangkok where I then found my way to my hotel via the BTS sky train  Recommended as it can be quicker and easier than a taxi which may charge higher prices to Western visitors

title: Convenient.
review: It's awesome Clean cool and well organised Keeps you moving without the hassle of Bangkok's traffic  It's very easy to use and inexpensive

title: BTS
review: Very efficient  clean and cheap Easy to learn routes and where to go to change to other lines or MRT

title: Best sky train
review: BTS Sky train is the best and oldest train in BangkokIts very convenient to travel anywhere through this sky train in bangkokIt connects all the popular places of interest and shopping placesIts speed is not very high n is favourable for aged and children

title: Simple & Cheap
review: A brilliant mass transit system which has made Bangkok much easier to navigate You'll see traffic jams consistently but if you take the BTS you will float an over them contentedly in air conditioned happiness A great way to get around

title: Fantastic trip. Don‚Äôt do Bangkok without seeing this
review: A really fantasy trip the guide was knowledgeable and funny Would strongly recommend  Could have done with a little more time at the railway market Do be aware the trip picks you up at the hotel but drops off in the centre of town They do state this when booking but a few people on our mini bus obviously didn‚Äôt read the full details and got really arsy with the poor guide

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap and easy Cool air conditioned which was very welcome Exceptionally clean Short walk from airport Great views while on board

title: Best way into and out of the city!
review: Don't bother taking the taxi and pay exorbitant prices to get into the city The rail link takes you in under 30 minutes with no jams The price  under 2 USD

title: Efficient and economical
review: We used this city rail system to move around Bangkok Easy and efficient If you get confused there are lots of staff to help you

title: Good transport
review: With Bangkoks crazy traffic the skytrain is really a convenient way to get around Not expensive either

title: Fast and efficient
review: Title says it all We used the machines to issue our tickets and they only take coins so if you only have coins go the kiosk and they will change notes for you or givr advice Dont know how good the servers english is so you might have problrms communicating Ststions are all very clean shops for snacks and drinks Trains can be packed out sometimes so be prepared to stand and be quite up close to each other

title: Getting around Bangkok!
review: For such a busy city the BTS  makes visiting Bangkok a real pleasure Very modern clean efficient

title: Convenient and Affordable transport to whole Bangkok
review: Affordable way of transportation around Bangkok Minimum fare is 15 bht per station Every 5 to 10 min Interval of the trains Safe Convenient when not rush hours and that's normal Stations and trains are clean duty guards on standby

title: A reliable way to get around
review: One can overcome the frustrations of being stuck in traffic by taking the MRT provided the one's starting point and the desired destinations are served by the MRT  Fares are by no means low taking into consideration the cost of living in Bangkok but MRT is the way to go

title: the only way to travel
review: so easy to find your way around and the staff are very friendly and helpful I highly recommend using this service  you wont be disappointed

title: the most convenient means of transportation for Bangkok
review: surprisingly clean organised easy direction easy access pleasant air conditioning  every time i visit Bangkok i rely on BTS MRT and local taxi BTS and MRT are more favorable for most location and continue with the taxi or other means of transportation  during rush hour it is advisable to purchase a rabbit card where you could easily top up This is to avoid a long line at the vending machine  love the local cuisine in Bangkok the river cafes are also a must to visit

title: Easy and convenient
review: I've taken the trains from Don Mueang to the North and Northeast of Thailand Always an adventure The Don Mueang Railway Station is nicely located as it's just across the highway from one of Bangkok's two major airports which has been renovated and greatly improved over the past few years

title: Fun !
review: Fast and cheap  I like BTS skytrain For view before skytrain arrives is beautifull and modern  We are like in cinemas can watching big screen while waiting for BTS skytrain Cool  Good job for you )

title: Easy & Fast way to travel
review: Who needs the Taxis and Tuk Tuks that can be a rip off when there is the sky train Cheap quick and easy to use and get to somewhere near where you want to go

title: 70th Birthday tour
review: We used the sky train only once to get from the Palace back to the center of the city as the station was just 100 yards from our hotel However at the ticket office when showing the man where on the map we wanted to go  he gave us the tickets and said jump on that train up in the station and get of at the forth stop after getting off and wandering about not recognising anywhere familiar I asked a tourist desk where we were and she said you are back to where you started almost  you should have changed trains at the first stop and got on the other line ( had to laugh üòÇ) so plan b get a taxi  That wasn‚Äôt easy as they like to stay in there own wee zones A man outside a hotel put us into a taxi after talking to the driver and when we moved away the driver says what hotel was it you wanted   You should have heard what he called him as it took him 45 mins to get through the traffic to the central hotel  Lucky for us the meter stopped running when we were not moving Travelers beware

title: Super convenient and easy to use!
review: We love the BTS  That and the MRT  Both are super affordable convenient and easy to use There are lots of stations around Bangkok and the trains come pretty often Much quicker than driving (taxi or Uber) with all the Bangkok traffic

title: Circumvent The Perpetual Traffic Jam
review: To make it short The airport link is cheaper than a taxi The airport link is faster than a taxi or a car You can take just as much onto t6e airport link as you can on a taxi The airport link connects at numerous stations to the BTS and MRT public transport and taxi stations along the way The airport link runs as an express and as a commuter train The airport link runs in 5 to 10 minute intervals  I suggest strongly you wait for your Bangkok traffic experience until you have checked into your hotel and then you can waste a day in traffic without having to schlepp your luggage around  The smart choice to get to and from the airport is the airport link

title: Easiest way to leave the airport!
review: If you can avoid taking a cab and the various fees attached to it do consider the Sky Train 40 bahts will get you in the city center in no time

title: Hidden Gem
review: If you use bangkoks MRT it is best to get a travel card so you don‚Äôt have to constantly look for change Once you have it getting around this very gridlocked city becomes easy It cleanefficient and user friendly If you travel out of the rush hours you are sometimes the only one on board

title: Immerse yourself in this amazing country on the remnants of the death 4ailway
review: Great way to experience the country whilst travelling on this amazing River stretch‚Äù of the death railwayover timber viaductstrestles clinging to the valley sidesending by going over the bridge over the Kwaitruly memorable

title: I couldn't get on the train.
review: Although the instructions said to take a train to the railway market we were asked on the tour bus whether we wanted to take the train or go directly to the railway market with the tour bus If we took the train we were warned that we would have to get there by ourselves without a guide and that it would be rush hour and many locals would be riding the train so it would be very crowded and it would be very difficult to get on and off We ended up heading directly to the railway market but the train wasn't actually crowded so we weren't able to experience riding a train which was disappointing After touring the floating market for about 30 minutes on a rowboat we went ashore to have lunch and shop and the time was just right

title: Cheap and efficient way to get into the city
review: If you arrive or depart from the Suvannabhumi Airport this is the most efficient means of transport to and from Instead of paying hundreds of baht for Grab or a normal taxi you can head into the city using this train no wasted time in traffic

title: Nice service but I never use it
review: I like airport rail links in general  The problemS with the Bangkok one for me are (a) links to a BTS station that is far out of the way from my house making me transit through central Bangkok and (b) I usually have a lot of luggage loaded with kong fak  There is no room for multiple large cases on the crowded BTS   But  if you are a travelor with limited luggage or on a one day business trip this is a fast inexpensive way to get to most destinations   Cab fare is still really cheap in Thailand  Both major airports have convenient setups to access taxis and a taxi can handle my stuff  I have never had a cab fare in excess of 400 baht (around $12 US) so for me a taxi is best although I have used the airport link when I fly short trips out of Bangkok  Soon both airports will have BTS access

title: Easy to get around
review: We found the BTS system easy to navigate and simple to use The air conditioning was a great break from the city heat Only real downside was the consistently long lines to buy tickets both from the automated machines as well as from the ticket agents

title: Clean, fast, easy to use... and cheap
review: When going somewhere in Bangkok if the Skytrain is an option I always go for it It is easy to use (everything is both in Thai and English) clean airconditionned (sometimes a bit too cold for my taste) fast and very cheap

title: Hopeless...
review: Slow terrible design for anyone with luggage (er everyone) leads to nowhere convenient better take a taxi

title: Good to experience but MRT is probably more convenient.
review: Most 'must dos in Bangkok mention taking the BTS skytrain We rode it a number of times  It gets VERY crowded but is airconditioned and trains are very regular  I couldn't tell you how much it was but it was cheap for western standards On some stretches of it you get a great view of Bangkok (if you can see through the window) We tended to use the MRT more often as there were more conveniently located stations for most of the tourist sites we were going to but I would agree with the reviews that it is something you should give a go D

title: Low cost way to explore the city
review: We road the BTS multiple times and found it easy inexpensive and efficient Often it is standingroomonly which we didn't mind Using google maps made it easy to see the direction and stations we wanted to hit and then we would usually walk to our end destination

title: Easy
review: A fast easy and cheap way to get into central Bangkok with good connections to other lines Trains run a few minutes apart so no long waits

title: A special place for some but not for me
review: As I understood it European American and Thai war prisoners were held in horrible conditions by the Japanese forces who put a deadline of 4months (5 years were needed) on building a bridge that functioned as a supplyroute Hundreds of thousands died while working on this railway In Kanchanaburi you can see and walk a newer version of the bridge that the Allied forces bombed A must see but to me visually not impressive

title: Very impressed
review: Very impressed with the airport rail link Was prompt clean quiet well signposted quite cheap and gave a very nice welcoming view into Bangkok  If you a little adventurous or just want to save the hassle and cost (and traffic) of getting a taxi from the airport try the airport rail link for sure  Great way to get back TO the airport from the city too

title: Love the Skytrain
review: Clean fast and easy to navigate around the city $6 AUD for an adult all day pass is worth it Would definitely use again next time I come to Bangkok

title: Fast and cheap
review: The skytrain is very efficient For those of us not intrested in motorcycle taxi this is also a cheap alternative During rush hour taxi drivers refuse to drive by "meter" instead they offer you prices much more expensive than skytrain Also if you want efficient transportation you don't want to be stuck in the traffic jam The train departs all the time is clean and has AC But it is very popular so don't expect to get a seat  If you are travelling with small kids at least the thai people will offer their seat to the kids

title: Convenience
review: We used the airport link just to try if it's convenient or not  Thank's God it was indeed so convenient and fast  We arrived on time and we have more time to stroll

title: Chaotic and not big enough
review: Considering that Bangkok is one of southeast major capitals the BTS does not have enough coverage over the city Payment is high compared to car apps and tuk tuks but can be convenient during rush hours No the BTS is not available to visit major Buddhist attractions located in the old city

title: Great System
review: Bangkoks traffic is legendary take the BTS as much as you can  The system is very easy to follow stations allow ticket purchase from machine or counter  One tip  weekends are very busy with ticketing be patient and have the correct change

title: Efficient Transportation
review: Clean efficient and regular Runs from 6am  midnight spanning a large part of the city Single fare or day fare options available Like public transport in many cities around the world some sections can be very crowded at rush hour

title: A wonderful day
review: This was an excellent tour and what made it even better was having such a lovely cool guide Sara She looked after me and taught me lots of things I never knew about A great person   Hugs Mr Frank   Only 24 letters in the alphabetüòç

title: Good!
review: This is a nice way to get away and to the airport  A key thing to remember is that there are is the airport link and the city link  The airport link is non stop to one of two stations while the city link stops many times before its final destination  The ride on the Airport Link is nice as most people use the City Link  Its quick

title: Well managed and maintained ( Well Done )
review: BTS Succeeds since  I visit  Thailand  I enjoy traveling with across Bangkok to most of Bangkok tourist attraction places  it is fast always on time  far ticket fees   if you are planning to visit Bangkok book hotels that are 3 mins walk far the nearest BTS

title: Good Investment of a few Hours Getting Outside Bangkok City
review: Having already seen a great deal of Bangkok coming in and out of the city for the past 8 years we decided to try something different  This tour took us out of the city for approximately 6 hours and we got to see one of the famous floating markets plus the lesser know train market  Allinall a fun thing to do with a half day  Our tour guide Kwan was fantastic  She was super super friendly and able to offer great suggestions for lunch on our own  Plus her English skills are very good and she was easy to understand when she spoke  If you book this excursion then I suggest you ask for Kwan to be your guide

title: Great way to travel in BKK and bypass the traffic
review: Very easy to use but can be a challenge initially Great to use as it quickly bypasses all the horrendous traffic Once you understand how it works it's super easy and convenient The station are way up in the air and you'll have to walk up 23 flights of stairs Once there you go straight to the ticket machine if you have coins othwise walk to the window hand the worker some paper money and they'll give you change Back at the ticket machine find the stop you need The amount it costs to get where you need to go from where you are now is displayed just press the button for that amount on the ticket machine and put in the money Ticket in hand walk to the "turnstile" and slide the ticket into the slot It will be sucked in and pop out the top Pull it out and the gates will open Make sure you know what direction you need to travel and go up the proper escalator There are arrows on the ground telling you where to stand to wait for the train Make sure you stay out of the way of the people getting off when your train arrives  The train is great there are maps and displays on the walls so you don't have to worry about missing your stop The next stop is also announced When you get off you repeat the process at the turnstile to get out only this time it will keep your ticket Hope this helps the idiot proof guide to catching the BTS

title: Passable
review: Cheap and easy ride Suitable in case you don't have several bags Around 30 minutes to city Need to exchange trains if your staying around Sukhumvit area

title: Nice & Modern
review: BTS Skytrain is safe nice modern and lightful I love it The best access to the great sukhumvit boulevard

title: Cheap and convenient
review: If you know where you are going and can find the directions  and you are not afraid of crowded areas use it as it has ac and also very cheap but quick

title: Great way to travel
review: Great prices and a superb method of getting around Bangkok especially considering the heavy traffic doring peak commuter times Compared to a cab this was my preferred method of travel because the ease of access the prices and no congestion

title: Fast, On time and enjoyable
review: I used the BTS Skytrain during a recent visit to Bangkok and found it to be a really great service A modern working transport system in Bangkok just awesome

title: Nice transportation experience
review: I love to try different modes of transportation For 22baht we were able to travel two stops to Siam We took it back also quicker than getting an Uber and fun to experience

title: Great option to Taxis and Cars.
review: Considering the Road Traffic congestion the BTS ( MRT) is a god sent servicevery comfortable and convinient

title: Easy to travel and clean train
review: Train directory are easy to understand and train are fast and cleaneasy to travel from point to points

title: Extremely Clean
review: For a city that has very dirty streets the public transit was surprisingly clean  The fares were cheap (a little more than $1) and the trains were arrived frequently

title: Avoid at all costs...
review: Wanting an adventure and having read great reviews we booked tickets from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and then later on from Bangkok to Surat Thani Huge mistake Perhaps for most people who either have never taken the train or don't know what train travel SHOULD BE like  Thai Railways is good But for a person who has travelled in Europe and Russia by train  THIS was painful 1) The trains are old Really old And they haven't been maintained well Or cleaned either 2) Both trains left the station 23 hours late 3) The AC is unbearably cold and there is no way to turn it off (though I am sure without it it would have been unbearably hot) But why can't we control the amount of cold air that goes into each room 4) The beds are hard the trains are loud and its impossible to sleep 5) The restaurant car is well just a car where you can sit and get horribly cooked food 6) Cockroaches yep they were on the train too The staff The staff laughs and says this is normal No I wasn't expecting the Red Arrow (train from Moscow to Saint Petersburg) of course not But this was beyond all expectations

title: Views!
review: We used the sky train to go from our hotel on Sukhumvit Street to the weekend market You need coins to buy the tickets at a machine which is easy to use It's nice to have a view instead of being stuck underground

title: Fastest Way to Reach Downtown Bangkok from Suvarnbhumi Airport
review: The Rail Link station is easily accessible from the Arrival are of the Airport and getting a ticket is pretty easy Runs every 1015 mins It is the fastest and the cheapest way to reach downtown bangkok For Hotels in Sukhumvit Area its convenient to get down at Makkasan and catch either a metro or taxi from there to your destination Defnitely more convenient and cheaper than taking a taxi from the airport

title: Reliable Way to Get Around
review: A easy and cheap way to get around bangkok Ticket is not super expensive If you are close by it's faster than car during rush hour

title: great ride
review: and stopped near my hotel so excellent for seeing Bangkok a big plus for our holiday really like it

title: Very much recommended
review: I recommend those that decide to travel to Bangkok to take the BTS to save money and to avoid scams Its very easy and straight forward

title: Easy
review: Easy to navigate cheap a little crowded but saves you so much time getting across the sprawling city Stations with just one platform can be confusing be careful not to get on the train going the right way

title: Beauty with a hidden beast
review: I visited Thailand in October 2018 My 2nd day into my holiday I started to scratch and noticed 3 what I thought were mosquito bites on my abdomen I continued to scratch all holiday and then I was also bitten on the plane journey home A month later I was frantically scratching and my back was badly scarred and bled with my constant scratching I truly believed I‚Äôd been bitten by mosquitoes so treated my self made wounds with pharmaceutical alcohol Even that didn‚Äôt do anything by the end of the 2nd month I went to the doctor who referred me to a dermatologist By this time tiny blisters had appeared on my back This doctor recognised my condition as having picked up a parasite in Thailand although similar to scabies it did not have the tell tale red lines it is still an infestation of tiny microscopic mites which burrow under the top layer of skin and lay eggs My doctor prescribed 2 tubes of PERMETRIN cream I had to cover my entire body back and front before going to bed Shower the next day with Tea Tree Oil soap or Tea Tree Oil shower gel  I removed my bedsheets immediately and washed them in water at 60 degrees I then mixed several drops of tea tree oil with water in a spray bottle and sprayed the mattress and pillows before putting new sheets on the bed I continued to wash my sheets every day for 2 weeks from the first application and afterwards I never make my bed I open the sheets every day lightly spray the tea tree on them and leave them in the air with lots of light too The second tube of cream should be applied after 7 days same procedure All clothes that cannot be washed at 60 degrees should be placed in a plastic bag close tightly for 7 days then wash everything normally after 7 days Wash all the towels bathroom mats kitchen towels all the fabrics in the home Vacuum the house every day Smaller carpets should be washed Change your towel every day for at least 2 weeks This whole issue has left me quite paranoid about hygiene I‚Äôve always been clean but now I‚Äôm manic and continue to use all body products with Tea Tree Oil This kills mites head lice etc but not the eggs The only solution to kill both is the cream It‚Äôs important to keep vacuuming as you don‚Äôt get rid of the dead parasites till your skin renews which could be a month or more Although cured after the 2nd application you continue to scratch for weeks Keep a tube of cream on hand because an odd tiny blister may appear where a random mite has taken up house  Beautiful country fabulous foliage but doubtful I‚Äôll be back ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Express Line 15-20 minutes to Airport
review: Express Line  Good for express service  shorten the time   avoid the traffic   price is ok  City Line   too much people after office hours most of office worker use for their transportation back home To avoid lots of people don't go after 6 PM  8 PM  Staff can advice about the time exactly

title: Very efficient Bangkok mass transit
review: When travellling around Bangkok it is highly recommended that you use the BTS train Best way to avoid traffic BTS train is fairly modern relatively cheap and easy to navigate Best way to avoid the traffic jam especially during rush hours

title: The best way to get around....
review: Stay out of traffic & enjoy the trains They are nice new convenient easy to use & clean

title: Way fun Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: Second class sleeper in the newer trains is the way to go Super comfy and affordable and you wake up to beautiful northern Thailand scenery We felt safe and slept great You can stash backpacks under the seats and there are electric outlets in both bunks Just be sure to bring snacks because the food on board is kind of gross and bring an eye mask because they leave the lights on

title: Clean, fast inexpensive
review: Well air conditioned modern trains Good announcements and maps I had no problem navigating the system

title: Excellent mode of transportation
review: The BTS is easy to navigate and inexpensive People line up very orderly It is PACKED at the end of the day Do not go to the car at the top of the stairs It took us three trains to get on It was well worth the wait though We took it whenever we could A great way to get around

title: Much better than using taxi
review: It really ease reaching many places but there should be special places on it for kids there should be also more escalators and more elevators to ease using baby strollers

title: Fast, clean, cheap
review: If your hotel is located on the MRT line use it The traffic is so huge in Bangkok that such transportation is more than welcome Air conditioning on board fast cheap (huy a card to avoid the queue at the ticket machine) I used it a lot

title: Cheapest and the Fastest link to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Easiest fastest and the cheapest way to reach the city centre from the Airport Has couple of interconnectivity points to the other modes of transport (Makkasan station links to MRT Phetcha Buri and Phaya Thai station links to the BTS SkyTrain) Costs anywhere between 1545 baht a person

title: Best Way to Get Around
review: It's so easy We bought rabbit cards so we could swipe on and swipe off As the traffic inevitably snarls below you zip along above If you are going to Bangkok it's a very easy and useful mode of transport

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Fantastic way to see Bangkok from above very clean easy to follow stations and very exciting for all travel

title: Easy
review: Easy to use If unsure go to information booth and they'll tell you where to get off Also a great way to avoid traffic

title: Express way to airport
review: Easiest mode of commute from the city to airport super fast service  direct pathway inside airport saves all the time which wld take up in Bangkok traffic

title: very practical and fast
review: We took it from silom to central world plazzaVery crowdy but with air condition you feel ok It is the best in BKK

title: clean and convenient
review: we used this to get just about everywhere in bangkok even when it didn't go directly somewhere we'd take it to get close and then a cab or tuktuk because you can avoid traffic airconditioned reliable polite

title: Pretty good
review: Pretty good considering how many years this system has operated They‚Äôll be extending many more lines to other parts of Bangkok so that‚Äôs great news

title: Fastest route to and from Suvarnabhumi and Bangkok city center
review: Kiss goodbye to traffic jams tolls and getting lost around unknown routes as you travel directly from the Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok city in under than hour May be more challenging if you are lugging heavy luggage around as the city pavements may not be so smooth

title: Modern transport facility
review: My family rode the BTS several times as the station is a minute away from our hotel Buying the tickets require advance preparation as the ticketing girl hardly speaks English so you have to speak slowly and clearly for example just say "Chatuchak return 4 people" The information on the train and the stops are helpful One disadvantage is the staircase People with mobility issues would find this a bane although there is a lift for those on wheel chairs only Security at the BTS stations are good and the passengers are somewhat disciplined as they queue in a nice line and allow those getting out to disembark first Although there are cases of shoving just ignore and enjoy the ride Tip avoid the office crowd as it is extremely tight and this is when jostlings occur

title: Easy Way to Get Around
review: Its an easy way to get around  Not cheap at times and stations not in the usual places where you would expect

title: A good possibility to get around
review: A fast reasonable possibility to move within some areas of the city Very clean well organised and freezing coldI always carry a sweater when I know I take the skytrain Unfortuately the tickets are not valid for the MRT So if you change between the two trains you always have to buy a new ticket and the day pass is only valid vor the BTS

title: Just as in London or Paris
review: I took the MRT a couple of times going to the train station Good and comfortable underground trains I use the MRT in rush hours mostly They are comfortable and there is also AC in all of them

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Well run inexpensive clean efficientsafe sometimes a little crowded easy to work out how to use the service

title: Very easy
review: Best way to get around Bangkok by far  Super cheap and quick  Very easy to manage  Paid only 32 Baht to go through 5 stations  Wish it was more extensive throughout the city but between this and the interconnecting subway you can get anywhere quickly

title: An underground but overground
review: I dont like conjestion so it was a bit busy for me (i'm wierd)

title: Clean, quick and reliable
review: The trains are quick clean and reliable service and pretty cheap way to get around Bangkok Routes are easy to read and identify even for my first time visit

title: Sky train
review: Best way to travel around the city for reasonable cost You have a cheap and cheerful way to get around and also helpful Thai people are so friendly and they show you what to do x

title: Clean, Cheap, Quiet
review: The sky train is a great way to exit the Airport Its extremely cheap I paid 500 baht to get from my hotel downtown to the airport leaving the city Highly recommend for the backpacker on a budget

title: Was just looking around
review: Had a day just catching trains everyday just for something to do so grab a day pass for the BTS and Airport rail link and just swapped trains and got on and off at different stations

title: A great addition to the BTS system.
review: I have visited Bangkok before this link was added to the BTS Skytrain system and I was always forced to take a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport  This link saves my money and especially time getting to the airport  I still take a taxi if I have a lot of luggage because it is difficult to haul luggage in and out of the Skytrain but for shorter trips when I only have one bag and a carryon this is the way to go

title: BTS the way to get around some of the main areas
review: A good overhead train service The ticketing system must be improved get change at a booth then get the ticket from a machine is ridiculous Hotels used to offer daytickets so the challenged tourists needn't fumble about at stations trying to comprehend Thai business (il)logic I use the BTS on a daily basis and have a card so it is very usable for me Great staff at most stations go help the poor 'ticketed ' travelers

title: Nice Trip.
review: Did the tour yesterday and was very nice The tour guide also was lovely and would recommend The only small thing was the bus was a little cramped for myself I am only 6ft tall but my legs wouldn't fit behind tea seats so I had to sit sideways which was possible as there was 10 people on a 12 seater bus   Still a nice trip though

title: Save time and money
review: Ive been using this rail link since 1 year Not only it takes me to the heart of city faster than other modes but its also way too cheap A taxi might charge 400 baths to take you to baiyoke sky but this rail road will take you there in just 35 baths and way too faster than those taxi's

title: Crowded, safe and efficient
review: I went on twice once directly after I arrived at the airport  would not recommend Take a metered taxi in Bangkok The second time with a Bangkok guide but still overwhelming It's kind of cool also really how safe it is I'm just not used to such crowded spaces

title: It's alright but...
review: The train it's very fast and good to avoid traffic but the list of stations are limited Sometimes you have a choice than take a taxi

title: Life saver
review: Good option to get around cheap and easy to use security checkpoints are friendly and so to are the staff you can change notes at booth but best just carry a heap of 10 baht coins Saves time Avoid peak hour and it's a quick trip peak hour can be a little busy But overall a awesome public transport system

title: Quick Travel Around Bangkok
review: Always use the Skytrain for quick trips around Bangkok A simple and easy way to avoid the heat of the day allowing quick access to many locations around the cityWell sign posted and a number of ticket options

title: Very good train. Not very convenient connections
review: The train in itself is very good The problem is its interface with city internal transportations It you wnat to transfer to the undergroung or the sky train you have to exit the station then go to other station Also it is not a combined ticket If you are on a budget by all means use it If you arrive at traffick peak hours (like Friday afternoon) or at times when there is a long line to get a taxi and you have a small amount of lugagge by all means use it

title: Always an eye ipener
review: The BTS is one thing I am always amazed at The speed and efficiency The cleanliness and accessibility It works Coming from South Africa it is a serious eye opener and one really appreciates these public transport options that are provided for to the masses

title: Interesting
review: We rode the train for about an hour The view was nice Unfortunately our tour guide was in a rush so couldn't explain the History to us but it was still an enjoyable experience

title: A really good way to get around and beat the traffic.
review: We stayed hear a BTS station so it was super convenient  Inexpensive to use once you get the hang of the ticket machine and not too busy out of rush hour  Definitely a good alternative to a taxi or tuctuc

title: Fantastic!
review: Our hotel had a BTS Station very close by The train will get you around most of the city easily The train is air conditioned which is fantastic in the heat of Thailand They run super frequently so just show up & you won't have long to wait Be prepared for being packed in there at particular times of the day though We bought an all day pass for 120 Baht from our hotel Great value Made our visit and sight seeing in Bangkok super easy Highly recommend

title: Best way to travel in BKK
review: Much much busier than it was about 67 years ago the sky train is by far the easiest way of travelling around Bangkok The traffic congestion is worse than ever it took me over an hour to travel a few miles in Bangkok when I was there earlier this month The sky train will never cost more than 42 baht for a one way journey When you think about the price of the tube in london  you really can't complain It is also airconditioned which is nice when you have been walking around a hot city all day

title: quick way to travel
review: MRT is quick way to travel especially to many of the shoping malls sharp turn of the metro going to MBK mall was nice

title: So clean and fast. Great way to get around
review: If you are comfortable with public transportation in the US and Europe you will find this to be a great option Riding tuktuks are fun but there is a ton of air pollution especially in March when it is so dry The train will keep you out to the car exhaust

title: Best way to get about in bangkok
review: Clean and cool and runs on time Cheep to use and convenient  It‚Äôs relatively easy to find your way about with the sky train  It will take you to Siam central which is where you will find lots of shopping centres

title: Quick and easy travel
review: Very easy way to travel and not have to deal with the traffic It gets really crowded so be prepared to share your personal space  It is air conditioned and stops at many of the shopping malls The tickets are from a vending machine but if you don't have change there is a counter that will either sell you the ticket or give you change

title: Efficient and fast
review: Great  for getting around the shopping district as well as other bkk attractions Not exactly cheap compared with taking a cab if you are in a group but it does avoid the rather tiresome traffic that plagues central bkk

title: Crowded during the afternoon peak
review: Lots of luggage people and few seats Cheap and easy to find on lowest level of terminal Fast way to get into city centre

title: Easy to move around
review: With a map of Bangkok and a small amount of baht you can get to anywhere you want to see From the horse races to the train markets BTS is very easy to understand and operate

title: clean fast overland views
review: fastest way to connect cheap and totally safe    The system is logical simple and efficient highly recommend

title: V nice
review: The bestfastest Easy and quick way to get from the airport And its awesome if your hotel is near to any BTS line

title: Best option to go from airport to the city
review: It is way cheaper than a taxi Taxi can cost you around ~400 baht But this train ticket is just 45 baht per person Plus it is much more faster  More ever taxis can get stuck in the Bangkok trafficThe frequency of the trains is good Plus once you reach Phaya thai you can get good fx rates at the shops there On 31st December the travel was free on behalf of New Year Eve

title: Best public transport
review: Best public transportation I have ever been on Clean  easy to navigate and safe Staff and even fellow passengers are happy to help if you are confused or lost

title: slow train for the big populations
review: trains are running too slow for the size of population  but clean and well maintain for big population at bkk

title: A must day trip in Bangkok
review: A fantastic day experiencing the rail market on board and on the ground Floating market was an experience unlike any other shopping All done with a great tour guide and driver that drove the streets of Bangkok very safely

title: easy travel in Bangkok by BTS
review: we need BTS in Bangkok to avoid the heavy traffics daily in the city Get the RABBIT Card easily at all the BTS Stations

title: Reliable and cheap way to get around
review: We stayed along the river and took the BTS sky train to Siam Square for shopping It is a clean cheap and reliable method of transportation When booking a hotel I would definitely check to see if it is in walking distance to a BTS skytrain stop as it will make your life a lot easier getting around congested Bangkok

title: Efficient way of travel
review: BTS trains are very efficient to get around and the trains run frequently  Be aware that during rush hour the trains might be really crowded thiugh

title: Easy & Cheaper Access to City...
review: Convenient & cheaper way to enter into the city Follow the instructions on the walls or contact the info desk for clarifications

title: A great way to travel around the city
review: Good clean quick service  A great way to get around the city avoiding the traffic on the roads  All day pass is relatively cheap

title: Convenient Transportation to city
review: The Airport Link is very convenient to reach Bangkok City Center The cost is very cheap and you depart from the Suvarnaburmi Airport There is a departure every 1015min from my memory and only takes around 30min to reach Bangkok Center It's convenient if you don't have heavy and huge luggage but if your hotel is near one of the train station it may worth to go by train It is a shame that the Express Link does not operate although the infrastructure is created

title: Beat the taxi ripoffs, catch the train.
review: Easily accessible from the basement of the airport it's very little trouble to wrangle your luggage onto the platform and be dropped off in Bangkok city for 45 Baht Good views of the city as you travel and a nice way to get an overview of the city without spending time in traffic jams Avoiding  Bangkok taxi drivers is also highly recommended in order to keep blood pressure normal  The hidden benefit of using the Airport Link is that you can be sure not to miss your flight on the way out (travellers have sometimes found themselves on a gridlocked freeway for 2 hours with no offramp for kms The Rail Link can also be easily accessed from the BTS Skytrain or the MRT (metro underground) at the places where they intersect Smart travellers learn how to use these amenities in a city suffering from nightmare traffic congestion Not to mention that you het good views while you ride

title: Awesome Tour Guide
review: Our English speaking guide "Kiwi" was awesome She kept a high spirits throughout Constantly feeding us historical information Best of all recommending which toilet is most clean ü§£

title: Excellent! So convenient!
review: We usually travel in a group of 4 so we usually take a cab as it's more economical but when we picked our holiday apartment with direct access to the Airport Rail Link we were sold It was a breeze buying a ticket from the airport Signage is clear Just ask the counter staff when buying the tickets (which is a coin token) if you have questions  Most convenient was on our return trip to the Airport We didn't have to prebook a cab and we didn't have to worry if the ride would turn up because the Rail Link was dependably on time Great alternative to cabbing in Bangkok

title: Great transportation option to avoid heavy traffic in the city!
review: Easy to use super clean and organized transportation system   enjoyed taking it up and down the city multiple times to avoid the heavy traffic of Bangkok Plus using public transportation is a great way to see the inner pulse of a new city  highly recommend using the BTS skytrain

title: Good timings for an out of the city airport link.
review: Its good to have an airport link specially one thats close to avail from Siam but for an airport as busy as Suvarnabhumi this link should be upgraded to a 24X7 service

title: Mostly not crowded
review: Took the Airport Rail Link on my way back to the Suvarnabhumi airport during morning time The metro was not crowded and I found to be a convenient and economical option that a taxi

title: wonderful system .....
review: Air conditioned trains every few minutes that cover most of the city  what more could  traveller want for such low fares

title: Good value but limited coverage
review: The BTS Silom line was good value for us but most of the main Bangkok sites are not near any stations  So it is a good alternative to taxis and tuktuks during rush hour but only if near where you need to go

title: Quick and Predictable
review: I have used this service for years on a regular basis for commuting and it's let me down once It punctually arrives every 20 minutes  (I think) and I was always able to perfectly time my morning routine and arrive for the airport link 1 or 2 minutes to spare before it arrived  Clean good for commuting quickly from the center to places near Hua Mak and Lat Krabang and it's reasonably priced for its convenience

title: Efficient transport, nothing special
review: If you need to get from A to B BTS is a good choice Rather cheap ticket machines have English language menue so easy to navigate However it is still a Mass Transportation System lots of people and in my opinion not a "sight" itself

title: Great way to get around in Bangkok.
review: From our experience the BTS is usually a better option than a taxi The Skytrain doesn‚Äôt get caught in traffic jams so it's a speedy way to get around in Bangkok in air conditioned comfort

title: The Best Way to Get Around.
review: I've been traveling to Bangkok for many years long before the BTS was build  This is by far the best way to get around the city  Make sure you purchase a Rabbit Card from any station this saves you buying individual tickets for your travel  The BTS is fast clean and efficient

title: Best way to get around
review: We have just stayed in bangkok for 6 days The sky train and metro are the best forms of transport it's cheep and comfortable enough It's well air conditioned and it easy to work out where to go while on the sky bus  It's a lot quicker then taking taxis What took us an hour in a taxi takes 20 on the sky bus   Don't go in rush hour it's cool enough but it's like sardines in a tin

title: Crowded but efficient
review: The skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok if you're willing to brave the crowds Try your hardest to avoid peak hours and you will be ok

title: SImple BUT busy!
review: Great speedy see the views cheap clean efficient BUT crowded  not always easy to get a seat for the a whole trip but usually after 3 or 4 stations you can sit Great air con too and well signed Simple

title: Worthwhile journey
review: Take the 1 & half hour trip & get off just past the cutting for quite a nice lunch Interesting countryside very sobering to remember that every sleeper the train passes over cost a life of a POW or forced labourer Perhaps go right to the end if the waterfall is in action

title: Unexpected Encounter

title: Very Easy
review: Often when travelling i find i tend to shy away from public transport systems and opt for the "easy" taxi  This system really couldnt be easier and has rewritten the rule book for me  In March I visited Bangkok twice The first time i did just that Took a taxi Immediately had the battle of getting the driver to use the meter endured some dangerous driving in an old car with no seatbelts and bad air con  Had to figure out how much the toll fees were and in the end the driver couldnt find the hotel  even though i had the address in thai    Second time round i opted for the airport link Finding it is easy as it is in the basement of the airport and well signed  No danger of getting the wrong train as the only route is to the city  I was staying in Chit Lom which is on the BTS skytrain route so got the airport link all the way to Phaya Thai station  The system is easy  buy token from machine ( in english) and walk on  The train is extremely clean and there are no crazy people the service is very efficient and fast I wouldnt recommend this if you have a large amount of luggage however as there just isnt the space to put it 1 medium to large case per person is manageable   Once at Phaya Thai it is a short and well signed walk to the BTS Skytrain network which is similarly effective Well signed very clean and safe  A few stops and $1 later I am practically outside my hotel  No stress of dealing with taxi drivers dangerous driving and air con that doesnt work   There is absolutely no reason to take a taxi if you are staying anywhere near a BTS station I cant recommend this enough it is THE way to get around Bangkok

title: What is that little black plastic token all about??
review: Rail link is safe fast and convenient way to get downtown Read other reviews about all that  Let's talk about how to actually pay and get the magical black plastic token  1  Once you pick up your bags at BKK follow the train signs (2 signs  one red and one blueboth go to same underground entrance)  2  Signs take you down 23 floors vi multiple moving sidewalks 3 Follow the clearly labelled signs to entrance of trains 4  Look for electronic kiosks to purchase your black plastic token Kiosks look like ATMs will generally have people lined up and they do have English speaking attendants helping  5  At the kiosk you select your station number of people pay and out comes a black plastic token for each person  (Check YouTube for videos on how to use kiosks) 6 Follow signs to turnstile and place the black plastic token against the turnstile sensor The gate will open  7  KEEP TOKEN DO NOT THROW AWAY  8  When you get to your destination and exit the train you will encounter another turnstileyou have to deposit the black plastic token into the slot to open the turnstile's gate  SUMMARY at turnstile 1 (airport)  black plastic token uses RFID sensor to open gate KEEP TOKEN at turnstile 2 (your destination) deposit black plastic token into slot to open turnstile gate  Easy peazy lemon squeezy

title: Great idea poor execution
review: Quick way to get into the centre of Bangkok but the main terminal station in town has poor onward journey options  When we tried the airport link the journey to the centre itself was smooth fast and what is to be expected from a airport transfer but when you get out at the other end it seems the project is poorly thought out  The main terminal in the city is practically inaccessible by car in fact the roads leading into the station are so congested that it takes 2 or 3 times as long to get tot the station than it would take to take a taxi direct to the airport  If you would like to get there by public transport the only option is by Subway which will take you to Petchaburi station where you then have to log your luggage on a poorly constructed footbridge Why not have a tunnel into the MRT station where passenger can stroll in the cool air and conveniently take a lift up into the railway link station area  I will not be using this service again unless access to the station is greatly improved  If you like people watching and don't mind spending the extra time  then this may be an option for you

title: Convenient, Economical, Comfortable, Fast, Connectivity & Safe by Airport Rail Link
review: The Thailand Airport Rail Link is my preferred choice of transportation between the Suvarnabhumi Airport and downtown in Bangkok   It is most convenient economical fast comfortable and safe to travel via the airport rail link to towns The train station is right at the Basement of the International airport   With just THB 35 I sit comfortably from the Suvarnabhumi airport to Makkasan station in 20min journey without worry of traffic jam on the road It is extremely easy and convenient to connect from the Makkasan train station to the Phetchaburi MRT station with just a short 5min walking distance under the covered link bridge Very clear signage along the way  Generally passenger need to pay THB 120 for the highway toll fee plus THB 250300 taxi meter fare from town to the Suvarnabhumi airport thus using the Airport Rail Link not just saved you extra THB but more importantly you can easily manage your Travelling time on your journey between the stations without any worry and anxiety of caught in the heavy traffic jam on the road  My strong recommendation to use the Bangkok Airport Rail Link for your travel between Suvarnabhumi Airport and town in Bangkok  Jason

title: The best place for clean air in Bangkok
review: Most users are glad we now have a reasonable subway running in Bangkok I agree with other comments that a common ticket with BTS would be helpful  I disagree with the problems with tokens  which is correct if just jusing it rarely  But everyone can buy a valuestore card  including rebates  with ease (and ID) Yet thousands of Thais prefer to cue every day instead of putting 100 Baht into a card (which is about 3 UDS)  The good news considering the horrible pollution in BBK's air we measured the particles namely the 25 ppm at the big exchange station AsokSukhumvit To our surprise at MRT level the air was 510 times CLEANER than at ground level So the air filtering and climatization there is excellent  A pity there are nearly no seats or benches to sit down and breathe clean air for longer  PS The optional questions about this "attraction" make nt alot of sense since we talk about a public transport system And asking about "Veterans" and discounts is rather an American gimmick  insulting for other countries even who have their own thinking about US Veterans  I strongly recommend asking for "Senior Citizen" discounts instead

title: Efficient, clean and cheap form of travel
review: The last time I stayed in Bangkok and left the Suvarnabhumi Airport my friend wanted to try alternative travel to the taxi which is always a rip off with most drivers charging Baht 370 or more to get into Bangkok  So we tried the Airport Rail Link  The station is on the lower floor to the arrivals floor  There are plenty of signs to guide you  If you ask one of the spruikers however they will convince you to use a limousine 'very cheap now just for you today only'  Don't fall for this one as it doesn't really turn out cheap at all with all the add on's  But once do it just for fun no matter the cost  Anyway back to the train  Finally found the station without too much trouble ticket machines and station underground with the cost of the tickets not expensive at all to travel to Bangkok  The trains run very regularly about a 15 minute wait between each  Going on board with suitcases you have to struggle with other travellers also coming on board with their luggage and traverse all those obstacles lying on the floor before you find your corner  Usually you have to stand which I did not this occasion all the way into Bangkok  The train was fast clean and well air conditioned  The trouble was knowing where to go when you arrived in Bangkok which being the first time my friend and I had no idea  We got off at a station which sounded familiar but was still some kilometres from our hotel  I wanted to find the station which had the cross over to the Skytrain but couldn't find it  Ended up getting a taxi from the station to the hotel  Lugging suitcases along stairs and escalators wasn't my idea of fun  Next time will get the taxi from the airport and pay the extra Baht cost for the comfort of not having to lug around luggage across town  But for the cost conscious the train is a good alternative  You may have better luck finding the station where you switch stations to the Skytrain than I did
