review: It is cleanthat's for the plus side It is also noisy with inside and outside screens constantly blaring advertising While the network and the number of passengers have considerably expanded since the opening more than 15 years ago the trains and their frequency have remained the same Even though the stations were built to harbor trains with up to 9 cars the same overcrowded 3 cars initially put into service are still there Finally there is the disaster that is the ticket selling with not enough machines asking for stupid prices such as 32 or 37 baht which passengers have to pay for by inserting countless coins some of which are regularly rejected while queues are getting ever longer

title: Rabbit Card
review: For frequent travelers get a Rabbit Card and top it up You can use it like a tapandgo cash card at 711 supermarkets and various outlets  Of course the convenience of just tap and go thru the gate at BTS station   BTS is the best way of traveling in Bangkok It is frequent and fast

title: A peaceful and jam free travel
review: I was on the trai just before my flight to  Yangoon I was able to reach well in stipulated time No tension hurry bury or anxiety about the long stops & traffic  jam I landed well ahead of the time  A great and peacefull  to air port

title: Poor system and time table.
review: It is not recommend to take Airport Rail Link to get to town and airport The express line is once per hour The city line was also a long wait Taxi is much more reasonable and more time management

title: MRT beats being stuck in traffic!
review: Bangkok's MRT is very clean and efficient Most of the time it will take less time vs a taxi especially during rush hour

title: What a treat!
review: The traffic in Bangkok can be horrible  Especially when it rains  It was such a pleasure to travel quickly and efficiently in this air conditioned train  Ok sometimes it can be busy and crowded but it sure beats getting to your destination quickly than being stuck for hours in a cab

title: BEST TRANSPORT
review: You can reach almost everywhere from AirportArrangements of ticket kiosks and information with escalators is very convinient

title: First time on a first class travel from Hua Hin to BKK
review: Originally booked second class ticket from Hua Hin to Hua Lamphong railway station in Bangkok for 800 baht when I bought the tickets the day before my departure  When I bought the tickets was not offered first class I went back to the ticketing counter and asked if they have first class and ticketing staff said yes  I top up an extra 500 baht to buy a first class ticket  On the day of departure train arrival was delayed by an hour from 630 to 730am  My train the Thaksinarath Express arrived at 730am It was a brand new train with updated cabins  I was brought to my personal cabin by the train attendant He was very helpful and helped to make my cabin seat to lie flat bed  There's also a shower room with instant hot water and food coach right at the end of the train  There are 2 classes in the train 1st class which comes in a individual cabin (upper and lower deck) and 2nd class which has both upper and lower decks with 40 paxs in a cabin Both classes are air conditioned  It was a very good experience taking a 4 over hours first class train journey which was very affordable and pleasant as well

title: Only 70 bahts to the hotel
review: I've always taken a taxi but have gotten so fed up with the local taxi drivers that I've decided to try the airport rail link It's 45 baht to town and another 25 baht on the BST to my hotel Efficient My only complaint is that the sign postings are not very clear

title: Convenient!
review: Traffic can be congested in Bangkok  I found the best way to get around was on the Sky Train  The trains cars were kept clean and it was pretty easy to navigate for a first timer to this city Cheap and very convenient  Saves you from the many unscrupulous tax cab drivers

title: Good but too crowded
review: Fast for moving around but too crowded at all times It's a good way if you want to skip traffic Most of the malls have connectivity so you can directly get down and enter malls

title: Convenient traffice
review: Very convenient way to look around Bangkok city There's many famous tourism spot  on the BTS line It's a good choice to avoid stuck in the traffic jam that commonly seen in Bangkok

title: Cuts the guesswork to get to the airport
review: Trains run on schedule to the new airport You are dropped off on the lower level The walk isn't far to the main airport terminal Price for the trip is cheap

title: The best choice of transport at Bangkok.
review: If though you would like to travel around Bangkok it's the best choice for anyone I often take it on Saturday and Sunday

title: Very good skytrain
review: Travel without spending time in taxis Very very cheap long trip from airport to city only 1 euro Good air condition not so cold Full thai people using wifi

title: Best, cheapest and fastest way to get from Airport to the City
review: RailLink is the best cheapest and fastest way to get from Airport to the City At the end station you have a connection to BTS and somewhere in the middle is a connection to the subway So you have a perfect connection whereever you have to go In case you have a hotel at the river check if they offer free shuttle boats to the bts station (most hotels offer)

title: Avoid the traffic jam. Take the Sky train
review: We use the BTS sky train a number of times during our 4 days in Bangkok We could have taken a taxi but we preferred the sky train to avoid the neverending rush hours and traffic jams We note that some of the stations do not have lifts or escalators therefore you may have to climb up the stairs  We were not sure how to buy the tickets but after some observations at the stations we could easily buy the tickets at the machines or tickets booths   Taking the sky train is a very convenient way to travel around Bangkok city

title: Best Way to Downtown
review: Very fast and cheap way to travel from the airport to the city The rides takes only 18minutes The taxi takes arround 4070minutes because the enormous traffic jams in Bangkok The price is very cheap and of course is aircon in the hole train Departure every 14minutes At Makkasan Station is direct link to MRT or BTS

title: The best mode of transportation in Bangkok
review: I strongly suggest to utilise the BTS while you are commuting in Bangkok Most of the stations are located in a very strategic locations especially for food and shopping main attractions

title: Blue Commuter City Line Trains are not even real Airport Link Trains!!!
review: The blue Commuter City Line trains are not suitable as the Airport Link Trains since they were intentionally designed to be city line commuter trains with metrostyle seats which do not offer enough space for airport passengers' luggage How lame It is like SRT is trying to fool us because they think that we are stupid They wanted us to pay extra money for the Red Express line train just to get better seats and more space for luggage So stupid The red express line trains were suppose to be the only airport link trains so they better called it as Airport Rail Link or Airport Train instead of Express Line The red trains are the real ones Why putting the city line commuter train on the same rail tracks as the airport line The city line train was suppose to be running only on the city line rail tracks as a good substitution of metropolitan trains Even worse is that these SRT airport trains never reach Hua Lamphong Grand Central Station and forced some airport passengers with heavy luggage to take a BTS metro instead where there is no space for luggage and the connection between Phaya Thai station and the Airport Link station is too far so the airport passengers with heavy luggage had to walk far while transiting between the 2 lines That's not very convenient at all Extending the airport's link standard gauge rail directly to Hua Lamphong Grand station would be better so Hua Lamphong would have been the Terminal Station and not only for airport link but also for all state railway trains in the entire country included MRT Metro and buses therefore it would have been a great big hub of public transportations This service is kinda inadequate Next time learn to order the right train rolling stocks before putting them in service I wonder what kinds of idiot do not even know this

title: respite from the heat
review: lovely clean airconditioned trainsdislike=too many steps to climb

title: Very convient to use.
review: My husband and I have been in Bangkok a couple of times and always say how assessable this city is with the bts the airport rail etc It connects together so simply and makes every outing enjoyable and simple to use The shuttle is on the lowest floor of the airport You purchase your ticket and take it to the BTS  which is its last stop You then hope on the bts sky train and get to your hotel very quick and simply with no strees at all We will be taking this back to airport as well You save a ton of money and time doing it this way You don't have to battle the traffic o sit in a long cab ride

title: Like Bullet train
review: Amazing experience from airport very fast just few minuted to city center And very cheap If u have 1 luggage can go try right from inside the airport

title: Fast, Efficient and Tourist Friendly
review: As a tourist in Bangkok this was such an efficient and cost friendly option to travel It will take you to all places plus you get a day pass(or 2 days pass) option which is really reasonable if you plan to go around And money exchange places are available in the stations and they share  a common rate which really is a good thing

title: Convenient
review: Easy and convenient way to reach your destination you may have to take another mode of transportation along with it like BTS and a taxi to reach your final destination

title: Very efficient
review: With less bags this can be the idea way to get into the city Then you can get to all MRT & BTS stations Amazing

title: Touring Cyclists - I know what your thinking!
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok The stations are in Thai and English to make it easy for us tourist You can get from one end of the city to the other for only 41 BHT BTS is well organized and easy to use

title: Easy to negotiate
review: The pay stations all display in English and are really easy to operate Quick comfortable and great transport

title: Fast, Cheap, Easy
review: I timed it and it took almost exactly 23 minutes to get from the airport to the Makkasan Station  That's fast  It comes frequently but it still gets crowded  Even so highly recommended

title: Skytrain
review: It is easy to purchase of the tickets Accurate fast airconditioned It is a fast and comfortable way to travel in this massive city

title: My favorite transportation
review: The train is always clean AC going well take you fast short queue safe and a simple navigation system to transfer you Just one word  Recomended

title: Cheap
review: Very easy to use conecting different areas to River piers  Clean frequent and cheap so a good alternative as traffic can be bumper to bumper

title: Best Mode of Transportation in Bangkok
review: Best mode of transportation in bangkok at the moment well if you don't mind being bombarded with advertisements be it posters or loud commercials It is also the coldest place in Bangkok on any given day Remember to bring an umbrella because the condensation from the air conditioning tends to drip down once every second train All that said It still is the best mode of transportation in Bangkok provided your destination is within walking distance of the lines

title: Excellent
review: Great system There was a wait and the trains do not come as often as BTS   It's a special purchased token coin operated rather than a ticket

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to use and covers most of the city The machine only takes coins but the station attendant will give you change It has air conditioning Cheaper than taxis

title: So cheap!!!
review: Compared to the airport train service in KLIA Airport Rail Link in BKK is waaaayyyy much cheaper faster and more convenient Truly impresses as this was my 1st time using this service in BKK

title: Near our hotel
review: Prompt service And strong air con for the hot weather  Gets crowded at peak hours otherwise well connected  Seriously do I need to write 100 words just for BTS FEEDBACK

title: A cool way to travel
review: Although we travelled in rush hour there was no pushing or shoving It was all very calm The air con is fabulous and very welcoming after a hard days sightseeing A really good way to get around nd easy to use Announcements in English so you know where you are

title: clean, cheap, fast
review: Perfect way to get around Once you take your first taxi ride and are bored with tuktuk pollution you'll stick to the skytrain for transport

title: Affordable, clean and easy to use
review: Traveling around a foreign city can be very intimidating especially if you cant speak the local language But taking the skytrain is as easy as falling out of bed and in the instances where you aren't sure of anything you can always just ask any of the tellers for some assistance  The trains are clean well maintained and operate like clockwork this was really one of the easiest travel experiences I have ever had And to top it all off it is very well priced at 25 baht for a 4 station trip which I believe to be very decent Trust me if you are in Bangkok and need to get around don't hesitate to use this mode of transportation

title: So quick. So easy. So affordable.
review: Connecting directly to the Sky Train system and so easily accessible from town and the airport itself this is the only logical way to travel to and from BKK It's a great feeling to watch the slews of traffic stuck in gridlock while your air conditioned train effortlessly whisks past them

title: Easy way to travel
review: Clean and cheap method  very fast and smooth  but you need lots of coins for the machines to get your ticket  they do give change at the counter so you can do this

title: BEWARE
review: I would avoid as no staff speak English or refuse to help whjen they do The numbers and lines advised by staff are not accurate and feel its a ploy to get more money regardless of time of flight

title: modern means of transport in BKK
review: very convenient connect to all the key destinations reasonable fares prompt and frequent arrivals and departuressafe air conditioned comfortable ride

title: Easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: Clean ponctual secure cheap (if you take the right pass) connected to underground and to the airport express train Th√© trafic is so bad that this is THE way to travel in this city And it is airconditioned wich is not bad at all

title: Very easy
review: Handy clean and very easy it takes you about 40 minutes to reach the airport without the transfer

title: Good Enough but Being Late is the Norm.
review: By far the most convenient way to get from downtown to Suvarnabhumi Airport and viceversa The ride is comfortable and relatively fast However the trains always delay and some of them break down more often than other rail services in Bangkok

title: cheap transport
review: The sky train is a handy way to get across town in Bangkok its air conditioned and its very cheap The trains can get very packed and they could be kept a lot cleaner but for a trip across town it is cheap and convenient

title: Great Transit
review: I'm really liking the transit lines here Very fast the stations are nice and I love the payment system You only need to pay for the amount of stations you are going to so going one station is very cheap Everywhere was very clean and I felt very safe Just wish there was more metro lines all over the city to counteract the traffic BTS and the other lines are great

title: Fast and reliable.
review: Do not even consider using anything else than Airport Rail Link for trips fromto BKK airport Fast (30 minutes) reliable and connect directly to SkyTrain Also very afordable AC works overtime in the train )

title: Perfect way around Bangkok
review: Some great tips for you   Traffic is horrendous in Bangkok so always take the sky train to your nearest point where you need to go and then take a taxi You will save a lot of time   Buy A ticket for the next stop Just 15 baht Travel all the way up and down the sky train observing Bangkok from above Travel over the river one stop and back again Get off at your starting point or the next stop That's all it will cost  And all air conditioned  Enjoy

title: Easy moving around with BTS
review: Quite well connected to go to many places in Bangkok Price is cheap also I would recommend to take BTS if possible as sometime taxi don't go by meter

title: Best way around town
review: The sky train is so easy to use says this NYC gal But it's very efficient inexpensive clean and the fastest and easiest way to Get around the city

title: Cheap and easy to use for a tourist
review: This transport is cheap and easy to use for a tourist if you are going to use it more than a few times get a "rabbit" pre paid travel card makes it so much easier than buying single tickets

title: Good and Cheap
review: Is the cheapest transportation from the airport to City it is clean and on time A bit crowded but OK is about 35 to 45 Bahts only as compared to a taxi which is about 400550 Bahts save the $ for beer

title: Best way to get around Bangkk
review: Cheaper then a can or Tuk Tuk and no haggling over the price Can be overcrowded during peak times and you do have to walk up and downstairs to get there but it beats the traffic jams

title: The only way to get around
review: The Bangkok underground is great for getting to somewhere closer to where you want to go The traffic at most times is so bad that you can spend 1 hour going 100 metres So if you know generally where you want to go you get the MRT or the skytrain to the closest point and then grab a cab or tuktuk or as pillion on a motor bike As a senior citizen the MRT has half price tickets as  well but you have to ask at the ticket office and show ID The trains are clean the service is efficient and the staff are helpful

title: Not recommended
review: You spend more time on the bus than you have at the markets The tour guide talks a lot You can skip the trip  it's a waste of time

title: Best way to explore bangkok
review: It is by far the best way of travelling within bangkok It connect most of places you may wanna go and at the same time you can beat the traffic

title: A must use
review: After working out how to use this service WOW best thing ever So easy to move around motel to shopping centers

title: Great experience!
review: Loved a Skytrain Very easy to use and clean Sure beats the traffic Love how people line up on the sides of the doors letting other people to exitvery organized

title: Very regular, always cool inside, but always crowded
review: The only way to travel in Bangkok quite efficient air con very good but seldom got a seat Modernization of station access would be good Lots of stairs not many escalators lifts were restricted to wheel chairs and required a station assistant for their use

title: Such a great transport networj
review: New since we last visited in 2003 and wow what a difference this makes compared to sitting in the traffic in Bangkok

title: Always busy
review: Using it from chatuchak market to sukhumvit Always busy  crowded But they have child  senior ticket price not like BTS

title: Fast and Efficient Transport around Bangkok
review: I always stay somewhere near the BTS It is a fast and efficient way of travelling around Bangkok The trains are air conditioned (always good) and clean They run on time and are a great way of moving around this crazy city Much faster and easier than taxis and tuk tuks The only downside is that the staff at the stations speak very little Englishso don't expect to have any in depth conversations about where you want to go etc with them If you are new to the BTS best talk to the staff at your accommodation for advice and tips Once you get familiar with how the BTS works it is wonderfulfast and cheap )

title: Great way to travel
review: Great way to travel the city Taxis can rip you off Grab app is quite good however traffic jam is just insane Usually you have to stand up during your travel but it is definitely better than the traffic jam

title: Lovely
review: Sky train is also a good experience but gets very crowded sometimes in the evening but very convenient to go from one place to another within minutes and get a good view of Bangkok at the same time

title: Amazing!
review: I wish my city had a skytrain  It was so clean quick cool and easy to use  even if you have to transfer  The booth workers are very helpful and give you the exact change you need to purchase  the fare you require  Excellent way to get from BKK into the city  Our hotel was right off Nana station so the Skytrain was very convenient for us

title: cheapest way to commute in Bangkok!
review: the cheapest way to get you anywhere in Bangkok just try to avoid during peak hours as it going to be super crowded

title: Clean, safe, fast
review: Traffic in Bangkok is terrible This was much faster and more convenient than taxis or driving The only inconvenient part is that there is no line that takes you all the way to the sites near the Grand Palace We got off and walked which allowed us to explore Chinatown

title: Dead easy to use
review: This is cash only so make sure to get local currency before getting into queue From the airport to the city centre stop is about 45 minutes $130 USD and very comfortable

title: Great way to get around the city
review: It spreads across Bangkok making it easy to move around the city The only bad thing is that doesn't offer mobility to people with special needs in all statios  there's a lot of stairs and very few elevators working

title: Good if you have lots of time and want to save money
review: The airport link is good for those who want to save money and have lots of time To get into the city it costs around 60 baht then depending on where you want to go within Bangkok another 40 Per person A taxi will cost roughly 350 by the meter plus 75 in toll way If you are staying at Khao san road then the rail link is not for you

title: It's just transport
review: It's not a touristic attraction in my opinion but a transport facilityand so crowded at rush hours

title: Good Facility
review: I like BTS because its fast and cheap to move around in bankok you can go through to reach shopping mall like Siam paragn and mbk

title: Best way to travel Bangkok's notoriously crowded and jammed streets.
review: For those targeting locations around the BTS stations look no further if you are not a fan of walking Bangkok streets have seriously jammed streets which gets much worse around the rush hours solutions to minimize commuting time is either to walk if weather allows humidity can get seriously uncomfortable at certain seasons OR use the BTS as a safe quick and budget friendly alternative One could either get a onetwo way ticket or simply get a card that can be topped up at 200 BHt ( equivalent to $7 or so  It takes you to the famous malls and shopping Centers along Sukumvit Road including Siam Paragon Central World Terminal 21 MBK and not too far from the weekend market During rush hours when the train is very busy you may want to wait for the nextless congested train which are only a few minutes apart Use your common sense and best practices regarding all crowded areas keep your valuables close and carry minimal cash You wont regret considering this option trust me

title: Excellent depending on were your going
review: Very good for getting round most of the city but sadly some of the major tourist stops are not serviced

title: Life-Saver
review: Definitely take the BTS and MRT when you‚Äôre in Bangkok Saves you from being stuck in horrible traffic jams especially during peak hours Get a stored value card (‚ÄòRabbit Card‚Äô) that you can topup when the value runs low Remember to return the card and get a refund of the remaining value at the end of your stay if you‚Äôre not planning to return to Bangkok anytime soon

title: Well Connected but too cramped on weekends
review: Pricing was reasonable   It was easy commuting between On Nut and Siam Square   However we found it quite cramped and people weren't offering seat to elder people   We understand the that F&B are prohibited on trains However it didn't seem logical to sell F&B but prohibiting eating or drinking at the station

title: Very clean
review: Easy to use very helpful staff and locals for advise the trains are spotless and you can't eat or drink on them

title: Life Saver in Busy Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain is the best thing to happen to Bangkok Taxi are available but due to traffic and also because of language barrier are not effective Ideal way to commute is to take the BTS and the quality safety and punctuality is par excellence It's cost effective and covers most areas specially the town center from and to airport (Suvarnabhumi)

title: Good and fast service
review: Good and fast transport in Bangkok Just the price could be a bit better especially for day passes Otherwise the best and fastes wasy to travel in Bangkok

title: my visit was mainly a rest and shopping.
review: I traveled by airport city link to Ratchaprapop railway station last year  Things were very well organised Every station was announced in English too I found it very easy to find my way to my hotel in Pratunam

title: Airport Link
review: This is the special Metro service from Bangkok city to International Airport of Bangkok Suvarnbhumi Airport Much cheaper than Taxi services in Bangkok Only drawback it is not in operation late night or early morning If you have flight to catch around 2 AM you will not be able to use the services operations hours are from 6 AM to 10 or 11 PM

title: Sky train
review: Absolutely brilliant this makes London seem back in the 80s simple to use clean and efficient cheap and hassle free

title: The Most Efficient Way to Get Arround Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok can be a real challenge but the BTS Skytrain can make that a non issue  Check on your destination and view the map to see if your needs can be met with this highly efficient and economical means  The cars are clean and modern and well air conditioned  The rates are very reasonable and the ticket agents can provide help in addressing your questions and how to get where you want to be  If you travel by cab or other means during peak hours you'll often encounter a nightmare but not so with the BTS  It's not the best answer all the time but it pays to keep this option open

title: Great way to get around BKK
review: Fast clean and efficient way of getting around Bkk The skytrain was much better than I expected It's easy to learn how to use and stops at all the major stops and shopping centers in the city center It's also freezing cold A good escape from the hustle and bustle and heat of the streets

title: Easiest way into the City
review: Don't bother with the taxis Bangkok is so clogged up with traffic it will take longer than the train The airport link is cheap and relatively rapid it joins with the skytrain (BTS) and metro system (MRT) so you have a lot of options to get close to where you want to be Air conditioned nit too busy easy to find from the airport and in town for the way home You do have to walk for 10 minutes between the SkytrainMetro and the airport link but it is relatively unchallenging unless you have a lot of luggage Really think carefully before you take a taxi you have to queue to get a taxi at the airport took us over 30 minutes to even get into a taxi on one of the two occasions we were idiotic enough to go that route and then another 90 minutes and Baht 500 to get to the hotel next to the Sarusak BTS stop how I wish we had gone by train Do yourself a favour take the train

title: Faster
review: 2 Types  of  trains 1 City link ( Stopping All Stations ) 2 Airport link ( Nonstop one end to other )  I been to City Link ( Blue color )  Faster but not good for  heavy luggage  short  distance and more than 1 Pax  If traveling more than 1 person  better  go by Taxi door to door No Train from mid night till 5 am I been to Ramkhamhaeng Station   Ramkhamhaeng Station is  too high and long walk  for a taxi at the main road ( Soi Ramkhamhaeng ) If you are traveling without any baggage its ok

title: Cheapest and Fastest Transport in Bangkok
review: I really like BTS service Buy the oneday pass Only 135 bahts Unlimited use It reaches many shopping malls and popular districts in Bangkok Including Chaktuchak It can get quite crowded during peak hours And since the ticketing machines accepts coins only the easiest way is to buy a oneday pass at the counter Save the hassle of getting coins and the long queues at the ticketing machines

title: Faster than Taxi
review: Although Taxis are a good bargain in Bangkok the Skytrain is much faster in certain parts of town but can be very crowded

title: Convenient, clean & reliable.
review: Only used it twice but got from a to b with no fuss Lots of stops at all the important landmarks Liked being on the surface rather than underground

title: I would give the guide zero stars
review: We booked a private tour for a family of 5 and had a terrible experience as our guide added zero value to the trip She arrived on time but didn‚Äôt know what tour we were going on and was very disorganised  For the entire 6 hours she didn‚Äôt share a single fact She didn‚Äôt speak to us at all in the railway market didn‚Äôt know what was going and it was only her second time there Very disappointed as there was a lot of travelling with three small children and we were hoping the guide could add interest We basically did the tour with the taxi driver as there was no point in the guide being there

title: Beats taxis and traffic jams
review: Cheap and fast and served well Got it from Phrom pong station which is very near where my mini bus to victory monument stops in fact they dropped me at the steps as the traffic was jammed

title: Great way to get around quickly and in the cool.
review: The locals don't use the Skytrain¬†much too expensive For tourists really reasonable and very quick  and the frigid aircon is a boon for cooling down from the outside 40+ degree swelter

title: Nice!
review: After arriving at Suvarnabhumi International Airport Bangkok in the early morning hours I took Airport Rail Link to Phayathai station in Bangkok city From Phayathai station I took BTS sky train to Nana station on Sukhumvit Line My hotel was located on Sukhumvit soi 11 which is at a walking distance from the Nana station The distance is about 12 KM and it took me 10 minutes to cover it A lot of hotels are located in Sukhumvit and one can choose Airport Rail Link and then BTS for the sake of convenience and to some extent comfort

title: Great
review: Fast clean and efficient service Could not fault Best way to get anywhere in Bangkok Also very cheap

title: Best way in and out of Suvarnabhumi
review: You can connect with either the BTS or MRT and this is by far the cheapest most reliable and hassle free way to get to and from the airport Can be crowded at the busier times and they really should add more cars to this train but even when busy its better than Bangkok traffic

title: wow wish we had them in London
review: these are an excellent via of getting around you are not allowed to eat or drink on them and there is proper air con only down side the stations that we used were not very accessible if you had mobility issues

title: Easy & Inexpense ride to the city
review: to me this is the only way to go with bangkok traffic one never knows how long a trip can take we jumped on at the airport and took a taxi from our stop to the hotel easy fast inexpensive

title: Bangkok MRT
review: Very convenient and linked to sky walk connection Not expensive Has wide options with stations at most places of interest A little crowded during peak hours

title: 100% more economical than CAB and lightning fast
review: Airport Rail Link Bangkok is best option to reach city from Airport and Vice Versa It's drops you at 23 major locations like Makkassan and Phaya Thai   Though always overcrowded still too useful  In peak hours Taxi will cost you sometimes upto 1000 THB in evening hours from Sukhumvit to Airport While this one is just 70 BAHT so it's heaven for those who want economical transport to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Great if you are a Backpacker
review: I think it took 35 bahts to reach to the other side of the town from Sukhumvit Airport using ARL It was awesome The taxi would have taken at least 300 bahts along with 2 hours If you are visiting as a backpacker i highly recommend that you take this rail to leave from airport If you are a family count the cost Each person will cost around 35 baht to reach the last station from Sukhumvit using ARL

title: Great way to move about the city.
review: Most oneway journeys were 42 baht A one day pass was 140 baht  When I arrived at the old international airport (Don Mueang DMK) there was a shuttle bus ( 30 baht) from door #6 that drops you off close the Mo Chit SkyTrain station  From there I rode the Skytrain clear into town for only 42 baht

title: Convenient way to get around downtown Bangkok
review: Convenient way to get around downtown Bangkok and super easy linkage to nearby malls with all the covered walkways  Get the "rabbit" card (contactless card) for travel so don't have to queue up everytime for ticket  Deposit thb80

title: Must-do Tour!
review: My husband and I had a wonderful time on this tour We Were picked up from our hotel in a comfortable air conditioned vehicle and made our way to the train station Great driver and tour guide  they also provided us with water after the train ride (which was a blast) And exploring the market The floating market was amazing lots of vendors selling their wares plus we had time to walk around the market afterwards and get something to eat after the boat ride  All in all it was a stressfree tour and well worth the money  I would recommend this to anyone

title: Quick and easy
review: I have been to Bangkok a few times and always find the taxi option a slow ride due to the traffic The prices also vary depending on your negotiating skills Meter rates are very cheap that is why they quote a price instead The skytrain however is a set rate (cheap) and very easy to access They run very frequently and give easy access to major shopping centres such as Siam Square area and MBK

title: Clean, quiet, easy to use once you understand the ticket/coin system
review: Bangkok streets are often clogged with traffic  If the underground rail is near your destination take it  Especially outside of rush hour day or evening  It is clean and feels very safe  Riders obey the 4 yellow arrows on the platform  passengers exit straight out before anyone enters from the sides  So simple so efficient so needed in many western subways  For single rides purchase a plastic coin from one of the machines in the station  When entering there is no slot for  the coin  The coin has a sensor  place it on the turnstile reader and enter  To exit deposit the coin in the slot to release the turnstile   Use the underground rail  So much better than sitting in taxis in traffic

title: Best public transportation

title: Quick and Easy to the Bangkok Airport
review: We were staying at the President Palace Hotel near Nana Station on the Skytrain line  There were 3 of us and a taxi would have cost approx 600 Baht  My kids who are used to taking the Sky train at home (Vancouver) were eager to try the sky train so off we went   One thing you must do if carrying suitcases is to look for the escalators taking you up to the station from the street or down to the street  There is usually only one set of each while there may be two or more stairs From Nana station it was a short ride to the juncture point to transfer to the Airport Rail line  Buying tickets for the Sky train is very easy  Get a map from your hotel and find out where you are getting on and what station you need to get off to get the attraction or point you are going  At the station the yellow dot tells you where you are   Look for the dot where you want to get off and that corresponds to a number  Go to the ticket machine  you need coins so if you don't have any you have to line up at the coin change booth to get some   Back to the ticket dispensing machine  Look for the point where you get off and it has a number  Push that number on the machine and the same number is how much you have to pay to get there  Put coins in and watch the printout tell you how much more you have to put in  Get the ticket and go to the wicket  Put the ticket in take it with you as you need it to get out  At the exit wicket put it into the machine and if you have paid the correct amount the gate will open and the ticket will stay in the machine   At the juncture to the airport rail system you need to exit and buy another ticket  For us the total cost for 3 was approx 45 baht each from the juncture and 31 from Nana station to the juncture (Phaya Thai)  Total cost  226 Baht  If you have suitcases I suggest you get on at either the first or last train since they tend to be less crowded  It's very quick especially the Airport Rail Line  If you are aways from the closest station you can always take a tuk tuk to the station  Its a great way to see the city on the way out since you are elevated and you can avoid being stuck in traffic in the city

title: Exceptional convenience for tourists and easy to use!
review: I visited Bangkok for two weeks and had several days of preplanned tours but also had many days that I could travel on my own or join a tour that was not starting at my hotel  I got a thirty day card with preload number of rides on the train  I forgot the exact amount but it was cheap  less than one cab ride  I didn't use up the card during my stay  The BTS runs every few minutes so planning for exact time was not necessary  It is air conditioned and comfortable  When it was packed and I did not have a seat young people gave up their seat for me since I'm a senior  I found that transfer to MRT was not always convenient (eg Silom) but generally it was seamless  Also station personnel including the security guards were very helpful in giving directions  Overall it is faster and cheaper than taking cabs or risking with tuk tuk or motorcycles

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: Easy to use and very cheap Ticket machines only take coins Change notes at BTS kiosk on each station Name of your destination station shows cost beside it Select destination station Enter amount and ticket is dispensed Put ticket into electronic turn style at front pull it out at top and gates open (green tick) At destination station exit via electronic turn style place your ticket into machine gates open Ticket is retained by machine Easy and cheap travel around Bangkok

title: Nice Train with Great Air Conditioning

title: Great tour, highly recommended
review: What a great experience I highly rate this company Pickup and drop off is super central at River City next to the Sheraton Royal Orchid The tour lasted 6 hours door to door in a high quality minibus with just 12 passengers good AC and a charming and funny local (English speaking) guide The railway market is totally crazy and an absolute must see when in Bangkok On this tour you actually enter the market on the train and then watch it leave from the side of the track which is when all the craziness begins The floating market is also a lot of fun and includes a 30 minute boat ride which is ample time to soak up the sights and sounds You have many options for tours in Bangkok but I would definitely recommend Big Country at just 1k TB per person (including the train & boat ride) this is really great value We booked with a lovely lady called Oh who coordinated everything seamlessly 5 BIG stars

title: Good & convenient
review: On our first time in BKK we stayed 3 mins walk from BTS Ploen Chit and found the GREEN line superbly convenient as most of the famous attractions such as Erawan Shrine Siam Square Platinum Walk (15 mins walk from BTS Chit Lom)  are accessible via this route   It is fast and on time with clear directions for exit gates The guards are very helpful and friendly  In our second visit to BKK this year we realised that the fares are not than cheap compare to taking metered taxi Sometimes especially when you are going further places and during nonpeak hours it usually is cheaper and faster to take metered taxi  We also notice the BTS are not disabledelderly friendly Not every station has lift and escalators Hope they can improve on this area

title: Swift and clean service, refreshing too
review: My experience of BTS is consistently positive from living there 10 years I have since moved overseas and my experience is still very pleasant every time I visit The sky trains come very frequently and I have never encountered a dirty carriage The aircon is so refreshing as you step into the train in contrast to the usual hot and humid weather It is one of my main mode of transport when in BKK

title: Convenient way to move around in Bangkok
review: This infrastructure linked the Bangkok city well It was no different from the MRT of all the Asia countries like Singapore Seoul Taipei and Tokyo U just need to read the route map and then next u can use it well The system just similar to the one from those countries with MRT  It was congested during peak hour this was also similar to the other country But I in Bangkok I would suggest to use BTS especially u are in a rush in peak hour this was because the road traffic was very bad Taxi might even took longer time to bring you to your destination compare to BTS The BTS far is cheaper than the other countries as well

review: So much cheapereasier & faster then a taxi Especially if your accommodation is close to a BTS station Go to ground floor of Suvarnabhumi airport buy a token from ticket office swipe the token to go through the "gate" The last stop on the Airport Link line is Phaya Thai where you insert the token into the "gate" to get out It takes 30min costs 45 baht There is a BTS station (also called Phaya Thai) a short walk from the train station so you can conveniently continue your journey to your accommodation via the BTS (sky train) We didn't travel in peak times so had no issues with not getting a seat

title: Makes it easy to get around Bangkok
review: My mom and I took the BTS skytrain quite a bit while in Bangkok We landed at DMK airport and took the A1 bus to Mo Chit BTS Station and then the skytrain to Asoke which is where our hotel was We took the train quite a bit the second day (first to Taksin from where we could catch the ferry to the Grand Palace later from MBK back to our hotel and in the evening to Thong Lo and back for dinner)  At Mo Chit you can buy a ticket from the ticket office Most other places you can go to the ticket office to get change for your bills because the machines only take coins (1 5 and 10 baht coins) You can also buy a 1day pass from the ticket office which we used the second day we were there and made getting around quite easy  also prevented the need to stand in line every time to buy a ticket There are signs next to the machines that show how much your fare is (it's the number in the circle next to the station to which you want to travel)  The only downsides are that there are no signs indicating when the next train is coming (although we never needed to wait very long) and the train doesn't go everywhere in Bangkok (the one time we took a tuk tuk was to get from a restaurant near the Grand Palace back to MBK Overall was very pleased with the skytrain

title: Important transportation
review: The traffic in Bangkok is terrible  I completely avoided Tuktuks and taxis (it's cheap thoughfare for travelling between the city and airport was about 400baht only) or other forms of transportation during my 4 day trip in Bangkok this recent weekend  Even at around 10pm at night from the Skytrain I still see huge lines of stuck traffic down the road  That's why it's the best means of transportation in Bangkok    But it's definitely not one of the better railway transportation that I have had from my experience of travelling in multiple cities  First off there are no airconditioning in the platform areas  This is a huge turnoff given the yearround heat in Bangkok  I was sweating just from waiting for the train at the platform  Also among many stations I think there are only a few that have lifts andor elevators  Aside from having to walk all the steps in the heat that's a major problem if you are travelling with someone who have walking difficulties    Well I feel safer travelling in BTSskytrain than catching the trainsubway in Paris though  That's a plus   We also managed to purchase the daypass for 130baht each and that's a great saver

title: For Pete sake ! pity the elderly, pregnant women and the monks .
review: Every trip to Bangkok won‚Äôt be completed without taking the BTS skytrain   As now I have relocated to Bangkok for good  so I hope that my observation below may be in tune with like minded commuters who use BTS skytrain just like me   The end seats of the row of each train marked with reserved for elderly  monk & Pregnamt woman is a Joke   I see many old folks pregnant women even the monks  standing in front of that corner seats those who sit there  couldn‚Äôt be  bother to give up their seat not even look at the ppl other than gluing to their hand held phone or dozing off   what a shame to Thais who are known to be gracious and hospitable  Are those days of giving up seats or asking to carry bulky bags are gone with the Tsunami    Look not further than Singapore  the country where her people  many Thais used to laugh at them branded as ‚Äò rude and no culture ‚Äô  In Singapore  there are same reserved seats as in Bangkok  but Singaporeans are ready to give up their seats to those who need the seats more than them Don‚Äôt believe  go and see for yourself and prove me wrong    Dear management of BTS skytrain  please do something  start campaigning to create the awareness among the commuters to really practice the culture of ‚Äò Giving up‚Äô  reserved seats to those who need seats more than them    Singapore SMRT did that and succeeded  Singaporean tourists visiting  Bangkok  are having a good laugh at the Thais now for being ‚Äò rude and no culture ‚Äò   For Pete sake  pity the elderly pregnant women and the monks commuters

review: Clean and efficient service from the city to the airport Be aware that this service is for the New Bangkok airport Suvarnabhumi (BKK) which is located in Racha Thewa in Bang Phli Samut Prakan about 25 kilometres (16 mi) east of downtown Bangkok and which services most International flights However be aware that it is one of two international airports serving Bangkok  The other Don Muang (DMK) is 25Km (16miles) north of Bangkok that provides mainly internal flights within Thailand but also offers International flights for AirAsia Malaysia AirAsia Thai AirAsia and Indonesia AirAsia Transport tofrom Don Mueang Airport is best done by taxi or bus although nonair conditioned trains do run directly to the Bangkok Railway Station at Hua Lamphong Examples of distances and costs are Suvarnabhumi Airport   50km ‚Äì Taxi  45 mins  2 hrs	THB 400  Bus 1  2 hrs	Bus No 554 & 555 THB 25 Central Bangkok (Siam Area)	23 km	Taxi 30 mins  1 hr  THB 250 Bus No 29 THB 20 Mo Chit (for connection to BTS & MRT)	14 km Taxi 30  45 mins 	THB 150 Hua Lamphong	25 km Taxi 30 mins  1 hr Taxi	THB 200

title: Crazy busy but fun!
review: In the morning the company we booked through Get Your Guide picked us up right on time at 820 am Clean bus 10 people and a guide and driver Explanation in English and to the Maeklong railway Arrived there 1 hour We plunged into the crowds looked at the shops and bought souvenirs At a nice time we sat down on a tiny terrace and waited for the train It is a treat to see how the shops are adapted on the train The driver of the train drove by with a big smile and everyone was happy High fives exchanged with the train passengers After the train get back on the bus and go to the floating market Also an experience in itself We were put in a boat and sailed across the water past the various shops and boats that sold all kinds of things Lots of vegetables fruit and herbs and the necessary knickknacks It was incredibly busy we were in a kind of rowing boat but there are also boats with a longtail that race through everything Back on the quay we had a quick look around had lunch with a reasonable Thai snack and boarded the bus for the return trip Back at the hotel at approximately 245 PM All in all it lasted just long enough super touristy but still fun

title: Very efficient and convenient for a quick trip or any other time.
review: Landed at BKK and had a 24hr layover in Bangkok Spent the night at a nearby hotel The next morning returned to BKK and checked my bags in at the left luggage room on the 4th fl by the airline check in desks I headed to the basement level of BKK to get the BTS Don't change any money until your by the BTS gate Best rates no fees From the BKK airport stop Blue Line the BTS  takes you almost all the way downtown 40 mins From the last stop Phaya Thai about 75 Baht by taxi to Wats the Palace riverfront Chinatown  Very efficient convenient and economical On board line map displayed over doors and station announcements Can get crowded at what I thought would be off peak evening hours Both ticket machines and staffed ticket booth I grabbed a taxi to get from the riverfront back to the BTS station The taxi driver even after showing him my map and a passerby tried to help was unsure of the station stop "Phaya Thai" or  "Blue Line" by name When I said "BTS' he immediately acknowledged me and knew where I wanted to go An hour later I was retrieving my luggage and checking in for my flight The adventure continues
