review: You have to try this A skytrain cool (Get a jacket) fast with an incredible view to the huge buildings of Bkk

title: Easy & efficient above Bangkok's traffic
review: The easiest and most efficient way to get around in Bangkok is by SkyTrain (also known as BTS) It is very affordable and per trip tickets are available through automated ticketing machines at all the stations The clean and  airconditioned cabins also provides a cool respite from the tropical heat of the streets below With BTS you can get to almost all the major city attractions and Bangkok mega shopping malls Siam station is the main interchange station and it is surrounded by Siam Square Paragon Shopping Mall and other major malls Getting to the Chatuchak weekend market is easy as it is just a 5 mins walk away from Mo Chit station Trains can get quite crowded during the peak hours but it is to be expected as in any other large cities However I never had a problem with this at all I hardly ever take a taxi within Bangkok as I have always found the SkyTrain to be a much more efficient option given the heavy traffic on Bangkok streets

title: User-friendly public transit
review: I found the BTS to be easy to use clean and a more affordable way to experience Bangkok than by Taxi

title: The best way to avoid traffic jams in Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic jams can be a bit of aa nightmare The airconditioned BTS is the best way to travel Worth buying a Rabbit card ( THB 200 cost of card THB 100 & comes preloaded with THB 100) The Rabbit card is reloadable and holds good for 5 yearsIts quite like the Oyster card in UK

title: Waiting for express
review: The express line which stopped in 2011 was the best possible way to get to downtown Bangkok taking just 18 minutes The local that takes 30 m is the second best is advisable only if travelling solo as one has to change trains at Phya Thai (or find other modes of transport) to go further Also since it stops at all stations it tends to be overcrowded and travelling with big luggage is not pleasant for anyone in the car

title: Cheap and easy
review: I was a little intimidated at the idea of taking public transport into the city from the airport instead of a taxi but needn't have been It was incredibly easy to use easy to tell where you were fun views (especially as someone who'd never been to Asia before) No worries in the least

title: Save money and save time
review: This Airport Link is very convenience for me save money save time and very near my place where i am stay It a short time to the town

title: A Superb Underground
review: The MRT takes you to the corners of Bangkok unaccessible by the BTS  Built 8 years after the BTS the MRT is brilliantly designed signposted and efficiently run Arm yourself with the map and when in doubt ask for help from the always courteous staff  Ask for and claim you Senior Citizen concessions (often 50%) at the ticket booths  The Thai's have a culture that is truly respectful always show geat self control and have a nonconfrontational attitude Be sure  that as a tourist you reciprocate

title: Cheap, convenient and easy to use
review: Ticket machines are in English and easy to use Cheap convenient and quick mode of transport into the city Travelled to Phaya Thai station at 8pm Plenty of seats and space for luggage PhayaThai station had a lift to the ground floor so no humping suitcases up and down stairs Would recommend

title: Nice Experience
review: Its my first time taking a train and this experience makes me want to do it more I bought the 1st class so the shower and toilet are shared with just the 1st class cabins which consist of about 12 in all The room is an alright size with a small wash basin Each room has 2 bed the top and bottom which me and my friend shared It is not as I imagined with the choochoo sounding and noisy It is airconditioned and very comfortable (velvet seats) and it made a few stops along the way so it is very relaxing You are free to walk thru all the trains and the canteen is at the 7th section I would advise not to order the food when they come around to take order as you will have more choice when you go to the canteen yourself and it is definitely more enjoyable thou the seats are limited Thou it is a 16 hours ride from BKK to Hatyai it passes all too quickly Will definitely try again It is fun for someone who is experiencing train ride for the first time

title: Bangkok will be ruined without this!
review: Very convenient for those who want to commute in Bangkok It is connected with MRT at Silom Asoke and Mochit station Also connected with Airport railink at Phayathai station

title: Convenient to Travel Around
review: We used the BTS to go shopping around bangkok It was really good and convenient to beat the traffic

title: Very convenient
review: You can access to many shopping malls and night markets If you go there from time to time get a rabbit card If you do not have changes at late night you may be able to buy ticket as the office counter closes before the end of train services

title: Convenient
review: This is a very efficient mode of transport and once you master the various destination stops it is easy way to get around the metropolis of Bkk

title: inexpensive, convenient way around bkk
review: fast way to get around bangkok during our stay we used bts for almost all of our trips around the city it is clean comfortable and AC works great    Avoid rush hour though you surely don't want your face stuck in someone's armpit   Ticket machines accept coins only so be ready to have coins or have your bills replaced with coins at the ticket booth  I'd recommend using BTS (aside from walking around) its cheap very convenient you get to see and feel Bangkok more plus you get to avoid traffic and cabtuktuk drivers who will try to rip you off

title: quick travel but limited
review: The route is limited and the trains are very crowed week days and weekends  However due to the intense traffic it is a must for getting places quickly  Get as close as you can on the train then take a tuttut

title: bts skytrain
review: this is the quickest 25mins and cheapest 45Bhat "jan 16" way into the cityit stops 8 times in the suburbs and terminates at Phaya Thai  always very busy

title: Fast and cheap mode of transportation
review: Travelled to Bangkok for a short stay and have already read a lot about BTS and MRT  As I wanted to travel like a local on a shoestring budget I thought to use the 1 Day unlimited travel pass to explore the things on my own  Pros  1 Clean stations 2 Good security checks 3 Easy navigations onboard the train 4 On time performance (Luckily there was no breakdown or delay during my visit) 5 Announcements in local as well as English language 6 Gives beautiful view of the city  Cons   1 Some stations may not be accessible with  escalators either side you need to walk through the stairs or the to catch the escalators you need to climb some steps manually  2 As I am coming from Singapore I expected 1 pass to work through all the public transportation system(atleast the metro rail if not on the buses) but I understood a BTS pass cannot be used on MRT  ProTip  1 Apply for 1 day unlimited pass at 140 baht to explore the whole of BTS  2 If coming from Don Muang Airport Airport Bus 543 at 30 baht to Mochit station and then BTS to your stay will be useful combination  3 If planning to explore Grand Palace and Temples alight at Saphan Taksin BTS Ferry Charge is 1520 Baht per person from Saphan Taksin BTS to the pier 8 from which you can walk to Grand Palace and the famous temples  4 A stay near BTS Asok is helpful for those willing to explore Sukhumvit Areas   5 BTS Asok is walkable to Sukhumvit MRT Terminal 21 Mall and other Nightlife Attractions  6 Ekkamai and Morchit BTS stations have Bus Terminals to transit to Pattaya  7 If you have plans to goto Pattaya it will be nearer to goto Ekkamai BTS from Asok  Do let me know if you found my review helpful‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: It works!
review: Tickets are bought very easily cheap clean takes you almost anywhere in Bangkok great views Worth a ride

title: Good transportation infrastructure from the airport.
review: 45B 30 minute ride to connecting train ride into the city almost not worth getting a taxi from the airport if you know where you are going this is like the kind of train you could expect in Japan from Narita

title: Cheap and reliable
review: Probably the best way to travel in Bangkok The fares are cheap and trains are generally not that crowded compared to the BTS Great transportation service to utilize when going to your shopping destinations like Terminal 21 and Chatuchak

title: Fun day with Sara
review: Such a fun day Sara is the sweetest and wisest woman Really do recommend you this genuine and happy day The markets are what you expect and Sara makes the day

title: Crowded but beats the traffic
review: It is very easy to use and great to avoid the horrible Bangkok traffic  Also we found it to be very clean  It can get super crowded

title: Trains are really good
review: Very well maintained safe secure fast We travelled mostly in train whenever possible it is cheap and fun

title: BEST TRANSPORT IN BANGKOK
review: The skytrain is such a great way to get around the city even if it doesnt get you close its still the best mode of transport to get you close enough to then get a taxi meter or motorbike taxi to your final destination Yes at certain times during peak hour there is a hussle and bustle but just go with the flow dont get all pushy and abrupt and you'll be fine The Thai people still offer there seats to kids elderly and monks which shows a great respect that other cultures don't do much anymore which is a shame But if i had 1 negative to say if you have a backpack on take it off your back and put it between your legs when its on your back when the BTS is crowd and trust me sometimes i think they are going for the Guinness Book of Records for most people in a carriage your backpack not only takes up alot of space but unbeknownst you take out alot of people  To sum up a great and quick way to get around the city go with the flow relax and enjoy the experience I use it all the time in Bangkok would travel any other way

title: Easy and cheap to use
review: We used this to get around some areas (it's a shame it doesn't cover more as traffic is immense) Very modern bright airey easy to use and very cheap

title: Excellent way to get to and from the Airport
review: This is a really quick convenient and economical way to travel between the airport and the city (and points in between)  There is plenty of space for luggage too  I often stay in the Huamark area and can get there from the airport in about 15 minutes at a cost of around 30 baht (about a dollar)  It certainly pays to have a hotel close to one of the stations  The Nasa Vegas in Huamark comes to mind and it is actually connected to Ramkamheng station by a covered overhead walkway  Can't get much more convenient than that

title: For most visits in city centre.
review: Skytrain works easy Choose your destination put 10 baht coins in the machine get a card and travel in a sometimes to cold skytrain

title: Good public mass transport system to reach core areas in Bangkok
review: You can reach shopping areas in Sukumbhit few attractions weekends market MBK by BTS system Get a multi trip BTS card to avoid long Queue at stations Bangkok planning network of BTS and MRT work progressing Have good connections through foot bridges access to shopping in Sukumbhit SIAM and Chitlom

title: Add more carriages.
review: The stations are clean and well kept The staff kind and helpful Very efficient way to communicate around the city away from traffic The train is clean and efficient But I don t understand why they pack us like in a can of sardines They use only four carriages while the station is long enough to accommodate three more so that we can all travel more conformfortably Women with prams and babies or elders with difficulties It would not cost much more at all Instead  they squeeze us on top of each other This is awful

title: Fantastis Exoerienced
review: Best Tour GuideMsYui really help us and give many good information and always make us comfirtable during the tour

title: Train service.
review: This is the ARL train that connects between Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK) and downtown Bangkok Fares are available on a singletrip basis (by using token)

title: Avoid traffic jam!
review: Nearly 99% of the time I am using BTS or MRT to travel within Bangkok to avoid traffic jam   Their network cover most of the Shopping Malls within Bangkok

title: Excellent Underground Network
review: I always love to travel by MRT whenever I stay around Rachadaphisek area This is the only option and most of the stations are nearby so whichever hotel you stay there will always be a MRT station around It connects to BTS Sky train at Sukhumvit which makes it easy to go around the tourist hub However avoid travelling around 56 pm towards Bang Sue as trains are very crowded and there are long lines at the platform However commuters are very disciplined and courteous

title: Walk from SIAM BTS to ChitLom BTS
review: The SIAM BTS station is an interchange  So make sure you look at the direction of the route before hoping onto the train You might have to take the escalator to another level for another sets of trains depending on which line you are taking Below the BTS station you will find the walkway link from SIAM to Chit Lom Station This link will bring you to direct access to Central World It's a good option to walk to the shops from this walkway link as you are sheltered from the rain and sun and traffic on the street level

title: Convenient method of transportation
review: The presence of the Airport Rail Link makes transportation more convenient not only to and from the airport but also within the city as well  not as much as the BTS however The only complaint I have is that there are not enough trains and as most people are probably on tight schedules you end up with too many people on each car

title: BTS better the US subways/el
review: Fast and reliable Pay as you go The passes are really only beneficial if you live in BKK Better then the subwayEl systems in the USA

title: excellent
review: very easy to get perfect air conditioning clean Cheap and you don't need to bargain like with the taxi drivers

title: Best way to get there in a hurry
review: Well organised mass transport in a City that is otherwise choking in traffic The choice of prepaid card or payment just for one trip is also advantageous

title: frequent, efficient, excellent value for money
review: At the airport look for floor 1 and buy a token at the machine get on and relax your trip to the inner  city will be all right

title: Cheap and very quick transport
review: I use MRT nearly every day as a resident in Bankkok As a pensionist you get half price Just ask for "elder ticket" at the ticket counter

title: 2-Hour train ride, worth it for the experience
review: Slightly repetitive after 2 hours (you have to come back the same) but nevertheless a historic experience you do once in a lifetime And 100 baht only

title: impressed
review: I am obviously a visitor and have not used the SkyTrain daily to commute so my view may be simplified but I was very impressed by the orderly queueing the general cleanliness and just the overall practical use of the SkyTrain in a city with a traffic problem Skip the taxi and the jams take the SkyTrain

title: A most necessary evil
review: The BTS or Skytrain is a must for Bangkok's mad traffic  Once you've squeezed onto it it whisks you across the city in airconditioned comfort assuming you are lucky enough to get a seat Yes it's an ugly scar on the city streets but it's so needed  Strange though they didn't invest on extending the underground or MRT instead To me Bangkok's BIG mistake is investing heavily on building new roadways many at very expensive high levels competing with the concrete pillars of the BTS  The more roads you build the more traffic it will attract into the city  Traffic should be dissuaded from city centres and the money invested in extending public transport like the MRT and BTS The BTS is so successful that it's nearly always overcrowded  The money should be spent on either longer trains (more carriages) or more frequent trains (currently every 10 or so minutes) But it remains a truly great way to get about Bangkok and it's crazy traffic

title: Very efficient in rush hour
review: Sometime very busy and crowded but in rush hours 40 minutes and you're downtown Bangkok Outside rush taxi is better and not that expensive

title: Very cheap, easy and quick way to get around bangkok
review: This isn't really "something to do" in Bangkok you don't need to experience the skytrain or anything but it is a really good way of getting around and it's really cheap avoids the taxis and traffic of bangkok it's not as big as the London underground but a lot of main places are covered and if the destination you're going to isn't near a stop then just go the closest place and get a taxi from there probably still better It's pretty easy to understand and when you buy a ticket there is a map of the BTS on the back of the ticket to help you get where you're going Super useful

title: Very easy to use
review: Get about no problem even in rush hour as you seem to squeeze in Day passes are the best as you don't have to keep loads of loose change to pay for your tickets

title: Good
review: Every bts provide free map for us It's easy to get direction It's cheap and fast The price of ticket is different according to your destination U can buy rabbit card if u dont want to queue U can save the card and refill it

title: Very Convenient
review: Extremely cheap clean fast and convenient option to get out of the airport and into Bangkok I highly recommend taking the rail from the airport to a station in the city and then hailing a taxi or tuk tuk to complete the journey to your hotel

title: Prompt, efficient and cheap.
review: Given the traffic on the roads the skytrain is a brilliant way of getting to the airport Quick frequent and cheap

title: Reliable travel
review: From BTS phyathai station I took the airport link connected within to the airport link station only 57 minutes walk direct to the suwanaphumi airport   Very reliable always on time never late and traveler friendlymeaning that it has place for baggage‚Äôs and comfortable seats   Cost only 45 ($140) per trip one way

title: Getting around BKK
review: The BTS Skytrain is convenient clean fast cheap and the best way to get around Bangkok     Staff is helpful and the maps are easy to read and switching lines is also quite easy

title: Okay, I guess
review: I've done this tour before  a few different times to the floating market and at least once to the railway market Most of the experience is right there to see and requires little explanation  Unfortunately our guide today suffered from a desire to talk a lot combined with very poor English pronunciation She insisted on having us all write our names and then mispronouncing the vast majority of mine which was pretty irritating Also insisted on very banal and unnecessary advice on things like the exchange rate of THB to USD and other such things  So while it's really an easy tour to deliver she made the experience slightly irritating and made me wish she'd minimize the explanations and let us just see stuff for ourselves  Another problem that happens with this tour is that usually they just take you to the railway market to experience the train going through the market inches from you  which is great of course I haven't yet found a tour which puts you in the train which would also be a very good perspective

title: Avail Airport rail link to avoid traffic
review: The connectivity is super Our hotel was at Sukhumvit So to reach there we took a airport link train till Makasan and from there took a cab to our hotel It took only half n hour for us to reach hotel during the busy day at Bangkok

title: Excellent Experience - Chiang Mai to Bangkok
review: We were rather keen on experiencing a train journey in Thailand Having read so much about the great country side views we booked ourselves on Train No 14 from Chiang Mai to Bangkok in 2nd Class ac compartment  We booked just two days in advance and were glad to be allotted the preferred lower berths On the day of our journey we were rather surprised to note that about the half the compartment was vacant   The compartment was very clean and the toilets and wash basin areas were also absolutely clean and smelling fresh Our overall experince was amazing and it was a treat to watch the beautiful country side in the few hours of daylight At around 6pm the attendant came and made up the beds The bedding blankets pillows were all spotless and totally clean The airconditioning of course is quite on the colder side as most other reviwers have mentioned This however was easily taken care of by using additional blankets which the attendant gladly provided  In one of the reviews I read about berth length being small and was worried on this issue as I am 6ft tall When the seats were flattened out I was pleasantly surprised on his count too Point to be noted though is that the given pillows are pretty thick which i did not use my guess is that a tall person using such a thick pillow would automatically get pushed down by say 6inches or so and would feel congested on the length of the berth  Our another worry was catching the early morning connecting flight The train started on dot at 1600 hrs and reached us on time at 535am on Don Mueang station The attendant was very attentive and woke us up on time at 500am further this kind attendant even helped us unload our heavy baggage when alighting out of the train  All in all we had an really great experience Whether it is service cleanliness punctuality ride quality we would definately rate it excellent on all parameters

title: Good transit for light traveller and on a budget only...
review: If you are alone or a group and have two luggages or more w spinners on them and with carryon I say just grab a taxi in the airport it is not that expensive as long as you requested the to use the meter stay away from taxi drivers that will not use meter though But if you still want to ride the MTR use the elevators and not the people movers or escalator You will have a hard time holding those spinners luggage from staying put while you go down Each stop stations are interconnected by above the street bridge but be aware there are no elevators in the train station ( if there is ask for it as I did not see one) and the stairs steps are narrow in width and kinda steep I saw at least three tourists with luggage in tow slipped and fall on these stairs and it was not a good sight

title: Transportation in city
review: Clean comfort fast enough cheap I used the bts a lot during the holiday in bangkok Make sure to have coins or go to the service desk to get change

title: The only way to get around central Bangkok quickly
review: The sky train continues to be the most popular way to travel around central Bangkok  If you are traveling to Bangkok for business or pleasure ensure you book a hotel that is in walking distance of the skytrain or metro  Be warned though that you need to be fit  All skytrain stations have staircases to walk down to the street level  sometimes as many as three floors  Most skytrain stations have escalators to get up to the trains and some stations have elevators

title: Good A/C, clean train, but a bit confusing
review: We rode the sky train all over Bangkok We were staying directly in front of one of the stops so allegedly it was to be an easy excursion each time We started at the airport and upon our transfer to another train line to get to where our hotel was we had to ask several people because the signage for the trains was not very userfriendly that is if you don‚Äôt speak Thai We realize that we are in their country and not everyone puts up English signs however Bangkok is the most visited city in the entire world so you would think that it would be a little bit easier The trains were very well airconditioned very clean and we felt safe on them at all times Thank goodness for the Thai people who could speak English and help us

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: In Bangkok traffic jams can be really bad and gridlock can be more the norm Easy to use and safe Quickest to use BTS and walking to get around

title: Have to love the bts
review: I was in Bangoko for just over a week  For the first day we bought a one day pass which we also used on arrival from the airport after taking the train to Phaya Thai  Having the one day pass allowed us to go to Saphan taksin to udum suk  for Kia and the back and forth all day  We then used a rabbit card for the week which is 450 Bhat fr 15 trips for the week  This means you do not have to stand in a queue for each trip and can be cheaper than buying a ticket for each trip  bts is very easy to use you just need to look forthe last station on the line you are taking to know which way to go If you go in the wr g direction simply get off at the next station and switch trains  I was also there when the service had technical problems so essentially hardly working for a day However fixed for the next day and working like clock work  You can get around Bangkok in a very short time and avoid the traffic jam  Most bts stations  only appear to have stairs soyou would need to be able to climb up and down   Great way to see Bangkok Inexpensive quick convenient

title: Very convenient
review: Travel by BTS is much faster than by car as the traffic jam in Bangkok is just crazy Easy to navigate for tourist

title: The punctual way to and from Suvannabhumi Airport
review: Airport rail link helps the travelers and passengers to get into or out from the city center with economical transport fare without any nervous with traffic jam  pls be good to walk inside the train especially in rush hour

title: Worst than many country
review: When you travel arroud you will see how terrible of it and they never change   In other country in peak time is mess but here is wrong you cannot mange the time here

title: Travel
review: Ive never experienced the most convenient way to go to and from the airport Airport Link in Bangkok is the fastest way to go to the airport and from the airport to the city or to move to another sky train to your destination but if your traveling with big baggages or loads of bags and your alone better yet take the taxi If your in a hurry to go to the airport take the link The train is spacious and fast

title: Very touristy and a long drive
review: We were picked up at our hotel and taken to River City Bangkok where we were checked in and ushered to a large bus with AC Note that the tour description said a max of 15 people There were 28 in our group with a single guide We drove for ~90 min to a train station and then boarded a train to ride into the market One we got off the train we spent about 20 min  at the market mostly to watch the train depart Then back on the bus for a 30 min ride to the floating market We just had time for lunch and then boarded boats for a 30 min ride through the market  Overall the excursion was very touristy  I think those markets exist only due to the tourists And it was a long drive But there were some interesting moments I was annoyed that we were left off at the end at MBK Bangkok (huge mall 50 min walk from our hotel) rather than where the tour started There was no mention of this in the listing and we therefore assumed that the tour would end where it started

title: Ridding the rails in Bangkok
review: Bangkok has a terrific city transit system and I believe you can get just about anywhere you need to without needing a taxi or tuk tuk  The stations have great directions and maps and there are manned booths and tickets machines which take the coins required for each trip  A fast and great way to get around and easy to use

title: Sarah is a superwoman!
review: We had a wonderful trip to Damnoen Saduak Market and Maeklong Railway Market today Sarah kept us all on schedule to avoid traffic and crowds  She was always hustling around even when it was time for lunch‚Ä¶she helped to take our orders and expedite having the meals at our table She is full of information jokes and kept us entertained through out the process  She made lots of memories for us and we are so glad we booked this tour

title: Train to Bkk Suvarnabumi airport
review: Cheap and comfy to avoid sitting in the taxi during the heavy traffic of Bangkok only  if you don't have big luggage

title: Efficient and cheap
review: It runs promptly on time and fast and cheap Was there with a thai friend who took care of the ticketing so I don't know how that works Outside the train you wait on each side of the door so people can get out before you get in There are even arrows on the floor showing you where to stand )

title: Very clean and cheap
review: Used this several times and found it to be punctual and cheap Very clean and not too overcrowded Worth a go for the views of the city

title: Visit Bangkok in January & March 2018
review: We travel in Bangkok usually use the BTS due to traffic jam even on late evening especially in down town around Siam & Chit Lom   Even my destination is not close to BTS station I will take BTS and transit by taxi as it save the time for traveller

title: Convenient and easy to use it
review: The Skytrain is very convenient to avoid the traffic in Bangkok and very easy to use it and comfortable

title: Great way to get around!
review: Works perfect everything from ticketsystem to timing is just perfect And you do not have to sit in a taxi for hours blocked in traffic

title: Quick, Fast, & Cool
review: If ever wanting to get to some locations in Bangkok in a hurry take the MRT underground train  The train system hits many city locations and for a fraction of the price it would cost for say a taxicab  However as one might imagine if utilized during the rush hour periods it WILL be very crowded That being said it's very rapid in getting from place to place and has nice cool air conditioning  Finally if you're a "frequent flyer" (user) of this train system (haha) you can obtain a special 'M' card at the ticket booths where you'll pay a small deposit and can then top up for as much as you want whenever you want and then won't have to fiddle around with waiting in line to pay in cash or coins at the machines or maned booths and only getting a one time card for that trip That way with the special 'M' card you can hit multiple stations just by scanning the card any time without having to pay for each trip with money ANDas an additional feature (and at any time) you can turn the card in to the ticket booths to get a refund if you do not wish to use it any longer They have a small menu at the ticket booths showing the different M cards available and prices and are very inexpensive so check them out if you think you may be using MRT multiple times

title: easy transportation
review: in bangkok BTS was a smart way to go to any place  becasuse traffic in CBD was so terrible If you are traveler please choose the hotel that located near BTS stattion

title: Would be excellent if only they had more carriages
review: By far the fastest and most reliable of getting from BKK airport to central Bangkok Would be even better if they had enough carriages to use the whole platform

title: Fast and Smooth
review: We recently took this train from our hotel to MBK shopping centre in Bangkok  The procedure is very simple and we arrived in quick time  Very clean and feel safe

title: You are never alone!
review: Much faster than a taxi since traffic is a nightmare Very crowded though most use deodorant  They don't seem to break down or i did not ever experience a delay

title: Very efficient.
review: Fast clean and cheap Great way to get around the city  if you are english speaking only it can be a bit confusing so be sure you know our stops in advance Buying the tickets can be done by machine or thru a ticket desk where you can ask questions

title: fast,and connect easy
review: it was easy to go to the main point in bangkok we no need to have a problem with traffic jam convenience clean fast safe the time

title: Comfortable and easy
review: This is a nice way to get around in Bangkok Nothing special though Just a means of transportation As everywhere else it is bit crowdy if you use it in peak hours

title: Quick and comfortable
review: Comfortable travel within the city and easy to understand even for foreigners The maps are easy to read and the trains are quite smooth

title: Easy for everyone
review: The BTS is covinient and easy for every one to use Although it doesn't take you to everywhere in the city it can get you close enough and if your not sure where you need to go the map on the back of the ticket is very useful

title: On time comfort transportation in busy Bangkok
review: If you are a budgeted traveler and if you need to explore every inch in Bangkok your answer is BTS in Bangkok All caravans are AC and very comfortable  Since you get a train in every 5th it's not crowded at all However compared to other public transportation it's expensive Minimum cost is 18B if I'm not mistaken and it's just to pass one station But with huge traffic it's worth  All stations are connected with iconic place or a major shopping mall They have 2 train lines and Siam is the only interchange You must try this in Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: convenient and cheap for travellers to suvanabhumi airport easy to use but you need to purchase ticket you can't use the rabbit card

title: Amazing value for money.
review: Great guide great organisation and an opportunity to meet people Worth the price would definitely recommend as you can see two very interesting locations

title: Sky train, beat the traffic in super cool air :)
review: What a blessing the sky train is in Bkk The traffic in Bangkok is notoriously bad so to have a super cooled air train that is always on time and speeds past the hours of traffic in minutes is really the only sensible option to take Can get busy during early morning and after work time but let's be honest your a tourist and you can avoid those times )) Enjoy your trip and download a BTS map

title: Quick, cheap
review: At the moment they only had the City Link which stops at all stations Not a problem for us but some seemed to miss the quick connection A bit crowdy but efficient And cheap we paid 40 baht per person to Rajpraprop station which is close to Baiyoke Sky hotel

title: Easy access
review: Good transportation system that connects me to the places that I need to visit It may not cover the whole Bangkok but it was sufficient enough for business and touristy stuffs

title: An easy way to get around Bangkok, a great system MRT
review: The MRT is a great underground rail system that also connects to the BTS Sky rail  You might find your first experience obtaining your ticket a little difficult as it is different to the BTS system the touch screen is the same system as used on the MTR in Hong Kong so if you have used that system it will be easy  The system is in Thai and English so select English and if you know the station where you want to go to then touch that station and you will see your fair come up insert your money and out will come a round disc you swipe the disc as you go through the entrance and when you are leaving you insert the disc into the slot and the gate opens  If you are uneasy about using the system for the first time then go to the office and buy your disc there as the staff are very good and very helpful I would suggest trying to use the system during the quiet time as at peak times there are hundreds of people all lined up waiting to get there disc  If you are going to be in Bangkok for a few days or longer and using the MRTa lot i would suggest you buy a ticket from the office as you can top up the ticket at any MRT office for as little as 100 Baht = Aust $4 the card will cost you a few dollars and is not refundable but the time you will save standing in lines and having to carry change for your ticket then it is well worth while i use the card all the time as it is so easy and quick and very quick to top up  The MRT is a very fast service and if you miss one train there is usually another train with in about 4 minutes the trains are very clean and like the BTS there is no drinking or food to be eaten and do not leave your rubbish on the train take it with you and show respect for the other people  Entering the MRT station is the same as the BTS there are security guards to inspect your bags and luggage as they are there for all our safety When on the station stand behind the yellow line and to the side of the entrance to the train that allows the people to get off and makes it easy to get on that is the same system as the BTS

title: Overnight train from Chiang Mai
review: Took train 10 from Chiang Mai  to Don Mueang airport Bangkok  amazing  Had first class sleeper compartment with two bunks made from comfy seats  Compartment also had a little wash hand basin and table  Toilets were at the end of the carriage and were always clean and well supplied with paper and soap  There‚Äôs also a shower with shampoo and shower gel  The lovely lady looking after us gave us a wake up call before our destination and helped us with our luggage  There‚Äôs a restaurant car but we didn‚Äôt use it  Would recommend this train  had a lovely sleep

title: Fantastic

title: Easy
review: Most convenient and cheapest way to get into Bangkok from the airport Avoid the annoying taxi drivers and get on the railway

title: A must see

review: Very reliable clean and cheap way of getting to a lot of the Bangkok sights One way tickets are a great way to use this system as you can the come back via another mode of transport

title: VACATION
review: Very nice and comfortable It is safe here I thought it was gonna be like a dark subway system where it was feted with bad company I was wrong This train is very clean comfortable and safe

review: Very Safe and easy connectivity to the city  Very systematic and well planned time table schedule of the Airport Railway Link

title: Highlight was the local train ride
review: Located in Kanchanaburi over 120km West of Bangkok close to the Myanmar border  the Death Railway or BurmaSiam Railway serves as a reminder of the history and cost of World War II Over 90000 locals and 12000 war prisoners lost their lives building the railway The tour involves all transfers a visit to the well documented memorial museum and cemetery a boat ride and local train journey between Tha Kilen and Nam Tok A good day trip a much better choice than the Floating Markets if you are deciding between the two

title: Convenent
review: This is a very easy way to get around Bangkok Best to purchase a top up card if you plan to ride around for a few days as buying single trip card can be difficult as there will be a huge crowd during rush hour especially at Asoke station

title: Best mode for Airpot
review: I have many times travel thru ARLalways find it convenient specially with family & time worthy keeping in view the traffic in Bangkok It connect all major areas which are known for tourists I recommend to prefer it always instead of taxienjoy

title: Take a ride

title: Good fast and cheap
review: This is a good way to go to the airport Never problem with trafficjam If you donnot have to much luggage it's good

title: BTS
review: At first it can be daunting But having been in a few days its super easy fast and so cheap Warning if climbing steps is not your thing than learn this BTS  sits higher than the road and some cases buildings To get up there you need to go thru the shopping areas Its easy But longer walks Great if you want to diet and exercise Purchase ticket and watch which platform and where to get off Look at the chart on the train Listen for stations My favourite is NANA Just stand and listen how sexy it sounds I have guys using their phones to record the voice haha Gosh still in my head NANA

title: Forget taxis
review: Bangkok traffic is still a problem so get to know the Sky Train  Its air conditioned  fast frequent and visits lots of the attractions you will want to see You need coins to buy a ticket which can be obtained from a window near the ticket booth  You need to insert ticket on the way to the platform and again when you leave Unlike many others cities locals seem not be honest and actually buy a ticket When we were in Bangkok after you proceed through the turnstile a security will have a quick look inside any carry bag I presume that this will now be a feature of Bangkok life after a few incidents in the past It's done quickly and politely We found the station announcements to be clearly spoken in Thai and English

title: Airport to Piya Thai rail connection - excellent option to taxi
review: You can take train to to its last station which cost 45 Bhat per head then you can take taxi to the hotel You can avoid traffic jam and at the station their is a desk to help you in finding taxi without any additional charge

title: Excellent
review: Fantastic what a simple way to get to the airport 90thb takes about 20 mins Aircon & very nice much better sitting in a taxi with drivers that doing know where there going & much cheaper

title: Convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: This is a convenient way to get around Bangkok You avoid the jams and it won't cost you too much The train maps are easy to read & buying tickets is a breeze If you need help there is always the station counter You may want to avoid peak hours as the trains do get quiet packed Other than that a pleasant and safe ride

title: It All Depends on the Baggage
review: I've taken the Airport Rail Link quite a few times but not all the time  For me it all depends on how much baggage I have with me  If I'm flying light with a small carryon weighing about 5 kilos I'll take the Link from BKK to the Makkasan Station walk from there over to the Petchaburi MRT Station head one stop south to Asok transfer to the BTS Skytrain and head to my hotel via BTS  This is both faster and cheaper than a taxi dealing with Bangkok traffic  However if I've got two suitcases weighing a total of 12 kilos or so I'll just take the taxi instead  Ensure the driver turns on the meter pay the two tolls on the way and get to your hotel for 320 baht or so (US$10)  The heavier my luggage the more I'll take comfort over cost  Also I'll note that I have both and MRT card and a BTS card and have spent about 2 years in Bangkok over the last 6 years  If you're a firsttimer to Bangkok even if you're travelling light I'd recommend you take a taxi (ground floor to the right via machine at BKK) rather than deal with three different mass transit systems the first time you're in town  Also if you're a couple rather than single and even more so if you've got children with you pay the taxi fare for sheer convenience

title: Best Way To and From the Suvarnabhoomi Airport
review: I along with my friend used this Airport Rail Link service in December 2016 as we were coming back from Thailand and we took the train from the RamKhamhaeng station to the Suvarnabhoomi stationIt is the most comfortable and cheap way to travel into the airport as we reach directly into the Airport and also we can skip the Bangkok trafficThe train was very comfortable and hardly had any crowds as we took the last train at 1215 AM and it took just 20 minutes to reach Airport

title: Super easy & inexpensive

title: full rating
review: the reason is that we took the bus from don mueang to mochit bts and took the skytrain from there to sukuvit i thought i would be harder to go into the city from don mueang but it was as smooth as i should be  don't take the train get the A1 bus which arrives in front of the exit you can not miss him and you get the Ticket on the bus  make sure you have small money like 20 baht bills best choice ever to the city

title: Efficient
review: Short waiting time whether it's peak or offpeak Can be packed to the brim during peak Just queue in line to wait for the next train No worry about buying tickets with coins  every station has coinchanging counter Not suitable for those who ascenddescend by steps  most stations do not have elevators

title: Skytrain: fast, cheap & easy to use
review: It took less than 30 seconds to work out how to buy a ticket trains run continuously in a metro service and it's very easy to navigate the systemThe intense aircon was quite a thrill but necessary on hot days

title: Best way to get around!
review: If you're browsing for hotels make SURE one is near a Skytrain ‚Äì you won't regret it  Bangkok isn't the easiest city to navigate but the Skytrain makes getting around so much easier and you'll soon get used to the layout of the place thanks to it It cuts through the vast majority of the city is quick and efficient clean and cheap It gets busy during rush hour but Thais are friendly and courteous (so make sure you are too)   Skytrain doesn't cover the 'huge' tourist attractions of Bangkok like the temples ‚Äì to get to those that you'll need to grab a taxi or boat (both fun) ‚Äì but for shopping and nightlife destinations you won't need to use anything else  Ticket machines are in every station and easy to use (simply push the button for the station you want to go to and there'll be a corresponding price) Please note that the ticket machines only accept coins so head to the manned ticket booths at any of the stations to get your notes changed I found it handy to always have a bunch of change on me so I didn't have to keep doing this  Runs from 6am  midnight

title: Fabulous transport system
review: Fabulous transport system so easy to get around the city Every city should have a sky train We travelled all over bangkok for small change  Well done bangkok great all the staff we approached were extremely helpfull and informative

title: Quick, cheap, clean - well recommended
review: As my title suggests it was great and leads to downtown Bangkok  with lifts at most stations  As I remember it was only around ¬£1 each to get there with just one change from our nearest BTS station and takes you right to the airport  It's a great service and so much more relaxing than getting a taxi

title: Protip - get your hotel near the BTS
review: It works  It's faster than taking a taxi  Use it  It's actually incredibly easy to use as well once you figure out the basics of it  Well done Thailand

title: quick and convenient

title: A wonderful experience

title: Excellent Service

review: It is the fastest and less expensive way to reach the city of Bangkok from Sivurnabhumi Airport since the fare is approx US$ 150 each trip and takes exactly 30 minutes Only carryon luggage is recommended due to the number of passengers Highly recommended

title: cool travel
review: The BTS (skyrail) is great to travel on airconditioned with screens that show each station utilise the day pass for many stations getting through the gates is kind of fun the only down fall is the day pass doesn't include the  MRT (underground) it would be good if you could utilise both services on one pass

title: Best way to move around
review: The most convenient way to move around in BKK Easy to use ticket vending machines and clear route maps Could not be easier to use

title: Great experience! Loved the Train Market the most!
review: Booked tour on Get your guide Tour was very well run guide (Lucky) was very nice and did her best to make our day enjoyable We were picked up from hotel on time at 6 AM the group was small (11 persons) we went on a AC van to train station and stopped for coffee at a gas station on the way (coffee was on our expense but they provided water and fruits along the way) We took train 3 stations and entered the market on the train It was quite an experience Lucky arranged that we had seats with view so we can take good photos The market itself was awesome  one of the most authentic things we experienced in Thai We had 40 min to walk around (would have liked 1 h) Then we were transferred by van to a boat doc and took a long tail boat to floating market The ride was so nice The floating market was interesting to see but it's a touristic place now nothing authentic just souvenirs Nevertheless we enjoyed and are glad we went What I didn't like was that we were kinda forced to take a boat in the market (which was an additional 150 baheach) I didn't mind paying but the ride was just thru a canal with horrible souvenirs with the boat stopping at some and the vendors hustling you into buying It was weird as you were at the mercy of the boatman and the vendors and couldn't leave Maybe some like souvenirs but I would have preferred to skip this experience and just walk more on the docs Total time in the market maybe 2 h Overall the tour was very well organized the schedule was great and we had a great day We were back at the hotel at about 3 or 4PM Would recommend this tour

title: Clean, fast and On time
review: The subway system is easy to use even if one doesn't understand Thai  We used the ticket machines which all offer instructions in English and the route system and platforms are simple to figure out  The stations and platforms are noticeably clean and tidy and the riders are polite and lowkey  A great way to get around a very large city

title: This is just an airport train
review: Note that this is not an express train but just a normal train to the airport   The cost is cheap and will get you to the BTS where you can change train to get into town   It is quite crampy in the train and take care of your belongings so that it does not obstruct others   It takes about 30mins to 45mins to get you to town depends on where you are going to   During peak hours it definitely beats taking a taxi where sometimes you will be stuck in a jam for more than 15hours

title: Great air con
review: We only travelled three stops from Siam Station  train was very clean fantastically cool Views from windows somewhat disappointing

title: Good access to the centre.

title: So convenient !
review: This is probably the reason why I love Bangkok So easy to go from a place to another that it makes life in Bangkok really easy

title: The best way to travel from the Airport to Bangkok
review: The train is easy to access and is a safeinexpensive and a relatively clean mode of transport into the city Although the express train appears to be permanently out of service the normal link works well getting one into the heart of the city in less than 12 an hour

title: Easy and Inexpensive
review: Extremely easy to use and very inexpensive to see the city of Bangkok  Even if you get lost the Skytrain will make a full circle and you will get a full tour of the surrounding areas  It is very safe and majority of the people speak English should you need any assistance in getting to the right destination

title: this is the way to get around bangkok
review: last week i spent 2 hours in a taxi to go 4km  one of the greatest additions to bangkok the mrt is state of the art on time like clockwork comfortable and safe and no gridlock

title: Hassle free and avoid the traffic
review: BTS Skytrain is a great way to avoid the MASSIVE traffic jams in Bangkok (which has some of the worst traffic of any city anywhere on the planet  trust me I‚Äôve been to a lot)  If you‚Äôre here for a few days buy a reloadable card as it saves the hassle of queuing at busy time for single tickets It‚Äôs great value for money and will often be quicker than a taxi The air conditioning is fierce so its never too hot on the trains However be prepared for very busy carriages especially at peak times

title: Railway market enjoyable but floating market is pushy and expensive üáπüá≠
review: A long day at least 90 mins each way and overhaul I was disappointed with the floating market because the price of items were very overpriced We enjoyed the railway market and here the food and souvenirs were priced more reasonably I paid three times more for some gifts at the floating market Be prepared to barter for anything you wish to buy Glad I did it would I do it again no

title: Much quicker and cheaper than taxi
review: We braved the Skytrain full of trepidation after one lengthy taxi journey that mainly involved sitting in queues of traffic as there seem to be traffic lights every hundred metres telling ourselves we could always get another taxi if we got hopelessly lost Although there is sometimes a queue for assistance and buying a ticket from a human we found the staff to be very helpful and once we got the knack were able to use the coin machines to buy tickets more quickly We found the Skytrain to be much more civilised than the London Underground no pushing and shoving all very orderly with footprints marked on the platforms designating where one should stand in the queue no one eating smelly food or talking loudly into their phones enough seating outside rush hours and a speedy way to travel around the city with views on the way Definitely the best way to travel in Bangkok

title: awesome
review: very easy clean and efficient Easy to purchase tickets and so much faster than a cab or tuk in the city

title: Great Views & Efficient Travel
review: The Bangkok Transportation System (BTS) is an elevated train system that runs over Bangkok It only consists of two lines which intersect at one point Siam Square As a result Siam Square is a very very busy station It also is located right next to a busy shopping mall which adds to the chaos The train provides a very nice view of Bangkok from above but being a skyscraper city it‚Äôs only a view from above the small buildings The only thing I think the train could add are seats facing forwards and backwards instead of sideways This is only my opinion though and I‚Äôm sure there is a much more logical reason for why the seats face each other Overall it is a fast and efficient mode of transportation that provides nice views

title: Cool, fast ride
review: BTS is well recommended transportation within some parts of the city to avoid maddening rush and cool ride The only gripe being the network is not vast to cover everywhere you want to go

title: Maggie Jeff Jayne garry
review: Need to do sky trains it's   the cheapest  way to get a round  but the taxi are cheap and so are the tut tut

title: A great solution to many of the traffic problems
review: We stayed in appartments beside the Chao Praya river and the traffic jams here can be bad if you are trying to use taxisTuk Tuks A better idea 9we found) was to get the skytrain at Saphan Taksin and just travel up 3 stations to Sala Daeng bypassing the main traffic bottlenecks and then using taxis to were ever we wanted to go The Skytrain is simple to use very clean and comfortable however the Suhkumvit Line can be crowded at peak periods

title: Fast train
review: The airport train is really simple go straight to the city center it cost 30bath very nice for backpackers üòâ

title: Fast and comfort
review: The Bangkok Rail Link only cost you 45 THB from the airport to the Phaya Thai Station the trip around 30 minutes The seats also comfort for the passenger who travel some hours in the plant You could change the BTS or get a taxi to you hotel easily

title: Easiest way to get into the city
review: The airport link would probably be your easiest way to get into the city to beat the traffic Its clean and usually on time But make sure you know where you need to go or which BTS line you should get onto before getting into the Airport link

title: Excellent skytrain
review: Loved their skytrain It was fast and on time all the time and when it isn't peak hour it usually is half empty so plenty of chances of getting seats although we were only two stops away from Siam

title: Underwhelming with an uninterested guide.
review: Quite disappointing we specifically booked a tour with an English speaking guide but there was pretty much zero 'guiding' Instead of any information about the two sites or Thai history the only information shared by our guide all day was about the number of road accidents and how we should hire a car in Bangkok Overall he seemed pretty uninterested in the group and just wanted to herd us onto the train and floating market as fast as possible   The floating market was particularly underwhelming as its a complete tourist trap with an agenda of making money by selling you the usual items and photos   For the time taken and cost of the trip I really cannot recommend

title: Who needs a car?!
review: Great service clean cool reliable and much faster than cars or taxis and cheaper too The Thai Government needs to extend this wonderful transport system ASAP to try and reduce the terrible smog in Bangkok

title: Try to use it as much as possible
review: To get to your destination and to cool off  Lines are limited so you will still have to walk  You must use coins to enter  So you queue for coins and then queue for tokens then go through  Could be more stream lined  On the water festival day the lines were quite long  but stops are clearly marked and announced in English

title: Good if you are a very light traveller..
review: Saw it develop and build over the years of visiting Bangkok When it is ready they gave free or a token fee of tHB10 one way ride  The station locations are okay but most stations are not inter connected with other rail transits in the city like the MRT and skytrain So this is down side  It is a very good and fast method from Suvarnabhumi International Airport to down town However the carriages are narrow Since Bangkok has many visitors coming in every moment it gets crowded So getting in and out of the carriage would be a problem when you are having a large luggage and other things with you  So if you are a very light traveller then this is good

title: Great experience!
review: Early start but well worth it to see the ‚Äòtrain market‚Äô  completely bonkers and fascinating  The floating market was also very interesting and our guide Monee could not have been more helpful or informative

title: Wish the London Underground was like this!
review: Efficient and air conditioned trains All stations are signposted well and there is a queing system which I wish they would employ in London

title: Fast, clean and cheap
review: Good way to get around BKK This is Bangkok's underground with stations mainly in areas that the BTS doesn't go Having said that there are some interchange stations Always clean airconditioned and very efficient Monitors advise of the wait time in minutes If you are over 65 get an 'elder' card and travel at half price As usual in any major city avoid peak time travel if you can

title: excellent way to get out of the airport
review: excellent way to get out of the airport without having to hire a taxis to go thru the ever congested Bangkok road way There are 2 trains that serve the city and the airport The Airport Express is nonstop but less frequent as well as more expensive whereas the city link runs regularly less expensive Even with more stops along the way the time difference between the two is only a matter of minutes

title: Easy efficient, very inexpensive!
review: Used this a week ago in Bangkok coming in from the airport at 6 am  Easy inexpensive and reasonably fast I'd say almost equivalent to a cab given morning rush   Would definitley recommend

title: Worth a Go

title: Skytrain
review: During our visit to Bangkok we use the Skytrain on several occasions to get in and around Bangkok and found it a cheap very clean and safe way to travel

title: Holiday visit to Bangkok

title: Great security team
review: I travel with Airport train everyday for my work  and  sometime I urgently need assistance from the team I want to thank to Security staff who worked at Ladkrabang station on 11 December at 2033 hrs (I travel from Phayathai to Ladkrabang) I need to top up money He help me with smile and not just taken my card to let me access to gate but he also give me more information of my total balance as wellCheer up

title: Disciplined crowd makes travel easy
review: An economical way of travelling within the city it is fairly comfortable and well planned I was quite fascinated with the barriers put at each platform for safety Trains are frequent and traffic hassles can be avoided Hong Kong type walkways have interconnected various points with the train A 140 Bhat whole day ticket saves you the hassle of standing in line every time you like to board and is quite reasonable Tickets must be bought at the machines installed otherwise The unlimited day travel pass is available at the kiosks where the English speaking persons are quite helpful Recommended for foreign tourists at least one day to get a good feel of the city

title: Best way to go from airport to city
review: Best way to go from Airport to city and back Due to the heavy traffic in BKK this is the only way to come to the hotel fast

title: Efficient train service
review: Very easy to commute good ticket price able to avoid traffic jams endemic on the BKK roads Also able to see a part of urban BKK landscape from the rail track interesting

title: Convenient and very affordable
review: The fare is economical for the convenience it offers  I queued only once for my entire 6day trip to top up my Rabbit card so I did not have problems many other travellers claimed they had for spending ridiculously long time on buying tickets or topping up their Rabbit cards  I knew exactly where I wanted to go before my trip so I could check out at the BTS official website and work out the total fare I would need to spend on BTS train  That saved the hassle of buying tickets  However the estimated time shown on the official website for each journey turned out to be shorter than what actually took me  If you are planning on a tight itinerary be sure to add 37 minutes to each journey on the train

title: very good !!!!
review: the ride is short nice and comfortable it was nice to see another side of bangkok    with aera that i didn't see befor

title: Excellent

title: Tried the sky train - great!

title: Amazing experience
review: Sara was an amazing guide She gave us a very thorough and fun tour with lots of facts about Thai culture and the language The tour was great we got to do everything we wanted to do Our driver Bank was also very lovely Thanks so much guys

title: Best way 2 travel
review: Airport Rail Link is  best way to travel  fast and easy can avoid heavy traffic jams and saves lot of time

title: Crowded All the time.. But best option to avoid traffic
review: Crowded All the time But best option to avoid traffic at peak hours We used the BTS for visit MBK mall & other shopping streets

title: comfortable public transport in bangkok
review: very comfortable and reasonably economical to beat the traffic jams in bangkok during morning and evening especially around victory monument

title: Full in rush hour & long delays between train in off peak hours
review: While overall clean well maintained and fairly priced the BTS tends to get real full between 730am  to 9am and then again between 6pm  to 8pm In the lower traffic periods the time between trains can get annoyingly long (  10 mins) for a mass transit system waiting in the heat on the platform Trains themselves are well air conditioned  though and after all sitting in a cartaxi might take even longer )

title: efficient, clean and convenient
review: The preferred way of transport in Bangkok Traffic can be horrendous and if your destination is reachable by BTS you are lucky

title: Skytrain
review: Clean and safe Easy to go around Bangkok Me and my son travelled alone on the train and never felt scared Very easy and cost effective to travel through the city Airconditioned

title: very easy
review: i used this to get to my hotel in down town Bangkok its fast and convenient   it also joins up with other lines which make your journey  a lot more simple a cheep way of getting from the airport to downtown Bangkok cheaper than using a taxi

title: Late, slow and too light to sleep!
review: So we thought yes the sleeper train saves a nights accomm and we get to go on a sleeper train Cool Got 2nd class air con and the compartment was pretty good ) All looked good Then some lady came round asking if we wanted a carton of orange juice One of them ones you can buy back home (for me the uk) for about 30p Said yes can we have 2 (me and my partner) as we were thirsty and it costs 120 baht for a rubbish drink so don't buy it Kind of my fault as i should have asked the price but hey We decided to get some sleep the bed was quite comfy for a train but couldn't sleep The staff kept walking past the carriage chatting pretty loudly and they keep the main corridor light on all night and its bright So bright its like the sun in my face even with the curtain closed I can't sleep unless its dark or pretty dark so no sleep for me Our train was supposed to arrive at 6am i think I don't know why they write times on the trains really as it was over an hour late also 2 other trains we recently got in Thailand were an hour late So just add an hour on each time u book a train journey and your good )

title: Fun way to see Bangkok.

title: The most fast, convenient , safe way between Airport and city

review: This transportation is very ideal for us to move around Just avoid weekdays peak hours 79am and 47pm Suggest traveller to choose hotel near skytrain station

review: If you don't have mountains of luggage and a fairly good at negotiating a map Then the airport rail link is the way to go It's cheap Fast and Convenient  No Bangkok traffic jams And a great way to see how large and beautiful Bangkok is  It's an exciting and overwhelming cite to see Bangkok for the first time and you can't see it any better then this especially for the price The train is clean and has Airconditioning   and there is always some one ready to help if youbare lost

title: Adrian Bergbaum
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok Not expensive and can be even cheaper if you buy a day card Only one problem is access there‚Äôs a lot of stairs involved and not many escalators Lifts are available but you have be disabled and get the station staff to operate it

title: Efficient and Effective.
review: When you see Bangkok traffic the BTS is a great alternative The trains run very regularly and are easy to use They are air conditioned and though crowded are a quick and effective way to move around a very crowded city The cost is minimal and we have no Thai language and did not struggle to wirk thingd out Most announcements about next stations are repeated in English after Thai

title: Convenient
review: Especially when you have been walking the entire day it helps to catch the train and its frequent of course

title: Best option

title: A modern conveyance
review: Riding the Skytrain is inexpensive and quite easy to navigate  The cars are air conditioned and clean  As New Yorkerswe are accustomed to crowded subways but we didn't expect the equivalent of rush hour traffic on the Skytrain  Surprise  The trains were packed

title: Quite Simply becoming too overcrowded
review: Last time in Bangkok I avoided the sky train every chance I could by 1)walking or 2) taking a taxi Only take it if you really have to Sometimes the train will come and you can't get on bc it is full Sometimes you barely squeeze in and you are pressed up against 4 or 5 people packed like sardines In years past it wasn't like this BKK needs to step up here and either add more cars or raise the prices The skytrain just isn't what it used to be

title: Excellent
review: Stay near a BTS station I first went to Bangkok before this and the subway It was dreadful getting around This ever expanding system is exceptional efficent and cheap

review: Not only is it easy to buy a ticket and get around quickly it stops at the malls and you can walk straight in Clean air conditioned cabins Excellent
