review: Clean cheap easy to get around We used it several times while in Bangkok Catch it on the second floor of the St Regis and take it to the mall or Jim Thompson house

title: Convenient but lacking
review: The stations are easy to maneuver and information is displayed where needed at times maybe hard to find The waiting platforms offer little room when crowded and can become difficult to board or depart the trains during rush hour

title: If you have a small light luggage you should consider using this rail link
review: If you hav3 a heavy bulky luggage it might be easier to take a cab or Grab otherwise I would recommend this It‚Äôs cheap and efficient

title: Efficient and easy to get round
review: Get a map and go to all the malls on it paragon mbk terminal 21 Siam centre Easy to get around on and clean and efficient ticket machines easy to use

title: Fast and cheap transportation
review: Easy access and direct connection to the Skytrain System will avoid traffic jam not too good with a lot of heavy luggage good service to guide you to the trains fast

title: EASY TO USE!!!
review: If you are travelling light this is an easy option for getting to and from the airport from the sky train(I personally hate dragging big suitcases aroundbut you can do it here)

title: A fast and safe way to get to your destination
review: I loved the link because the Express train takes only 17 minutes from the airport to PhayaThai station and then one can take the BTS The Express train runs every 30 minutes so if you have bad luck you may have to wait quite some time Further from the PhayaThai station to the BTS platform the walk is a bit long and you must go down stairs (not great if you have heavy luggage However I prefer the Express tain in combination with the BTS system over taking a taxi mainly because the taxi drivers drive extremely fast on the freeway no seat belts are available and the heavy traffic once you reach the city

title: One of the faster ways to get from the Airport to Bangkok
review: Very fast train and this is a sister railway to Seibu Railway in Japan Very easy to use and cheap as well

title: Fast and reliable
review: Not crowd and quite comfortable I tried three times and the trips were safe and quite smooth No time delay and the direction signs are clear and easily to find the exits

title: Super cheap, super fast!
review: and super convenient The announcements are all repeated in English so as long as you know where you are going you shouldn't have any problems

title: Cindy Little
review: The sky train is excellent way to get about Bangkok fast efficient and clean helpful staff and cheap highly recommend this mode of travel

title: Why no escalators
review: We took the airport link into Bangkok as the queue for taxis was so long  As generally with Bangkok Airport everything is big and far as is the station  It is very easy to use the link and it is a fast and cheap way into central Bangkok  The only problem is that at the terminus you have to lug your bags down stairs and then lug them up again to connect with the BTR could someone not have thought of escalators I would hate to do this in summer

title: BTS experience
review: It is great way to travel in the city I suggest you to buy the Rabbit card than top up when the money is gone It cost 200 THB than you can use 100 THB You can top up with over 100 THB

title: By far the best way to get around
review: Feels a bit odd reviewing a trainsubway system However this aboveground metro system has in many ways revolutionized getting around in Bangkok (well at least to the places it reaches) No longer crazy traffic Very modern very much ac very every 10 mins or so If all you're doing is seeing the main templespalaces downtown don't worry about it (train doesn't go there anyway) but if you're doing "other stuff" as well then staying close to a stop is really helpful

title: Useful to move around - not for the old Bangkok
review: If you are staying around Sukhumvit or Siam areas it‚Äôs a really good option to move around  The BTS get to the old area Khao San Road palace so you‚Äôll have take tuc tuc or taxi to that area either way

title: Great
review: Very good transportation Very regular reliable and very clean Thats one of the best way to travel accross Bangkok for affordable price

title: Fun Experience
review: The Service We took the night train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai that left around 1900 and arrived at 0900 the next morning We booked through the "12GO" website and collecting tickets was super smooth The train was clean great service and well organized (one of the attendants comes around 2100 and makes up your bed in less than a minute We knew from reviews that the fooddrink prices were a bit of a ripoff so we brought our own snacks with us  The Interior Seating was comfyin fact this was the most comfortable mattress we slept on our entire 3 week vacation in Thailand We had an electrical outlet conveniently located near us to charge our electronics There are both western toilets and asian toilets on board and sink stations to brush your teeth and freshen up in the morning   TIP Choose lower bunks I bought tickets for top and bottom so that we could sit together but next time I would get two lowers across from eachother and do a seat swap unofficially for the few hours you are actually sitting No price difference Lower Bunk  has 46 hooks to hang items has a huge window to watch the sun rise in the morning is much wider more than enough head clearance to sit up fully and is nice and dark Upper Bunk  no hooks narrow unable to sit up fully no window bright due to the curtain  not coming up to the ceiling and freezing as the aircon is not blocked out by the curtain as the lower bunk is  TIP get the best photos and videos of the sunrise and scenery from the restaurant car in the very back of the train where the windows open

title: Lame
review: It is a best way to get around some parts of Bangkok because the roads are so badly managed however I don't like the BTS You can't eat or drink on the BTS Plastic molded seats greet the lucky few Advertising videos blare out nonsense nonstop Also there are very few stations with lifts so good luck if you are disabled It's as though they (the corporations) expect you to be grateful for any transport service As a result they ram advertising down your throat and treat you like a child The BTS is also overpriced This means that you won't see many working class people traveling there Maybe that suits you but it does mean that the majority of commuters are priced out and chose cheaper alternatives It's an elitist mode of transport with no apologies

title: Quick and easy to use!
review: Best way to get around Bangkok avoids the gridlock and chaos on the roads Much quicker way to get around and is very cheap You need coins to buy tickets in the machine but there is a change booth to get some if you don't have enough Trains very often so not a long wait if you just miss onem

title: Very well connected to major shopping areas
review: BTS is very well connected to all major shopping areas and very convenient for tourists Instead of taking taxi where you get stuck in traffic just hop into BTS and reach your destination  faster and conveniently Don't forget to carry map of BTS SKYTRAIN

title: Happy Family Moments in Bangkk
review: We have travelled by SKY train amny timesIt is very cleancomfortable than road traffic jamsseats are comfortable

title: OKK laa
review: the location is great and perfect for travelling around BKK city However it's quite take time for waiting the train since I heard the BTS has problem recently Apart from that its totally awesome to take it

title: Waiting for the train
review: A bustling little station with 100's of people waiting to board the train over the River Kwai Would be great if someone set up a little restaurant for a quick snack or drink Was a lovely experience just very very hot

title: Great day tour
review: Great day tour to the railway and floating market with our wonderful guide Sara She was funny an very knowledgeable

title: clean quick and cheap
review: near my hotel and very easy to use to get around town i used the one day ticket which was 120 baht and went to the siam paragon mall and mbk centre

title: very clean and modern
review: not the most effective net work and at prices you can easily get a taxi which is going to be faster in most cases especially if you want to go the the old town

title: Average Hotel for the price and expensive all round
review: Hello ReadersVacationers Chaophya Park Hotel is located in the far suburbs from main Bangkok hub where real activities usually take place This hotel charges the same per day rate for room as main 34 star hotels in central Bangkok charge so then the question is why stay here so far from all the main activities if you're on vacation then you want to be in the center staying in a 4 star hotel close to Sukhumvit Road The hotels in the center are the best and give you the best value for your money Even though the frontdesk staff wasn't rude and didn't understand much they were nonetheless helpful  I guess with some effort in explaining one can get by easily The only other issue about this hotel is there are NO RESTAURANTS in the nearby vicinity  at night time there are very few street light  and if you're walking from Rachtdapisek MRT station to the hotel it's difficult to navigate thru sidewalk even though I've to admit that its a safe neighborhood even at those time of the night I never heard of muggings or assaults whilst visiting Bangkok though I did witness an ugly incident between a foreigner and Thai street market man Breakfast wasn't included in my stay so I can't comment on this issue Massage was ok but at their prices you can get more for your money outside the hotel  at other massage locations My room was ok  but at a 4star hotel  it could have been better There was pool and Gym facilities in the hotel which I didn't use so I can't comment The 247 snack shop at night has rude staff  they know you're at their mercy because hotel restaurant is closed and there is NOTHING nearby  not even a 24 hour 711

title: fast and convenience
review: The train system is good You can connect to almost everywhere in bangkok and also connected to the airport rail link Tickets machines are available in English

title: So convenient and practical to get around without traffic delays.
review: So quick and efficient to get around in such a vast city avoiding the long delays usually encountered on road transport in Bangkok

title: great rapid transit system
review: wonderful way to avoid the street traffic and get around the city  easy to navigate and as comfortable as possible

title: Fast and convenient
review: Used the city line to and from the airport cheap and fast Unfortunately the red express line was not working not sure why

title: Fast and good way to get to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Suvarnabhumi airport is pretty far from city center but luckily there is ARL It will take you only 30 minutes via city line and 15 min via express line (from Phyathai)  The sign are somewhat confusing but you could ask the staff there

title: Wow...
review: We took a cab downtown since we didn't want to take the boat shuttle from our hotel in the rain and it took an hour even with waiting ten minutes for the next train the trip back was about 20 minutes

title: Interesting
review: After a walk over the river Kwae (or Kwai as I knew it) you can take a train that rides close to 2 hours Definitely a worthwhile change if you have visited plenty of temples already Little surprising is the fact they take picture you can buy prior to the end the selling of Tshirts and candy The only thing that is really required is some refreshing drinks and that is for sale too

title: Bts for any random trip u wish to plan anytime
review: Clear and easy to understand directory U can go anywhere by bts rabbit card or one day one month pass will be more convenient for repeat user Easy for travelers with random plan Access to mainly shopping malls and attractions You might find a k9 police officer on duty when heavy traffic hour

title: Best transportation in Bangkok
review: Need to get around Use BTS  They are inexpensive and reliable  Crowed during peak hours but better than taking a taxi in traffic

title: Bangkok - Anyaprathet
review: Wife and I caught this train to the Cambodian border It leaves daily at about 550am From platform 6 but check this beforehand Sit up class is all that is available and all that is needed The price we paid was 48 baht each (cheap) Tickets can be purchased at the booking office at the station We got there one hour early and we're glad that we did as it got busy just after we arrived The minimart opened not long before the train left so we were able to get snacks for the trip The journey was very relaxed with locals getting on and off all the way If you are a smoker you can smoke between the carriages We arrived at about lunchtime From here we caught a tuk tuk to the border at Poipet about 1015 minutes away  about $5US

title: Excellent journey.
review: Fantastic train ride on the death railway The journey takes 2 hours from Kanchanburi train station to Namtop You go through lovely countryside There's some lovely places to stay The views are excellent It costs ¬£250 (100 baht) well worth the money Would recommend From Namtop you can get to Hell Fire Pass in about 20 minutes

title: busy subway!
review: we wanted to go to chinatown so taking the MRT was quite stressful due to the long queues at the ticket booth maybe 100 people We got the tickets and waited for 3 trains as too bust Plus is the trains are new but we took a taxi back

title: The only way to travel in Bangkok!
review: The Skytrain is the perfect way to get round Bangkok and the only downside is that there are still areas of the city without connections  but extensions are on going The trains are spotless with regular services There is the added advantage of the Skywalks which allow easy foot traffic above the crowded streets in the city centre

title: MRT has great fares and decent coverage of the main attractions in Bangkok
review: Combining MRT with the sky train you are able to visit most of Bangkok attractions Add to that the river normal (not tourist) boats and you can visit the best of Bnagkok

title: Speedy
review: It is speedy and have good view of city while on transport Oh It is cheap just 40 bahts for whole journey

title: An experience out of this world
review: It was amazing to watch the train approach the market and then leave all the hustle pulling carts and covers away in seconds only to put everything back as soon as the train passes by I didn't imagine the train to be that close to the merchandise I don't think this exists anywhere else in the world If you are in Bangkok this is a must do In addition it's the cheapest market I visited and we bought so much stuff plus the mangos are to die for

title: Markets Tour
review: We were only give 5 minutes to look around the train market after travelling 90 minutes to get there It wasn‚Äôt good at all The floating market was better but the travel of two hours to get back wasn‚Äôt great

title: Fast, budget and confortable
review: We used The Airport Rail link on our last trip to Bangkok This is a budget fast and efficient way to get to the airport In the future I won't consider a taxi as an option for airport transfer

title: Amazing mode of transportation
review: BTS Skytrain is a very good mode of commutation in a very bustling and crowded bangkok city  Very comfortable too

title: The cheapest means of transport in Bangkok
review: Take a daily pass of 240 bath or so it is cool All sky train bus water ferry all free Always book a hotel walkable distance from station All stations have shops etc

title: Easy to use but crowded to rush hours
review: The skytrain is an excellent and cheap way to get from a to b in the Heart of Bangkok Just be aware to rush hours in the morning and in the evening

title: Best way to travel in BKK
review: Easy to travel even for a new person It's clean and cheap You can travel most of the places using this Airport Rail Link No Taxi Scams just take a ticket and get in You are safe even in odd hours

title: Totally worth it
review: Wanted to visit those places but had read so many reviews with bad experience Thus chose this tour because of good reviews and not so early start Thank you P'Audi for the fun tour

title: Reliable and fast
review: I should have known about this train earlier When there was a traffic chaos in the city and my friend and me needed to get to the airport quickly we found out about this train And once we got to the station we were at the airport quickly However it would be nice if there were a station of this line at Khao San Road as well because to get there a taxi ride (or a very long walk) cannot be avoided

title: Useful Depending on where you need to go. I rather take the shuttle to Khao San
review: There was no AC meaning that I was roasting I thought I was saving money and time by taking the train to the last station and then a taxi to khao San but in the end I spent the same time but with extra burden of having to walk and change modes of transport and no AC  I guess if you have to go to Silom it's very convenient but not to Khao San

title: Best way to get into downtown
review: I use the ARL daily to get from the suburbs to City center The trip is very short when compared to any other type of transportation If you arrive at BKK airport then the ARL is certainly the quickest way to the city hotels Just bear in mind it is usually crowded

title: Good and bad
review: Very easy and comfortable to go to the city during peak period Don't have to face with crazy traffic but you will face with lots of people and Queing

title: Fast and clean
review: Always the best way of transportation in Bkk  Safe clean and cheap  Explore the big city by Skytrain in a great valuable way

title: very bad
review: really needs improvement cant trust the service in busy hours and if you are in a rush to the airport  Dont count on coming on time but if you insist and leaving afternoon then should go earlier

title: Easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: Not only is this a cheap way to get around bangkok you can save the trouble of negotiating taxi prices and then finding stuck on traffic jams    Finding a hotel within walking distance to BTS will make it very easy for you to explore bangkok One way prices are approx 250 Bhat (about 13 US$ dollars) you can also buy a 15 trip tickets (7 days) for 450 bhat   Keeping change will help since BTS does not accept notes But you can change notes at station control but sometime you will need to queue twice (One to change note one to buy the ticket)

title: Quick and easy
review: Situated in the basement of the airport  the link is easy to get to  just keep going down the escalators  Very quick and excellent value for money  I got the airport link to makkasan then changed for the underground to hualamphong train station where I was staying  Took about 50 mins and only 70baht

title: Easy and cheap.
review: Easy and quick way to go to the airport Very clean and not expensive at all a cheap way to travel with Easy to buy tickets

title: Very convenient and fast
review: The best option to get to  from BKK airport  Bangkok city centre Price is very good and very easy to find also it is pretty fast Around the last station in the city centre (Phayathai) there are lots of nice and cheap hostels

title: standing room only
review: You may be hard pushed to get a seat but for sheer speed and convenience you can not beat this service Especially during the rush hour in Bangkok which lasts from 5am to midnight  Plus it's not expensive

title: A cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: We always take forms of local transportation wherever we are in the world  The BTS sky train is a fast and cheap way to get around Bangkok  Even though my daughter and and I don't speak a word of Thai it wasn't difficult to figure out how to buy tickets or which trains to take  Inside the trains its air conditioned which is good because the outside temperatures can be pretty hot  There is an announcer who announces each station in English as well as other languages  This is a good way to save money on taxis and get to know the city

title: The best
review: The connection is very good and there is a lot of frequency and you don't have to wait long Train is very clean and efficient

title: Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport
review: Fastest and the Cheapest way to reach the airport if you are single and are not carrying much baggage It connects you to Bangkok in all directions if you are visiting

title: Getting about Bangkok
review: The Bts and Skytrain services are a prompt and efficient wY of getting about in bangkok The trains ron approximately every 10 minutes the do however fill up pretty quickly they are also very affordable with auto ticket machines and people manned coun ters

title: Cheap and fast way to get into town
review: The Sky Train will take you direct from airport to a few central locations in town possibly worth even taking it to town and then continuing with a cab to our destination  ride to town is ~40b

title: Easy travel.
review: This is one of the best ways to get around  the streets of Bangkok are congested  taking the skytrain and the river are your best options

title: Reliable and easy to use.
review: Clean easy to navigate reliable air conditioned trains take you anywhere you need to go for a small cost prepare for a little queuing for your ticket

title: Best thing that has happened to Bangkok
review: The easiest cheapest and cleanest way to get around Bangkok I just wish that the entire city gets connected with this beautiful system The ticketing is easy access is super (you can get to the station from some malls without touching the street below) the service is punctual and efficient and the cleanliness is impeccable The trains are comfortable and clean The announcements are clear and co passengers are well behaved Note that the BTS can get very crowded during peak hours so avoid travelling at that time if you can Other than that this transit system scores big Well done BTS

title: Best with light luggage
review: This is the option you should take to get into town  So quick and in no time if your hotel is right next to the sky train station  The train is clean new and smooth and runs at a very reasonable price

title: Good Way to get to Down Town from BKK
review: Reasonably priced train from BKK to central Bangkok At night it doesn't run that often and can get crowded mostly with locals Good option for people without much luggage

title: 2nd Class Sleeper Train, Bangkok to Chiang Mai
review: Not great experience on the sleeper train to Chiang Mai  They leave the lights on all night so it's hard to sleep and with the air con it's freezing  Guard was uncharacteristically rude and horrible  Food was overpriced and not very good  Views out of the window for last hour into Chiang Mai were amazing  It's actually a similar price to fly so we'd definitely be doing that again in the future Apparently in the First Class you get control of the lights which would be better but First Class sells out really quickly so it's quite difficult to book

title: Clean, A/C'ed and easy to use system!

title: Best way to reach airport

title: Fast transport, super convenient
review: When travelling along sukhumvit and down to the river the sky train is your transportation of choice It's super convenient easy and clean And there are trains every 23 minutes It's way faster than any taxi or tuktuk Can get a bit crammed at peak hours but as everyone is very disciplined even that works well

title: Easiest and fastest way to get around
review: Clean efficient and fast  Avoid the busy streets and take the skytrain  Security is very good so as a female solo traveller you feel safe

title: Definitely a great way to get aroung
review: This is a very well organized and clean transport system which is easy to navigate and the people selling tickets can manage in English Pay attention to how the people line up to get on and the courteous way in which this happens Other countries could learn from the Thai nation

title: Convenient n efficient

title: Avoid Worlds Worst Traffic
review: Bangkok is once again the world leader for insane brutal traffic There is no reason to worry Bangkok has the Sky train Now it doesn't go everywhere but it's quite inexpensive fairly simple to navigate and very clean I found it to be an effective way to get around the city stress free Now there are times it can get crowded but the people (particularly the locals) are friendly and polite I highly recommend trying it and out and avoid dealing with the gridlock Now many spots have stairs that are quite steep so this may be an issue for some folks There are very few escalators so be forewarned

title: Cheap and f

title: Perfect Transportation
review: Trust me anyone who's living or has been to Bangkok has only 1 major complaintand that's TRAFFIC The BTS Skytrain thus is a God given relief to the city and helps commute people faster across various parts of the city Though the entire city is not connected but most major parts are and it is truly a life saver

title: Clean and efficient way of traveling

title: Well Connected

title: One of the best
review: I still have to visit other top notch   train services but so far this is the best one I have seen It provides the perfect break from the suffocating heat The way people queue to board the train is unseen in many first class subways systems Understandably it is in constant expansion since the two lines don't provide access  to some key areas of the city Prices is not crazy expensive but is not crazy cheap as so many other things in Thailand It doesn't travel underground so you get cool views of the city and stations are well connected to neighboring buildings and malls Enjoy the ride

title: Fly past the surface traffic
review: The Sky train system is clean efficient easy to get to from major attractions on the river boat stops  By far the easiest way to cover a lot of distance without the surface street crowds  Satani bat bi

title: Fast and convenient way to centre
review: We had about 7 hours between arrival by domestic flight and international departure and we planned to use the time for dining in Bangkok After storing the laggage in the room "Left laggage" near gates Q in departure hall we went down to take a taxi (about 500 bahts) It was after 1800 and there was a huge line for taxi So rail link was the best option City Link price is 45 baht per person and it brings you to final ("terminal") station near the centre We waited for the train about 10 minutes and the trip took 30 minutes It was dark and we mostly  watched lighted skyscrapers around the elevated railway I think it is much better in the daytime The bad thing was that we found no taxi stand on the exit Few taxi drivers which stopped at the street refused to go to Machalai district we wanted (I think because of short distance and small price) So we had to use tuktuk (150 bahts) to get to the restaraunt area After awalk and dining we returned to airport by taxi (400B from the city) So if you have time and no laggage it is a good option

title: As a first time traveler I LOVE THE BTS!!!!!!
review: This was our first time traveling internationally from the US  We brought our big family of seven to Thailand for a once in a life time family vacation  The BTS Skytrain made traveling around this huge busy city so easy  Everything is in English  All the signs and announcements are in English  Everything is really clear and easy to understand  The trains and stations are clean bright and safe  It is really easy to get to the Chatuchak Weekend Market the biggest weekend market in the world  It is easy to get to the Grand Palace by BTS and then by public boat  We got a hotel between Asoke and Nana and we were able to get to and from the airport and all around downtown without any problems at all  I love using the BTS  It has great air conditioning and it is fun to look out over the city as you travel  We would travel over roads absolutely stopped in traffic and we were so grateful to be on the BTS  Quick and cheap and safe

title: Good enough
review: Prior the existence of the airport rail they had  3 bus routes running to the most touristy parts of town they were suspended probably to promote the airport link Nowadays a bus road to KhaoSan rd Is running again You get the Express line with two stops one called "Makkasan" which interchanges with the MRT The second one and terminal station is called "PayaThai" interchanges with BTS In the past you could check in from 1200 am at Makkasan station and you were rid of your checkin luggage and got your boarding passes right there if you purchased a express line dongle I believe it was 150 bath back then don't know about the current pricing ox the express line Further I believe that the checkin options are not longer available Interchange to MRT is a bit tricky as you have to cross a busy road and a railway track not recommended with heavy luggage unless it's the MRT you use for your final destination anyway The ordinary line has 8 stops and serves the same 2 stops mentioned b4 Price to PayaThai is at the time of writing 45 bath If going on with luggage the transfer to BTS at PayaThai is somewhat easier than the interchange with MRT It can be a bit crowded at peak times as it's widely used by commuters working at the airport or nearby

review: First off There is a Taxi tout at the entry to Airport link (sweet lady approached me) They or she will tell you the train is more expensive and slower than it actually is They will say it takes 4060 minutes and the Taxi only 30 minutes Then try to charge you 1500 baht Train is 45bht and 3040 minutes and airconditioned Then from Phaya Thai plan the next step in advance    I tried Airport link for only the second time despite many trips into Bkk from the Airport usually by Taxi  We were staying near Phaya Thai which the the end of the line for Airport link where you can switch to BTS for further journey to other areas It‚Äôs great Can be busy so grab your seat It avoids the traffic jams Sweaty seats in Taxi‚Äôs even with aircon on the plastic seats are uncomfortable Definitely a better option during rush hours as you can get very close to centre in a taxi in 25 minutes then spend another 25 minutes on the last 2 miles  Give it a try Do your research before you go as to how to complete the journey from Phaya Thai

title: Touch & Go tour.
review: Our tour group had a total of 11 pax and we boarded a minibus which took us all to a local train station on the outskirts of Bangkok We then boarded a train to Mae Klong railway station which was the final stop where we all had to alight  The tour was short and sweet A tad too short for the Mae Klong Railway Market leg because we barely had 40 minutes upon arrival at Mae Klong before we had to depart for the next leg of the tour at Damnoen River Market via the same minibus  We spent more time spent at Damnoen market roughly one and a half hours (including lunch) before we departed back to Bangkok via the same minibus and ended our trip at MBK centre If you are looking for a touch & go experience this is the tour to go for   It was a pretty pleasant experience for my family of 4 which included 2 elderly folks one of which has a bit of a walking issue because we had a good guide who paid special attention to my elderly folks Thank you  P Tom

title: The quickest and cheapest transfer from the airport to central Bangkok
review: Lost of tourists to Bangkok are still lured taking (very) expensive transfers to Central Bangkok only to be stuck in gridlock Using the Airport Link is by far the quickest and cheapest way to get a transfer from the airport to Central Bangkok It's easy to find just head to the basement of the airport instructions are in English The airport link is air conditioned and once you reach the nearest station to your hotel you can either choose to use the BTS (Skytrain) or MRT (Subway) or if you're carrying a whole bunch of luggage take a taxi DO NOT get lured in taking expensive taxi's or limousines for the airport to central Bangkok it's far more expensive and you'll get stuck into gridlock anyway

title: Convenient
review: BTS Skytrain system is one of the most convenient way of transportation going around Bangkok must see places Advisable to get the Rabbit Card (100 bath for card fee and another 100 bath credit) easier to skip the line

title: MISS THE GRID LOCK
review: Simple travel around Bangkok without wasting time sitting in a traffic gridlockhorrendous queues coupled with fumes from assorted vehicles Also an economical way to travel as well as convenient

title: Efficient
review: Very efficient and reliable clean with security Air con and friendly staff Great way to travel to the main line for the sky train

title: Best way to directly go to Bangkok downtown
review: Really the best choice to avoid traffic jam This train is comfortable and the trip is 30 min between Airport and Bangkok We used it at the end of our trip in Thailande Our recommendation  choose your hotel along this train line

title: Good fast,cheap and clean and traveling
review: Good to go around with Better than traffic jam smelling dirty car gasses Faster and cheaper Good given directions

title: Very convenient
review: Easy to navigate  As clean as a public transportation system can be  A great way to get rid of any coins you have as the ticket dispensers require coins  If you don't have any there are machines where you can switch bills to coins  If you don't see a machine just go to one of the people in the booths and they can easily switch bills to coins for you

title: Very Handy
review: To or from airport no hassle cheap travel on a flat fare Avoids all the traffic takes about 40 mins slow

title: Great way to avoid traffic jams
review: Having read a number of reviews we decided to give the train a go We bought a day ticket at the kiosk which was quick and easy and we didn't need to find coins The train system is very easy to understand and follow  there are only 2 lines which makes it very straight forward It is really quick compared to using the roads where you sit in traffic jam after traffic jam The carriages are very crowded but they are air conditioned we never had a problem getting on even at the busiest times but we always had to stand but as it is for a relatively short space of time it's really not a problem The all day ticket is 140 bhat about ¬£3 at the current exchange rate

title: OMG
review: How is it possible to make something so difficult to use Only a few machine to buy the tickets and even more few machine ho only take paper money  If you coming from Taiwan and be use of the perfect system and now  Not long trains and so much people at one time to enter

title: Take the train, dont get into bangkok's traffic
review: During the day it could save you a lot of time and some money take the train near your area and a taxi from there

title: Cheapest and fastest way to explore Bangkok!
review: Very good to explore Bangkok and much faster as with the taxi It is airconditioned and you can get a One Day Pass for only 150 THB

title: BTS SKYTRAIN
review: Makes getting around Bangkok very simple BUT can get extremely crowded  Also lots of steps to climb up and down so can be very difficult if you have kneewalking problems

title: Thank goodness for the BTS Skytrain
review: Thank goodness for the BTS Skytrain Having lived in Bangkok in 1996 ie preSkytrain I can say that the Skytrain is a saviour  fast efficient and accessible

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain will take you to most of the important shopping and partying destinations in Bangkok It also connects to the MRT (another train) BRT and the touristexpress ferry service to get to the other side of the river

title: Most Desired Link
review: I think this project was due for a long time and finally it is there and most convenient mode of transport to and fro airport

title: Very Good
review: The sky train is truly a boon for Bangkok  The accessibility of the malls and other places of interest is very helpful for the tourist who wants to get around the place on their own rather than hiring a van

title: Super convenient!
review: We traveled by cab during our first few days of our trip to Bangkok and I wish we'd started using public transport right away BTS is cheap convenient fast and you don't have to sit in traffic or worry about getting scammed out of your money It's by far the best way to get around in Bangkok

title: Cheap and comfy
review: Cheap and comfy to get tofrom airport  Lots of place to keep a stroller seat and transparent windows to enjoy the city view while riding

title: Good transportation
review: Works fine Actually better than taxi because og traffic yam Train are Cheap and fast Takes about 30 min from the AirPort

title: Great Travelling
review: Bangkok without Skytrain will be far less attractive and convenient Well managed service During a short stay in Bangkok we were required to travel lots of places in a short time Couldn't have managed without this train system with such a less expenditure World class

title: Reasonably frequent, Air conditioned and cheap
review: We used this a lot frequent service and air conditioned Ran from our hotel street to the main shopping centres Tickets are very cheap less than $1 for most trips

title: Getting about
review: Great transport system Can be very busy at times though Might be a struggle if travelling with cases

title: Good but avoid rush hour
review: This is the underground of Bangkok The tickets for this cannot be interchangeable with Skytrain which is above ground There are some interconnecting stations between the two like in AsokeSukhumvit and Sala DaengSilom There may be others but I am not sure Overall a nice way to travel slightly more expensive than the skytrain Trust me avoid rush hour Its a mad house

title: Super deal
review: Save Bahts and time by taking the train We were forced because the taxis wouldn't take 5 people Once we got over the fear we were good Just do it

title: Too few
review: BTS is very convenient but there are too few trains running at any time of the day which makes you wait in the heat sometimes for almost 10 minutes It is also very expensive compared to most others capital of the world and only a few stations ate handicap friendly It could be much much better

title: Fabulous, cheap, quick and easy to navigate
review: A great service to get from the airport to Bangkok The trains run regularly are very clean and safe way to travel

title: Fastest and cheapest way to Airport
review: Better than hopping into a taxi or catching an uberIt's the easiest and cheapest way to go to the airport

title: Safe, Easy Way to Navigate
review: A reliable efficient easy to use public transportation system  The most expensive fare (for the maximum number of stops) is only 52 Baht (about $160)  I never paid more than 42B  Because the Sky Train runs high above the ground it's a very good way to see some of Bangkok's many sites  Even when "packed like sardines" it's easy to exit at your chosen stop  Because I was in Bangkok during protests the Sky Train could take us places taxis could not

title: Convenient and quick
review: The ARL is easy to find at the airport and must be the quickest way into town It is also cheap relative to similar links in other cities Trains run every 15 minutes and take about 25 min into town where it connects (a bit convolutedly) to the underground and monorail

title: Dont take the bus. Take the skybus.
review: BTS is simply the best way to travel in bangkok You could go almost anywhere in a matter of minutes It could take you hours by road The sky train is indeed a huge boon for the public The stop near siam city is the central station from where you can decide which way to go

title: excellent n fast
review: this connection from airport to city is 30 minitues to siam and best and fastest you could reach the city and at lower costs then a taxi

title: Fast, save and comfortable
review: The BTS Skytrains is the fastest and safest transportation system in Bangkok I always use it if possible

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Well very good link cheap ( 45 B a person ) a taxi would cost you a 1000 B easy and takes you right in the airport sometimes buses are full and they want you to wait several hours but withtthis train you get near the victory Monument where you can catch a minibus right on amazing link

title: Good for most areas
review: We used the Skytrain on several occasions and found the whole process to be very easy It is a shame that it does not cover more of the city but I am sure that will come

title: Skytrain efficient but busy and very crowded
review: Cannot rely on staff helping in English and can be vague with directions Suggest you research well before arriving at statikn

title: A must to do
review: Booked this trip as had seen the train market on tv  unbelievable how close to the track the market is  we went in on the train and stood in the market as the train went out  amazing  We then went onto the floating market which was also interesting with a boat ride into the market amongst the action  A well worth while trip and our guide ‚ÄúSARA‚Äù was first class

title: So easy to get around
review: I have used the BTS skytrain to get the the JJ Market ( Mo Chit )  from the stop near my hotel ( Ashok ) Easy to use  just read the sign that tells you how much to the stop you want to go to  then change your notes into coins at the booth  then enter coins into the machines  all written in English

title: The only way to go in Bangkok
review: BTS makes travel in Bangkok so much easier than surface travel  And no dealing with tuktuk or taxi drivers  You speed along watching all the traffic jams below you

title: Good but Can be made improved a LOT!!
review: The BTS Skytrain is great to get around Bangkok However the major issue is the haphazard way in which things have been developed   Single Pass should be usable across BTS MRT BRT RailLink and Ferries If that were possible it would be a delightful experience  You needs 1 5 and 10 THB coins to buy machines from Vending machines If you do not have change do not worry look for a Change counter nearby The vending machines are easy to use Just pick the station The number on the station is the fare)

title: Easy ride
review: This was an easy connection from the airport just located a few floors down  It was simple and easy to maneuver to connect to the BTS and then to our destination from there  It takes about 25 minutes to get into central Bangkok but it was a smooth hassle free ride

title: Handy but gets busy!
review: We use the sky train a lot to get around It is air conditioned cheap and efficient At peak times trains run every couple of minutes and off peak about every 5

title: Easy travel avoid the traffic
review: Bangkok traffic the the worste I try to use the BTS metro as much as I can It saves time and headaches for sure Its reliable too

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Drop the taxis and greedy tuk tuks Take the sky train if possible It's  cheap and easy to do Once you try it once it's easy to just jump on and it runs to some of the great shopping malls and attractions  like SiamParagon mall and Chatuchak weekend market

title: Quick and inexpensive
review: Hate the scammers that hang around the sky train areas The sky train is efficient and a great way to get around Peak hours its a crush

title: what a great way to miss bangkok's traffic
review: I was lucky the hotel i was staying in was a 5 minute walk to a skytrain station and it was on the rail linkso it took me 25 minutes to reach the airport instead of maybe 1 hour Also it cost me B40 instead of B300 will always take that in future

title: Efficient transport
review: A quick and easy way to get around Bangkok The roads are so chaotic around the Sukhumvit area this is the only way to travel

title: Quick and efficient
review: If you are travelling light it is the best method of transport between downtown and the airport It's relatively cheap and quick rather than be in trafficIf you have heavy luggage connecting to the BTS (skytrain) is a little bit hard as there are not escalators or lifts at many of the stations to get to and from the platforms

title: Saved Me
review: Due to Airport rail link train it was possible for me to catch my flight on time rather i would have missed my flight

title: Sanctuary from the heat and humidity!
review: Great way to get around if you are not in to getting stuck in traffic and have no problem getting sweaty from walking to and from the train station

title: MRT or BTS 5 Stars
review: I have lived in Thailand for 6 months and I always use the transit system Cheap clean and easy to navigate Recommend highly I am returning in August and I will use again

title: Brilliant
review: Just easy and cheap and the air con awesome Used it every day to get around Bangkok Forget the cabs

title: cheap and effecient
review: a fast and affordable effortless way to get around bangkok   great connections with river boats the metro and the train to the airport

title: Airport link
review: The airport link is a great way to get to and from the airport and Bangkok It has convenient points of contact with the skytrain and the subway system

title: Cleanest Transportation Ever
review: This brand new transportation is the cleanest thing I had ever seen The trains are comfortable and the stops are in the best places to get around Bangkok Every other major city should take note

title: Very good service
review: Service very good trains very clean very cheap can get from the airport to Sukhumvit in around 40 minutes for very little money indeed

title: Smart choice of travel within Bngkok
review: There are always rush hour in Bangkok so the train is a very good option to travel within Bangkok During the day the train is crowdy but it takes you to your destination in a safe manner Remember to have small money in your pocket as the ticket machine only eat coins

title: Brilliant alternative for airport visitors
review: First impressions of a country tend to linger and so few will complain about a lowcost alternative to the eternal hassle of trying to secure a taxi at Suvannaphuum Airport and then struggling through Bangkok's notorious traffic to get to downtown  With the Airport Link you are guaranteed to be in downtown in 45 minutes in comfort and safety  The Airport Link is fast airconditioned relatively inexpensive and clean but it requires the traveller to know a little bit about Bangkok as the only two viable places to get off are Makkasan or Phaya Thai (the end of the line and linked to the BTS)  The escalatorelevator system is not brilliant so elderly people or those who are carrying 30kg of carved wooden souvenirs may find it challenging but for the majority it represents the easiest and most hasslefree way of getting into central Bangkok  Note The Airport Link was originally conceived as a kind of express service for tourists so there might be people prepared to sell $5 'Express' tickets rather than the $2 normal tickets  Much better to get some Thai 10baht coins or 20baht notes and use the vending machines

title: Efficient
review: It is not only efficient but also clean and fast way to move around It might be a little pricy but it is definitely the best way to move around safely   Howver I would also recomend trying local tuktuks and motorbike taxis

title: Needs to begin earlier in the day
review: We'd been told that BTS starts at 5AM so that's when we'd planned to take it to the airport  However from the station near our hotel the trains begin at 520 AM then from the station that goes directly to the airport trains do not start until 6 AM  We *almost* missed our flight due to this misinformation  They have information clerks there who do their job but appear none to friendly  Even with language barriers I would have appreciated a smile

title: Clean!!! Can get to most tourist areas from here
review: The BTS was our main transportation while in BKK It's efficient other than scanning on the way out which gets bottled necked I wish it stayed open past midnight 2am would be reasonable especially for a tourist city

title: Cheap and easy to use
review: We only use the airport rail link to travel back to airport at the end of our visit but it was a third of the price of a cab journey when we arrived Although the train does sometimes get extremely busy so you may be packed in like a sardine initially it does empty out the closer it gets to the airport If you travel with rucksacks it is really easy

title: Quick way into Bangkok
review: The airport train was very good lots of room for your suitcase great way to get a bird's eye view of Bangkok on the way in A 30 minute ride Our hotel was Anajak Bangkok which was at the last stop & about a 5 minute walk to the door was very easy to get to Going back to the airport it became the first stop so easier to get a seat on the train

title: Great Public Transportation
review: The BTS is a fast easy fantastic way to get around main parts of Bangkok  Clean air conditioned (sometimes too cold) easy to navigate and very safe

title: Buy a three day pass.
review: A previous reviewer mentions the expense A three day pass costs 230 baht Less than ¬£5 and for this you get a reliable hassle free way of getting round the city and to shopping areas  Its airconditioned too  My only gripethe automated announcement system starts to grate after a while

title: Very Convenient
review: Took train a week ago and very convenient I did not have to deal with the taxis at the airport This by itself is worth it

title: One of the better sky trains
review: I use the Bangkok Sky Train nearly every day Have to say it's one of the best definitely in Asia  Just avoid rush hour as it get really cramped  Otherwise well done

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS in bangkok is a great service  unfortunately it doesnt connect the whole of Bangkok but it does a great job in helping you to get around  the traffic in Bangkok is pretty bad  trains are always clean and air conditioned with security guards at every station  ive never seen any problems at all in all the years ive been using the BTS  tip  make sure u have small coins so u can buy a ticket at the automated service  sometimes the queue is quite long to purchase at the customer service window

title: Comfort, easy, fast, affordable, simple
review: Comfort easy fast affordabel price and simple type of transportation to reach shopping and business center in Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: Best way to travel north  south of Bangkok avoiding the traffic of Bangkok city Well managed with self operated Ticketing Machine at all the stations

title: best metro in aisa
review: its simple easy to use and cheap first time maybe tedious to understand how it works but take your time and once u do its a breeze   while bts is elevated the mrt is underground   best way to reach the city from don muang airport take a cab from the airport  ( this is the base for air asia and the smaller airport than suvarnabhumi ) to bts mochit  have thb with u  change a 100 at the bts ticket counter where u will get coins of 10 thb each  go to the ticket machine opp and see your destination station and the number beside it  insert coins according that number and u get your ticket any extra excess amount if u have paid gets returned to u along with the ticket  the bts is ac so a huge relief from the heat very efficient runs every 5 mins  thai people unlike indians make queues while waiting for the doors to open  its a challenge however to find a seat during morning and evening rush hour  however evrytime i was with  a suitcase someone would always get up and offer me their seat   the traffic in bangkok is worse than mumbai or delhi so bts is the most fastest way to get around the city

title: Easy to navigate
review: We took it to JJ Market and it was easy to navigate Only about 42 baht each way per person It was clean but crowded You can buy tokens from an actual person Keep the token when you enter and return it when you leave There are special seats reserved for monks If you are female don‚Äôt sit next to them

title: Very convenient to travel in  Bangkok.
review: Very convenient for Bangkok city as BKK always traffic so the solution is the BTS always always on time and always clean and smells nice different than other Asians country

title: Great for budget travellers
review: We took the train from the airport to Bangkok City centre  The ticket only cost 45 bahts and could be easily purchased from the vending machine or service counter  The train was crowded but still quite comfortable with nice airconditioning  It had a few intermediate stations but could still brought us to Phaya Thai terminal station in around 40 mins  We could then connect to BTS sky train quite easily Highly recommended for budget travellers without lots of luggage

title: Makes life easier
review: This is pretty easy to figure out even if you're a tourist who doesn't know the local language Make sure you have a map And if you plan on using the bts for more than twice get the card it's a lot easier

title: Bangkok visit 4 days
review: Cheap clean and very well air conditioned The best way to get around Bangkok Even if you‚Äôre not near one it is probably more efficient to get a taxi bike to the nearest stop and go on from there

title: handy and reliable means of transport
review: You travel quickly and smoothly to and through Bangkok via the sky train Always very clean driving counts and very disciplined users

title: gr8
review: Gr8 2 get around Bangkok cheap compared 2 taxi & tuk tuksc alot of Bangkok while on train during day & then @ nyt everything gets lit up & looks different again was amazing ova xmas new yr's 2 c Bangkok lit up on the sky train

title: Efficient and cheap transport from the airport
review: I stayed at the Radisson Blu Plaza and took the train both to and from the airport on my trip I found the train to be fast and cheap  It did get very crowded after we got out of the airport complex There are ticket machines in english and the ticket counter staff speaks English and can help you choose the correct station to get off at

title: Conveniently shuttling people along shopping places. Get the 1 Day Pass.
review: If you are in for shopping in BKK better get a hotel near any of the BTS stations Better to get the 1 day pass (140 baht as of MayJune 2017) to avoid lining up  you can use it until 12mn of the day same day you bought it

title: Great!
review: The guide Sarah ) She is so so kind and funny and has so much knowledge to share about this beauriful country  Was very interesting visiting the umbrella market and the floating market

title: Taxi in Bangkok are very cheap and after a long range flight it doesn't worth to get an airport link
review: I travel to BKK a few timed from Suvarnabumi It os true that traffic is always heavy in BKK but it is also true that taxi are so cheap that you can just seat in the car and rest in an aircon environment Airport link brings you in a metro station and with a bulky luggage where you need to change line and get metro line or a skytrain don't expect escalator just stairs to climb with your luggages

title: Wonderful experience
review: I really enjoyed this trip especially the floating market The group was great and Sara was an amazing and caring guide

title: Excellent service
review: It's a great service if you don't have many bags or don't have time to mess around with a cab in bkk traffic The rail line has stops where you can connect with other lines

title: Exceptional
review: I don't need to take a taxi to Bangkok city centre as ARL is much faster and cheaper and comfortable Traffic jam is no longer a problem  From Suvarnabumi to Makkasan is about 20mins and follow by a 5mins MRT ride to asoke and you've reach Sukhumvit  There aren't much of these train services around in the world

title: Great way to travel
review: Easily accessible and very reliable Air conditioning makes the dofference It is easy to use and cheep

title: Great Railway
review: The BTS Skytrain is a model for other cities It is reliable clean and good value Like all railways they are much better when they go where you want to go With BTS I have found it a great way to get to parts of Bangkok to explore Being a sky train it is also very helpful when walking around and getting a little lost It is highly visible and helps maintain orientation

title: The best way to get around  Bangkok
review: Excellent train system Easy to use and you can get just about anywhere in Bangkok Cheap and easy to use

title: So easy
review: It was so easy and the staff working there were so helpful Definitely recommend it It cost us 35baht each to get to the airport

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: I travelled from Silom to MBK market Well airconditioned it can get packed during peak hours so make sure you are familiar with the map and the stops Its on time making it convenient for easy travelling Its also cheaper than other modes of transport

title: 1 minutes distance for each station.
review: Fastcleancold sky train That's total have two different lane can exchange the lane in "siam station" Every station to another station is just the 1 minutes away distance very fast

title: hard if you have to much luggage

title: Best way to get around bangkok

title: Quick but exciting experience
review: Guide sara was really kind and helpful all the time Her Englishspeaking is really good and the tour was awesome and the perfect just to have a lock of the experience Recommended

review: Very cheap and easy to use Maps etc clear and in English Just remember where you got on and won't hit a problem

title: Reliable service

title: Why bother?
review: Getting a taxi to Makkasan is nearly impossible  getting one back from there is even worse  In fact I could have taken a  taxi from the airport and made it home quicker  Taking a taxi is much easier

title: Super practical
review: Clean and fast the best way to move in Huge Bangkok Quite easy to understand how it works there took me 20min to understand everything  Then you really enjoy visiting the city so fast (sometimes its better to forget the taxi TOO MUCH TRAFFIC Go for it

title: Convenient
review: Cheap and quick way to get into the city area but closes at midnight and not open until 6am Travel by rail to lower Sukhumvit 76baht same by metered taxi 350400 rip off cab's 7001000

title: Great travel - not luggage friendly
review: Good connectivity Certain stations lack facilities for tourists with luggage bags eg Ploenchit station

title: Death Railway
review: Take the train from Kanchanaburi station along the Death Railway  Initially the views are of fields etc but after an hour you travel along the edge of the river The railway itself is quite high up and it makes you think of the extreme conditions that the men building it must have suffered At the end of the train trip walk along Hell Fire Pass to get a real feeling of the effort needed to build the aptly named Death Railway

title: Sky train
review: Efficient and quick to get you between shopping centres Signage is good to show you the different lines to take One thing that is good is that there are offices at each station to help and change your money for the machines Air conditioning is refreshing but need more carriages at peak times but even so the sky train is still an efficient way to travel

title: Fast and Efficient
review: I take the sky train regularly Although it can get very crowded during the rush hour it still beats taking a taxi during the rush hour I much appreciate the sky train as I've been vacationing in Bangkok since way before it was built and remember the old days of standstill traffic on the streets and no decent public transportation

title: Convenient, time saving, and inexpensive
review: A clean reliable relatively fast train service that keeps you out of Bangkok traffic Great value compared to taxis Links to the BTS train line at Phyathai

title: Convenient
review: Easy to use in Thai and English  Good signage  Easy to map your root and ask staff to help you on where to go and get off   Bring coins as you will need them to pay

title: The reasonable way to get around BKK
review: The reasonable way to get around BKK Its easy to access its easy to locate and cheap And it always a train leaving ore comming you dont have to wait for long

title: BEST in the world
review: As i work some of the year in Thailand I need good transport and the BTS is it Taxis are too slow in BKK and some try to inflate the prices Tuktuks are faster but just unreliable bandits The BTS is fast reliable and clean but these days quite crowdeddo expect a seat If i can use the BTS to go anywhere I do so in preference to the subway which is also excellent MAKE SURE you get a recent BTS map as new stations destinations sometimes make routes confusing

title: bangkok 2017
review: a very easy and cheap way to get round this big city    air con in carriage is good and very clean and reliable  best to buy a day pass   cost on 140 bart  so just over ¬£3 for the whole day

title: Highly efficient, clean, and safe
review: Bangkok is certainly a rising supercity and it's train system reflects this  Fast very clean security guards easily spotted and low fares  Plus their incarriage system of showing where you are on your journey and what stops you have coming up are brilliant

title: So easy
review: The BTS system was so easy to navigate around It's quite cheap and so convenient with trains running quite regularly Use the system if you want to get around  and get a sense of direction You are also able to see more than when in a cab or tuk tuk

title: Fast service
review: Its not very hamdy As in delhi metro Otherwisr if u find the way through bts U may save money compare to taxis But uber cab and bts is almost same when u r not alone

title: efficient
review: I stayed near Asok station and it was very convenient to go to BITEC (Bangna stn) Chatuchak and Siam Paragon Fast easy and reliable

title: Not affordable fort Thai, only good for tourist.
review: The only way to avoid traffic on Sukhumvit  As of for the negative review  You can not use the same transportation card (Rabbit) for both BTS and MRT   If you are handling a bag in front of you the system will consider it as the passenger and as a result the door will smash your legs and bruise your thighs badly

title: Cheap, clean, quick and convenient - the only way to travel in Bangkok
review: The traffic jams are horrendous at all times of the day and night Buy a day pass and travel in comfort  knowing that you arrive at your destination at a given time without all of the worry  By far the easiest way to get around the city get to the river and then use the extensive system of ferry boats  Do make yourself familiar with the different ferry routes as indicated by the flags

title: Best guide Sara
review: Sara is the the best guide She explained very well both markets and the trip was really nice )))))
