review: BTS the safest and fastest way to reach places connects via BTS To avoid time getting tickets all the time  get a train card and keep topping it up

title: A hard airport rail link
review: Bangkok ARL is a crowded airport link every station had a lot of people alighting and boarding if you carry a lot of luggages oh you'll become a can of sarden  I don't think it's fast but it's cheap  It took 15 hours from  SUVARNABHUMI Airport to MBK when I left Bankgkok just 45 minutes by meter taxi  Also 90% stations were no elevator or a only a out of service lift  We need to take our luggages stairs up and down  What's a wounerful airport express

title: Easy to use and efficient
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok Cheap easy to use machines and frequent airconditioned trains

title: MRT different form BTS
review: Because of the different company that built the metro line ssytem in Bangkok BTS and MRT have different way in buying their tickets MRT uses token and BTS uses card How we wish they are using the same system so that we will not have to change all the time or line up and buy tickets not to be inconvenient

title: Really a great way to move around.
review: It's great The only thing was that we could not find an elevator anywhere on the piers so with two small kids and one strollers it was a bit tricky but still manageable After riding the skytrain there is no point in taking a taxi anymore It's that convinient

title: Cheap, fast and convenient
review: The MRT is an underground tube system that runs through the most important localities in Bangkok and suburbs The older blue line originates at Hua Lamphong station and terminated at Tao Poon The new Purple line also called the Chalong Ratchadam line originates at Tao Poon and terminates at Khlong Bang Phai currently and the rest of the line till Rat burana is yet to become operational The minimum adult ticket is 16 bahts with gradual increments depending upon the distance I found its more economical to travel longer distances The Metro Malls in some important stations offer a wide variety of basic shopping Seamless ticket booking between blue and purple lines exists however no seamless ticketing for BTS and Airport Rail Link exists although the changing stations between these do exist

title: Efficient Train System for travelling!
review: I really enjoyed train rides to go to markets & malls It is a very good way to travel economically & comfortably We can easily avoid peak traffic hours as we are tourists Also you get to know the city better if you travel by local mass transport You also get an elevated view of city from train Maps are available online & offline Combination of trains buses & taxis works well in Bangkok and also saves money

title: Easy to use and Clean
review: I was impressed by the BTS The train system is easy to use and affordable I would recommend using the airport train to get to and from the airport Cheaper than a taxi

title: Busy
review: The BTS was jammed packed but is a very cheap and easy was to travel to certain parts of Bangkok Used it once to experience it but decided to pay a bit extra to get the taxi back to the motel

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: In traffic jam capital the quickest and easiest way to get around the city Air conditioned as well for a bit of relief from the heat

title: The only way to get around the centre
review: If you're in the centre plan everything using the sky train as transport Buy a 'rabbit' card and avoid the ticket queues at peak times Escape the heat in its extreme ac Keep bags in front of you in 2 years it's never happened to me but I've heard about lots of cut bags If you don't want to waist time stuck in traffic you have no other choice except the MRT which is also good but I've only been on it once

title: Best way to get around -- even to or from airport!
review: Full disclosure I lived in northern Thailand for four years before I had enough courage to take the BTS from Suvarnabhumi Airport to a hotel off of Sukamvit Road I don't even think I knew you could do that for the first three years After that it was easy to take it to the shopping centre Of course it helps that Thai people  even if they have very little English  always want to help you Bangkok is justifiably proud of its fast efficient lowcost public transportation system

title: Quickest, cheapest, easiest way to get around Bangkok
review: Whenever we book our hotels on Sukhumvit the first thing we check is access to the Skytrain Staying on Sukhumvit the sky train makes easy access to all the major shopping areas as well as the Chatuchak weekend markets Most trips are between 20 to 40 baht but you need coins to buy tickets so we usually go for an all day pass at 120 baht to save lining up for tickets and searching for change The trains run every few minutes They are quick and very clean inside You avoid all the Bangkok traffic and pollution all for a few baht per trip Unless you need to visit somewhere way off the Skytrain route I would recommend this as the only way to get around Bangkok

title: Great dat out
review: What a great day out our guide Mr T was very helpful throughout the day and greatly added to the overall experience  The train market was an experience of local culture where as the floating market has become far to commercialised towards tourists Best thing on the day was the trip on the local train through the market

title: Great
review: I like it  I hope every gonna change this years  I heard about news  That's they will  Use one card all the ways to airport underground  And centres sounds interesting Good job guys

title: AGood Way To Get Around
review: The MRT is a good way to travel if you are going somewhere in the city that it can be used It's cheap and efficient Along with the BTS is the way to travel in Bangkok

title: would class service
review: the Bangkok BTS is a world class service   never more than a 5 minute wait for a train   clean carriages and reliable

title: Convenient and cheap
review: Fastest and Easiest way to go to the city from the airport Train schedule is mostly on time Well maintained train and staff promote patience and orderly when boarding or alighting from the train enough space on the train and alloted area to accommodate luggages However there is a bit of a walk from airport link to the BTS station

title: Bangkok is bursting with cultural heritage, sights, sounds and smells of the famous street food!
review: One of the main high points outside of the beautiful sightseeing locations was the inexpensive prices to eat and drink in this friendly and busy metropolis Public transport is excellent cheap and punctual

title: Just perfect
review: This is the best way to get about this very busy city If you miss a train wait two minutes and another appears Ticket office is efficient and quick Very cheap to travel throughout city to all major spots

title: Affordable transportation
review: Pretty straight forward transportation into the heart of Bangkok  Pretty cheap too Prices are according to the distance You could buy the ticketstoken at the station self serve machines Try to bring small changes

title: Fastest way into the city
review: The ride from end to end costs 45 bath pp and takes 30 min It departs every 15 min You can take the first train at 530 am from Paya Thai From the airport you need to get all the way down to B level it is fairly easy to find  The ride is comfortable easy to get into and efficient meanwhile the traffic outside is just at stand still

title: Fun but pricy
review: It is a great fun We were there with children of 5 and 8 which were full price All of a sudden it is 100 baht for 4 which is more cheap and more nice in a taxi

title: Comfortable and fast
review: Unfortunately it doesn't cover very much of the city and the interchanges with the underground (MRT) and the express boat service on the river are few  If you're adventerous try Bangkok's famous 2 wheeler taxis (motorcycles) or get to know the bus networks  That's what the locals do

title: Bullet train
review: Hassle free journey ample space for luggage and passengers brings you straight to the city center in the least possible time  However the frequency between trains should be reduced

title: Easy and quick.
review: Easy and quick way to go around Bangkok Very clean and easy to buy tickets from the ticket machines

title: Fast, economical, convenient
review: Used it a few times and saved lots of money and time  The signage was in english and there were plenty of people willing to assist us  We spent 25hours in a cab from DMK airport going to the hotel  Could have used the subway and saved 15 hours

title: smog free.
review: Short distance from Lebua tower hotel Obtaining tickets was simple travelling reminded me of the British underground A little more expensive than going by taxi but no smog and no continual stop starting as in taxis

title: Excelent
review: This is the tipe of train that you wish forFastckean and with wifi i was very impressed about itI give 10 of 10

title: Use Rabbit card
review: I love using their Rabbit Card otherwise you are stuck fumbling for change or having to stand in line for coins

title: The best!!
review: Inexpensive and east to use  Book your hotel near a station and you can get to it from the airport with ease From there you can get to all the sites and back

title: Cheap and efficient
review: Easy to get around air co and cheap  Announcements in Thai and English  Tip though is avoid rush hour as it is major sardine time

title: Quick and economical
review: Be aware that few stations have elevators or escalators The trains are frequent and well air conditioned

title: Skip the traffic
review: For about 45 baht you can sit back (if you're lucky enough to find a seat) and enjoy the air conditioned railway to downtown Bangkok  Ive been stuck in traffic before and it was the absolute worst  It made LA traffic seem like it was nothing  I literally stood still in a taxi for 40 minutes   I even felt bad that the taxi was kept in idle that long just for air conditioning   This railway is quick smooth and takes you all over Bangkok

title: Useful, but packed
review: We got on the train at the second stop on the line heading to Suvarnabhumi airport and it was already packed By the time we reached the airport it was muxh quieter a lot of locals seem to use it for commuting However it took us right to the airport and ran regularly at a very reasonable price

title: Easy and Cheap
review: A cheap and easy way of getting around Bangkok Links to the Metro and Airport Rail Link train Trains can become very crowded and long queues for the train

title: Best and most inexpensive way to get to airport
review: Airport Rail Link is quite convenient and easy to use The service is very reliable and not expensive It saves you from having to sit in traffic and dealing with taxi drivers trying to rip you off The ride is comfortable and arrives there quickly There are also some station that connect to local BTS & MRT stations

title: BTS is fast and convenient
review: It is very fast and convenient to travel by BTS There are 2 main road lines Sukhumvit and Silom It is very easy to use this kind of transport If you don't know when you can drop by the place you want go to the office booths in every station platform then ask the staffs to give you a map in which all the station points are illustrated clearly You can look at the map to identify your place If you are not sure about anything just ask the staffs or the security they are very enthusiastic One more thing to bear in mind is it is cheap if you travel a long distance but expensive if go for a short routine For example it costs 52 baht to travel from Bearing (the terminal station) to Siam (the interchange station) but it also costs 52 baht for the same routine from Bearing to Mochit (the last station) So take it into consideration guys Plus there is an interchange between Sukhumvit line and Silom line at Siam station and an interchange between BTS and MRT at Asok station It is cheaper to travel by MRT but there are fewer stations only from Asok to Hualamphong So it's up to you to choose your appropriate way to go Have fun time in Thailand

title: Easy
review: Easy fast cheap  Can not ask for more Traveling light it is great Lots of baggage take a taxi

title: Lovely!
review: Yep a little hectic at rush hour but where isn't Love it simple to use easy to understand Clean and personally I feel pretty safe Really cheap effective way getting around mental Bangkok

title: Know your currency
review: You pay a different rate depending on your trip so as a firsttimer to Bangkok I wasn't that familiar with the coinage That was a bit confusing for the first trip But given Bangkok's street traffic congestion the Skytrain is the way to go

title: Tourists if more than one take a taxi !
review: Far better to take a taxi and ensure meter is put on If not just leave taxi and get the next one if its outside your hotel expect a story Generally Bangkok taxis are good and cheap BTS is about climbing stairs  waiting crowding  rush hours  heat no toilets looking for change (you have to go to a booth to get change to put in the ticket machine) and then a walk all in a very hot and polluted environment BTS not particularly cheaper if 2 3 people

title: Eagerly waiting for more lines
review: BTS is a crucial and fast method for getting around the city better than Taxi in time saving  It is very easy to buy ticket from the ticket machine  The carriages are clean and well airconditioned    Unfortunately there are only two BTS lines (and anone MRT line) in Bangkok  Eagerly waiting for more lines

title: US$ 1.5 takes  you in comfort to city
review: Airport Taxis are bit of Scare for any foreigner specially in BangkokAirport link is the best way to avoid go to Basement floor very comfortable setting for buying ticket (machine & office) Pay Baht 45 (US$ 15) to get to city Two stations are in the city centre MAKASAN and PAYA THA both connect you to either underground Metro (MAKASAN) or BTS overhead rail (PAYA THA) check your hotel and disembark at appropriate station

title: So handy
review: Buy a Rabbit card for 100 baht (¬£230) if you're in Bangkok for longer than a few days and just top it up when u get low Easiest way to get around by far The BTS does NOT go near the old city but we just got the BTS to the ferry terminal and then got the 35p boat up the river Avoid rush hour if you can but if not you'll still survive

title: Great experience!
review: The BTS Skytrain is excellent  cheap and effective way to get around Very well maintained and run

title: Top notch!
review: At less than a 100 bth it will get you right in the heart of Bangkok A great way to avoid the overpriced taxis at the airport

title: 25 minutes to airport from Phaya Thai (city centre)
review: Good choice if you're not carrying really big suitcases Coming from the Skytrain where most escalators only go upward the walk down the BTS platform can be quite a strain Once you get to Phaya Thai sign lead clearly On the floor where you get tickets proceed to the counterit's faster than dealing with the machines At least here there's an elevator to the platformwhich can get very busy and crowded so watch your wallets When you move in enter to the righthand side if you want a seat Too bad they've forgone the express line that takes you straight to the airport  If coming from the airport line up properly and don't try to jump right in after the people have gone down Security needs a minute to scan and check the train   It's 45 baht one way versus at ten times that on a cab If you're alone or a couple Airport Rail is a good idea

title: Quick and easy
review: This is a fastQuick and easy way to get from the airport to your hotelI use this sometimes and never had an issue

title: efficient way of commuting
review: I have a mental block of maps but my husband  effortlessly figures out routes in whichever country we visit  It initially took us time to figure out the price of the ticket and which  route to take as there was a change over required   The only flip side being there should have been at least one ticket counter selling physical tickets for those struggling to understand maps like me  Thank god for my husband    although they had change counters for the vending machine they weren't able to help with the route bit   overall fastest way to commute within the city

title: Easiest way
review: Most cheap fast and easiest way to reach bangkok town from the airport Costed us just 52 bhatt per person And we reached ploenchit station where our hotel was located in less than an hour's time  Must use it

title: Skytrain around the city
review: Easy to use and follow signs they are in englishand staff very helpful if unsure Very cheap to travel by Skytrain thus avoiding lengthy taxi journeys in the heavy traffic in Bangkok

title: The best way to get around
review: Easy to get from and to places besides the shuttle boat services Self tkt machines in English Very convenient and simple to hop on

title: Good and Fast Service
review: I took it every time from Phay Thaya station it costs xactly 45 Baht to the airport from there  fast and comfy chairs

title: Quick and inexpensive
review: If you don't have a lot of luggage this is the quickest way into town and very cheap too  Easy connection at the end of the line to the BTS Sky Train

title: Well equipped and clean
review: Its the best way to see the main city you can have a daily pass of 140 baht you can start from one station to other as you like it

title: perfect people mover
review: pickup inside airport at ground level connects to all other transport options good ac and good seating

title: Sara was rhe best
review: Sara was lovely Really happy woman explaining everything Best trip so far  You get a lot for the little money you pay

title: Easy to use and avoids delays in queuing traffic
review: We took a chance using rail compared to taxi transfer it was quick and easy Definitely recommend others to use

title: Easiest and cheapest way to the airport
review: It gets the job done However I think BTS is a much better train  both inside the train and train platform

title: Sukhumvit from above...
review: Clean cool safe Guards at every station Priceworthy

title: Airport Rail Link
review: Located at B2 of the airport it is a convenient way of travelling to the hotel if your hotel is near the BTS Need to change at Phaya Thai (mostly) to connect to the BTS The express train broke down on my visit so took the normal one About 35 minutes ride from the airport to Phaya Thai Only 45bath Clean and convenient Take a deep breath and exhale if you see passengers piling their luggagesbags on the seatsmost inconsiderate for some of these people The thai people don't do that Will be good to show some respective and civic mindedness when in someone else's land

title: Best way to get around
review: Very efficient  Cheap  Best way to get around Bangkok  Takes you to airport if you get off at the proper spot  It was a little overwhelming at first but got pretty easy to use once I got the hang of it

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: I love the Sky Train Quick clean easy to maneuver and takes you to the main areas of town What more can you ask

title: Bridge over the river Kwai and Hellfire pass
review: What a fantastic trip our guide Ken was very knowledgable about the bridge the railway and Thai culture in general he was full of information throughout the day He managed to get us very good seats on the train and his English language was excellent The best part of the day was the visit to the Hellfire pass  a very moving and humbling experience greatest of respect to all those who were involved  A long day but we would definitely recommend you give it a visit

title: Great! But disappointing
review: Caught the Sky Train many times It os efficient and inexpensive IT IS CLEAN and it is a great way to get around  I did get pickpocketed on the train but I took a photo and reported him to the authorities I do not know if they caught him and he was NOT Thai He was from the continent and apparently they work the trains because they appear less suspicious as though they too are tourists  The train guards were very apologetic and helpful I was lucky I caught him and he dropped my wallet and I lost nothing Otherwise I recommend then BTS to everyone just don‚Äôt use your back pockets

title: Very useful system
review: This is a very effective and cheap system  My only caveat is that depending on the number of people going and where you are heading (or heading out of) in Bangkok it can be more costeffective to take a taxi  From most places near Sukhumvit you can get a taxi to Suvarnabhumi Airport for a total of under 400B including tolls and depending on the time of day the taxi trip can be under 30 minutes  Taking a taxi relieves you of the need to do the hiking with luggage that you have to do to get to the Link from the BTS or MRT systems

title: Fantastic
review: Great way to get around Bangkok and very cool and clean The ticket booths will not sell single tickets though instead give coin change for the machines Or arm yourself with coins before you go Clear English info before each station and it is repeated on the TV monitors showing adverts

title: fast way to travel in Bangkok
review: skytrain certainly made my travel from one part of the city to another faster and with less hassles It was so easy to get the tickets The stations were clean The train was comfortable I have nothing to dislike

title: easy and perfect
review: the best way to visit Bangkok quick and easy  prices are cheapstops at any convenient or interesting places

title: Amazing experience!
review: Sara was the best tour guide She did a great job explaining all aspects of the tour and our group had a great time exploring the markets Would highly recommend

title: Convenient and a cool place to be when it's very hot outside
review: It's a very good alternative to ground transportation as one can imagine in Bkk You can buy a pass for the the day and even if you do not travel for the whole price of the pass it's still worth it just to avoid queuing to buy tickets at the machine especially when you have kids with you And one noticeable behaviour when the wagon is packed and when you have young children people that are seating give their seat to the children or to the mother with a toddler Thank you to these people that we have met along our trip

title: The cool way to get around Bangkok
review: When I say it's the cool way I mean it literally  The airconditioning is so great  I just got on the BTS Skytrain when I needed to cool off  A day pass costs 140 Baht and then you have unlimited trips in a day

title: Only way to get around
review: Will keep this one short and sweet This is the only way to travel around Bangkok Above the busy streets no smog airconditioned clean and easy to navigate  Why deal with traffic jams and haggling over trip prices Great way to get around

title: fast and easy
review: Great was of getting around combined with the sky train is clean and fast plus the price is super cheap

title: A shortcut to town
review: This is the greatest way to escape from the traffic jam in Bangkok But please avoid the rush hours because there are crowded of officers

title: excellent but crowded train
review: clean mtr trains run underground and accessible w fully travellerelevator assisted (unlike BTS many stations are manned by flights of stairs)

title: A safe, fun way to travel
review: Good value convenient way to get around staff at the stations are helpful Be prepared for a cosy trip if its rush hour

title: Excellent
review: Efficient clean cheep and biggest plus aircon in side It is easy to purchase tickets you will need coins for the machines as they don't take notes

title: Super fast, super convenient
review: Travel on the BTS everyday and its never let me down   Just get on and take a ride even if you have nowhere to be

title: A great way to travel
review: This is a must do experience An overnight train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai The chairs get made into beds about 9pm and you can get a full nights sleep in an actual bed The toilets are a drop to the track which is also an experience This route can be booked in advance via 12goasia which is a great booking service You pick up the tickets at the office in Bangkok (it‚Äôs just over the road from the train station) all very easy Highly recommended

title: Convenient if alone and witouth luggage
review: Fast and cheap but not very convenient with luggage or when in a group A taxi to anywhere in central Bangkok will cost around 10 USD and will drop you in front of your hotel Going by train involves getting on the BTSMRT (and deal with the guards that insist pretending to look into your luggage) then drag the luggage around the station then around the airport

title: I dont like taxis
review: so this is just a dream  and such comfort all the way to the airport  just great   I would say the seats are a little uncomfortable

title: Very efficient
review: Clean & efficient Could be better mapped out & the access is a bit tortuous lots of stairs Cheap though & better than the stupid traffic Very cold sometimes so not good for our homeostatic mechanism never mind the sinuses

title: Why take anything else?
review: easy to figure out and efficient Why take a cab

title: Great way to get to hotel from the airport
review: Just ensure you have THB handy to buy your tickets as no Credit Card acceptedreally clean handy and regular service  Easy to access Pity we couldn't get the train back from city to the airport due to a very early flight so just check operating hours  Good value if you can manage

title: Best way to move around
review: Can be really crowded at peak hours especially if you are travelling with kids  But certainly will save you a lot of time and money Traffic can be really heavy  There a number of interchanges  where you will switch between Skytrain and Subway trains so do note that some popular places with be served by both

title: Efficient time saver
review: The best thing to do is get prepaid cards with multiple rides for convenience sake The 25 rides card goes for 550 THB for students (anyone under 23 years old)   There is a fee for starting a new card so in total I paid 650 THB for the card which can be topped off when you run out of rides   The BTS is very reliable thus it makes it the best mode of transportation in Bangkok You avoid traffic and are easily connected to many areas   I took the BTS from the airport to my hotel (Pullman Bangkok Hotel G) which took about 30 minutes longer than estimated by google maps due to the sporadic but relatively frequent train arrival times It can be challenging for solo travelers with two pieces of luggage so keep in mind that you‚Äôll need to go out of your way to make it up and down platforms because elevators are not frequently used

title: The sensible way to travel in Bangkok
review: Why waste money on Tuk Tuks and cabs Buy a Rabbit card and use the excellent BTS Clean reliable and efficient It's the only way to get around Bangkok

title: Cheap & fast way to move around
review: Buy a storecard balance value can be cash out Save time to buy ticket everytime just tap n go Always stay at hotel near the station Hot climate in Bangkok is not nice to walk outside too much

title: airport rail link
review: its an excellent service at an affordable price all that you have to do is explore this wonderful convinience as bkk is  always suffers with long traffic jams

title: Effective and Efficient, and it is Economical (EEE)
review: We love the MRT in Bangkok It is not only EEE it is also very clean and safe mode of transport The staff are professional and helpful too

title: Very quick
review: Much faster than road traffic easy to use card system to use for single trip or dayweek pass Great way to get around

title: crap shoot
review: if the traffic is bad in BKK then its a good idea to take the train Otherwise its faster and about the same price for two people to take a taxi as well as being much more convenientAlso if you are traveling from one end of the city to the other its a good idea to take the train

title: Easy
review: Great experience of what is must be like to be a sardine  Easy to navigate Everyone is on their phones Everyone

title: Very cheap to use
review: Is a great way to get around and see Bangkok and so easy to use Very reliable and always running on time

title: Easy & Economical transportation in Bangkok
review: If you're travelling into Bangkok the BTS Skytrain can bring you to many destinations inside and around Bangkok with the 2 lines as Sukhumvit and Silom the Skytrain save you lot of $$$$ and time due to the worst Bangkok traffic jams in the peak hours On Both lines few main or central stations have the access to Subway (MRT) or Bus Transit (BRT) Airport rail link stops at Phaya Thai BTS Airport rail link has its own fare from Suvarnabhumi International airport to the last station meet up the BTS Sukhumvit line at Phaya Thai BTS Rabbit card or other BTS card can not use on the Airport Rail Link or MRT  SIam BTS station is a Central Station There is covered skywalk linked from Siam BTS to other stations with clearly signs and directions to all venues shopping malls attractions along the Skywalk We purchased the Rabbit card coz we are planning to comeback to BKK the Rabbit card valid for 5 years minimum top up is 100 baht max 1000 baht 100 baht is just for the Rabbit card with no value for refunds The Rabbit card is easily damaged and you have to pay extra 100baht for replacement then you can transfer the balance on the damaged card to the new ones at any BTS station ( manually by BTS staffs) It happened to me once with the Rabbit card inside my back pocket

title: Our annual month in Bangkok.
review: If you have never been to Bangkok be warned that it has some of the worst traffic of any large city in the world  I do not want to split hairs here comparing one traffic nightmare with another but if you want to spend over an hour in a cab to go two miles then go for it    Or you can take the BTS Skytrain throughout the city and whizz over the traffic congestion below  The coaches are new well tended and air conditioned  They do get busy during rush hour but the worst is nothing like the frustration of missing a dinner reservation because of traffic  You can purchase fares many different ways  Because we are here for awhile we get what they call a Rabbit Card  It is loaded with whatever you wish to pay  You swipe the card over the card reader when you enter a station of ingress then do it again at your station of egress  You can reload it as it depletes and the card stays valid for 24 months  So we bring it back with us each year

title: Excelent
review: We stay hotel close train walking distanceThe seurity is good and staff help you if needA lot of coffe shops

title: Cheap and Easy
review: There are constantly trains coming and going from the airport which means little waiting time It's cheap and easy which makes it the best way to get to the city

title: Excellent
review: Easy to use I like very much Save your time save your money too I recommended this transportation Good service example buy rubbit card to use

title: Good transport system
review: We took the skytrain to the market and then back to MBK then back to near our hotel and found it easy to use clean with air con Trains are very regular so it doesn't matter if you just miss one Great way to get around Bangkok

title: best way to travel fast in Bangkok
review: I use MRT (the subway) and BTS often almost everyday  This is the best way to travel around BKK The limitation for travellers is difficulty in getting on the train during rush hours It's similat to Tokyo's rush hours Be prepared

title: Clean, fast, functional
review: The sky train is fast and you rarely have to wait more than two minutes at a station before a train arrives The trains are clean and not too crowded wouldn't class this as an attraction although it's nice to see Bangkok from slightly higher up the sky train is first and foremost just a means of transport

title: Very Quick and cheap..
review: I always try to get a hotel near the Airport Link line as it's by far the quickest and cheapest way to travel to and from the airport  It links up to the BTS and the Metro also so you can use it to travel to most places  Beats sitting in a taxi in BKK traffic for hours

title: Great Way of Transportation Around Bangkok
review: Cheap fast easy What more can one ask for  The BTS Skytrain and MRT trains are a great way to travel through Bangkok but you'll have to make do with walking or grabbing a taxituk tuk if you want to travel around the Old City    I found the MRT to be the easiest to travel around when it came to hauling luggage to and from the airport but the BTS and Skytrain are good as well Just take note that some stations have escalators going up but no escalators going down so you may have to drag your luggage down the stairs (hence why I preferred the MRT they have escalators going in both directions at every station) Also take note that the Skytrain carriages are fewer in number so it gets more crowded (and hence a bit more difficult to travel with luggage) especially at Siam station and during rush hour (5PM to 8PM)   A phenomenon that you may be interested in takes place at 8AM and 6PM everyday Siam is a good place to witness it )

title: Catch daily train from Kanchanaburi to Nam Tok for 100baht (¬£2)
review: There are a couple of trains daily so we took the early morning one from Kanchanaburi (607) to Nam Tok the end of the line  It cost 100 THB (¬£2) which is the flat fee for all foreigners for any distance along this train route (so you could travel all the way from Bangkok to Nam Tok for 100THB)  It takes around 3 hours to reach Nam Tok from where you can travel to Hellfire Pass (by taxi or by local bus)  Best to sit on Left hand side for views  Soon after you leave the main station at Kanchanaburi the train travels over the famous bridge  If you catch the morning train you may be lucky enough to catch the sunrise over the river  Stunning  Keep watching along the way especially as the train crawls over some of the 'house of cards' bridges which look impossible but have withstood the test of time  I had mixed views about coming here & riding on this train  The history of this railway is harrowing so many lives lost & destroyed in order to build this link from Thailand to Burma but on balance I think I would rather see it continue to be used than to fall into disrepair & disuse  The line currently ends at Nam Tok but there has been talk over the years of reopening the rest of the line into Myanmar

title: Easy to use once you know how
review: So clean and we'll organised Took a little getting used to but once you understood what was needed it was easy Little tip only pay to the stop you want to get off at as it's not like the London underground where you can pay from a to b and get off at various stops along the way

title: SIMPLE, COOL WAY TO TRAVEL
review: Traffic can be so bad in BKK that you need an alternative and the SKYTRAIN (along with the MTR  the local 'underground') is the perfect solution The system is easy to understand effectively it is a giant Y with signage is in Thai and English And it is cheap by Western standards You can pay per distance  x for y stops But it is probably easier to buy a full day ticket (sadly you cannot buy a multi day ticket as far I know) Between this the MTR and the odd taxi (cheap providing the meter is used) travelling around one of the busiest cities in the World is easy

title: Fast and efficient
review: There were six of us in a group The train cost about twice that of a taxi but was much faster during rush hour

title: Stung by bee
review: I was stung  by a bee near my eye this morning while standing at the station the station staff were fantastic they pulled the stinger out of the bite and picked aloe Vera leaf to put on it Absolutely wonderful so very kind

title: Give it a try if staying in Bangkok
review: We've done this a few times now as we were getting fed up with the taxis outside the airport appearing to be regulated and then refusing to put the meter on and charging what they think they can get away with It was clean fast cheap and efficient with connections to the MRT and BTS systems in central bangkok being the biggest benefit f you know where your hotel is in relation to where you get off Good if you don't have too many large bags and not far to walk otherwise the benefit is eroded and you might as well take the taxi

title: Nice group tour with hotel pickup yet can be touristy in some parts
review: Decent price for 2 tours (railway market and floating market) railway train ride early morning pickup and the twoway 12 hours drive in and out of Bangkok  Our guide Tammy and driver were great hosts Quite a fun and interesting experience Look out for delicious bargains at the floating market like Thai food at the food centre and coconut icecream For railway market keep an eye out for things like fresh coconuts snacks on bargain and pictures  photo cards for sale

title: Great city transport
review: I think is One of the most confortable city transports I have seen Due to how Bangkok is designed it is perfect to go from One side of the city to the other really fast More stations were being built at the time We were there It is not expensive They should have extended Service time at night

title: Very Fast Cheap Safe Travel Direct to Airport
review: With connections from the BTS Skytrain Metro and bus system ~1 Euro to the Airport  Fast clean safe AC  One of the best global city Airport transport I have been on

title: Moving around the city! Easy and cheap.
review: Best way to move around the city Combine it with BTS and you can move even more places Airport Link also connects to MRT and is pretty fast and much cheaper than going with Taxi

title: Easy
review: very easy way to get into the city  its a long journey so try and get a seat if you can It is also very cheap 45 Baht

title: Avoid peak hour if you can
review: We have used the MRT extensively on trips to Bangkok  Some times you can't avoid the peak hour rush and if travelling with a few people you may end up on different trains and need to wait a short time at your destination for fellow travellers to catch you up  The trains are clean efficient and good value for money  Getting from A to B in Bangkok depending on where you are staying can mean studying the pubic transport system calculating your best route and changing trains and stations  But it is easy to do no Thai necessary

title: A must for getting into the City
review: I always use the airport rail link to get as close to my hotel as possible and then get a taxi or tuk tuk for the last part  It's ridiculously cheap  air conditioned and fast as the traffic in Bangkok is usually horrendous  Google map first and look at the different routes and options as some train lines go in a big loop which wastes time   For example if your going to Sukumvit it's faster and cheaper to get off at Makkassan and get a taxi then do a big loop and swap to the BTS train line If only my home city of Melbourne had such a great train service for less than $2 each way

title: Airport Rail link to Suvannabhumi Airport
review: Fare is very Cheap Clean Fast and very convenient way just take the rail link to Suvannabhumi airportIt's suitable for the rush time to flight by the express Rail link

title: Tight Quarters
review: Bangkok could use a few more trains to help with overcrowding They do check backpacks randomly so be prepared esp if you are in a hurry

title: Good Way to Get Around
review: An inexpensive way to get around Bangkok  The stations are elevated and some do not have elevators so be prepared to climb several flights of stairs  This is the best way to get to MO Chit weekend market which is a must to do on Saturday  Once you get to that station just follow the crowds

title: easay reansport
review: The best way to get around Bangkok only minus is no where to park a car near any of the stations They are on time safe ride and easy to figure out

title: This is a first rate public transportation system
review: This is a marvelous way to get around  It is air conditioned and comfortable  You can interchange to other modes of transport

title: Good way to get around the city
review: Not an attraction unless you love riding on trains but a great way to get around  Clean and comfortable can get crowded at times  120 bht for an all day pass is a real bargain

title: Quick, clean, comfortable and affordable mode of travel.
review: It easy to get tickets Is helpful if have change ready  The staff is helpful It saves a  of time Great way to travel in Bangkok

title: Best way to go to the airport
review: The airport rail link from Bangkok city center to Suvarnabhumi Airport is very convenient You just need to take the Sky train to Phaya Thai station and from there take the sky train all the way to the airport The trip takes 30 minutes and there's also a faster alternative which takes 15 minutes You will reach the airport faster than a taxi and it will be much cheaper as well A taxi costs around 400 THB and the train is 45 THBperson (fast train 150 THBperson) In addition to that my experience is that you always need to argue a bit with the taxi driver and you never know if he will take the nearest road or try to rip you off I will for sure use the train if I would return to Bangkok

title: its easy to use just ask
review: thise is first time i use the train but  it provided me a lot of money  i advice every body use the train because when you take  taxi by meter its traffic you will pay more than train

title: Good transport means
review: If it happens you are hopping between malls the bts is the best way to avoid the crowded streets of Bangkok  Bts is far from being a world class tubeMTR(Hong Kong) but still it is clean and have frequent rides Very good mainly to avoid the brutal traffic jams of BKK

title: Fast, clean Rail.
review: The BTS is a very quick and clean option to get around town Make sure you know where you are going and how to fill up your card Find out where you're going then go over to the ticket machine and press the amount and then insert your coins

title: Easy and fast to get to town - and not expensive
review: Had to meet a friend in town and since I was staying near the airport I took the hotel shuttle to the airport and the railway link to town area where I could connect to the mRT to Lad Prao Definitely a faster way of transport than a taxi during rush hour  and also not so costly For the way back I did the same procedure it took about 40 minutes to get back to the airport

title: Easy, sensible way in and out of BKK
review: You can take the most convenient and less demanding route  ie the very helpful Airport Taxi system or you can just go by train   The train doesn't get stuck in any traffic jams and is both clean and fast It's the winner for me

title: Clean and fast
review: If your hotel is near the MRT do not even think to use a taxi MRT is fast clean and convenient if your destination is close to the station

title: Fast, convenient, inexpensive...but can get really crowded
review: Every big city benefits from having a subway or rail network that links it with its airport(s)  And so it is for Bangkok where traffic can slow down to a snarl in an instantand stay that way for hours  The airport rail link has Suvarnabhumi Airport and Phaya Thai as its terminal stations a journey that takes slightly under half an hour with eight additional stops in between  That makes it fast convenient and easy to use for travellers  Having said that it is used extensively by the locals as well to get from point A to point B so can get very crowded at times  For travellers with large or bulky luggage the ease (or lack of) in getting on or off the train or out of the stations during peak hours (including on weekends) might negate all of its advantages and they may be better off catching a taxi or a hired car instead  Still if it's good for you that's good enough

title: Fast and easy to use
review: Might be crowded at times and certain stations but a very reliable and convenient way to get around  Make sure to move fast through the bars and never try to get on a train once they started to beep before closing the doors  Exit numbers will show you were it is best to get out

title: Excellent trip
review: Everything was good the communication the appointment the guid sara was friendly the driver was good

title: Great service
review: We found this service to be very good easy to use and very clean ( no graffiti on trains or stations) Staff in the stations were very helpful in helping us when we needed to know which stops or platform we needed A cheap way to see the city and get to where u want We would recommend using public transport

title: Save time and avoid the traffic
review: The best way to avoid the traffic snarlups just a pity it doesn't go to the sightseeing areas  Like all metros it does get crowded but the fares are reasonable

title: Convenient transport to avoid traffic
review: Well connect Bangkok BTS is the lifeline when want avoid Bangkok traffic Fastest way to move  within the city I always take to BiTech for conventions and shows shopping Centers etc It‚Äôs easy to connect from BTS to Underground metro train You can buy a day long pass for 140  THB with some restrictions I buy a Rabbit card and keep topping as needed All stations are pre announced in English and signs are visible everywhere Clean and Safeway to traveling which makes it easy for all tourists

title: Best way to reach all places
review: Sometimes too cold but the best way to get from one place to the other Also taxis are very cheap But so very easy

title: Makes getting around Bangkok easy and is pretty cheap.
review: Best way of getting around Bangkok much much better than a taxi as the traffic is terrible Trains are frequent and never really crowded (may be in rush hour)

title: Easy to use
review: Very very cheap to travel fast in heavy traffic bkk Chep onnly one euro from city to airport and only 20 minutes by taxi almost 2 hours

title: Easy way to travel around Bangkok
review: Travel on the Skytrain is easy from obtaining tickets clear signs and the extensive system enabling you to travel the city with ease The trains and stations are well lit and very clean The cars are air conditioned

title: Convenient
review: It is convenient and right by my hostel Posh Phayathai Affordable and clean and took only 30 minutes from Phaya thai to Airport

title: Nameless Transport Card Recovered !
review: Staying for more than a month I had a transport card with a number of journeys on it and no name It fell from my pocket in the station and I left without it Realising a bit later that I had lost it it was recovered at the station by a woman who gave it back  She could have taken it and used it for herself but she gave it back and I still had all my journeys on it ) Thank you for the amazing help the BTS Sytrain staff gave me  Nonetheless be careful when you ask for change because some people give you change for 50 when you give 500 and tell you you gave 50 because the bills are the same colour Beware of that please

title: best and cheapest way to go down town
review: if you arrive in bkk then this is the best and fastet way to go downtown takes you about 20 minutes until you reach the subway or the BTS

title: Only way to get to get to Airport
review: Dont sit in the traffic this is the only way to make sure you do not miss your flight At 90 THB from Makkasan Station a steal

title: Fastest way around Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok is terrible You have 2 options BTS & MRT Both will give you a comfortable ride and quick access to Bangkok

title: Convenient but expensive
review: Connects to most local attractions of Bangkok Tickets are on expensive side need to be rebooked while changing to MTS line

title: The more economical way to get to Bangkok's downtown area
review: My family of four would often choose the Airport Rail Link instead of taxi We usually put up around the Pratunam area and metered taxi fares from the airport to that area cost about 350 Baht allin The Airport Rail Link to Phaya Thai will take about 45 minutes at half the price  The direct nonstop train is permanently down until further notice  we have not seen that train in years  The journey to Phaya Thai is often crowded with locals who commute using the Airport Rail Link as such getting a seat with your luggage may be quite a challenge The train frequencies are at 1530 minuteintervals so make sure you allocate plenty of time Most stations are not properly linked  Phaya Thai is the one that's connected the best  to the Phaya Thai BTS We took once to Hua Mak and realised we had to perform an illegal crossing on the railway tracks to get to the nearest bus stop  That said we found the Airport Rail Link to be bearable if we were to travel from Phaya Thai to Survanabhumi We secretly wished that there would be greater improvements such as better connectivity and increased frequencies (now that tourist numbers into Bangkok are steadily rising) but for the time beingwe will choose this mode of transportation over taxis

title: Quickest Way around the City
review: The BTS is Cool and quick  its cheap too  if we wanted to get out of the heat we just jumped on the train and chilled out got off and back on at the same stop to get back to where we were going

title: Cheap and easy way to get around town
review: BTS is the easiest way to get around town  We were nervous about the language (we are not Thai) but all of the train clerks speak English  And it‚Äôs so cheap as an added bonus you will by pass the crazy Bangkok traffic  Family of 4 traveling to the mall about 5 km away cost $350 for all 4

title: cheap and efficient
review: Direct into the city from the airport and cheap 1 hr max don't bother with expensive taxis and traffic jams

title: Great way to get around Bangkok, avoiding the traffic
review: Efficient on time air conditioned Easy to use Helpful staff Get to see other parts and views you don't from the path

title: The best transportation to get lost in Bangkok
review: BTS is the answer if you want to avoid Bangkok's traffic They have two lines Sukhumvit line (light green color on maps) & Silom line (dark green color on maps) and Siam station is the crossplatform interchange This station is always busy everryytime  You can get the ticket directly at the station using vending machine (most of stations only can accept coins but you can change at the counter) Or if you're planning to stay longer at Bangkok you can get the Rabbit Card at the counter They provide several package StudentAdultsSeniors or even pertrips as you needed  Get your direction from Google Maps and ensure which line you need to go But again there are rush hours in BTS too 79AM and 69PM on weekdays

title: Easy to use, fast, very little waiting time
review: Despite not having my head on initially and choosing the wrong platform which was ok as I was not in a hurry at all I had a great day using BTS Enjoyed the air conditioning the people watching and gained an excellent understanding of the city layout Each time I needed to change a train there was very little waiting time the announcements were clear and easy to understandeven buying a ticket was simple Will be using them for the rest if my stay

title: Cover some distance, fast and affordable.
review: In my travels to Thailand I use the Skytrain more often but the MRT works well also  I used it this trip to help move around to photograph some temples

title: GREAT OPTION TO GET TO AIRPORT
review: I used this to go TO the airport  This was very inexpensive and quick   I did have to do my research ahead of titme to be find the correct RAILLINK station located closest to my hotel   Grabbed a cheap taxi to from hotel to that station  Then took lift from street level up to station level  Is a bit trickey to make sure was getting on outbound(to airport) train and not the and inbond  Like in all metrotransit it was worthwhile tfor me to know the line's endtermination station names  On transit maps the RAILLINK lines are red and blue  Note  MOST ticketoken machines DO NOT TAKE CARDS and accept small denomiation (100 or less) Baht or Baht coinage   Advise you have some so as to avoid having to wait in line to get change to put in machine

title: Very convenient & inexpensive
review: Certainly the best way to get you into the downtown core from where you can catch a taxi or take the city metro lines

title: You'd be crazy not to use this............
review: so simple to use you don't get caught in traffic get great first views of Bangkok when you come inwhy wouldn't you use this service And those other reviews are right don't bother with the express service

title: Best way to downtown.
review: From arrivals at Suwarnabhumi down a couple levels and elevated train right into Bangkok Phayathai 300 metre walk and I'm at my hotel

title: Simplest, quickest and cheapest way to move in Bangkok...safely and freshly
review: If you have to move in the vibrant city of Bangkok there is nothing better quicker and cheaper than the BTS Skytrain Try it and you will adopt it To make it even easier take a card that you can refill as you go and then getting in or out will be even easier And on top of that even at rush hours all people are respecting the waiting lines and making it almost as smooth as silk

title: Its sky train
review: Same as others country have sky train i can say clean inside the train Ticket to sky train acceptable But speaker sound in side the train need to be high can not hear the Next stop

title: My visit to the floating market
review: Sarah has been a fantastic guide She is very informative and super fun On the way down she gave history and is very easy to understand Throughout the trip her advice and info was great and we had a fantastic time

title: Fast, efficient
review: What more can I say Easy to use fast clean efficient (compare with Heathrow Express  ugh) At off peak times you may have to wait a little

title: Skytrain
review: Cheap convenient but a bit crowded at rush hour  However short times between stops so no real problem there

title: Best way to avoid traffic
review: Traffic in Bangkok is a very big problem and BTS train is the solution to avoid it It's affordable and convenient And the main reason why I have a lot of coins in my pocket

title: 5 it's great!!
review: Easy way to get around the city and connects to the metro and river Now all we need are more places it goes (I think they may be working on that) Like it better than the metro (also great) because you get to see the city from high up Clean air conditioned but if you are travelling in rush hour it can get very busy Make sure you follow the signs on the floor and queue correctly

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Great mode of transport with an elevated view of the city as far as the line stretches Rush hour is often standing room only but the carriages are clean and the aircon is very effective Try and book a hotel or accommodation near one of the BTS stations when in Bangkok It really does help to get around and it's a cheap mode of transport

title: Great way to travel, but be prepared to walk!
review: A great way to get around Bangkok for sure but not the most accessible Most stations dont seem to have escalators going up & you end up climbing long flight of stairs  not something that you would like to in the hot Bangkok weather   Otherwise trains are frequent clean & airconditioned  standard fare you can expect on most city trains globally Another downside is it seems to be eternally busy probably due to all other tourists so be prepared to stand & travel just hard to find seats on most rides  Rides are not really cheap  by Asian standards so be prepared to spend a bit still cheaper than taxis fleecing tourists Not worth though if you travel in groups of 3 or more   Another frustrating fact was the long queue to buy tickets from the vending machineFunny to see they have more machines accepting coins(& you needs lots to buy a fare) whereas just 1 or 2 machines in each station which accepts currency notes Leads to long queues so plan to get here ahead if you are on teh way to shows or other time driven activities

title: This is a great service but slow
review: Love the airport link I took it for the first time this week Waited a bit for the train but it came eventually Took me right to Makkasan then a walk to MRT then that train to Lumphini about 1 hour from airport to hotel in Sathorn What a great service inexpensive way to get to the city center Better than dealing the ripoff thieving taxi's and BKK's irritating traffic   There is quite a bit of walking to get to the rail express from arrivals and the walk from Makkasan to the MRT is a bit of jaunt but not too bad overall I only had carryon luggage so if I had full luggage it may be more arduous but still doable  it's the savings that make the journey worthwhile

title: Save your money and get a coach or time and fly...
review: I'd done some research and decided I'd like to do the night train to Chiang Mai Having taken a night train in Vietnam it was something that excited me I purchased a couple of alcoholic beverages to help me sleep and had these 'confiscated' like a naughty child I'm a 32 year old man who certainly has no intention of engaging in any form of antisocial behaviour I'm also respectful of the ruleslaws and had previously read of the availability of alcohol on the train and there were certainly no prior warnings from the travel companies of the various blogsinternet sites regarding this However seeing past the embarrassing moment of having my alcohol confiscated I saw past it and looked forward to what I hoped would be an enjoyable trip As time went on the lights were still on I'd read that they get dimmed in the evening unfortunately that is not the case I attempted to speak to the train guard which was an inconvenience to her as she was more interested in her phone as she relaxed in the toilet area between two carriages she rudely informed me that the lights do not get dimmed thus removing any advantage of the journey My advice is that you can't see anything after 8pm so the journey itself offers approximately two hours of 'nice views' should that be what your after it takes longer than both the coach and an aeroplane it is rivalled in price by plane and more expensive than the coachso unless you want comfort (granted the beds are comfortable) alongside an extremely broken pattern of sleep due to the artificial light this journey really holds no advantage in terms of time money or a decent night a sleep I am extremely disappointed with the overall experiencecredit where it is due however the food served was nice

title: Remarkable
review: I have nothing but respect for the people who built this railway and there are examples on its route of unbelievable engineering feats mixed with views that are stunningly beautiful The train is fairly basic but that is unimportant considering the significance of the railway itself Tragic history in such a beautiful part of Thailand Respect to all who gave the lives building this piece of history I recommend this to anybody provided the memories of those who built it are remembered

title: Fast Service
review: I travelled from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi airport on the last day of my trip (8th September 2017)  Reached in just 30 mins Great service

title: Good cheap way to commute
review: We used the sky train daily on our stay in Bangkok  I bit confusing day 1 but after figuring out the system it work easy fast and affordable

title: Holiday
review: BTS Skytrain WOW What a cheap way to get around Bangkok  The only negative thing is the crowding on the train Its just a way of life here so its all part of the adventure so enjoy the experience You can get the rail map from the desk at the hotel Very handy to have

title: BTS Skytrain system
review: Must be the cheapest and simplest ways of getting around Bangkok Every station is clearly marked and if you are in any doubt about where to go there are many people willing to help A must for any visitor to go on just for the experience

title: Great line!
review: Perfect to avoid the potential taxi scams It is very easy to find at the airport and with only 7 or 8 stops you will be at Phaya Thai in around 30 minutes where you can connect easily with the BTS  The ticket from BKK to Phaya Thai cost us 45 THB each

title: Safe and comfortable journey
review: Need to get back to my Hotel at Sutthisan I took a ride on the MRT  from one of the mall Much more comfort faster and safer Considering I took an early taxi ride which took me 2 hours to reach due to traffic congestion

title: Top knotch
review: We landed in Bangkok a couple of hours late after being delayed in New Delhi airport due to the "Indian way" then the experience change in BKK Everything followed a logical process including finding the airport city link clearly marked Ticket booth easy to find and clear pricing and instructions failing that a security guard made sure you got what you needed Easy access to platform a minute or two wait for train train kept you informed where you were and 25 mins you are in the city Then you are on your own to travel either on the sky train or to hire taxi on the street we arrived 10 o clock at night so we had to tackle the taxi mafia The link is excellent

title: Practical and efficient
review: A very convenient means of transportation But always crowded  Also good literally to cool down         efficient ac

title: quick and easy
review: best way to get around town and the fastest clean efficient and always on time be careful of the rush hours

title: The most friendly way to get around.
review: Absolutely fabulous and easy to understand due to clear markings etc Makes newer attempts eg In India feel embarassing  keeping in mind there was such a good example for that arrogant nation of selfish politicians and incompetent bureaucrats to follow Even the BRT sets a great example for those that wish to follow and not explain why theire attempt eg in India is chaotic Well done Bankok

title: Bts Train
review: Extremely clean and very easy to get round bangkok city I always use it to get around Next time you are there try it as you will be impressed with the helpful service

title: Best Travel Companion
review: Its best for travelling all over Bangkok The Trains runs very fast and comfortable to cover the city  The one thing is problem for the name of the stations

title: Good to travel after flight
review: Its always better to travel by the Airport Rail Link than to travel by road You escape the traffic Very good service Didn`t get the free internet hours along with the ticket as mentioned on sign board

title: Good if you have no luggagej
review: Clean easy cheap but if you have luggage and you are 2 or more heading for sukhumvitstick to the public taxis at airport

title: Great service
review: We used the Skytrain several times Always on time a smooth ride and easy to use Would be good to have a return fare ticket instead of having to buy one way fares all the time

title: Very impressive service far superior to southern rail in uk
review: As a commuter into London the sky train was so impressive Slick trains in very smart stations and helpful staff The trains are very frequent although well used very clean and spacious Recommend using it to travel around Bangkok

title: Safe and reliae
review: The BTS is a great option for getting around Bangkok The traffic in Bangkok is terrible and the train is a good way to get to places on time

title: Good Transport system
review: Airport Rail Link is a very good transport system in Thailand It is a express train It connects the Airport and the City We can join with the BTS & MRT subway train systems at two locations through this Airport Reail Link I preferred to visit Thailand mainly because of their transport system in the city It takes about 30 mnts to go to Thailand city   Trains are available every 30 mnts from early morning to midnight Train comes to inside the Airport We could easily find the station at the Swarnabumi Airport Sign boards are available  Nice train Less people Save money Very good option for transportation

title: Bangkok after a month around this country
review: Thailand ok you really have to see I came there 30 years ago and to tell you the change is an understatement of the mountains of tall buildings it's not New York but almost except to find the real Bangkok underneath the crowded streets a profusion of clothes to disgust you on the clothing side the food is in abundance in these little carts (I never wanted to eat there because they don't have running water and the fried food seems to me to have been there for weeks the cleanliness leaves something to be desired on the other hand the Thais are extremely smiling friendly and impeccably polite even if they don't understand you or if they don't know they will smile at you so as not to appear stupid always choose a hotel in the center so you can avoid taxis and you will be close to markets and department stores and easy to visit the temples the river etc far from the railway market there are hotels with extraordinary views the Sirocco restaurant (don't eat there especially not very bad go up to the 56th floor just to have a drink it's sublime you also have the hotel Oven season go for tea at the Mandarin Orientale a very old hotel a little too renovated for my taste but you can also have a meal there by the river be careful if you buy clothes you can't try anything on we must also tell you that all the invoices at the bottom of this one you will find taxes in addition to the service to get the equivalent in euros you will have to multiply by 38 change your money in Thailand on site it is better to have cash avoid bank cards you will have interest to pay avoid ATMs there are small green shops and the exchange is better I have already written about the south all the islands Ko Samui ko Lanta Krabi and Pucket  months so we know what is good and above all everything to avoid we are currently inexhaustible on this country but especially on the south anyway you can always go into luxury hotels for a drink

title: Best way to travel in the city
review: Fast clean and cool air con what more could you want in congested hot Bangkok beats traffic jams Day pass is cheap  great value you can go everywhere with ease

title: Very convenient but must not be too charged with luggages
review: The airport link is cheap clean and takes you to Phaya Thai ( last station of the line) in 30 mins Costs 45 baht for a single journey Only thing is you must be quick to load your luggages into the train and make sure your kid is also on board as the train leaves fast and is packed after the first stop (Lat Krabang) Still a good option to head to the airport and avoid BKK traffic jam

title: Inexpensive, clean, and reliable
review: My friend and I utilized this transportation option many times during our trip While it is true that the line might not drop you right at some attractions it will get you close enough to cut your travel time in half and allow you to experience walking on some local streets As of September 2015 (perhaps as a result of the recent bombings) before entering you must walk through a metal detector and present your bag for a quick inspection This does not seem to slow down your travel at all There is a ticket desk but also self service kiosks with an "English" option Very simple to use just indicate your destination stop and the amount charged will display Most machines accept 100 baht notes or under and most coins We rode for an average of 2025 baht (less than $1) per ride A token will dispense that you touch to a pad to get through the "gate" At your final stop when you exit the station you put your coin through a slot to open the "gate" The subway is clean and efficient Stops are announced in both Thai and English Make sure to mind the queue indicators on the floor As another heads up train direction is indicated by the final (terminus) stop in each direction

title: Airport to Soi 18 Maitria
review: Thinking of taking the ARL to downtown since we are only 2 with light luggage What's the best way from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Maitria Hotel on Soi 18
