title: Fast! Helps you to save time
review: Very nice service ) save your time and also clean if there is no seat nothing to worry You can stand for 10 mins and as it is fast you can be at your destination

title: So easy
review: Mass transit is super easy to help you get around Went to a handful of fights with no problem Stations workers eager to help with any questions

title: Excellent means of transportation
review: All routes are clear sign in English and help is provided clean and fast way to get to the city If you have a lot of luggage and 5 person you may consider a van to the hotel

title: Sky train
review: It was air conditioned and efficient A good and cheap way to get around Bangkokit does get very busy so try to use it out of peak times eg 46 pm it was packed

title: The way to get around
review: If you want to get around Bangkok really quick and cheap use the BTS or MTR When you book a hotel make sure you're close to one of the stations

title: Convenient for getting around
review: Check route on Bangkok map Links with BTS sky train in places such as Makasan Goes from main train station

title: Quick way into BKK
review: The airport link is okay if you know ur way about Bangkok and have a good idea where you are going If you have a lot of luggage or heavy luggage it can be awkward As you need to use the lift at most of the stations

title: Super fast and inexpensive
review: Skytrain is often faster than a taxi and the layout is very easy to get around with lots of signage in English and handy maps everywhere Super clean and fast

title: Quick, convenient to get around
review: The skytrain is a quick option to get around Bangkok Given the heavy traffic in the city at most times of the day this is a convenient option It is clean with aircon  If you intend to use one multiple times a day or more than a day buy a pass for the day or the rabbit card

title: No wheel chair access for my old mother
review: Had to access Lots of stairs no one to tell you that to get on certain lines you had o get of the trains

title: Life savior to beat taxi que
review: For convenient reason during our short holiday  me and my friends always took cab to go places in Bangkok   However there was  one late noon where we need to rush back for cruise dinner and only to find the long taxi que  Decided to go to BTS station above Siam Paragon     3 tickets to 3 station away = THB 78  Most importantly it saved us the time from 1 hour ++ queuing to 20min or so  Just be ready for full pack train   TKJul'18

title: Excellent
review: We began our tour with viewing bridge over the River Kwai Then bought tickets for famous train and it was fabulous We took almost 15h ride watching all villages fields and finnaly ride on the scarp through railway built during WWII by Dutch Prisoners Some history as Long as experience Definitely must see when going to Thailand

title: Quick and Efficient
review: This is a great way to get around but it closes at midnight which is not great especially in a city like Bangkok

title: Clean and reliable
review: Easy way to get around Bangkok Save you the worry of being cheated by taxi touts BTS staff required always willing to help if you are unsure of which line to take where to alight

title: Nice to cool down from the heat.
review: One needs to change 10 Baht coins (normally 3 pieces for 30 Baht) to enjoy transportation in the city

title: love it very much
review: The train very nice n fast n on time Easy to commute to destination Buy daily pass ticket at hotel so save time from queue as well money savingskytrain staff there very friendly Need to go to toilet then asking one of guards The guard asked cleaner to accompany us to staff toilet Eventhough they cannt speak english but still try to help us

title: Great way to get around
review: Before coming to Bangkok read up on and familiarize yourself with the transportation system You can get around on the sky train from the airport and transfer to other lines reasonably easy It is cost efficient and much quicker than taxis Be aware that taxi drivers really don't know their way around even when you give them an address They only seem to know the immediate area Sky train is very reliable

title: Efficient and cheap
review: A modern cheap and efficient rail link it does exactly what it says and is easy to use We took it to phaya Thai to save money on taxis

title: Cheap,Fast and Practical
review: Easy to use Is the cheaper way to travel around the shopping mall or place of interest like River taxi @ Saphan Taksin Chatuchak @ Mo Chit ParagonSiam Square @ Siam Airport to Town @ Phaya Thai Information can choose in English in the station try to avoid morning and evening peak hours you might need to wait for two or three train before you can get in

title: Great Time
review: we had a great time our tour guide TUM was the best She was patient with us and very helpful and funny 100% recommend

title: Easy to understand and fair to good coverage.
review: Easy to understand and fair to good coverage It was convenient to our hotel It wasn't as crowded as I expected It was a bit challenging getting individual tickets and getting and refilling the cards where somewhat confusing but no more than trying to do it in say China or other SE Asia places

title: Avoid Bangkok rot dit (traffic jams)
review: Use the BTS sky train to commute in aircon comfort around Bangkok and avoid those horrid traffic jams Buy a prepaid Rabbit card unless you want to que up at each station with lots of coins Most of the major shopping malls are connected to or a close walk from BTS stations and a few (like Bangna MegaMall) have shuttle bus services from the station to the mall Because its above ground you also get a great sightseeing view of the city so take the NorthSouth and EastWest lines all the way to their ends for a quick & relatively cheap trip around Bangkok city Peak hours are crowded as are weekends but trains operate every few minutes Many stations also have lots of food coffee & drink outlets plus ATMs and other shops

title: Always visiting my Asian friends
review: At first my Thai friend gave me directions to get the BTS to go meet her from skuhumvit to asoke and I thought I'll never get there But 1 of the easiest to use when it's not rush hour üôÑüòì  I used it in rush hour once and well that was enough for me at rush hour time üòÇ but so easy to use

title: Very clean
review: Excellent way to travel in Bangkok very clean but can be very busy Try to use it off peak as you are packed in like sardines if using at peak times

title: Excellent
review: Very Clean (food and drinks not allowed)  very organized very efficient conveniently located super affordable very informative (having a map also recommended) Air conditioned takes safety of passengers seriously and train announcements andor next station stops are made in both English and Thai

title: Awesome!
review: you can't be late to your flight by using this and it's fast rather than getting a bus or taxi price are reasonable I recommend this to all it is located on the basement of the airport you can check the signs on how to get there and it's easy to find

title: Cool way to travel in both sences
review: A quick and easy way to get about Bangkok As it is above ground it is not claustrophobic At peak times it can be busy but the air con is very efficient Internet signal in the carriages is great and it is amusing seeing everyone working their phones Taxis can get jammed up in the traffic so an easy way is to use Skytrain to near the address that you want to go to then walk or take a taxi motorbike or Tuktuk for the final part of the journeyYou can find them at the station exits

title: Good link to airport
review: The airport link is a fast and superaffordable way to get into the city and from here you can link up to the BTS and trains without fuss  Roads are congested at times so the airport rail link is a great way of getting to and from the airport

title: The Engineers for the Train ( Siemens ) are needed to re-School !
review: Even the Airport Link WebSite is trying to explain the Door Operation for the Train  Why it is this and that  It is a Joke  Only train in this whole wide world DO this Shutting   Another thing is the Customer Service Mind is not in their Thinking Process among all the public transportation   No Elevator for Customer to use  especially Airport Link which everyone has Luggages with them  I used it ONCE and that is  Limosine to the Airport for 1000 Bahts is spent and it is better than support the Organization that does not has a Brain to think

title: wonderful service
review: One need not take a taxi from Bangkok Airport You can travel to any part via Airport rail link Very efficient and easy to commute

title: Just a form of transportation
review: I am not sure why can this be a tourist attraction Other than that it is a convenient   and easy way to get to the airport

title: The cheapest way to travel in to downtown bangkok
review: Fast clean and at 45 baht one way this must be the cheapest airport transport link ever If you have multiple pieces of luggage or young kids the changes in levels might be more of a challenge but with a rucksack or a single suitcase it's easy

title: Clean with Televisions!
review: Accessing the BTS skytrain was a painless for us and is a very helpful way of getting through the clogged traffic of Bangkok  It's clean airconditioned inexpensive and fast all with televisions  They only play commercials but it's an unexpected insight into Thai popularconsumerist culture

title: Fast, easy, clean
review: This is a great way to travel into the city but make sure you have smaller note and coin denominations for the ticketing machines (you actually get a token)  They don't accept cards  There is one customer service window open to give change but it can get very busy  There are cafes kiosks close by if you want to buy water etc and break a larger note in the process

title: Siam to Thonglor
review: I traveled with family with 2 kids It was safe and cheaper and time saving I traveled at evening so  crowd was there but it was ok

title: Quick and easy
review: We took this train for the first time  Great connection to the center of Bangkok and the BTS Fast and easy

title: Frequent and convenient
review: The easiest way of getting into the city from BKK Suvanabumi 30baht single Makkasan station connects with MRT

title: Still Running good
review: What can I say about the BTS Now that Uber is available in  Bangkok BTS can be not so economical but traffic is what helps BTS maintain the edge Let me tell you all the plus points 1 Trains are very frequent and each train has a lot of compartments not like the one in Kuala Lumper where each trains needs more than 10 mins after the one that left and only 2 3 compartments so smaller trains 2 They are very clean and well air conditioned 3 People are mostly polite and proper queuing to get in and waiting for all the people to exit first 4Connected by SkyWalk in so many places with all the popular places so it can be super convenient This one of the best train systems I have been one recently

title: Cheap and convenient way of getting around
review: Bangkok train system may not be as extensive as compared to NYC subway but it's a cheap and quick way for getting to other parts of the city plus our hotel was by the station making it very convenient The stations are air conditioned which was a relief from the heat and humidity The only downside trains stops running by midnight

title: Best way to travel around Bangkok
review: The roads are so busy all the time so this is the best way to get around central Bangkok The trains are often busy and at times it is hard to even board We travelled with young kids and people are generally friendly and smily  they will help you on and ensure that your kids have a space Great way to see the city from height too

title: Practical but not authentic Bangkok
review: Practical and safe way to travel but no where near as authentic way to travel around Bangkok as a tuc tuc Clean and punctual though

title: Floating and train market
review: We loved the day trip to the markets Our guide Sara made it interesting and fun The trip was well organised  Thank you Sara for making our trip so special

title: Commuter
review: The train is crowded and stops at too many stations along the way They ended the express line a while back

title: Pleasure to travel in BTS
review: BTS Skytrain is one of the important transport system at Bangkok The full form of BTS is "The Bangkok Mass Transit System" and it is commonly known as the Skytrain  It is an elevated rapid transit system in Bangkok  The Skytrain runs on an elevated level We had the opportunity to travel in the Skytrain when we were at Bangkok We were staying in a Hotel near Sukhumvit  and the BTS Skytrain was very close to our Hotel  It was a pleasure to travel in this train  The stations are well maintained The people follow discipline while boarding and alighting from the train

title: Fast and clean
review: Good option to travel in Bangkok But if there is 4 ppl or more cheaper option is to take taxi) But keep in mind traffic in Bangkok  BTS will be faster )

title: Very good transport connectivity for bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain provides a very good linking connectivity throughout Bangkok It generally had very less rush whenever i used to travel The metro stations are also bang on the main roads as i had a hotel nearby only so i didnt have much problem travelling to the station In short neat clean and a very fast means of travelling better than taxi service

title: BTS Skytrain
review: The BTS skytrain is a good way to get around Bangkok There is not much help for travelers using the system for the first time  The system can be very crowded during the day Overall it‚Äôs a good way to get around Bangkok

title: The worst transit system in the world.
review: For 5 years Thai people have had to suffer with only 4 cars on each train The platform can hold 6 BTS are money grabbing b*stards who don't care If they added 2 more cars it would increase capacity by over 50% and would mean more people could use it It's terribly packed at most time of the day and incredibly dangerous

title: Air conditioned!
review: A great way to travel Easy to navigate through for a reasonable price and the best past is the rescue from the humidity

title: Generally efficient service
review: Only complaint is too few stations but that's the way it is Surprised that people can play water guncanon in the train during Songkrang the wet floor may most safety hazard to commuters It's a pleasant ride overall and can avoid traffic jam in the city

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: A great way to get around great value and convenient  Much better than sitting in traffic in a taxi

title: No more traffic jam!
review: What a relief no matter how crowded it is during peak hours it is still better than being caught in the jam or haggling with the taxi drivers Fairly easy to use we have no problem at all with in

title: Public transport Plus++++
review: The MRT in Bangkok is one of the simplest public transport systems to use even for non Thai speaking users Definitely recommend grabbing a MRT card and load it up The stations well sign posted and easy to navigate Once in train announcements are both in Thai and English Very clean inside train and stations Staff very helpful and welling to assist It interlinks with the BTS and buses at some stations Cheap way to get to point A to B

title: Convenient but there is room for improvement
review: The connection is quite goodrather frequent Not very disabled friendly as there is stairs to climb between stations Can only buy the ticket from the machine using coins but you can change for coins at their counter  The aircond is good and the trains are clean

title: nice for travelling in downtown area.
review: I'm Thai and of course I'm living in Bangkok Thailand I use BTS sky train daily The sky train is clean and easy to use But sometimes there is a long queue on the buying ticket booths or the ticket machines that happens only during the rush hour and on popular stations  The sky train is good if you want to travel fast and just in the downtown area of Bangkok You can reach Siam for Siam Paragon shopping center and National Stadium station for MBK Along the sukhumvit line there are many shopping centers and luxury restaurants (many nations from japanese to mexican) On the MhorChit line you can get to Chatuchak weekend market easily  The only low point of BTS sky train is that they don't access the old town area of Bangkok  the Khaosarn road or the temples and palace area These places you have to get a taxi or tuktuk to reach them  Also the price for the sky train is cheap according to other touristy cities Little reminding you are not allowed to take food and drinks inside the BTS sky train )

title: Quick Ride
review: Quick clean ride  Helpful ticket staff for directions Easy signage Trains arrived on time and cars not overcrowded

title: Overnight sleeper Chang Mai to Bangkok
review: Booked on this trip by our tour company A "first" for me and an experience I would recommend as a way to travel  Service was excellent staff were friendly and helpful Bunks were made up by the train guard  a bit early maybe but practicalities probably dictated Comfortable clean and spacious Bathrooms clean and enough facilities for each 'cabin' Would recommend eye shades as lights have to be on for safety  Good way to cover vast distance and not waste time as would have been asleep anyway

title: Always crowded, but smooth, timely, and cheap.
review: Easiest way to get around Bangkok We used it everyday during our visit We stopped at many different stops Payment and navigation was easy as well Wouldnt hesitate to use it again

title: Convenient
review: Stayed near Asoke BTS station Hop on it to go Thong Lo Mo Chit etc You can use it to get to Siam Pargon Chatuchak etc Very convenient to get around Most of the times can get into the Skytrain  It is very packed during peak hours though Do expect to wait for the 2nd or 3rd trains at these hours

title: So easy to get around
review: Similar to underground around Europe but with a view and easy to use Only problem was having to use pay machines and ge√æing stuck with line trouble which I guess is a rarity as it made national news

title: Travel on the actual railway from Bangkok...
review: Just 100BHT for the 3 hour journey from Thonburi station to Kanchanaburi is a bargain A much more interesting experience travelling the train rather than a coach Sights of real ramshackled 'houses' and the very poor of Bangkok as the train eases out the city Food and drink vendors plying their trade along the route on board Views of Thailand and the Thais going about their lives as you speed past Always something to see along the journey Close to Kanchanaburi temples in the hills can be seen

title: Skytrain
review: The train is extremely clean and modern  The air conditioner works great  The ride to downtown is a quick 2535 minutes

title: Modern and efficient
review: If you have not been to Bangkok for years you will find the transpory much improved This system is quiet on time and efficient

title: DELICIOUSLY COOL, FAST AND EFFICIENT!
review: If you are here for more than a few days it's worth buying a Rabbit card  like an Oyster card in London for reduced fares and avoiding the need to keep buying tickets Sadly the BTS and the metro are run by different companies so you need another card to use that system The air conditioning us great the ride comfortable Mobile phones work just fine The network if stations covers many of the interesting parts if Bangkok  from Chatuchak  where the huge market takes place each weekend ( and near where there is a fabulous modern art museum) to Thaksin bridge for connections to water taxis and public boats ( a for boats to take you to the wonderful Mandarin Oriental Hotel) It is easy to get into Bangkok from the main airport but you need to use yet another train  the Skytrain tokens for which cost about 40 baht each way Go to the terminus in the city and then transfer to the BTS It's quite a long walk from platform to platform but quite easy

title: Great service and value
review: Took this train from the BKK airport into the city Nice and clean train and very quiet Saved me money and time vs taking a taxi into the city 5 Star Train Service

title: The fastest way to get around Bangkok.
review: There are two main lines in Bangkok to the BTS skytrain One day unlimited use passes are thB 140 which is about $450 USD This is a lot faster than sitting in traffic

title: Takes you straight to the heart of the City but....
review: Like their SkyTrain is an excellent system that takes you right into Bangkok City  Clean and efficient  Be warned the major drawback is their lack of ramps (in fact almost nonexistent) so be prepared to lug your luggage down the stairs and along broken and narrow pavements potholds etc  Having checked out the taxi prices in our wisdom decided to take the train to our regrets  And the rush hour trafficcommuters does not help  My advise if you do not wish to lug around your heavy luggage(s) take the taxi

title: Convenient travel
review: Once you get your ticket all is fine However you need coins so that means lining up at one office You can only change $100 baht at a time Then you need to line up for the tickets and the machines are generally in a very stupid area where everyone is trying to walk past I am sure it could be better organised to save this hassle Maybe not all stations are this messy but the ones we used were The train trip itself was fine

title: Nice way of traveling around
review: Clean cheap and fast way of traveling around BK   You just need to count stations you want to travel on old ticket machines  42 bath for 8 stations

title: A trip not to miss
review: Great experience going to the railway market then to the floating market  Lucky was our tour guide she was amazing Gave lots of information on the drive to each place  Kept the group together always ensuring we were having the best experience possible  Personally I would have preferred to stay at the railway market longer more items sold and better food options we stayed approx 5 mins after the train had passed and moved onto the floating markets  Driver on the day was super nice aswell  Comfortable transport and provided with a bottle of water and a toilet stop before seeing the market  Highly recommend and if you get lucky as your tour guide you will have the best experience

title: Poor coverage
review: Poor coverage limited by the geology of the city  In sufficient capacity to cope with the demand  Poor interchange with the BTS  Not a world class transport system  But use it to save yourself from traffic hell that is Bangkok

title: Best way to get around the city
review: Dislike include having to pay for oneway tickets with coins only Liked everything else about it Nice and clean Stations walking distance from most tourist spots

title: Very good day out with experience and local street food.
review: Whether or not this floating market is genuine is mostly irrelevant it was a good experience interesting and a good fun day out   A good length not too long A trip on a local train a paddle boat ride and able to see experience and utilise two markets Food especially at the Railway market was genuine street food at very reasonable ‚Äútourist ‚Äú rate Vendors generally not too persistent   Lucky the tour guide was very good Thorough with her instructions not to lose anyone and informative   Minibus was good Clean and good air conditioner Driver good (but please do not read your phone while driving even if it is to check traffic  this is important for safety)   Overall highly recommended for a good not too taxing day out

title: Good way to get around Bangkok
review: The skytrain is very convenient to get around The only thing i didn't like is you must have coin for purchasing tickets so you have to line up at the booth for change Besides the skytrain only is kinda limited ie Can't get to China town or the area of Grand Palace

title: Must do in Bangkok!
review: Guide was super engaging and very attentive Great day at at 2 markets with the guide providing food recommendations and bartering directives

title: Easy to use
review: We used the sky train and found it cheap airconditioned and uncrowded  Much better than being stuck in traffic

title: Amazing and so cheap!
review: We use the sky train every time we are in Bangkok It's so cheap and convenient If you go two stops from Silom you can catch the river boata snip at 15 Baht for an hour's ride

title: Ice vs. Fire
review: It's a great and smart way to travel through Bangkok It's fairly cheap depending on how far you want to go and easy to use But note this You'll freeze in the skytrain cause the AC feels like it's on 10¬∞C and as fast you go out you'll be back to sweating 30¬∞C So be prepared ok^^ Other than that we always use it when we visit Bangkok it's very convenient so we always book a hotel near a BTS station

title: The fastest way up town from the riverside
review: It was easy to negotiate the payment system 30 baht one way from river to national stadium stop MBK shopping centre Use coins

title: Cheap and convenient
review: Bangkok traffic remains nightmarish We used the BTS sky train and found it very convenient Skywalks connect the malls shopping and mall hopping was fun

title: Convenient
review: A very convenient way to get from the airport to downtown Bangkok Remember to hold on to your chip Having a transit map is helpful if you have to make connections to other trains

title: Great way to get around!
review: We were hesitant at first to use BTS and metro but quickly fell in love   So easy to navigate and very fair prices Plus it‚Äôs air conditioned so a huge bonus Stations are clean and well maintained as well as the trains themselves

title: Convenient and fast access to many parts of Bangkok
review: The BTS looks modern and provides easy access to various parts of Bangkok There are also interchange stations where you can transfer to MRT or SRT With the frequent and widespread traffic congestion in Bangkok the BTS (and the MRT) are faster and better ways of getting around Bangkok

title: Swarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok City
review: Cheap transport from Swarnabhumi Airport Bangkok to City Safe and clean polite passenger service officer

title: Fast
review: We really liked this train service and it reminded Us of our DLR but they had discipline and order when queuing to enter Something we can all learn from The station staff were Helpful and on each ticket there was a map which made it easy to get around in a city with much traffic

title: Never take a taxi again
review: The Airport rail link is brilliant 40 baht to the city center in a clean super fast train For me traveling to the second last stop was 35 min and then I just had a short 400m walk to the hotle On our return having a few more bags we took a taxi from the hotel to the station which is also not a problem as taxies take all fair regardless of how short it is On previous trip I have spent 500600 baht for a taxi from the airport that took at least an hour The Airport Rail is the the way to go hands down

title: Could be so much better with more frequency
review: I use the ARL almost daily and the service is very decent except for the frequency 15 minutes between trains off times and 10 minutes peak should be increased to 10 and 5 respectively The fares are reasonable but the distance from the station at Makkasan to the Phetchaburi BTS could be challenging for many Phaya Thai is much better Another interesting issue is the service starts at 6AM and ends at midnight why The airport it services is open 24 hours a day They should have a 4 times an hour service from Midnight to 6AM Increase the frequency and this would be a great service (until it gets over subscribed)

title: Indonesia Jan 2017
review: For me train travel in Thailand is by far the safest most long distance trains arrive late in Bangkok

title: Cheap transfer to city center
review: Last time to Bangkok we took a taxi  it took us 1h and cost about 800 Baht  This time we used the ARL Tickets were much cheaper (about 60 Baht each) and the transfer to the City center took us 30 min  It is easy to reach on the first floor of the airport and handling is selfexplanatory  So clear recommendation of the ARL

title: Excellent way to get around
review: MRT on covers certain parts of the city but comBined with the BTS river boats and the one rapid bus line you can beat the traffic It is also a good place to escape the heat

title: fast and safe especially for visitors
review: This is primarily a transportation option for locals  Travels above the traffic chaos but only covers a small portion of this gigantic metropolis  Well air conditioned and comfortable

title: Convenient for few
review: Well i travel in and out of suvarnabhumi aiport weekly The link to the city is possible through airport link at the lowest floor of the airport The service is very good Convenient for those with 1 Not excessive luggage 2 Short travel to Phaya thai station via makkassan 3 You get 283 km to the city until Paya thai and then need to take BTS sky train to other locations   The changeover is best for those with scanty baggage  This service can heat the heavy traffic in that area

title: Excellent way to get into the city from airport
review: When we arrived in Thailand we got a taxi from the airport but used the Airport Rail link for leaving from downtown Bangkok Links up seamlessly with the BTS Skytrain in the city   Tickets can be bought from ticket machines or the manned ticket desk in the station Alights in the airport terminal   Quick safe efficient and very inexpensive Probably faster than taxi in rush hour too

title: Interesting train ride
review: Had a ride on the death railway and have to say it was very different  The wooden carriages are all open (no glass in the Windows) benches and tables on both sides of the carriage  A drink and snack was served whilst we had our train journey  (Very welcome)   It's a very worthwhile experience as the views are amazing giving glimpses into the lifestyle of the villagers and the drop to the river spectacular in some parts  The engineering that went into building this structure is amazing    Kind of scary to see small passing places where locals huddle together whilst the train passes and a sheer drop on either side

title: Train & floating market
review: I didn‚Äôt realise how long the mini van drive from BKK was going to be I was picked up at my hotel at 645am we didn‚Äôt arrive at the tour until 9am It was packed and cramped for 15 hours each way   Walking the railway market was interesting Crowded Hot The raw meat out on display was gross with flies and the smell made me sick  Same stuff being sold at every stall   The floating market was crowded water was polluted lots of motor noise and exhaust fumes   Look I sound ungrateful but I‚Äôm pleased I went and experienced this tour No regrets because now I can say I‚Äôve done it  Would I do it again Definitely not It‚Äôs exhausting   I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for my retired parents BUT it is better suited for younger adults I think

title: quick simple way to the heart of bangkok
review: easy to find at the airport lowest floor of the terminal signposted very well regular low priced trains for rapid access to the city

title: Great way to travel
review: Gets you from A to B fast and easy to useTickets easy to get and it stops along the retailers along the way

title: Fastest & Cheapest
review: The fastest and cheapest way to get to the airport A cab fare from Sukhumvit costs me minimum 400 bahts with the airport rail link I spend 75bahts only During peak time its best to take the airport rail to avoid the Bangkok traffic Only drawback is with too much luggage it becomes difficult to access the rail

title: Why get a taxi when the train is quicker and cheaper?
review: And it‚Äôs more fun too to people watch and soak in the city from the air If your hotel is near a destination go for it

title: Happy experiences.
review: We took an overnight train to Bangkok leaving around 630pm and arriving in Bangkok approx 7am  It was a comfortable experience although the seats were converted to beds very early on in the journey and most people settled down to sleep by 9pm  As we were not ready to sleep we made our way down to the carriage serving drinks and sat with the locals for a while  with windows and doors wide open it was a great experience although not sure how welcome we were We also did a return train journey from Bangkok to Ayutthaya There is a ticket office designated to tourists at Bangkok station and we purchased 3rd class standing tickets  ridiculously cheap at 20 baht one way  As the train wasn't full we managed to find seats for the entire journey out  you need to move though if somebody boards with a ticket for the seat you are occupying  The journey home was long around 2 and a half hours  The train was full and so we stood by an open door between carriages  After a very short time the guard came along and I think he must have moved some people seated in the carriage and beckoned for us to come and sit down  We were very surprised and pleased as we had purchased standing tickets for the return journey also

title: cheap and convennient
review: The skytrain is very cheap and convenient for tourists The network is quite simple so that it is very easy to use it It is also clean and in order even at rush hour I also feel safe to go by sky train Highly recommend

title: Value for your money
review: BTS skytrain is a value for your money to travel around bangkokGet a unlimited pass for a day which cost 140 bhat and most of the attraction are near BTS

title: Better than western worlds
review: Easy to use air conditioned and run like clockwork never any delays  I would suggest if using often you should buy a swipe card which you can add funds anytime  If you use only a few times there are machines which you can put "coin" into for tickets

title: Great addition to Bangkok
review: We hopped on the Airport Rail link and then the BTS sky train in order to get to the Landmark Hotel it was an adventure and much quicker than driving in the heavy traffic The Landmark was just a short walk away from the BTS sky train stop which was great

title: Very efficient
review: Very efficient way to get around Bangkok Traffic can be extremely frustrating and time consuming It is very quick and low cost to travel

title: Wow... I love BTS!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: This service is AMZING worth getting up to salut the king before the movies start)

title: Mass transport
review: Mass transport in Bangkok is pretty clean and well organised I have used the skytrain many many times recommended

title: Easy access from everywhere
review: Amazing experience  and very clean safe and a great value for money  Very simple to use also from airport to all tourist attentions

title: #myopinion
review: For me this kind of transportation is always helpful for me as backpacker It‚Äôs cheap fast (of there is no traffic jam) But yes you have to find ‚Äúspecial‚Äù station to find this (as i know this train doesn‚Äôt stop at all of the station)

title: Great tour!
review: The tour was such a fun experience and Sara was a really great guide It was a very warm day so it was nice with the aircon in the car )

title: Convenient and the best mode of transport!
review: Wish we had just used the BTS every day in Bangkok it makes a brilliant alternative to the scamming taxi and trike drivers It is cheap you get a token and the platforms are wide enough to avoid overcrowding Not only is it cheap it is effective and gets you from A to B quickly especially in the heat Make sure you have cashcoins Next time I'll prioritise staying in a hotel close by to a BTS stop

title: Fast and convenient transportation
review: Excellent convenient fast mode of transportation around Bangkok The train is cheap US Standards and convenient to many top attractions in and around Bangkok

title: It‚Äôs transportation!
review: Now please don‚Äôt let the 3 stars put you off from using the BTS It‚Äôs a great transport system that will take you pretty much anywhere in Bangkok The trains are modern clean and with aircon It‚Äôs also cheap to use so for sure I‚Äôd recommend using the BTS However it‚Äôs public transport and taxis‚Äô in Bangkok are also very cheap to use (download Bolt app) so I can‚Äôt give it 5 stars for that reason alone  Also try using the boat taxi as a great way of getting around

title: Efficient system, minus the lack of respect for the elderly that we left standing!
review: Typically when we visit Bangkok we love the fun of Tuk Tuks and catch them mostly around town or a taxi for anything a little further out  The traffic now in Bangkok is a nightmare and like a car park on the main roads in the city so takes forever to get anywhere  Our recent trips to Bangkok in Dec 18 & Jan 19 we used the BTS more than ever  We found is efficient and clean  The people in the ticket offices were helpful and I mainly went with screen shots of the stations names on my phone to show them in case their English wasn't very good  My only grip is that as soon as people get off the train the younger generation jump straight in to the empty seats and play on their mobile phones whilst the elderly stand around them and yes they were even sitting in the seats marked for the elderly while elderly stood over them  Where are your manners  I found as a foreigner I was standing for the elderly Thai people while the young locals continued to occupy the seatsheads down playing on their mobile phones  There needs to be someone policing this as they obviously don't have the manners or respect for the elderly to just do it themselves

review: Great way to get around the city Trains are clean cool and regular Reasonably priced too We got day passes 140bhat ( less than gbp4) which was decent as you can hop on and off all over town Use it to get to the river to get to get transfer to old town If you aren't staying there  dont get the tourist boat  There are some areas that doent have bts eg Chinatown and old town so make sure you plan how you will travel  Trains run till midnight and it's a service that I'd definitely recommend

title: Quick and efficient.
review: I find the Bangkok Airport Rail Link excellent very good value in comparison to other cities in the world fast and efficient although a little crowded at times if you are travelling with only one or two luggage items the way to go

title: Good way to avoid taxi touts - but not if you have luggage.
review: The train runs about every 20 minutes It stops quite a few times en route to central Bangkok and the doors close with a terrible 'clunk' every time But it takes about 30 minutes to get to the end of the line Unfortunately you are not done yet you need to get to another station to get another train to the city centre If you have bags I'm sorry for you It's the same site but a long walk And you can't get a through ticket when you start your trip You have to queue up with your baggage to get change and then again to get a ticket But having said all that it's faster than by taxi and you avoid the taxi drivers who decline to use the meter But if you are going to a hotel get a taxi from the airport It should be no more than 500 baht (¬£10) The train is about 100 baht (¬£2) But considering to get to a hotel you have to change trains then get a taxi from the centre you're probably better off getting a taxi to start with Just insist on the meter And make sure you get a taxi from OUTSIDE the terminal These taxis are controlled Inside the terminal touts will offer you taxis limousine service express service et al The prices are horrendous After a long flight they hope you will be glad to accept their offer Don't Just walk outside the terminal and get a taxi there The train runs from underneath the airport

title: Fast, Convenient
review: Stops at all the major shopping spots and tourist attraction Trains are fast and frequent Best way to travel around metropolitan areas of BKK

title: An experience to do once
review: Did the overnight train from Bangkok to chiang mai with our 9 year old daughter As we were travelling with a child we decide to book the first class cabin (don't be fooled it's not first class by western standards) which was private Left and arrived on time which I think is very rare The cabin was very basic and very cold at night with the air con onI'd suggest you take an extra blanket The toilets were disgusting and so bad I hung on till we arrive in CM defiantly an experience we enjoyed and won't forget but not sure id do it again

title: Bangkok airport rail link... very good, could be much better
review: The Suvarnabhumi airport rail link promised to be an exciting new way to get in and out of Bangkok when it eventually finally came on line True it is a major step forward from taxies and traffic jams It's a cheap quick and comfortable way to get from the airport to at its final station Phya Thai which connects to the main BTS line that straddles Sukhumvit Or Makkasan the station before All good thank you One wonders why it's restricted to 3 or 4 carriages because it's nearly always full to overflowing More carriages equals more comfortable travel I would have thought It appears as though budget cuts might have kicked in by the end of the planning of the project As a frequent Bangkok visitor it was noticed that the infrastructure was set in place for YEARS before the trains actually started running Anyway on balance it's good and useful It might be nice if it ran 24 hours in stead of 18 Thank you

title: Great Transportation
review: The BTW Skytrain is an easy and convenient way to travel in the greater Bangkok area and gets you where you want to go in a timely manner It is inexpensive stops at convenient locations and is an inexpensive method of transportation A single journey ticket will run between $42 and $147 depending on how far you are going A one day pass costs $396 A 30 day pass will cost between $975 and $2543 again depending on the number of trips and the distance you travel With auto and scooter traffic on the streets jammed at all hours of the day and night one would be wise to invest in BTS Skytrain tickets and enjoy the luxury of air conditioned trains that are comfortable and clean

review: If you choose to skip the road jam travelling in BTS is the right choice However the price is abit at the higher end if you are travelling in a family esp with children There is no student price for tourist (as advise by the station controller) my 6 years old nephew have to pay adult rate when travelling using BTS  On top of that if you have elderly travelling with you or you are carrying luggage it will be a nightmare to travel using BTS Most of the stations does not have escalator from ground floor to the controller station You have to either get the elderly to climb up n down stairs slowly or cross the busy road to take the escalator up(which is impossible) or carry your luggage down

title: Simple travel
review: I liked the fact that I no longer have to dice with traffic taxis or AOT limos to get between airport and the city centre I disliked the fact that the train is as basic as the MRT or BTS  those plastic seats are horribly uncomfortable after 45 minutes And the train is often packed with many passengers travelling between stations on the line or being staff at the airport Most of the air passengers I saw seemed to be the more budget travellers Still fastest way into town  and out of town The connection with MRT at MakkasanPhetchaburi is awful though While signposted still have to drag suitcase a long way across a rail way crossing and down a very badly broken street Next time I went to the end of the line at Phaya Thai and used BTS instead

title: 2nd Class AC - not luxury - an experience...
review: I was torn about taking the overnight train I had been on overnight trains in Europe in high school and didn't feel the strong need to ride one again  However when I mentioned the idea to my little brother who I was going to be traveling with he got so excited  Considering the price saving a night in the hotel and the experience we decided to do it  My friend had warned me of how cold the AC cars were so I wore my pants and brought my long sleeve shirt and sweatshirt to layer  We were able to put our large suitcases in our cabin up above the bed area securely  The train departed at 730pm and finally arrived in Chiang Mai at 10am  We ate dinner before and brought snacks with us though food was sold on the train  The bathrooms were dirty and quite simple toilets I dealt with it pretty good at squatting by this point  Each bed had a curtain that closed around it  It was a bit awkward when a random Thai couple boarded the train a few hours in and we were sharing close quarters with them since there are 4 beds in each compartment  If I went to Thailand again and have a choice and a reasonable budget I would probably chose to just fly into Chiang Mai or maybe take a bus since I felt the trip was unreasonably long however it wasn't a bad experience just not something I want to do past the age of 25

title: only do this once
review: this is a one off  We travelled first class both ways and our ticket was booked by Trailfinders (who are the best) Be prepared for poor food freezing cold carriage noise and the most uncomfortable night you will have in Thailand  On the plus side you will meet lots of other travellers the "buffet car" is like a disco at night it is very noisy but the beer is cold  The staff are willing and friendly but try to sell you food and drink to have in your carriage it is available in the buffet car but you are better off taking your own  The toilets are OK but do get worse as the night goes on  Far quicker and cheaper to fly

title: Get the Express train

title: Pushy sales tactics disrupt an otherwise average experience
review: I have taken the night train tofrom BangkokChiang Mai twice now (April 2014 and February 2016) If possible purchase your tickets at the station in Thailand to avoid online booking fees ticket "pickup" fees etc During peak season tickets for limited cabins like "VIP" may sell out well in advance so if you are not in Thailand before your train trip you may have to use one of the online booking services  DO NOT TAKE THE ORANGE JUICE from the pushy drink salesperson unless you want to pay 60+ baht per drink (very overpriced) No matter what class of seat you are in it is not a "welcome drink" but the salesperson pretends not to hear passengers ask "how much" puts a straw in the sealed lid hands passengers drinks waits for them to take a drink then demands payment I did not order food but other passengers have complained about being charged prices different than the menu  Otherwise the train is okay compares favorably to night trains in Vietnam for example and has typically southeast Asian features squat toilets an occasional cockroach and air conditioning that is not adjustable (so it may be too cold) I did not think it was that bumpy and was able to sleep well

title: Fast and convinient

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS skytrain runs from through the city from the north end at the weekend market through the centre to the Central pier and another line going westeast  The trains sit high above the roads and provide good views of the city  The carriages are well air conditioned and very clean (no fooddrink)  They are sometimes packed but that is typical for large cities You can get single tickets from machines at each station  there is information on the fare required from good bilingual graphic displays  You can pay with 10 5 and 1 baht coins  the ticket desk can change notes  You can also get daytickets if you are going to hop onoff a lot   A tyical single journey is 3040 baht depending on the number of stops  The roads in Bangkok are bit crazy with traffic and often  with long jams so the BTS is a fast convenient and good value way to get around the city

review: We used the express train to Phaya Thai  If you do not have huge baggagesluggages with you this definitely the way to travel It is on time (just check out the schedule so you can plan the time you should get there especially if you are going to the airport for your departure flight) and really fast Also since this is not patronized yet by most travelers there is not much passengers and you actually have the choice where you want to sit  If you have huge luggage the travel itself is wonderful comfy and roomy seats with enough space for your luggage However upon disembarkation be prepared to lug your luggages as you trek the stairs or the elevator or wait patiently at a very narrow elevator My sister I have only hand carried luggages so this is not a proble for us but I have to admit I do pitied the other tourist who had large baggages with them

title: Best way between Bangkok & the airport
review: And the best kept secret in Bangkok is the airport rail link It is the fastest and easiest way to get from the airport to downtown Bangkok even with luggage It intersects with other mass transit systems which can take you almost anywhere in the city The maximum cost is less than $150 one way  Far cheaper than taxi cabs and Uber And the best part no getting stuck in traffic  Train runs about every 15 minutes and if you're going into the city you're the first stop so you're almost guaranteed to get a seat    The trip takes about 25 minutes and runs from 6 AM till midnight If your flight comes in later or you're delayed you'll have to find other means of transportation   I moved to Bangkok from other areas of Thailand just for the simplicity of using the ARL since my work requires me to fly out of the country 4 to 5 times a month You can almost set your watch to the Percision of the ARL

title: TRANSPORT FOR LONDON COULD LEARN HERE
review: Fed up battling with taxi drivers who refused to use their meters and dangerously driven tuk tuks I took to the Metro I'm glad that I did   Everything was spotlessly clean and that included the helpful staff Other travellers were happy to help the dithering European in front of the automatic ticket machine My change included a ¬£2 coin size plastic disc and this was my ticket   The platforms are sensibly marked with queuing spots for passengers getting on leaving space for passengers getting off Ok I was not travelling in the rush hour but it certainly works when there are not too many punters   It's a great system and the staff and other local travellers are charming and helpful It costs a pittance and you should try it Remember it's an underground so no views You'll need Skytrain for that

title: Easy Travel

title: Fast, convenient, cheap.

title: excellent service

title: Fast and cheap travel in Bangkok
review: MRT Underground along with the BTS Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok You beat all the notorious traffic which can hold you up for hours (literally) at peak times even though taxis are cheap and reliable If you plan carefully you can use the MRT or BTS to get to or get close to most of the main tourist attractions in the city as well as the main shopping areas (Sukhumvit Road) MRT and BTS intersect at various points making it easy to use both for a specific trip (though you have to pay separately for each of them) If you have to use MRT or BTS to get as close as possible to your destination then use taxi for the last bit

title: very crowded

title: Good Transportation

title: Great Tour
review: Both markets were very cool to experience and this tour was well organized We did the hotel pick up and our guide Vicky was awesome She kept us all organized provided tips to get the best experience stay safe at train market and gave tips for shopping and getting best prices and food   After everyone was picked up we stopped for bathroom break and rest stop to grab coffee and snacks It was fun to ride train into market and see everyone taking pictures of train and then we got to see train leave the market from inside the market Next you go to floating market and you had plenty of time to explore and have lunch  Highly recommend this tour company and Vicky

title: Very effective and quick

review: Very easy to use helpful staff to show you what to do all trains air conditioned and spotless and very cheap

title: BTS-SKYTRAIN
review: very simple  in bangkok to travel ok with bts and fast when traficjam and all the car is standing still bts is going with full speed

title: Nice day

review: We got a taxi up to hellfire pass that then took us to nam tok station  Approx ¬£2 per person for a ticket to river Kwai bridge takes nearly 2 hours but vendors sell food and drink on board  The Windows fully open and you see so much of Thailand countryside and areas of track you would never see from the road

title: Skytrain

title: Great day trip!
review: Great tour from Sara Sara has been very helpful and informative I recommend this as a day trip to get out of the busy city of Bangkok

title: Efficient and fast

title: Transportation only fit for the strongest
review: First of all I have to say the Airport Link is a great and convenient transportation which surely improve the life of us Bangkok expat a lot However if you are my friend come to see me in Bangkok from abroad  I  have to pursuaid you not to use this train to come to downtown Especially 1) when you are with small children or elders  2) when you arrive at night or rush hour 3) If you are carrying  large suite case with you The reason   a) There is no space to store your big baggage in the train You have to travel with a huge number of local commuter The train is very crowded all the time  b) When you reach downtown and try to connect to BTS train you may not able to find any lift nor escalator you can use (in many BTS stations lift or escaltor are eqipped only one side of the premise) Although you are lucky to find very precious lift you surely have to walk very long distance  c) If you try to use taxi from terminal station (either Payathai or Makkasan) it is not easy to catch them If you could many drivers don't know where is your moderate budget hotel or guest house but they surely know you are an innocent tourist desparately need a ride I strongly recommend to use airport limousine or hotel pick up if you are with your loved ones need your support (including your suites case) They are still affordable and very confortable   However if you are tough diehard tourist with strong feet and small baggage why don't you jump into the Airport Link It's the fastest way to hit the Bangkok ground

title: Lost at Rachadapisek

review: Great idea  so much quicker and easier to get to the airport without having to deal with the traffic  The only problem is that you have to get off this train and transfer to the skytrain to get to your hotel  This meant carrying suitcases down stairs and then pulling them a fairly long way to the skytrain where you had to purchase another train ticket  Escalators or lifts are needed at the train stations to accomodate travellers with luggage

title: Complements the SkyTrain but....

title: Fun and exciting tour
review: It was a fun trip for us  Our guide Eddy was a great host he was funny attentive and gave us clear instructions throughout the tour  The Railway Market was a bit crazy especially after you get off the train and had to move out of the way when another train is coming The Floating Market was a great experience  We recommend this tour

title: fast and cool

title: Jackie G
review: Half day trip on the train to the railway market was lovely  Trip including hotel pick up was very convenient and well organised and time for trip was sufficient to see everything  Actually travelling on the train to the market and seeing the stalls close up for us was very good  We had a much better view than the crowds on the street obviously  After that we had drive to jetty for long tailed boat ride which for me was the best part of the trip Speeding past local dwellings and seeing the countryside was lovely  On to the market where we transferred to smaller boat to be brought into the crowds of traders and tourist was also an experience I personally did not need the extra hour we had for shopping from the market stalls but obviously there to have us spending on trinkets   I had a lovely morning even though it was an early start Just long enough

title: Good

title: Convenient

title: BEST WAY TO TRANSFER FROM AIRPORT TO BANGKOK
review: This was the first time we have used the BTS to get from Suvarnabhumi Aiport into Bangkok City and will never catch a Taxi again Just try and make sure you choose a hotel which is close to the City Line on the BTS We stayed at the Baiyoke Sky (fabulous hotel) We caught the BTS Sky train which leaves from inside the Airport very regularly and took us approximately 25 minutes to get to the Ratchaprarop Station which is the second last station on the line and it cost us Thb40 eachcompared to anything up to Thb700 in a Taxi which takes over an hour or more in traffic

title: Miss the traffic
review: Great way to get around Bangkok no traffic congestion no pollution  Really efficient way to travel also the thais are so polite in letting people off and queuing Cheap ad well

title: The BTS Skytrain is an absolutely amazing transit system
review: BTS Skytrain is an absolutely awesome transit system  Use the Bangkok Airport Link together with BTS for transportation ToFrom the BKK airport  On time straight to the heart of the city  You never want to take a bus or a taxi to do this  Fast cheap on time reliable clean and safe  Once you're in the city look into purchasing a "Rabbit Card" a prepaid card to get on and off BTS without cueing up in a line to buy tokens  A real PITA when the system is busy

review: Only trouble with airport link is the express one has one stop and doesn't connect with skytrain line Therefore when you use the non express it stops at every station and becomes very crowded but does connect with skytrain line Very cheap and avoids the 400 pm traffic jams in a taxi

title: Best way to commute Bangkok
review: Bit pricey but if you are to roam all the day across the attractions take one day pass avaialble at all the ticket counters Taking road is adviced only if you are more than 2 and want to enjoy the Bangkok traffic You could also be surprised by the discipline of commuters on boarding and alighting close to singaporeans

title: The best and fastest
review: Absolutely the best and fastest way from the airport into the city and back i will ans do highly recommend this service I think a lot of other socalled mega cities should take a good hard look at  this amazing transport system

title: Fun even for touristy day!
review: We booked this thru Trip advisor which was a first for us We were picked up at our hotel which was awesome instead of trying to find our way to the meeting point  Our guides name was Lyn  She was very very helpful  Our first stop was the train station to take the Maeklong train This was a half hour Lyn was very helpful on where to sit so we had the advantage of pictures coming into the market This was funny having people take pictures of us on the train like we were important The market was crazy 300 meters of market and people but the fun of watching the umbrellas open and close as the train passEd within inches was intriguing  We then got back in the van to the floating market We were taken to a pier and put into motored long boats that took us thru Klingon   This was ok Hard for physically challenged people or long legged Granted we knew it would be touristy but we expected that We were not disappointed in this The sounds and colours were great The food from the long boats were also delicious Lyn suggested were to eat Where to avoid We had amazing mango sticky rice over the bridge we also enjoyed the bargaining buying a ‚Äúcroaking frog‚Äù on one of the floating stalls for 200 Baht I paid too much They were 150 Baht in the Set Price stalls But the fun of it was worth it  The 2 hour bus ride back was tiring after a long day but we also knew that All in all it was a good day and great guide We would of liked to be at the train market longer  Not enough time to look around And less time at the floating market The 150 baht paddle boat wasn‚Äôt worth it for my husband Very uncomfortable

title: efficient

title: very good

title: Easy Traveling
review: I love the sky train because it connects places so well and efficiently There are many cabs and tuk tuks available in Bangkok but you do find yourself stuck in heavy Bangkok traffic The BTS gets you from one place to another in the shortest time possible It's great clean and comfortable

title: A practical way to travel
review: The roads are clogged like the arteries of a 100 a day smokerfor most of the time and Its quicker to walk than take a cab  This is a clean efficient and affordable service which understandably crowded at times  but unlike cars taxis it moves

title: Convenient but always busy
review: This is the best option to traveling around Bangkok to avoid traffic but it has to stay in center Bangkok to connect with the sky train

title: BTS skytrain

title: Efficient train system in bangkok
review: The trains are clean most employees are polite and helpful I just wish they can add more trips especially during rush hours   Rabbit card is helpful as it can also be used to buy in several food establishments and some will come with a discount

title: Great transportation infrastructure
review: Thailand has excellent transportation services The airport railway links you straight to the city for an excellent price It's safe fast and well priced This is surely a great way to transport any traveler from the airport to the heart of the city

title: "Fast, convenient and cheap"
review: I had used the airport rail link from Phayathai station to Survarnabhumi airport and found it as a very convenient way to go to the airport The service starts at 6 am till 12 pm and it leaves every 5 minutes (on time) from the station It took me about 30 min from Phayathai to Survarnabhumi The price is cheap (45 thb) compared to the taxi and also considering the distance Also there is some space for luggage inside the train   Bottom line Consider it when you don't have many luggage for faster and cheaper ride to the airport enjoying magnificently beautiful view of Bangkok

title: Short but sweet ride
review: I would have enjoyed riding more on this train Clean easy to navigate  helpful attendants at station

title: Very fast and close to the hotel
review: The trains were Fast convenient  cheap and clean The trains come every 6 minutes so not a long wait

title: easy airport access
review: the  airport link is very good and cheap but I think   you need to be travelling light the downside when you really want to use it at late arrives it has stopped running and you are at the mercy of taxi trouts

title: connection to BTS sukhumvit is complicated
review: the airport rail link is a viable option to the airport taxi quehowever be aware that if you are headed to the sukhumvit area there is not a seamless connection to the BTSyou have to take an elevator down to the ground floor use a crossover to a bridge that takes you to the BTS station after a short walkwith luggage this is cumbersome and particularly so if you have never done this connection beforealso be aware that although you can get a taxi out of the station the ONE way road you enter is in the OPPOSITE direction of the sukumvit area which are you headedthe taxi has to make a U TURN which inn this heavy slow moving traffic takes TIME and runs up the billthe time alone makes the taxi option not advisableso most are forced to make the cumbersome connection to the bts

title: well price
review: efficient ride at very low cost 45 baht compared to KLIA Express whose price had shot up to $55Ringgit Signage and direction easy to follow and a very cheap way to get to town Coaches are celan roomy and not too crowdedTrip to city about 30mins with no traffic chaos

title: Best and Fastest Mode of Transport
review: We were most amazed at the way this mode of transport operates Extremely punctual Clear marking of where stand before entering and exiting Ultra clean and ever so safe you can use them from moring to night in comfort All electronic so you can see exactly where you are heading to What a blessing in a foreign country for us Also more affordable than most taxi drivers ripping tourists off

title: Great Subway System

title: Fast

title: Easy travelling

title: easy to understand although i dont speak Thai

title: A fun trip with lots to see
review: The tour was a great experience Sara  our tour guide was fantastic She was very warm and charismatic and spent her time explaining everything to make sure we understood She even taught us the Thai alphabet to how to count so that we could barter at the market Instructions were always clear and she made sure that we were as comfortable as possible  It goes by quite quickly so wear comfortable shoes It it very crowded at the markets The less you carry with you the better

title: Best inner city transport!
review: My fianc√© and I stayed in Sala Daeng which has a BTS station of the same name It is only two stops from the Siam BTS which when you get off is where ALL the shopping is At least once a day we'd use the BTS It's clean safe cheap and super smart It is the best way to beat the traffic and get to Siam and other inner city locations quickly  If you're travelling to a number of stations throughout the day an allday pass is quite handy

title: Wish we had a skytrain
review: This was absolutely the best way to get around Bangkok It is cheap it is clean it is efficient it is easy to understand and it's in English as well as Thai

title: Fast, frequent, inexpensive and easy to use.
review: The MRT subway system is fast frequent inexpensive and easy to use Yes at peak hours it's crazy crowded and busy so try to avoid those times All stations have great signage making it easy to navigate and there are both self serve tickettoken machines and manned tickettoken kiosks The MRT has connections to the BTS skyway at Silom [BTS Sala Daeng] Asok [BTS Sukhumvit] and Chatuchak Park [BTS Mo Chit] There is a connection at Petchaburi for the Airport Link line Makkasan station and at Hua Lamphong station you can take the underground walkway to Bangkok railway station also known as Hua Lamphong for Northern line Northeastern line Eastern line and Southern line trains The MRT subway used in conjunction with BTS skyway and the Airport rail link delivers the fastest way to get from A to B in BKK

title: Great tour
review: We love the Sarah Crew Great excursion easy transport and an amazing guide  Definitely recommend

title: Safe and Quick Journey!
review: The BTS Skytrain is very useful to travel around Bangkok city which goes through most of the main areas of the city It is very convenient also safe and quick too Most of the time it‚Äôs get crowded and mainly during the peak hours Purchasing of tickets now become simpler than before just follow the instructions written in English or you can get help from the counters It‚Äôs highly recommended to roaming around the city by the Skytrain

title: Extrem pleasant
review: It ist a extreamly well organised service and you feal very save  Not only in a techical Sense Fast and efficent

title: No Transportation Problems in Bangkok!
review: The Airport Rail Link from Bangkok's Main airport is so convenient even if you do not speak Thai  Once inside the city BTS Skytrain and MRT will take you almost anywhere you want to go  Taxi and Van services are also available for travel to sites of interest outside the city and motorcycle taxis are a fun and inexpensive way to travel short distances

title: Loved the  Rail Link Connection
review: I used the Ariport Link  to Suvarnabhumi and was delighted with the connection   Less than  29 minutes  and you are at Suvarnabhumi  when connecting from Phyathai   Smooth and effortless was the journey despite having a grand baggage and a backpack which otherwise by Cab would first be haranguing with the driver on the approximate fare and then into the traffic stressing out if you would get to the Airport on time Should it be a metered taxi you will be sure that the route taken will first cost you time and then  taken for a  round about ride with ever true  traffic situation  and so an altered path which will definitely not be faster but for sure expensive   Wherever you are in Bangkok and think of getting to the Suvarnabhumi Airport on time and at a reasonable cost I would certainly suggest getting to the nearest BTS and connect to Phyathai  where you can easily interchange with the Airport rail link The best part is yet to come It's just THB 49 for the Airport link fee travelling in comfort   and with the assurance that you will reach in the stipulated time   WoW This is definitely my most recommended route getting back to Suvarnabhumi in total comfort and avoiding the hefty price that would otherwise be levied by the various taxi services

title: See Bangkok from above the  traffic.

title: Easy

title: Very useful and easy to get around

title: Best

title: once you have worked it out it's great and people will help if you get on wrong train

title: BTS

title: Mrs

title: Easy to use
review: BTS is pretty simple to use and stops at many attractions or close to attractions Cheapest to buy 1 dat ticket if makinf more than 3 journiesstops

title: Efficient BTS Skytrain
review: Most convenient mode of travelling if you are staying along Sukhumvit Road Direct access to major shopping Malls and centres such as Siam Paragon Central World Siam Square Siam Discovery Central Chidlom and Embassy EM Quartier Covered walkways with access to each shopping areas ensures you are not caught even if it‚Äôs raining Very convenient mode of travelling and shopping

title: Convenient - but lots of stairs!
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around if you're ok climbing stairs  As others have noted almost every station has an escalator  but only going up  And if it's not on your side of the street you may need to climb a flight of stairs up and then down to cross the road to get to it  Almost every station has an elevator but they are kept locked and it's not guaranteed anyone will come to open it  Some stations have ticket machines that only take coins  they have attended windows and you'd think you could buy a ticket there but they only give you change and send you back over to the machines  Sometimes the machines give you the wrong tickets I had to go to a window and pay more to get *out* at my desired station  But for all that it's really one of the easiest ways to get around Bangkok and the air conditioning is much appreciated  Take your time travel outside of peak hours if possible and be ready for those stairs

title: Very easy to use!!
review: Don't be afraid to get on this It's extremely easy very clean and tons of people use it We found mostly locals using it and some foreigners We were very impressed with how efficient this was and how clean it was

title: Excellent tour, our guide Ken looked after us

title: Quick and Easy
review: The trains are inexpensive efficient and an easy way to see many of the best attractions around Bangkok Do not even think about driving a car It is chaos Get a multi trip card so you do not have to wait in the ticket lines every time The stairs to the trains get to be a little much after a heavy day of sightseeing A few more escalatos would be great  for tired legs

title: Efficient and Cheap Service
review: Bangkok Airport Rail link is a very cheap and convenient mode of transportation between Bangkok City and Suvarnabhumi International Airport provided one is travelling light Though no problem in carriage of luggage till Airport Platform but on reaching Phaya Thai Station in Bangkok trains have to be changed and shifting of heavy luggage is a problem which is further compounded in case you have to exit the station or any other station of Bangkok Metro as rarely you would find electric escalators for exiting from the platform  metro station in case of heavy luggage don‚Äôt rely on Airport Rail Link and go for metered Taxi but having said that Bangkok Airport Rail link is an efficient yet cheap mode of transportation between the airport and Bangkok City and I prefer Blue Colour MRT as it costs 45 THB and travelling time till the terminal station Phaya Thai is around 35 ‚Äì 40 minutes while Red Colour MRT costs a lot more and time difference is hardly 15 minutes

title: Fast and easy
review: Fast ride and easy information to all stations The BTS is faster than a tuktuk and cheaper as well

title: Quick and easy access to many parts of the city

title: cool and easy
review: Maybe sometimes a little too cool bring a jacket or shawl easy to use and oh so convenient But beware of rush hour  then it gets a bit too crowded

title: It Is very Useful to avoid The Traffic Jam

title: Smooth ride on ARL BKK
review: Choosing this mode of public transportation to Bangkok's downtown was a good idea After calculating the time cost and comfort the ARL proved that rail is better than road in this case As the Suva Airport is the first stop getting on board an almost empty coach was a joy Purchasing the ticket at the counter was OK although the staff needs to improve their English as this is the main language even among Asians  Pointing the stop on the ARL map and sign languages aggravates a passenger's disposition especially after a long haul flight However you need to know your stop so it is best that you research your travel plans Getting to the last stop Phaya Thai took about 30 minutes  Other improvements prior to boarding the ARL include clear signages especially for firsttimers to Bangkok The ticket price was fair and the ride was really nice as the rail passes through places that roads don't

title: Fast, cool, and convenient...but by no means perfect
review: There's much to like about Bangkok's BTS Skytrain  the network is extensive and is planned to grow further the trains speed above the city's perpetuallycongested streets with an efficiency that's hard to match rides are made in a (relatively) cool environment which any traveller would likely prefer over a sticky or muggy climate any day and finally it's clean and easy to use  Indeed apart from perhaps the Bangkok MRT and the Airport Rail Link it's often the best way to get from point A to point B  But like any mass transit system it does have its fair share of problems  Queues for tickets can be quite long and travellers who have just arrived in the city often find themselves in one  It can get incredibly crowded (think crushing) especially on weekends or during peak hours  Travellers with large pieces of luggage should consider whether a taxi to or from the airport or train station might be a more prudent option at those times  And the frequency of the trains on weekends especially on Sundays can be a little hitandmiss sometimes  And from a purely socioeconomic standpoint it's worth noting that a significant portion of the local population find travelling on the trains prohibitively expensive

title: Convenient where accessible
review: Quick and efficient but if you want to buy single tickets ie from ticket machines you will need coins as the machine does not accept notes You can exchange your notes for coins at the counter (or sometimes buy your ticket at the counter depending on the type of counter) and there is a chart by the ticket machines indicating how much the fare will be for your trip  Tip To avoid the queue during peak hour or at popular stations you can  1 Change your coins at the counter early or for a few trips at once (the coins are used up quicker than you'd think because there are only 3 denominations  10 5 and 1 baht) 2 Purchase the tickets you require for the day at a go so that you won't need to queue again Note that tickets are only valid on the day of purchase  3 Get a rabbit card It's reloadable and refundable (I think) Note that you will need a different card for the MRT

title: Toot, toot, all aboard. Chiang Mai bound
review: I travelled solo and rode the number 9 DRC (diesel rail car) train on Tues 4th June 2013 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai departing at 830am from Hualamphong Station I booked tickets via the travel desk at my hotel Somerset Park Suanplu Fantastic service and only cost me an extra $6 AUD for them to arrange delivery to my hotel room whilst I went out shopping I rode the scooter bike taxi to the MRT Silom then straight to Hualamphong Station Sweet as transport nice and hassle free when it peak hour traffic No way was I wasting my time on a standard taxi The journey was meant to be a 12hour trip but arrived into Chiang Mai at 930pm (13hours later) Don't make the same mistake as me I booked a 2nd class seat should have booked 2nd class sleeper carriage so if you're not on a tight budget pay the extra The rice paddy fields the temples and Buddhas are lovely sights   It's so easy to fall asleep with the clickety clack hypnotising you to zz dreamland zz The ticket price includes a meal and drinks This is where I discovered hairy red lychee fruityum Ticket price is cheaper than flying relaxing and you can chill out  There are squat toilets and normal toilets Enjoy your trip folks Get out there and experience Thailand
