review: Clean and modern the airport link is very convenient and efficient Linking to main sky train stations and other services this system provides door to door service in safe comfortable style

title: Excellent way around
review: Trains spotless no eating or drinking around  price is cheap and once you get to know the station you need to go to its simple Three of us on New Year‚Äôs Day cost less then ¬£1 to go 7stops  They get very busy so you need your wits about you  Most staff at thr station will recognise a name of a station if you say it in English then its relatively simple where to go  Believe you can buy a pass but we just bought tickets as we went along

title: Cheap, fast and well connected around city
review: Tourists could get oneday pass if needed Although it does get crowded at peak hours but it is still a convenient and fast way to get around city

title: Convenient and clean
review: I live in Washington DC and this train was the most similar to our public transit More so than other American cities Very easy to navigate

title: Best way to travel
review: Don't bother with taxis and sitting in traffic jams just get the train to were ever your staying its cheep  fast and reliable I think I paid just under 100 baht from the airport to my hotel in asok  the whole journey tuck about 40 min door to door with no haggling over taxi fares

title: Nothing great!!
review: Well nothing great about it Wondering why do they have a different metro and skytrain Although the connectivity is good and the trains are frequent Tickets can be bought at the counter or at the vending machines

title: Very convenient
review: A great way to get around the city Cheap and quick You need change to use the ticket machines so if you only have notes make sure you go to a change window first

title: Great!
review: 've found the BTS takes me to just about everywhere I need to go  It's easy to navigate cheap and sure beats sitting in Bangkok's notorious traffic jams with the metre ticking

title: Excellent!
review: The BTS Skytrain is very comfortable and convenient way to travel and save time while travelling in Bangkok with great view of Bangkok It is easy access to most of the famous places in the city Beat the traffic enjoy air conditioning get your steps and flights in going updown to the BTS

title: Convenient, quick, reliable, inexpensive
review: The most convenient quick and reliable way to get tofrom Suvarnabhumi airport Trains run frequently are well airconditioned quick (no traffic jams of course) and cost little (45 THB oneway from airport to Phayathai Station) Trains tend to be overcrowded by commuters during rush hour though

title: Bts
review: Fast and cheap Don't hesitate to hop on one  Very efficient way of commuting  I got tired of stopping taxi off the streets and bartering constantly As a foreigner I found it hard to get them charge you by the meter so the BTS may save you this hassle

title: quick way to reach the city
review: Liked the frequency of the trains Speed and accuracy Unlike the fare But over all enjoyed the ride

title: Great but...
review: This is very useful and very cheap but if you're 4 people with hefty baggae it's often easier to get a taxi as long as they're on the METER

title: Great way to travel to the airport!
review: If you are staying in the heart of Bangkok and have to go back to the airport in the early morning or afternoon this would be your choice To avoid the mayor traffic jams and long and expensive ride to the airport you can take the Airport Rail Link which is quick and cheap

title: Took it from Sukhumvit to Kampong Phet (Chatuchak)
review: First time using this comfortable in the early morning with few travellers but packed after 730am  Cool airconditioning and easy access  Tickets pricey for single trip

title: Best Way to & around Downtown
review: The BTS Sky train network is the easiest and best way getting around the City   The service is prompt and timely The trains are clean and adequately airconditioned though sometimes I wished the airconditioner could be stronger

title: Fast to Airport or City
review: With the airport train you can fast and easy from the city to airport And its cheapi think i pay 45 baht  Recommended

title: The best way around Bangkok
review: We travel to Bangkok yearly and always use the BTS Fast and cheap way to get around Needs to cover more areas

title: Super Fast
review: The best and the fastest way to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport It‚Äôs also the cheapest way to reach city just 45 THB Skip the cab and take the train you won‚Äôt regret

title: EASY & EFFICIENT
review: Learn to use the BTS it covers most of Bangkok's prime destinations Announcements are both in Thai and English

title: Wet during Songkran
review: Went during Songkran train itself was wet due to the soaking travellers It was super fun Technically water guns are not allowed on the train

title: many frequencies, waits are short
review: With short waits modern trains and excellent air conditioning this is the best way to get around Bangkok and avoid its crazy traffic

title: Very Convenient
review: As in Singapore the public train system is much more convenient and significantly cheaper than catching taxis everywhere

title: A must to get round Bangkok
review: We used the MRT many times during our stay in Bangkok  It was easy to use and very cheap  Staff were friendly and tickets easy purchased via ticket machines

title: Quick and cheap
review: Veey good way of transport from Suvarnabhumi Airport around 40 minutes to Phaya Thai station cost 90BHT

title: beat the traffic
review: It was my quick and easy way to get to the airport and back to the city  It sure is a good way to beat the traffic

title: Must use
review: It‚Äôs cheap and so easy to get to anywhere Highly recommend For two it cost us 50 baht It wasn‚Äôt over crowed and there was nice views as you make your way to the city Trains are frequent so you don‚Äôt have to wait around and the mapdirections are easy to follow

title: So easy!!
review: We have used the sky train today to get about Bangkok and found it so easy and the air conditioned carriages made a welcome break from the heat

title: BTS - efficient and clean
review: I was impressed with the timeous efficiency and cleanliness of the BTS  Easy to access and in peak hour traffic it was much faster to reaching our destination than using a car

title: Bts skytrain the way to travel around bamgkok
review: It is the cheaper option to get around Once you have worked out where you need to go it is easy Manned ticket agents are on hand so you dont have to use a machine if you dont want to

title: Excellent trains with great air conditioning.
review: Great train service in Bangkok Must do thing for travelers Connects you to all parts of the city and the sky walk helps is connecting railway stations to malls

title: Best way of getting around
review: If you're going to be around a week then buy a Rabbit card and top it up as it works out more cheaply You can also use it in some stores eg McDonalds and it gives you a discount  The BTS is really easy to navigate and the best way of getting around  It's also air conditioned so gives one a nice break from the heat and humidity of Bangkok

title: Best Way to Commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport
review: Airport link train is the best way to commute Between Bangkok City Centre and Bangkok International Airport (Suvarnabhumi Airport) if you want to avoid traffic and tout taxi drivers The Airport link train station is conveniently located at the level B2 of the arrival hall of Bangkok International Airport Airport link train runs from 6AM to midnight Using this train you can come to Phaya Thai Station (in 25 minutes) and then can transfer to any Sky train (within the Phaya Thai Station) to go to the city centre (I mean Chong Nonsi or Bangkok Station) in 15 to 25 minutes Airport link trains and Sky Trains are modern  safe clean and spacious to carry luggage Airport to Phaya Thai Station costs only 42 THB Phaya Thai to Chong Nonsi Station costs 31 THB Tickets are sold in vending machines in every station On the vending machine ticket price for each destination station is clearly specified Customer service booths in every station help to convert cash to coin

title: The only way to travel
review: This was our first time using the MRT and thought is was great It was massive clean well lit for an underground facility and the directions were very good Between the BTS and MRT any traveler should be able get around Bangkok with ease Surprisingly it was not crowded We are annual vacationers to Bangkok and look forward to using this mode of transportation again

title: traffic free
review: the traffic in Bangkok is horrendous and the roads are not the safest its a shocker if you're visiting from a country like The UK the train system became the fastest way of getting around the city Again if you're visiting from London navigating the train is intuitive so easy to use  we felt that the customer service advisors where very rude we got more support from local users than the people who were paid to do their job I hope I am not arrogant by expecting people to speak English in a non English country however in many cities I have traveled to there has always been English speaker at train station for assistance With the right customer service you can buy a day pass

title: Sky Train BKK
review: Easy connectivity but you have to buy tickets everytime I asked in ticket counter for smart or recharge card they said we don't offer  Being a tourist it will be good to travel by skytrain to get good view of city

title: Good first-world quality public transportation option: doesn't go to Khaosan
review: I have taken the BTS Skytrain on multiple occasions once from airport once from Nana both times to Khaosan Unfortunately there is no stop in Khaosan so I'd to deboard at Phaya Thai BTS station and take a TukTukUber (100150 baht from here to Khaosan) Although one time I was doing it for saving money the other time it was pure experience of it The train itself is amazing super clean very frequent and get a taste of local life It is crowded but not as crowded as some other metros I've been in You'll be most likely standing though The prices are very cheap too  The only issue I faced was the assisting staff barely speaks English and they don't issue tickets either They just change cash into coins which you've to insert into ticket vending machine yourself It could be a little bit confusing as a traveler Connectivity is of course another complaint for travelers although it does connect the business districts of Sukhumvit and Nana pretty well

title: Safe n easy n super quick
review: Bangkok airport rail link the best way to travel to and from the airport without being stuck in bangkoks crazy traffic jams and being overcharged by the citys taxi drivers This service starts at 0600 till midnight and travels 6 stops ending at phaya thai which connects with the bts skytrain cost to phaya thai is 45 baht The service takes less then 30 mins and can be taken from the ground floor of the airport just follow the signs And straight into the airport on return The trains run every 12 mins and taking large suitcases onto the train is no problem Yes the trains can get busy at times but the service is fast safe and easy with a map of the stops clear to see inside the trains Fantastic service

title: Beat the traffic, the cost, the JAM
review: Thanks to tripadvisor we discovered the best way to go from airport to town  We arrived at around 6pm midst of rush hour traffic Direction to rail is clear Cost THB 90 and 30 min from airport to Phayathai station The waiting time could be 15 min But still better than stuck in a parking lot called the highway and pay THB450 for a taxi The only downside is if you have lots or big luggage there is only stairs and no escalator or elevators up and down the station so could be challenging The link to BTS at Phayathai is a 3 min walk Great great great

title: Highly recommendable
review: The airport rail link is indeed recommendable it is the fastest and the cheapest way of getting into the city centre Numerous stations allow you to exactly plan your itinerary depending on where you want to go

title: Efficient, yet not so cheap service
review: The Bts service has been around for years I remembered it wasn‚Äôt so crowded initially when we started using the service Nowadays there‚Äôs almost not much standing room in each cabin as many more people use the service instead being stucked in the traffic jam for hours However this service doesn‚Äôt come cheap as a single stop will cost 15bht Imagine one would have to to keep topping up not very long after initial top up of 100bht So if you‚Äôre traveling with more people it‚Äôs still worth it to take the cab or grab

title: Clean and Easy
review: Cost effective way to get around Bangkok for site seeing  It was easy to navigate as someone who isn't exposed to a metro system and there was always someone will to assist if needed

title: Nothing to complain about except they keep it too cold!
review: Very reasonable price clean and convenient but had to take a sweater or a jacket it was even cold for my BF who is always hot

title: Expensive and slow compared to MRT
review: The BTS and the MRT are 2 different companies The BTS has stops nearly everywhere where usually tourists are going For example BTS Nana BTS Surasak BTS Ratchathewi BTS Siam and so on The problem that I see is that the BTS has to many stops is in general slower than the MRT and is in average way more expensive than the MRT

title: Sort out your public transport system
review: Annoyingly and slightly strangely for a large capital city the two public transport train systems BTS and MRT do not offer interchangeable tickets for through journeys So instead of travelling from A to B you are forced to get off at C and buy a different ticket before continuing your journey to B In addition the ticket offices don't sell tickets They just give out change for the machines Totally counterintuitive and puzzling Sort it out BKK

title: Best way to get around
review: Using the train system in Bangkok was so easy  There are maps on the wall for guidance and charts indicating exact money needed for fare  It's so cheap  The lines can be long to get a ticket from the machine or agent so be prepared to wait

title: Convenient
review: Convenient and regular trains but almost always crowded they could definitely do with adding a few more trains to the line Still a lot of areas in Bangkok that are inaccessible  from the train without catching a bus or taxi as well Overall much cheaper and faster than taxis

title: its easy, just do it!
review: It was our first time in Bangkok and all I have to say is  its easy clean reliable and on long term it saves you a whole lot of  money Don't even consider taking tuk tuks or taxis  with all the traffic and money they charge you  totally overpriced BTS is the best thing you can do when traveling around Bangkok

title: BTS
review: It's very clean safe and easy to use I was surprised when I first saw the BTS in Bangkok Really update and timely

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: Sky train is the best and fastest way to move around Bangkok as the traffic is very bad in the streets Only avoid the BTS at rash hours it will be really crowded

title: Most quick and efficient way to ride from or to Airport
review: Best way to avoid traffic to move between terminals and main locations in the city Cheap reliable and fast

title: Good service but expensive
review: Good train cheaper if you travelling alone expensive for couple or family covers many areas Convenient if you traveling to don meong airport

title: A good service
review: So easy to take the train the first time I visited Bangkok I took a cab and it took 2 hour to get into the centre but the train is so easy and quick

title: most convenient way to get around
review: perfectly organised value for money and the best way to get around Bangkok and enjoy this great city All stations conveniently named and in reaching distance to major places and monuments

title: System is much better than my home (NYC)
review: Trains arrive on time (intervals are very short) Station is very clean People are very respectful Very easy to get around Bangkok using this system

title: Easy Access From Airport
review: This will take you to the city center cheaply and quickly (Bangkok traffic does not move) and there are decent hotels there However it will not take you too close to Khao San Road if you book there It may still be better to take it to the end (Phaya Thai) and then get an ubiquitous cab

title: Great, clean, safe train
review: We travelled a couple of stops from Aetas Hotel to Lumpini park and the night market  The train was fast clean and safe

title: Very user friendly!
review: This is the cheapest and quickest way to get into the centre of Bangkok from the airport and is so easy to use All of the notices are said in English as well as Thai so travellers that speak English will find it a very easy experience It is a very comfortable and smooth train and there is a good view of the entrance into Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: When coming from the airport  make sure you have asked your hotel in advance which stop you need to take and if and where you should connect The information booth near the entrance was not helpful The rates are cheap and there are people who can helpt you locate the connecting trains It is pretty easy to transfer

title: Outstanding Tour - Highly Recommend
review: This was a very well organized trip with a very knowledgeable guide We would highly recommend it as we got to see all angles of the railway market We came into the market on the train then he led us through the market so we could watch the train leave  I‚Äôd definitely do this trip again

title: Easy way to get around the city
review: We tookt he Skytrian from our hotel located in Silom area to the river to catch a ferry to some of the city tourist sites  It is easy to use  We took it to the airport it was fast cheap and easy

title: cheap transpo from airport to the city
review: By using this train it was easy for me to go to airport without costing a lot of money Picking up and sending my friends out of bangkok or whenever I go back home I prefer riding the train than taxi

title: Perfect so far....
review: Not as cheap as i thoughtbut perfect timing spotless super air con good signs and easy to learn system and network I wish it would reach more of Bangkok

title: Needs to be Expanded
review: Whent the Skytrain first opened it was great  Since ridership has increased they have done nothing to add extra cars to each train  There is plenty of room on the platforms that were designed for longer trains  The cars are so crowded most of the time that you think you are in Tokyo

title: Great tour, trailway and floating market
review: It was a lot of driving in the mini bus and very touristic places but that is how it is First we drove to the trailway market walked over the market and saw how the train drives trough the market It is very close in front of you Then we drove to the floating market where we took a boat (6 people on every boat) and passed some shops where you can buy stuff from the boat It is very busy there and it is only for tourists This I would not recommend to be honest only selling stuff to tourists It used to be for locals but since 20 years it is only for tourists  The bus made some snack and toilet breaks The end was at the big MBK centre

title: Floating markets day tour
review: Gold tour tou get to see some salt production farms ride on a train and the floating market The first 2 in my opinion are not a must and if you are on tight schedule might be too long Floating markets was very cool and a must

title: Quick, easy trip from the airport
review: Very quick easy trip from or to the airport Clean and well airconditioned Can get very crowded though

title: Sky train
review: The BTS or Sky train is a modern and efficient way to get a round Bangkok some times the only way to get round BangkokMost times of the day it is standing room only

title: Love it!!!
review: This is the best way to travel around Bangkok  There is no hanging about waiting for travel which is the norm in Thailand  It's quick and cheap  We were around 25 baht for 3 stops super cheap  It does get very busy which is a downside travelling with someone's armpits in your face is not my favourite way to travel however it beats being stuck in a taxi on the busy roads of Bangkok missing everything

title: Cheap, convenient and fast
review: Much better alternative than taxi and tuk tuk in a jammed Bangkok However quite packed during peak hours

title: Interesting ride wondering around the city
review: Public transport in a city is a musttry whenever I visit a place  BTS has been a great way of moving around  Skipping the traffic of course

title: Superb
review: A cheap n convinent means for travel in Bangkok Take a rabbit card for convenience Bit crowded during peak hours

title: Great way to travel around Bangkok
review: Trains are fast and efficient getting you around the city with ease  It's probably worth having a hotel right near a train stop so you don't have to walk too far in the heat  All carriages have ice cold air con so it is a welcome relief from the intense humidity

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: This city is well known for taxivantourist transport scams  The BTS is the only legit way of travelling  We took the Skytrain several times during out trip  My wife was carrying our 1 year old and every time someone would give up their seat to them  This even happened during Friday rush hour when we were packed in there like sardines

title: The train market or the floating market?! Which one should you do? BOTH! This experience is not to be missed.
review: My wife and I booked this experience at the last minute we had just arrived in Bangkok and didn‚Äôt have any concrete plans but everybody kept recommending the train market and the floating market Not knowing which one to pick I googled which of the two is the better to visit and this experience popped up We were collected early from our hotel and introduced to our guide Tim He talked us through the itinerary and made it known that it is out the way from Bangkok (1 hour to the train market) but the bus was airconditioned and comfortable We were given bottles of water for the journey and Tim gave us information about some of the places we saw along the way When we arrived at the train market Tim suggested a place for us to get Thai milk tea and mango juice  both were delicious The experience of seeing the train was fascinating as was watching the vendors move their shop fronts to allow the train to pass Bit of advice (and this honestly shouldn‚Äôt need to be said) get out of the way of the train or you will be shouted at Once the train had passed we were off to the floating market  approximately 45 mins away Tim gave us a brief talk (where and when to meet etc) and then we were straight into one of the boats I do not want to talk about this too much I will just say this DO THIS EXPERIENCE Everything was incredible an absolute feast for the senses After the boat journey we were given time to shopeat the food was delicious and the beer was cold Bargains aplenty were available More advice take some 5 baht coins with you  some of the toilets require payment and they take coins only  toilet paper is 10 baht but you pay somebody for this so notes can be used ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ for paying not wiping After the experience it was time to go back to central Bangkok We were given more water for the journey and we arrived at MBK just shy of two hours after leaving the floating market I have been pretty thorough here but one thing I have not spoken about a lot is our guide Tim He was friendly informative funny and organised He ensured that we had his contact details he assigned each grouptraveler a particular number to keep track of everyone he gave us a little sticker to be able to recognise who was part of the tour he suggested excellent places food and beverages and he was always updating us about the goings on of the day and any updates to the itinerary I cannot suggest this experience enough it is absolutely worth it and the fact that it is toprated is justified and deserved ‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏Ñ‡∏∏‡∏ì

title: Too crowded
review: This is a nightmare to use at peakhours It's simply too crowded It's not exactly cheap either for a transport system

title: Extremely Busy
review: The Strain has 2 lines the light green (Sukhumvit) and the dark green (Silom) line It's easy enough to navigate but you do need proper change We always stopped by and asked for change for the exact place we needed to be and specified how many people we needed it for It can get pretty crowded but that's to be expected It's also air conditioned and you can't beat the price without haggling for it

title: Easy and fast
review: The Airport Rail Link take you to and from the Airport The Rail link is underneath Bangkok International Airport and can take you into Bangkok city for around 75 Thai baht Very safe

title: So easy
review: Very clear and takes you everywhere The staff are also very helpful so you won`t get lost Very cheap also

title: Forget the taxis.
review: Read the title No more needs to be said This is by far the quickest way to get to central Bangkok

title: Easy to Use
review: Refer to my review of the sky train Same comments apply Cheap and easy to utilize Tickets for this are below street level Once paid the kiosk dispenses a plastic 'coin' that you have to tap on the baracade (gate) in order to walk through to the platform Your large backpack or purse may be searched by security Once at your destination drop your plastic coin into the baracade (gate) to exit There is AC on the MRT and announcements are in both Thai and English

title: Excellent way to travel
review: If you hate heat and traffic congestion then this is the way to travel Be sure to orient yourself prior to using the system It is very efficient to travel this way

title: Great Transport
review: This is a very efficient way to travel around Bangkok and certainly faster than Taxi during the peak times

title: It's ok if your on a short layover
review: Ideal if you have a few hours to spare waiting for a connecting flight It's a hassle with luggage if you need to change trains to go to other parts of Bangkok Better to take a taxi if your staying a few days

title: Must do experience
review: What a great service the Bangkok transit systems sky train is frequent fast simple and incredible fun Great views of the city you can see no other way Fly through the traffic while crammed into a carriage with all of the cultures of the world

title: Bangkok to Chiangmai
review: What a fun train ride with the local folk and seeing the beautiful country It was a great experience to be with the Thai people at the train station We felt safe welcome and comfortable We'd do it again

title: Great way to avoid the traffic
review: I used the sky train a few times during this trip  The maps are easy to follow & you can usually find a young passenger that speaks English if you have questions  The booths won't give you a ticket only change  You need change 40 baht to the end of the line  You have to put it in the ticket machines to get your ticket  You will need to have your ticket to exit as well  Be careful where you get on & off as there are numerous entrance & exit points at some stations  I was only a few blocks from my hotel but since I left via the wrong exit I got lost Some cars have police in them some are very crowded like the one to the marketplace on the weekend  all are clean & run regularly

title: ARL Bangkok
review: This is a brilliant service not busy at all as locals feel it's too expensive for them but most European tourists find it reasonable and it links with the sky train so you can get pretty much anywhere in the city

title: Cheap and fastest
review: Bangkok is known for traffic Taking the Airport Rail Link system would definitely save you time from Airport to City Center and skip the traffic

title: the best way to visit the city
review: Beautifull comfortable and safe it's also amazingly clean convenient with the subway connections  No deal with taxi drivers so good

title: very convenient way to get from the BKK airport to the city
review: The airport link is a very convenient way to get from the BKK airport to the city I think it took me about 30 minutes to get from the arrivals hall to Siam square Also much cheaper and faster than taking a taxi

title: Inexpensive and quick way to get round Bangkok!
review: We used the Skytrain every day in Bangkok  I was worried that I would get lost or not buy the right ticket but it's very easy  Don't be afraid to try  It's so cheap and quick  the roads are so busy you would spend a fortune on a taxi or tuktuk  It stops at all the main tourist attractions and all instructions are in English as well as Thai  During the day there are trains every few minutes  Just remember no food or drink is allowed on the Skytrains  probably why they are so clean

title: Love the sky train, it is just so great for going anywhere
review: I  am travelling to Thailand solo and it is my second visit to this wonderful country when I was planning my trip I decided to take the sky train to different stops and explore each area around the station It worked great although I did get lost a couple of times But no worries everyone is very friendly and helped me find my way back to the sky train station

title: Super efficient, very cheap
review: Travelled from the airport to Phaya Thai (the last stop in the financial district) in less than 30 mins Was super quick and clean Also easy to buy tickets at both the airport and Phaya Thai Can switch to the skytrain at Phaya Thai to go on elsewhere if you need to do so According to timetables I saw online it runs every 15 mins but honestly the 3 times I took it it didn't feel like I had to wait ages for it although still worth checking out the timetable if you need to ensure you get your flight on time It's a massive shame it just isn't longer and goes near the tourist hotspots in Bangkok  A one way ticket cost us 45 baht each  unbelievably cheap

title: Best way to get around BKK
review: After you‚Äôve taken a few taxis you‚Äôll find that using the BTS is far better Traffic is pretty bad at rushhour is of the BTS get you where you want to go in the timely fashion  Take the BTS and or public transportation to get as close as you can to your destination and then perhaps take a scooter or a taxi

title: efficient and clean
review: The express was not running on the day but the airport rail link was and to me was efficient and clean although took 40 min when I think should have taken 20 min with the express The cost was a fraction at 40 THB

title: The fastest way to get around!
review: I would say this is the best and most efficient way to get around Bangkok We managed to get to all the major shopping areas by taking the BTS sky train and it's so cheap

title: Oh well
review: Well 20 minutes to the market and 30 minutes on the boat 8 hour trip Think about it )  I don't know what else to say  (*it was very good DDD)

title: Life Saving Facility
review: After we spent almost 2 hours in traffic in a taxi from Grand Palace to Westin Sukhumvit the next day we took the Skytrain We travelled a longer distance in only 20 minutes and a fraction of the price Very clean very informative there are announcements in Thai and English

title: Good choice if your destination is in the route
review: It is cheap and efficient method to travel in Bangkok However most of the tourist attractions and popular destinations are fall into BTS routes than MRT

title: Easiest way to get to the airport
review: If you are staying close to a BTS or MRT station using the airport link to get to the airport is certainly the easiest way to get to the airport  beats driving in Bangkok's crazy traffic or worse sitting in a traffic jam on the way to the airport

title: Fastest way around BKK
review: Most effective and fastest way to travel around the city centre Very crowded during rush hours but still the best way to get around the city

title: Very Clean and Efficiently Metro System
review: The BTS Skytrain should be used by other cities worldwide as an example of how a transportation system can be designed to enhance mass transit with the local retail and offices all enjoying the interconnected bridges that run for blocks These wide walkways are clean with good security with small retail shops for snacks and easy access to adjacent hotels etc It is well designed to keep the pedestrians from interfacing with the traffic below Enjoy using the BTS

title: Fastest Transportation
review: Bangkok is now experiencing too much traffic especially rush hour in the morning from 6 am to 9 am from 12 noon to 2 pm and from 4 pm to 7 pm BTS Sky Train helps a lot to fasten your travel to roam around the city of Bangkok BTS Sky Train is one of the best options to get into your destination on time especially if you have a flight so better use the train transportation system And there's also rush hour in BTS Sky Train but you it's manageable especially when you're in a hurry and too much traffic to take a taxi

title: Very convenient
review: There is not so much to say The BTS is the most convenient way to travel around Bangkok No traffic jam no overcharging taxi drivers It is clean and has a good frequency The staff is used dealing with tourists and will usually be able to communicate in english It gets very crowded during rush hour so you might experience some difficulties entering and leaving it while dragging a huge suitcase and backpack Despite being the fastest way to go to the airport keep in mind that the BTS can also have technical problems and delays  I could not use the Airport Express as it was out of order for the entire duration of my stay

title: Awesome
review: The Sky train is easy to use and everyone is helpful it is very clean but can be really busy especially during rush hours

title: Practical
review: Fast to get around BangkokOn time love it But Busy and can get crowded during lunch hourswork hoursand weekends

title: Convenient and reasonably priced
review: Just travelled today by airport rail link to the station nearest to the hotel I reserved I only spend 40bahts as compared to about 400bahts for a taxi ride Saving is not just financially but also the time as the time of my arrival was peak traffic condition so it would probably cost me double the time to reach my destination

title: BTS Bound
review: This is the train that I used to get to the BTS line  I have posted video of a portion of my ride on You Tube channel "I Went There"

title: Fastest way to airport
review: The airport Rail link will be your most efficient way to the airport if you are close to a BTS station as we were With luggage in hand we boarded our nearby station of Phrom Phong We stayed at the nearby Double Tree so the walk was less than 5 minutes  Once on we took the BTS to Phaya Thaya where we transfered to the Airport Rail Link There is an express line which does not stop and arrives about 15 minutes faster than the other option which stops like 34 times The cost differential was minimal so we took the express The nicest thing is you end up at the airport and avoid all the traffice and congestion which is Bangkok is pretty much all the time Best way to get to the airport

title: Great way to move around in the city
review: Its cheap and much faster than taxi and tuktuk especially in rush hour Easy to get around and you cant get lostüòä

title: Cool way to get around the city
review: Excellent way to escape the heat Can get a little crowded though but is clean cheap and fast Buying tickets is also easy but you will need coins only

title: My daily ride to work
review: Using the MRT and BTS you can explore a lot of Bangkok without sitting in time wasting traffic   Although the BTS is bigger and has better AC than the MRT I prefer the latter because it has 1 3 and 30 day unlimited monthly passes and you get to wait for it underground where the temperature is much cooler  The BTS and MRT interchange at two stops Mo Chit and AsokeSukhumvit  Like the BTS the MRT does get very crowded during peak hours and I would recommend avoiding Sukhumvit and stops adjacent to it during this time

title: A good alternate to travel around
review: A cheap and safe experience to travel in bangkok especially when tuktuk and cab act fairely expensive

title: Super Transport
review: Have taken many public transport systems around the world This one is definitely top notch A bit spendy for us but clean pleasant and efficient otherwise Have had no problem navigating our way

title: Convenient & efficient
review: BTS is cheap convenient efficient and clean Much better than the system at home We used it a few times and it was great Had a stop close to our hotel

title: The obvious option
review: Cheap clean fast You can get the link straight from the basement of the airport and it connects you to the main BTS lines A good idea to get a travel card if you are staying in Bangkok for any length of time Why would you get a taxi

title: Easy
review: An easy way to travel when you know where your going much quicker than a taxi a probably a lot cheaper

title: A great transportation system
review: The BTS Skytrain offers a day pass with which you can explore nearly all  the hot spots of Bangkok This 140 Bath are a good value We always use the Skytrain during our visits in Bangkok

title: Beats the traffic
review: Best way to get around Bangkok Cheap and cleanBangkok traffic is terribly bad so if you take a taxi or a tuk tuk expect to be stuck in a traffic jam

title: Interesting Journey
review: This was an interesting journey  we got on at Nam Tok and travelled all the way into Kanchanaburi alighting at the station just past the Bridge over the River Kwai The train was fairly empty apart from the couple of stops either side of the Wang Pho viaduct when unfortunately some large tour groups got on and barged around until we were past the viaduct when thankfully they got off again  Just looking at the terrain and considering the sweltering conditions we were sitting in was quite mortifying  frankly it was amazing that any POWs  survived  Would definitely recommend

title: Mbk
review: Place is good and many types of things are available branded shops and electronic products but i have noticed there is same quality products are available in different price in stalls

title: Brilliant
review: The skytrain is brilliant  very modern and clean and also very cheap  its easy too to get get ticket

title: Fast reliable way to get to and from the airport.
review: Just went on a joyride to try the train as I thought it was a little slow as there is no express (limited stop) train  Took it from Ratchapaprop station and it took 27 12 minutes and THB 40 to get to the airport  Best and most reliable way to get to the airport if you don't want to be caught in traffic  Seats are side benches and rather narrow and uncomfortable (must narrower than BTS seats)  However fir the price beats sitting in traffic

title: There are 2 Rail Services
review: This can be a bit of a trap There is a fast non stop service but it terminates at a station that lacks connections Then there is the all stops version (at a fraction of the cost of the fast service) that connects to the Skyrail But you need to schlep your luggage between end of airport line and Skyrail and buy another ticket at Skyrail ticket office

title: 50 Bath to reach the city centre.
review: Light luggage Fast and best money exchange Get down the ground zero of BKK airport then you get ARL to the city center with no stop or the 2nd line with several stop if needed Cleanfast cheap and easy No troubles with bustaxicrazy traffic at peak time Linked with MRTBTS Skytrain I cant tip better

title: Expensive if travelling in more than one
review: If you are travelling in 2 or more BTS is going to be more expensive than taxi  (Asking for using the meter) Further station costs about 52bht one way It's worth in rush hour only Be prepared to open your bag every station you pass through the ticket barrier The ticket machine accept coins only so you probably have to get the queue in order to exchange your notes

title: Great Train !! Easy to get to places in Bangkok
review: Transit in Bangkok is really good Easy to get places and nto epensive It has AC and quite enjoyable Rush hour could be a hassle as there is lots of people always

title: Best way to beat Bangkok‚Äôs notorious traffic
review: All great cities must have a convenient train system and Bangkok is no exception Convenient cheap and definitely the best way to beat Bangkok‚Äôs notorious traffic Nevertheless with only 2 lines it is not as extensive as the transit system in other more developed Asian cities and you may not be able to use the BTS to visit certain attractions in the city for example the Grand Palace and Wat temples area

title: Very useful, especially for the solo traveller heading into town.
review: Prices are currently 45 Baht for the City Line and 90 Baht for the Express Line Very good and useful addition to Bangkok's transport infrastructure

title: fantastic
review: The skytrain is the perfect way to get around Bangkok  Very easy to use and very cheap  Suggest buying a card and keep topping it up  Very regular and we didn't experience any problems  Mike and Sue

title: Perfect
review: one of the best transportation in the city if you don't want to go through the traffic Clean fast nice easy to use
